ar-7s2mlXvtG7Jg1oNZ4tw.text: I looooved this little spot, as a vegetarian there aren't many things on a menu that make you jump for joy. When I looked at the menu, I'd forgotten what it felt like to be able to order anything on that extensive menu! I had the wings and a bacon burger! Definitely going back soon. The drinks/teas are so good and refreshing! They need to have another restaurant closer to the west valley!

AxNHec06U5qK9F7L_lbWhw.text: I am really surprised at how good the food is at Green. Considering I'm not a vegetarian by any stretch of the imagination I can't believe that I actually really liked it. I got the Kung Pao noodle bowl with mock chicken and it was delicious. The sauce was spicy and flavorful. The veggies were fresh tasting and not overcooked. And I couldn't believe how tasty the "chicken" was! I don't know what's it's made out of but it really did taste like chicken.  They were super busy at lunch but they kept things organized and brought the food out pretty fast. I also liked all the healthy beverage options. I would definitely eat here again and any time I am asked for a vegetarian restaurant recommendation this is what I will say is the best in the valley.

WNCFIXC5EWLpJD_RW4EIXQ.text: This was my second visit to this restaurant chain, although the first visit was in Tempe, not Phoenix. I liked the peanut stir-fry with mock chicken so much in Tempe, I ordered it again at the downtown Phoenix location.  Unfortunately, this version of the dish was drowned in so much peanut sauce, that its all I could taste.  The veggies and mock chicken were cooked right, it was just that the dish was out of balance with too much of a powerful ingredient.

TqoBNttmTu-L7E23Yc5f-g.text: This is a "must-have" for locals and visitors! Whether you're looking for comfort food, a naughty snack, or healthy fare, Green has something for you. My favorites include the "wings", the BFF sandwich, the Wendy Pickle sandwich, the brussel sprouts, and the Thai peanut bowl. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. Be sure to finish up your experience with one of their famous Nami tSoynamis!

Q3b_XEHki727xzFTgSrbSw.text: Ew. As a vegan I'm into new and creative ways to make real food (aka vegetables, fruit, grains, etc) taste good. Not into weird fake meat with questionable texture. I literally felt sick when we left. I cannot believe all these reviews, I was super disappointed.

WKmPlQRpkAQcouN81-FJjA.text: Yum! We had already eaten at their other location and loved it. We were close to this location and stopped in for a quick bite.   Friendly service and we got our food quickly. I ordered the Argentine Po Boy to reminisce on our recent trip to the South and enjoyed every bite. Delicious and messy!  Great beer options too. I'd love to check this place out for brunch sometime.

v9EjneuoYoY0r2vK_RtcpA.text: So unbelievably good. Small restaurant and parking is tight but went there on MLK Jr. Day, Monday night, about 7 pm and could easily park. There was still a decent line inside, I can imagine a Friday or Saturday night might be a bit crazy here. Split the crab puffs, Big Wac, and Wendy's Pickle with a friend...all of it was amazing. Definitely can't wait to go back and try more!

0s4pLpn6qppPVArL6sjEzg.text: So the wifesky said we should eat something healthy today and wanted to give this place a try. Well, if the little lady wants to try this place out, that's what we'll do!  Location & Aesthetics - located in Phoenix on N 7th. Street.   A word of caution, if you use Google Maps (like I did) to search for this place, it'll show you a location on Scottsdale road (2240 N Scottsdale Rd #8 Tempe, AZ 85281) which obviously isn't the location for this restaurant as listed by Yelp (2022 N 7th St, Phoenix, AZ 85004).  I'm not sure if they're both affiliated or not. When you're driving on N 7th St. and you don't know what you're looking for, it's easy to miss the restaurant. The signage is large but it's decorative with decorative writing so drove past it.  The entrance too can be easy to miss as it's a bit small and the signage to enter was just as small. The parking is very limited and also....small, so if you've got a monster truck or SUV, you might have difficulty parking in the back.  Parking is also shared with their sister restaurant called Nami located next door that apparently serves vegetarian pastries.  We were lucky to snag a parking spot however, if the parking lot was full, then I'm not sure where else we would've been able to park. (-1) The outside had the usual seating for dinning but was small in size and close to the busy road. The interior was also on the small side. At first we didn't know if we had to be seated first and wait to be waited on, but after seeing a line forming by the cashier, we promptly joined it.  Apparently what you do is grab a menu, join the line, and while you're waiting to get to the front of the line, you choose your items to order.  Then you pay, you're given a number which you place at the edge of your table of your choosing wherever you wish to sit providing there's seating. I'm guessing if the place was packed, I'm not sure where we would've sat.  Perhaps we would've ordered to go.  Menus - the menu was self-explanatory.  The cashier who took our orders answered any questions we had about the food and the drinks.  Service - once staff brings out your food, we didn't see them again checking in on us.  Seems like they're there to either bring out the food and clean the tables/area.  Food - I had the big Wac -- 2 hand packed vegan burgers, special sauce, lettuce, cheese, pickles, onions on a sesame bun and the thyme fries (you can choose fruit or a tahini salad). The thyme fries didn't taste different than regular fries which I guess is a good thing but it was certainly crunchy, fresh, hot, and very tasty.  It certainly wasn't oily and greasy like regular fries was. The vegan burger also didn't taste like a vegan burger and in fact, I thought I was going to be biting into a piece of cardboard.  While it wasn't meat from ground beef, it was certainly very tasty and didn't lack any flavors as I thought it would.  In fact, the special sauce, cheese, pickles, and onions only served to enhance the flavor of the veggie burger patties itself and brought out the taste even more.  Even the sesame bun was soft and fresh as if it was just baked.   I think the various vegan items on the menu is enough to bring me back however I'm a bit leery of how small the establishment and their parking is.

gjo0_rR_JYSy6gOaEYqJIw.text: Meh. Don't get me wrong, the food tastes pretty good. It's just over priced and way too greasy.  So this place is definitely not a good choice for a light healthy meal. All the mock-meat and tofu dishes are overly heavy on oil, even the rice/noodle bowls feel super greasy. Maybe their salads are on the lighter side, but I've never tried any because I opt for junky delicious options, like their mock wings.    Their drinks selection is noteworthy, as it is vast and great (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic).  Oh, and I hate how they nickel and dime you for everything--like if you ask for extra sauce on something, they'll charge you for that.

J57vNEnOFmAL61vegk_HWw.text: Always a great experience. I love the Big WAC burger!!! Great service, always friendly. Great selection of cold teas and I think I honestly drink about a gallon before I leave. I wish they opened one closer to me in Peoria (I think I would eat here daily)

XB-jyMPs5cog1PsImaEZMg.text: Green is amazing, best vegan junk food I've ever had... Ever. The big wac is a veg version of a big mac, it's delicious and their fries are great too. While your there stop at their sister store Nomi, and grab a dessert, ice-cream but vegan, yum town. Thats at the 7th ave or.. Street location.    Decent atmosphere, but the food is what justifies driving from Tucson just to get it....yep, its that good, even non veggies will love it. I also adore the wendys pickle, its like fried chkn in a bun with mayo n pickles... With fries... Love that one, kind of a po-boy sammy thing.

-zyBsWVhev6L8DFjyu-IWg.text: This place is AMAZING. The staff is friendly, the food is amazing, it's not generally over crowded, and a great place to eat NO MATTER what your diet. Everyone loves this place. Seriously. Everyone.  I don't like fake meat, but my meat-eating friends loooooooove the fake meat here! I've eaten the fake chicken one time, and I literally freaked out about it because it looked and tasted just like chicken. Not for me, but if that's what you're down for - you won't be disappointed. I stick with the house tofu which is equally as amazing.

13LuMWEHlPqceqz0_FftKg.text: The food is ok but service is awful.  Ordered lunch today.  Waited 15 mins.  Politely asked how much longer.  Another 15 mins..not happy..snotty one at counter says..we are busy...they should tell you before you order or hire extra help at busy times..they know lunch is busy..and so are all customers who have to get back to their jobs..got my money back and left.. $12 for small burrito

mH9tWh5D1cwqsgUSLOl9mA.text: Green's makes vegan cool.   Seriously cool.  Your options go far beyond salads!  Here you can enjoy a full flavor, comfort food dish...all in good health and consciousness!  Burgers, sandwiches, "WINGS"?! need I say more?

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ranchero Salad with vegan &#34;wings&#34;!

mzlHU1J0pNNE4pu_IgX1Aw.text: Amazing! Hard to believe it's vegan! Their wac n cheese is drool worthy! Definitely recommend it

tMFcCV-lUXM_ZyKOeUMA2w.text: I am neither a vegan nor vegetarian. But this place is something encourages you to be so. The food is so good and satisfying. The place is nice and clean and the vibes as well. I saw so many people are leaving no crumbs on their plates. They got inside and outside tables. It is safe to go on open days as well. I asked for my food to be Safari so I do not mess it up while I'm studying, and still got a nice representation and quantity. I got the semi chicken and the coleslaw salad and both were so good. I would come agin and bring friends to try new plates. There are many spots for the parking on the back. JThe one star missed for the bathroom only.

clCXRZEhtUFxgbiJdAt8LA.text: Green Vegetarian- I love this spot in Phoenix. I loved it the 1st time and then without even realizing it, I ended up here a second time! The combo of great food, casual atmosphere and affordable prices make this place a total winner. Both times I've been here I have opted for the 'Bowls' which offer different preparations/sauces of a sauteed vegetables with brown rice (or noodles) I have gotten the Kung Pao and the Diablo and both were awesome. Simply prepared fresh veggies with good amount of heat make this a great healthy option. They have a bunch of different Veggie burgers and salads as well, which got rave reviews. Not to be missed if looking for healthy lunch or dinner in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kung Pao bowl!

5esoQ3Y-Ixp_fnXCjcHZDQ.text: It was so good! They take comfort foods and make them vegan and so delicious. Wish we had something similar in Prescott.

qR_ETG7FJuSnVgfEutHdRQ.text: Best vegan fries in town! Add a shake and meatless burger and you will be feeling the American pride with none of the American guilt!

krIi6IZ3Za9J3071k5RChQ.text: This place has food that is absolutely delicious. I love their  Big WAC Burger, in fact all of their burgers are incredible. Then, go next door to Nami's next door for creamy and tasty "ice cream" and doughnuts.

e6BhvRo3gS4R7pap9n4nYA.text: I love this place! Best vegan food in the valley.  I have never had something here I did not love.  I take my carnivorous friends here and they love it too.

MLlAF9aO9vF9o047a_QEcw.text: Everything we tried was super good!!! We had the buffalo wings, samosas, and egglessrolls. You would never guess there is not meat in there nor do you even miss it. They also sell agave soda which is a huge plus for me as I am always on the lookout for healthy sweetener alternatives. Also dig the use of the car doors as decoration. Creative!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut curry bowl with house tofu. Yum!

f6YfAkruuD6OqU0dT5pRwQ.text: Cute little cafe with a unique vegan menu.  I had a BBQ burger and thyme fries. The burger patty was on the small side. Luckily there was tempeh bacon and portobello mushrooms and cartelized onions to give the sand which some bulk.  It was tasty but not quite filling.   didn't see an option for vegan cheese.  Then again I didn't ask. That is my fault. Got a generous helping of the thyme fries but never really tasted the thyme.   Husband had the Big Kahuna burger special. It was more impressive in flavor and in bulk. He didn't taste the thyme either.  They have s great selection of teas and beverages to choose from.  That is a big plus for us.  Overall not bad.  Staff are very friendly and the place is clean.

RPxqbsnoN5NjjjpsTApEMw.text: Tried vegan for the very first time. I enjoyed it. The big Wac tasted like a big Mac...i think, since it's been decades I've been to a McDonalds. Tried the chili fries and edamane, both were delicious. Totally meet my expectations.

POkQLLiGY6A2Kuvb74C4fg.text: I am in LOVE with this place.  So far, I ended up going to this place three times the first time I visited Phoenix, and try to stop in every time I come to town.  The fakey buffalo wings were AMAZING! and you must hit up the brunch on Sundays.  This place made my dreams of vegan biscuits and gravy come True. The first time I stopped in for Sunday brunch, they didn't have any biscuits left (le gasp!!!), but one of the employees managed to find me some texas toast, and it was so amazing.   The staff here is very friendly, the place is CLEAN, and the food is amazing.  Definitely worth five stars.

LBnaKEz4-NnLSO1Y5nEFGA.text: I was visiting my sister in law and was tired of eating crap food. So, when we stumbled into this all vegan restaurant I jump at the chance to sample the cuisine. My sister in law was complaining the whole time we were looking over the menu. "If it is healthy then its not for me. " or "If its not full of meat it will taste like crap. " These were the complaints she said as she finally decided to try the Singapore orange. From the first bite to the very end she was taste shocked into silence.  The only sound was her fork scrapping the bowl and chewing.  When she finished the very last bite she replied: that was fantastic and very unexpected.    This restaurant is highly recommended from a very non vegan person.

lO3Mz58RDJth__tQJNBcIQ.text: Love this place. Have been coming here regularly for the last few months. Even though I am not a vegan/vegetarian anymore, I still love the food. I usually order the Mongolian with crispy tofu and brown rice, but have also had a couple of other menu items that have all been good. Their french fries are TO DIE FOR. Seriously... it's the kind of thing you have sexy food dreams about.  The staff are always pleasant and helpful, and the space is always clean and welcoming. I will continue to come back here for sure.

voM3QatRJWV2IvXZ6_67rg.text: Overall our experience at Green was great. We ordered crab puffs, artichoke gratine and samosas to share and sat on the back patio which was nice. The food was tasty and I was really excited for the crab puffs as I've never had them made vegan. It is worth noting that part of each of these appetizers was deep fried so they were a bit oily so they probably shouldn't be a meal which is what we attempted to do. The staff was very friendly and there were so many options on the menu that it was hard for us to decide what to order. We will need to return multiple times to try more items on the menu.

natjFc9wGmMpaE9UZCJJDA.text: I never once thought that one of the best burgers I've ever had would come from a vegan resturant, but it does. I'm not vegan, or even vegetarian, but I've been to Green numerous times and while I've enjoyed many things on their menu, I keep going back for their "Big Wac", their version of the Big Mac, or "BBBQ Burger", their BBQ bacon burger. They're delicious! The texture and flavor is exactly that of the meat version of the items they represent. They have everything from healthy options that you would expect from a vegan resturant, to bar food style options like mock buffalo wings and chili cheese nachos. There really is nothing negative to say about this place. I can't even think of an "it might be better if...". This is definitely a must try! Make sure to hit up Nami right next door for coffee and dessert when you're done!

nJ4FS1QoiPJ_qZ1XAi6_Cw.text: SO obsessed with this place. I'm not vegan (or even vegetarian) but I LOVE it!!! I'm in love with the buffalo wings... I have only tried a few of the other items because the wings are just so good and addictive.  It blows my mind that fake chicken can taste that good. o_o But I can say that the crab puffs and egg(less) rolls are also great. Every time, the food is great, the service is timely and also friendly. I only wish there was one closer to my house! I certainly hope they open more locations.

mb9cWWI8PXUBM67Vh3b_Wg.text: Finally a taste of green! Samosas and sauce perfectly on point. Curry bowl with pan noodles and veggies was deeeelicous, but I will add mushrooms and maybe chicken next time :) ordered online, supa speedy quick nomnomnomies ^_^

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Curry bowl with pan noodles and veggies!

44nSvSdJa0985eftIKAgBg.text: Just got here and I'm already impressed that they are doing a joint event with Roka Akor later this month. Great ambiance, service, and food. We ordered the mock chicken wings, chicken Kung pao bowl, and of course the original 'g' sandwich. I loved it- it was very comforting lol. We will def go to the event at Roka and come back to this cool spot.

WH7c1Oyzd6pHyVCpPe8fBg.text: This restaurant is inspirational!  Read on for details...  It is a tiny little place which does a great job of circling people through.  You walk in and up to the counter where you order from the overwhelming menu!  The menu is adorned with specialties and allows for much personalization in most dishes.    I do recommend starting with their famous wings!  They are quite spicy but the sauce is exquisite.  The crab rangoons are also a nice, refreshing twist on the Chinese deep-fried goodness... these appear to be baked and come with a really light dipping sauce which packs a bunch of flavor.  For the main courses, the menu is overwhelming!  I have tried the buffalo chicken sandwich which is their same spicy-amazingness sauce in the wing appetizer and comes on a submarine roll (which is a little too large for my fancy but filling all the same- I just opted to pull one half off of it).  I have also opted for something named with diablo in it-you can order it with rice or noodles (i opted noodles) and you can pick your choice of meats to add in.  This dish was swamped with veggies!  The flavor was an explosion!   If you made it through the first part of the review, please note that everything I have talked about is completely vegan/vegetarian!  That's right... everything is made of textured soy and mushroom to create a meat-like product for the dishes.  I have even "tricked" people into eating this food without them even knowing they are eating meat substitutes.  That's right!  Full-on meat eaters who would never order a dish at this joint were raving about the tastiness of their meals!  If you order to go, you are given wooden utensils and smart packaging... which I love.  portions are generous and you won't leave hungry...  I would even venture to say that an appetizer and meal by your lonesome is too much food!  You must be with others to indulge in both courses (unless you want left overs).  I am slowly making my way through everything on this menu.  I eat here for every single meal I possibly can when I work in Phoenix (almost weekly) so I will update once I have conquered.  See my review for Nami, it's sister restaurant in the same parking lot... I am in the LOVE!

N20NKntGRNL82EvCedpqng.text: My friend and I both had the runs after eating the poorly prepared food here. I only was able to eat half of my lunch because it was so unpalatable. Not impressed. Try the Loving Hut you'd be happier

z1JK7RPtNsfW3zEsKrVWCQ.text: Great healthy affordable vegan options! The hummus was delicious!! Love the bowls and the teas :) cute place located in phx.  Has a hipster casual feel to the place.

FrzG1jtNntz7DgJ_7McoJQ.text: I kinda expected the drunken mushroom chicken bowl to have broth in it because of the title? upon further review i realized my mistake. It was just better than okay for me (the vegan chicken was yummy but the rest lacked the flavor i was craving.) the meatball po-boy was quite good (as were the fries)  (see my reviews of the other green location and nami for more about the menu)

MfpC0PtwLlAWAk-2pG9yHg.text: I went here for lunch and about 45 minutes after I left started daydreaming about coming back for dinner! Unfortunately, I was too full from lunch to need to eat again tonight but I will definitely be back on my next trip to Phoenix. We had the wings, the big wac and the Argentinian Po'boy. I don't usually order veggie burgers at vegetarian restaurants because they are standard fare at most places now but I made an exception because it came highly recommended and I am so glad I did; it was spectacular! The wings were also fantastic. The Po'boy was really good but didn't wow me as much as the others. We also went over to their sister bakery (nami) next door for soft serve and I would suggest you do the same- So. Good. Can't wait to come back to both places!

saYuaer3GhA4zLWgNXq6lw.text: Friendly, quick service.  I had an order of crab puffs, which tasted exactly like the type you would get at a fast food Chinese restaurant.  The parking lot here is lilliputian and narrow, so large vehicles beware!

k1sgQd5bPLo9a7mlgTXLCg.text: Hands down best vegan comfort food! I have a friend that was eating here for weeks because it was close to her work and she didn't even realize it was vegan until I told her. Calico burger or spicy g is my favorite!

nY77j1AdqiV-UzyeJv6fMg.text: Diverse menu and unique specials. I have to admit that sometimes I want a dish with a meat=like texture. Green menu has that and great variety of other vegan dishes. Then there is the guilty pleasure of vegan desserts at Nami - right next door. We ask family for gift cards to Green, as we know we will be regular diners there throughout the year.

X-rBmGyv4QamZ1d8VhFvQg.text: Very clean and welcoming environment. It has both outdoor and indoor seating. Everything I've tried on the menu has been wonderful, but their bbq wings are the best! Afterwards we went next door to Nami for a strawberry shake that was perfect.

eXzrvBJ5yQk3g8jsnJBPwQ.text: I called and ordered to go on Saturday night around 7:40. I ordered 2 orders of the buffalo wings, the  cheesesteak and the BBQ mock chicken sandwich. They told me the wait would be about 20 minute. I got there at a few minutes past 8 and the place was jam packed. I wouldn't recommend coming here if you're looking for quick service on a Saturday night. I could see my order finished and waiting but I had to wait in a line of about 5 customers. Not a big deal, but I think it would be beneficial to have a line specifically for to go orders.   I waited in line for about 10-15 minutes and got my food. I brought it home to my girlfriend (whose vegetarian) and we sat down to eat. She got the BBQ sandwich and it looked and tasted great. The wings were awesome too! My only problem was my cheesesteak. I don't think it's normal for it to only come with one bun (on the bottom). It still tasted good, but obviously it was a bit messier than I was hoping for having only one bun.   All in all, the food was great and I'll be sure to come back. I may not order to go again though.   Cons: Parking, order pickup, lack of buns.   UPDATE: Came again to show my mom and brother. The food was much better. I think it does taste better fresh out of the kitchen VS. Out of a to go box. I had the Po Boy sandwich and loved it! Much better experience this time.   Best of all, they gave me 2 buns this time :)

eXCpY8Xm90BpgZHoWz083A.text: This place is great!! I'm so happy I live so close by and I'm vegetarian!! The food is great make sure to try their vegan animal style fries!

bs9xFCLAcoSrfD8atfoBZQ.text: Big Wack , and fries Fu+& Ya  Amazing tasty and delicious I eat mostly Raw vegan and love some cooked food once in awhile I am a truck driver so it's always an extreme Challenge finding good vegan vegetarian food a place to park grab my food and move on  I called ahead of time set my order up found the spot to double Park through the flashers on ran and got my food and let me tell you I will travel 600 miles today and this my friends was the best part of my day tasty delicious and I will be back thank you so much

LdQirphzw6OJiQjZmbA0vg.text: Went here after trying Nami for their brunch. Seriously great. I tried a Philly cheesesteak sandwhich, the bbq chicken wrap and the big wac burger. The big wac takes the cake out of the three with a close second for the bbq chicken wrap.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6g_iit2bdtCL4h1WdgrsPw.text: Amazing vegan comfort food. Would recommend the Big Wac, Wendy's Pickle, and the samosas. The only thing that I've ever been upset with was that one time the samosas were cold, but when I brought it up, they quickly replaced them with steaming hot delicious ones. If you're looking to splurge with calories, this is THE VEGAN PLACE. It is owned by the same people as Nami and they are both equally delicious. I had their burrito special today with FRIED PICKLES and I couldn't be more impressed with the quality.

Ld2vQ-1PTHP-3UGF4GJEXQ.text: This is the best vegan food I've ever had! I'm from California, but make sure to eat here every time I'm in the area. I usually order one of their mock chicken sandwiches, which doesn't have that aftertaste some mock chicken has. The bf usually gets the big WAC, which is also amazing! Make sure to save room for a tSoynami after!

6A_iG17u5e74ACNNdzsTRQ.text: Been on a kick on cleaning up my diet and was on the search for alternatives meat products, that not only tasted good but was wallet friendly. I've heard little blips of how yummy Green's items are and found that their Secret BBQ Sammie is one of the best mock chicken sandwiches you could order!  Green is conveniently located next to Nami which serves up soy-based ice cream, pastries, desserts and coffee. However, I needed food-food and Green serves up some of that and it is all plant-based! Green also serves alcohol, if you are so interested. I ordered the Secret BBQ Sammie, a side of fries and got their House Made Strawberry Lemonade. Items are a la carte.  The space is a bit small but has a patio out front and out back. Big windows to allow bright light in. There's bar seating and tables. The staff was really friendly and informative.  The Secret BBQ Sammie has slices of thin mock chicken, slices of bell pepper and carmelized onions in a espresso bbq sauce and vegan mayo. Legit BBQ sauce, it was tangy, sweet, hint of spice and then some. The mock chicken was thin like sheets of tofu, but had a texture similar to chicken but with more bite and chew to it. I really enjoyed it, it's one of those things where you can appreciate it's similar characteristics while still being it's own thing. The bun itself held pretty well to it's filling and did a good job of soaking up all the BBQ sauce. The fries were okay, they didn't seem hot or fresh but are the typical thin cut fries. I ended up taking half of my meal home because it was really filling. The house lemonade was good, I also tried their limeade and found both to be refreshing while not being overly sweet.   For price point I'm pretty impressed, this meal with a drink came out to be around $12 which is not bad for a plant-based meal that actually tasted legit!   Parking is a bit of a pain here during lunch time and turning into Green or Nami on 7th can be a bit of a hassle during peak times. Despite the traffic, I'm excited to try the other things Green has to offer!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ Secret Sammie with a side of Fries

9wHPq2d6iZJK71aeMKjRXw.text: BIG WAC and Fries. This will always be what I order for the rest of my life. Just so satisfying. Their slaw is also delicious. Great place to take people coming into town. Very unique and Hip. Great service. Food out quick and hot. Popular veg place. They have dessert next door called Nami and they have their signature soynamis that are delish and baked items. Coffee as well. Nami also serves breakfast! Check out the local joint. One of a kind.

vM91W1nfkAeHBgocIzWBOQ.text: Boyfriend and I went here about a year ago. He got a Chicago cheesesteak and I got a karma curry bowl. The first thing my boyfriend said when he bit into it was, "are you sure there's no meat in here??" I thought that was pretty funny. This restaurant is in close proximity to a vegan dessert place, which I am also a huge fan of. I'm a little far away from here, but it's definitely worth the drive!

JNIbH-wDvfBmU31vxpCXBA.text: The Big Wac is so good there! It tastes just like a Big Mac! It was a longer wait than I expected though to receive the to go order.

A6dcZS5t3u-WGZx6aFaIZA.text: We ordered the rice bowl with mock chicken.  It was delivered promptly, but was made with tofu. Got some pushback about how fresh/good the tofu was, but that wasn't what we ordered. The rice bowl had very little rice, it was a ton of broccoli with 4 or 5 pieces of mock chicken, and a very small portion of rice at the bottom of the bowl. The broccoli was cooked to perfection and the sauce was amazing

dDgNf2zUZDv7sFu10iEBew.text: I've only been to this location once (but a handful of times to the Tempe location), and it has a far more casual, almost fast-food vibe to it, even though the menu and service is essentially the same. The interior decor and seating arrangement just made it seem more of a rushed dining setting than the Tempe one. Not that that is necessarily a bad thing, but just something I noticed right upon walking in.  I got the Secret BBQ Sammie, which was one of the two sandwiches that could be made gluten-free (the other being the Original "G" Spicy Po-Boy), and even though I could have gotten it with their gluten-free bun, I was in the mood for more vegetables, so I asked for it without any bread and just on a bed of salad greens. WOW IT WAS GOOD. And the espresso BBQ sauce they used on the mock "chicken" and the onions and peppers? I wanted to lick my plate clean until every drop of the sauce was in my belly (but I maintained some dignity and didn't).  Also unlike the Tempe location, I'm not sure if there is a dish return station, and if patrons are just expected to leave their dishes and utensils on the table when they're done. Because I ended up feeling awkward trying to bring my plate and fork back and not finding any place for dirty dishes. But this meant a lot of the tables weren't bused right away, so finding a clean table to sit at outside was impossible until an employee came to clean the tables.  But otherwise, a good place to get a hearty vegan (and gluten-free if you desire) meal in Phoenix!

p83QOacULIcyY_sGERCf_A.text: Amazing food! Great atmosphere and friendly staff. The food is so good and they have gluten free options as well. Happy to see more restaurants opening that offer good quality vegan food. I highly recommend this place!

eJifyHYaZTYS1ZHlE91jww.text: I found them on yelp and decided to give them a try. The best decision I made. This is my only 2nd vegetarian restaurant I've ever tried and for now Mew Green American Vegetarian is my #1 go to stop when I want a burger. Omg their famous Big Wac burger is the best vegan burger I have tasted so far and it is well worth penny. I order the famous Big Wac and Buffalo wings. I had to bring the wings home because I was full of the Big Wac alone and the 2 cups of raspberry lemonade I had which by the way was delicious as well. Don't take my word go check them out yourself I promise your tummy will thank you and you will be thanking me for this review lol. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9f-EQeW7x0309Z-7wiuVmw.text: I absolutely love this place. Great food, friendly staff and super cool design. Will definitely be backing whenever I'm in Phoenix.

nXr7PbCiXBHy4-ISom_GOg.text: Being the only person in the family that is vegan it's sometimes not easy to eat out with everyone. So glad for Green. Here I can eat and be comfortable. And knowing that the food is delicious that even my non vegans can eat is a bonus. Would highly recommend. Well deserving of the 5 stars.

n-qQ9bkdfkYzmjlwQawq7g.text: Was amazing my husband had the Thai peanut bowl and I had the Jamaican Brussels sprout wrap.(I can't remember the menu name)Both were delicious. Parking is difficult here but well worth it. Service was limited but very good!

XeP0ysh52WtS8nRtBGLN7A.text: Drove from out of town, waited over and hour for the restaurant to open, and the first thing out of the hostess mouth is there's a 25 min wait before anything is cooked??!? literally 6 people in line ready to order and no orders wont even be started for another half an hour. Not that I'm impatient, just planned to have a great burger before I go to the dentist. I didn't even get to get food due to lack of time to wait it out more... tho it would have been worth it.

ZYBJ5MB0BXYWW-nMbgNVrw.text: I've been before, the food is BEYOND yummy. Unfortunately, I find the customer service to be lacking for infrequent customers. I wasn't aware that I was supposed to stand in a specific spot to get service. So when a couple was about to jump me in line, I made my presence known. The cashier made a huge deal about me not standing where she was expecting me too. As she was helping me, I described an item I saw on their menu online but she made it seem as if never existed. Then after she helped me, she apologized to the people after me as if I was an annoying customer.   To make matters worse, as soon as my plate touched the table I noticed ALL my food was cold.

zJktgSey05TsmLYRrvQXWg.text: I never thought that 'vegetarian' could taste so good!! Everything on the menu is dairy free according to the cashier, and there is a separate menu for gluten free foods.   I got the coconut curry with fake chicken meat - I could have been fooled it was the real thing. My friend got the coconut curry with tofu, which had so much flavor. The curry bowl came with brown rice hidden under a pile of healthy and crunchy steamed veggies, all smothered in a flavorful yet slightly spicy sauce. The only factor was that the curry didn't have much of a coconut flavor, but it was still really delicious.   I have absolutely no concerns about the ingredients that are used- as far as I know, Green is very transparent about their foods. Definitely the place to go to for people wanting healthier choices other than salad. I would recommend trying this place, even if you're not vegetarian. You would be surprised!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut curry with fake chicken

upAxs9eTuelc4iYVjk0OvA.text: Note: this is a Vegan restaurant  I'm not a vegan or vegetarian, I am an omnivore who will ponder the proper way to prepare any animal. However this place has a Secret BBQ Chicken Sandwich that still has me wondering how that is not BBQ Chicken. Awesome Beer menu. Oh and I am not usual a beer type of guy. They have all sorts of NON main stream drink choices like Dr. Better. NO Coke or Pepsi products. ALWAYS packed. Staff is sweet and really down to earth. You will find yourself coming back more and more. I certainly have.

YJVAx6IcLWgHjhPZZUOJrQ.text: It's a good option for vegetarian food but I'm not sure it would be my favorite.  They have a good selection of drinks and teas but the protein leaves a little bit to be desired

H3wAwyp-3QMWcTusyHnIVA.text: This is really good food but the only issue I have is the line. I ordered to go over the phone and when I got there the line was very long. I'm on my lunch break and I have to be back on time so it's really irritating for me. When I got my food, sat down, and it wasn't even hot anymore. You guys should really look into getting more registers or at least a designated to go area. I love the food, just wish it was hot by the time I sit down to eat it...

IuTUC-eG9dxEOKHSO9khFw.text: How does this place have such a high rating?  We went on a recommendation and were excited for the healthier versions of wings!  VERY disappointed. The wings were too spicy, the salad was underwhelming, the fake chicken had no flavor. Luckily, we were in downtown PHX so it wasn't too out of the way otherwise, we would have been even more bummed. We are both non-vegetarian but LOVE vegetarian food and will have to keep searching for our go to place.  Save your money and cook better veggie dishes at home.

cMKXfMSDntPm7b1DgYM9_A.text: The best vegan food in Arizona! Nami is great too! I go there all the time. I would give them more than 5 stars if I could!

4jhU5TxhkGLl0KlDIgRLQA.text: Love how there is place with an array of vegetarian and vegan options. Ordered the brussel sprout wrap and opted to have it on a bed of lettuce which was a wonderful modification. The only thing to keep in mind is that it's very difficult to find parking.

GANnA7DsAhRGFB2kifATCw.text: I am such a meat eater so this means a lot that I am giving a vegetarian restaurant 5 stars... Or a review at all!! But wow bravo to Green for creating a vibrant menu with a large range of dishes that actually interest people other than just vegetarians!! I've gotten the Big Wac two times already because it literally tastes exactly like a Big Mac... Like you ACTUALLY feel full afterwards it's crazy!! Helped me nurse a wild hangover! The environment is so welcoming and aesthetically pleasing :) only criticism is that it's a tad bit too nippy inside! I will be a returning customer, see you soon Green!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Get it
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Wac literally tastes like a Big Mac love it!!

HAREZtFlceV16TXgY2GFYw.text: It's not easy being green, but this place makes it delish ;-)  I ran into Green, well Nami really, looking for frozen desserts; you can't go to Nami and not eventually end up trying Green too. After 5 or so visits, I've never had a bad meal. Lunch seems to be pretty popular here - but never a terribly long wait. Order your meal at the counter, grab your number, find a table, and wait for delivery. The staff are always friendly and smiling - I don't think I've seen someone sad or unhappy to be working here.   On a recent visit the girl at the counter sold me on their daily special, this day's was a bratwurst; vegan of course. Coming with a few options for the side, I settled on their house made coleslaw; which I thoroughly enjoyed. The bratwurst was tasty with a dijan / spicy mustard and sourkraut, but the bun seemed to span the width of three brats and was sliced more like sandwich bread and not like a hot dog bun; I can live with that minor complaint though. I've had their hummus and buffalo wings appetizers, a big wac (their shameless vegan big mac), a thai penut bowl, ranchero salad, and one or two other dishes I can't quite remember at this point; all vegan, all delicious, with my favorite being the ranchero salad - it's my normal go to option here.  I believe I've answered the question of would I come back by actually coming back, once every month or so.  Happy Yelping Phoenix. This spot totally makes it easier to be green ;-)

NOty2Zkx1-DSe2Kl7qxZvg.text: Yum!  My friend and I were in town for a conference and got tired of gobbling together vegan meals and eating hummus so we decided to try this place. We had crab puffs, Wendy's Pickle, the cheese steak, and fried Brussels sprouts. The crab puffs were right on - crispy, fried, creamy crabby goodness. Out of the two sandwiches, I like the Wendy's Pickle best because of the crispy breading and the perfect pickle taste. They have a nice selection of beers at great prices and the staff was patient with our many questions and made recommendations.

riEw0Y66sP3D_RAHGDeckA.text: Ordered the BFF and cole slaw..did not disappoint! I'm just now starting to go to vegan restaurants and I was hesitant at first, I'm not at all anymore! It was delicious and honestly tasted like a real chicken sandwich...service was great and during my lunch I saw John Jay from the radio show :) overall fantastic food and experience

1VUkdhFPL_JOxZS13dTmCA.text: This place has great food , but to wait 45 + minutes for my food every time I come in . If it takes you an hour to open the kitchen I think you guys should open at 12 . But until this is fixed , I will not be supporting this establishment

Ibdd_iqE1pltOTT0nI32ug.text: Every time I visit Phoenix I have to get to this amazing vegan foodie location. The no harm chicken parm is out of this world! And for a vegan sweet I walk next door to Nami!

j324kdeT9QnhIbKAYsPkqw.text: So far, I've tried the Thai Peanut Bowl, Lemon Pesto Bowl, and Spicy Buffalo "Wings". Every. Single. Item. Was so unbelievably tasty and satisfying!  I'm positive I could bring my meat eating friends here and they'd feel the same way. I'm a very new vegan, and the taste and feel of meat is still very memorable. Their mock meat game is totally on point, and they use quality ingredients.   I especially loved the half sized pieces of walnut in my pesto bowl. Really a nice surprise.   Take caution with the parking.  It was my first time parking here today, and I only have a not-so-green Toyota 4Runner. The parking area is tight. I almost had to park elsewhere. You'd have a serious challenge parking anything much bigger.

nPw1eEAl1iqWtWdryeAhwQ.text: I'm not vegan but can appreciate vegan cuisine so I decided to check out Green New American and was happy with my meal.  I went with the Big Wac and fries which was really good and tasty.  It's quite interesting that they are able to make those patties taste so beef like but not have any meat in them.  I'd definitely come back some time to try some of the other options on the menu.  Worthy of a 5 star rating.

QW-yMxf8c6slQ4Xyf1L21A.text: I cannot say enough good things about this place.  The staff is always fantastic The place is always clean The food is always as good as the last time I love a place where I don't have to worry about cross contamination of animal byproducts thank you guys so much for being in Phoenix and being so awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Big Wac.. .for once legends do not disappoint!
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of my favs... BBQ Portebella Mushrrom burger, fries and chocolate almond shake. So good!

RvwJJi0yEBJ0AaaNmkSuYA.text: The customer service is superb!! They are extremely nice and yes it is difficult to make a choice.  Note to the customer: if you see a line behind you don't just stand there and make people wait because you can't decide. What I did was take a menu and stand outside of the line and when I was ready I hopped back in.  That's a new concept! Isn't it!  Lastly, the food was delish! That's why they are getting a 5from me.

MWVVmK_lCv73BjH-3PNbdg.text: My absolute favorite restaurant in Phoenix. The vegan chili fries and Po Boy sandwich are my go to here. They have a good beer selection and the sangria is amazing too. All the salads are really awesome too. Vegan comfort food at its finest.

NsAfwdqcri6qIIrr2QZNag.text: Fresh quality vegetarian cuisine I have tried two dishes thus far and based upon these two I can hardly bring myself to eat anywhere else The juice fountain has various juices and teas for $1.75 Refills are free A very small venue welcoming and friendly Lots of smiles all around

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sauted high quality veggies with noodles in a delicate light curry sauce
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everybody can find something they like here

tVdFSSTxRUUkk0s-fNGNvw.text: Been here a couple of times and love this place when I am in Phoenix.  It's super casual and in a very veggie prone area of Phoenix of 7th street.  The menu is very user friendly with juices, sandwiches, salads,  burgers, and small bites in which you can mix and match.  It's almost hard to decide but what I love about this place is if you get their handhelds which is the burgers and sandwiches you get to choose your side and there are all kinds to choose from fruit to vegan chile to coleslaw and even brussels sprouts.  Now I know there are many people who hate brussels sprouts but believe me they probably make the best ones in the entire planet, if you don't like these then yes stay away from brussels sprouts period:).  My go to dish is the dagobeah jungle which is a fancy word for jerk spiced brussels sprouts over salad tossed with a jamaican dressing and tortilla chips. You can also get this as a wrap.  If you don't like spice then avoid this dish but if you do you are in for a treat.  It's got this great spice and the brussels sprouts a so amazing the way they char them.  It's perfectly filling for lunch.  The burger here is also like crack and I love that with coleslaw.  Now here is the deal.  This place is so reasonable it's almost like I feel guilty how little I pay for such a great fresh meal.  I end up tipping handsomely even though you walk up and order yourself.  As far as beverages they have a whole line of fruit drinks from teas to ginger lemonade and you pay one price (again cheap) and you get unlimited refills.  This is cool because I got to try them all.  Some are a little sweeter than I like so I stuck with the tea and the berry one and added water and ice to make it exactly how I wanted.  It's all self serve so it's great.  They also have beers on tap and  wines and they give you a nice selection.  Overall I'm a fan and will keep coming back.  Win win win!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jerk spiced brussels over greens w/Jamaican dressing

lKpk4M7mCslEsZdqCVwMEw.text: The house tofu is the best tofu I've ever had! I wish I knew how to cook it myself! Get the house tofu in pretty much any of the bowls, and you're good. Also love their Big Wac for a splurge meal!

Nt8q47-XIHF7yziHkpLCBg.text: World class vegetarian in PHX! Had the chicken artichoke salad, boneless wings, chili fries, and eggless rolls. Top ten on Happy Cow!

LVmB5DLwXElnYPW0Q5A4KA.text: This place is amazing. I have been here many times, I'm somewhat of a regular here. Everything about this establishment is wonderful. It has a great vibe and it's a real fun place to meet with a friend or date. I've gone here with many non-vegans and no one has ever not fallen in love with this place. Their food is great. Almost everything on the menu is delicious. I recommend the buffalo wings and the Big Wac burger. They will convert any meat eater into a fan of this place. The staff is always friendly. Great customer service. This will always be my favorite place to eat!

_SP0hiVJZ_R_S_kXCRwROA.text: I was so pissed off.  I ordered the Coronado Enchiladas, the special they had last week. They were awful. If I wanted undercooked tortillas with a veggie filling, and taco bell sauce, I could go to Taco Bell. But nontheless, I paid $9.  And they did not replace my crap food for free. I ended up paying $17 total for the Mongolian... Which is good, but not $17 good.  Make sure that you are going to enjoy what you get, because them not owning up to shitty food is a bad idea.

w_VIQFgwXMY9YfZ-x0yP8g.text: My second time at Green (the first time at their Scottsdale location).  I tried the Diablo bowl with crispy tofu and noodles.  Great flavor and LOTS of tasty veggies (eggplant, broccoli, peppers, onions, carrots, zucchini) but lacking in noodles.  Still left full and satisfied though.    Was disappointed that they only have bottled teas/juices and no soda (Scottsdale location has a soda fountain).  I'm not even that big on soda, but I have one Diet Coke with my lunch each day so if it's not available - or heaven forbid, Pepsi products only - then I get disappointed.  Overall, a tasty meal, and I look forward to trying other items on their menu.

AARvs40R2lxoJmquG1o2DQ.text: Best vegan junk food ever! My favorite items are the spicy wings and the big wac. I've brought my omnivore friends here and they couldn't tell they were eating a plant based meal. Consistent flavorful delicious vegan comfort food at it's best!

2aU4glE56nSSrN84urVaRQ.text: Wait, did Green open up another restaurant in Phoenix?  Like many of you, I was overjoyed to utter that wholly unexpected turn of events.  Am I in a giant garage?  There's a hangar door for a narrow, long car.  I suspect this set-up works well when it is warm, but not hot, and you want to eat outside.  Or eat on the edge of being outside, but remain inside.  You get to choose how close to being outside you want to be without actually being outside.  The way I see, Green is a great restaurant and it happens to be vegetarian/vegan.  Where Green surpasses other restaurants is flavor.  The salad, the most neglected item on every other menu-- flavorful.  Other menu items -- flavorful.  Did I mention that I like meat?  If you are answering, "no?", then you need to read some of my other reviews.  And feel free to endorse them as funny or cool.  The answer is yes, people.  The reason I like Green is because what I like even more is good food.  This incarnation of Green has an artsy (in a good way), trendy, causal kind of feel.  There's folksy art on the walls available for purchase, and am in a hangar for mini airplanes?  There's also the companion coffee-dessert shop next door, called Nami.  It is where you get the Tsoynami.  If you don't know what that is, maybe it's time to find out.

5rj5jfpqhKRiajk_RehCHA.text: YUM! Some of the best buffalo "wings" I've ever had! We got the "No Harm No Parm" and "Secret BBQ Chicken" Sandwiches. Everything was delicious! Even though I was getting full, I HAD to finish!  Also, they have awesome restrooms.. I don't think I've ever commented on this before, but their's were really nice.

JECqZ0BcF0F1lvW6uJEyDw.text: Nice idea but I don't think many of the options here are actually much healthier than their meat-ful counterparts unless you stick with a salad. The place is larger on the inside than it looks when driving by. I had the Big Wac, which was good but not amazing like others report. My friend had a calexico which had a nice hummus/sauce mixture, but was otherwise pretty boring. I don't know....feel like burgers should have some form of veggies like lettuce, tomatoes, etc. Another friend had the thai peanut bowl. The tofu was pretty good but that sauce was so thick and heavy. I'm curious to try other options and check out Nami, but they've got some work to do to impress me foodwise.

E-Fs20rADeNvbFTfoF5Vgg.text: Amazingly fast service, friendly staff, INCREDIBLE food, decent prices, awesome laid-back atmosphere. I am so very glad we came here on our trip. I had the BBQ bacon burger with slaw and I also got chili cheese fries. No regrets.

eFdI6BUMTxj7Ayl8rikkGA.text: Amazing assortment of dishes that are packed full of flavor. The use of spices to enhance and pair flavors demonstrates top notch creativity. If you are a fan of brussels sprouts then the "dagobah jungle" is for you. Dig the Jedi tribute in the clever name. The art on the walls is also unique. The whole experience is just the right vibe. Weather permitting, dine on the patio!

50nsbtjKzibIsw53KoL9Sg.text: The food is delicious & the portion sizes are perfect, great location too...I'm giving the place 3 stars because I did not feel comfortable with the cashier...This has happened more than once too, she was not friendly whatsoever.  She didn't smile at all, nor did she seem welcoming/nice.  I believe her name was Taylor. . . Let's be happy  & give positive vibes to one another.

-_Y-QfgB6rt_2QBWijMPAw.text: I am not a vegan, far far from it. I couldn't be a vegan if I wanted to cause I hate most veggies.  My partner is a vegan however and I am always willing to try anyhting once. The meat-less meat actually has the texture of meat not mush.  I get the original "G". It is a buffalo meat-less chicken between two pieces of bread with tomato, lettuce, buffalo sauce, and some mayo like something as well. I get the french fries with this. I actaully crave this damn sandwich now. It is spicy so if you are not a spicy eater I would not suggest to get it. If you like spicy this might be the perfect thing for you. The fries are awesome as well. Shoe sting cut, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Mmmmmm. Just writing this make me want it. I also get the egg-less eagrolls. These are yammy as well.

QdQD-ZkPKq_347VYY58M_w.text: What an adorable and delicious spot. Enjoyed the big wac and the yummy tea. Then went next door for an ice expresso and cupcake... Absolutely delicious. Also tried their chicken wings and artichoke dip, both tasted very good as well. If you're a vegetarian, and ever crave the taste of meat, but can't eat it... This place will definitely satisfy your craving. Will be back to try something new. My husband is not a vegetarian, but loved the food as well. The portions are filling and the service is awesome.

dfD2miz7ec9uVx0EGbZXeQ.text: This place is great!  Heard about it from my daughter and it is now one of our top favorite restaurants.  I love the Big Wac.  I like veggie burgers already, but do indulge in a turkey burger once in a while.  The Big Wac is so good it can replace my turkey burgers :-).  You can have it with a side of fries, cole slaw or fruit.  I had the cole slaw with the tahini sauce...very good.  The portions are good but I didn't feel stuffed afterwards.

CCrUNOCpdfmGxcMKdgViHA.text: I loved this place.  We just stumbled upon it and it was wonderful.  The food was really good and the staff helped us figure out what was going on.  We're vegetarians but it was like, huh?  So yummy.  Also weirdly the cleanest bathroom I have ever been in in my life, ever.  I'd come back to Phoenix to eat here again.

G7qlJyCnEKAiFxcvsksP3Q.text: I love this place! Kind and informative staff, amazing food that vegans, vegetarian, and meat eaters a like can all enjoy! It's fun they have wine and beer as well! I had the spicy wings and chili cheese fries! I went back again and got the same thing it was so good! Next time I'll try a burger and I want to try the vegan dessert place too! Highly highly recommend!

4pJK43ked4n8XwVuY869zA.text: This place is AMAZING!  My (almost 18 year old) daughter and I are vegan, my husband and (also teenage) son are not.  ALL of us were happy with our food here.  We ordered the Big Wac (amazing) and the unegg rolls (also amazing).  My husband and I also enjoyed the Valentine's special ("beef" with fettuccine noodles).  We will be regulars here for sure.  :) I must try it all.

N2j6s0w-JAIXV2dgUjOAcQ.text: Went there on Saturday and ordered the  big wac and wendy's pickle, for my cheat meal. My bf loves the big wac and the wendy's pickle was good. The sandwiches are big portions, so bring your appetite.

tI3HEgAnTA7GeEP5lIVzNA.text: Great Vegan food! Casual and cute! We need more local joints like this! Especially for the vegan / health conscious population! I will def be back!!

tVPST92tzGdppXlk4uErBQ.text: This place alone makes me want to move to Phoenix! I would be there all the time.  It's got a similar set up to Panera - you order at the counter and then they bring your food out to you. The food came out within a reasonable time.  The best and worst part about going to vegetarian restaurants is that I literally want everything on the menu. I ended up trying the buffalo wings and the "big mac" which were both AMAZING. I don't typically like when vegan/vegetarian foods try to be like meat, but they did a fantastic job. The wings had a great sauce and the burger was a dressed up vegetarian burger. A lot of food, but I managed to finish it all. Delicious.  If you are a vegetarian and you're in Phoenix this place is a must!! Come to New York please!!

fA7V0NuK0TuJiDPRpql6cQ.text: Vegan food is the best when someone knows how to make good entrees .... big wac is the best ...

dYtTICwsDfFVKs9beWlO-w.text: Amazing food! I have loved everything I've had there, but I absolutely crave the West Coast Fries. They're like In N Outs animal fries, but vegan. I have a sensitivity to gluten, and have never had a reaction there, but the menu implies it wouldn't be great for someone with Celiac because cross contamination can occur. Biggest issue with this place is that it's always packed and parking is very limited. We need a bigger location!

YLj569pHGe59w8GwEMwcaw.text: I can only give this place a 5 star rating because of its completely vegan menu and consistency!  On my most recent visit, I had the Spicy Chkn Po' Boy, Thyme Fries, and Sangria. The fries were a wee bit cold, but still tasty and I didn't want to wait for a refire. I learned there was fairly new staff on board and that's such a small detail that it's forgiven. I know if I asked, they would have happily remade them! The Spicy Po' Boy was good and messy!! Their wing sauce is my favorite, I probably won't order that sandwich again, just too messy for me. I prefer their Bufalo wings anyway (eaten with a fork)! My standard order includes the wings, definitely what made me fall in love with Green. The Sangria was large, slightly dry, not uber sweet, and had peach slices! They have other cocktails beside wine and beer, but I wouldn't expect a full bar. However, the cooler full of non-alcoholic bevs holds quite the variety!   The Scottsdale location sells the tsoynami desserts inside, along with the full menu, while the Phoenix location shares a lot with Nami. Nami is the stand alone coffee shop where you'll find all the vegan desserts!   Great vegan fast food, there are healthy options, but who wants that when you can get a Big Wac?!   There's lots of indoor AND outdoor seating, the art lining the walls is local and can be purchased, it's counter service where they deliver to the table, booze, and desserts next door. Keep in mind that parking is limited and have patience with the parking lot, it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Original g   Spicy Po - boy
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thyme Fries
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sangria with Peaches

D652Q2WFKqx1MC_yqkWfWA.text: Love Green!  I had the buffalo wings and the crab ragoons. Very busy on a Saturday night, but I found a spot on the patio!  Right next door to Nami so I also got my dessert on. Wish they'd open one in Gilbert!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab puffs.

57OQERg9EBh8UxZfSQlfLw.text: This place was hands down one of the top and most delicious vegan places we have ever eaten! We were visiting from Southern California to apartment hunt and were so glad this was out choice when looking for what to eat. My husband and I got the BLTA and Big WAC burger, split both to share, and even the fries on the side were delicious. We're even more excited for our move now because we get to come back to eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GIp_4Dc2QcQVd5FDnL-VRA.text: Stopped in for all vegan lunch on our road trip across Arizona, and so glad we stopped!   This place is totally a gem worth finding. From the cool laid back bohemian-hipster atmosphere, to the friendly staff and great selection of eats, this place is off the charts.   A lot of restaurants really try at this, and the bar was set high from living in Austin, and having a lot of that culture within an arms length, we were spoiled. However, I am looking forward to my next road trip just so I can try new things and eat great food while on the road.   Locals you are truly gifted a wonderful vegan eat spot! Try the buffalo "wings" - they are incredible!

MieK8S69_OkXcs1qb5vXfA.text: Food is fabulous! Decent service.  I am not a vegan, came with my son who is.  I ordered the cheese steak

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brussels sprouts here are delish!!!
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This place is soooooo good!

DRLOrdsPn0QgoNOpIpNrMw.text: I really do love this restaurant. I adore the plant based food (being lactose intolerant, it's often difficult to find cheat day like food when the craving hits) and the delicious dessert shop right next door.   What I don't love?   The parking.   Almost every time i've gone, i've almost narrowly missed hitting someone who is backing up out of a spot or the tiny parking lot is cramped by mid day and you're circling around like a chicken with their head cut off to find a rare open spot.   I get the exclusivity of this place but go here on the off hours or lyft to get something to eat (I'm not kidding)

SyVpB2MMnKjO8ORRIbrCyA.text: I love this place so much. It is my oasis in downtown Phoenix. I understand that the food here is not terribly healthy but it is INCREDIBLY delicious and all vegan (praise be to Jah!) As a vegetarian, I already eat pretty healthy so this place is always a treat for me.  I would avoid the obvious lunch and dinner hours because this place is very popular. Also the parking lot can fill up pretty quickly so plan the timing of your visit accordingly.  I don't really care for the salads here but I compare every veggie burger I eat anywhere to the outstanding BIG WAC (a vegetarian Big Mac) and I also love the buffalo wings, crab rangoons, and occasionally I get the tahini cole slaw. The same owners own Nami next door so on the rare occasion that I still have room in my belly for more, I'll get a s'mores tsunami from Nami as well.

pmzwv9sxTWUeU-dMOqsWaw.text: We came here on a work trip bc of all the great reviews and WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED. I had the peanut "chicken" wrap, and my friend got the artichoke salad. It was actually hard to choose, bc so many things sounded amazing. Highly recommend!

habHExfPy5MyxM0bZYiXrg.text: Okay I wasn't gonna make a review but honestly I can't get out of my mind how horrible that food just was. The past 3 times I've ate here it's not been a good experience. I'm almost 99.9% sure you guys took your BEST cook and put them in the Scottsdale location, because last time I went there the food was ON point, how your guys's USED to be..and I'm really disappointed..when you pay extra to get gluten free bun, then the burger comes with NO sauce and VERY tiny amount of cheese..almost a PLAIN burger for the most expensive one? What are you giving your customers? What they paid for?? NO. After going to fast food vegan restaurants in Cali, I really hope they come out here because they're gonna take away all your business. They are cheaper and 100% more flavorful and healthier as well! I honestly will eat at home from now on. Much rather make something BOMB, healthier and less expensive than that CRAP food. Not even sorry, that's just the honest truth. Thanks for being as good as you could be? LOL

MG6QSzcZ82NzmO36W98QWA.text: Amazing food with great service. This has been my new go to for over a year and everything on the menu is so delicious. If you haven't tried them or the word vegan scares you be adventurous and be sure to swing by and give your palate a chance to experience some great food!

kvyHffzs3vF3a-SEgJe91Q.text: Recently, I made the switch to pescatarian, eliminating my toughest meats... chicken and turkey. That said, I came here and ordered their wings" and they were amazing. The right amount of spice, texture and flavor. To add, I love that it came with cucumbers and carrots. Most restaurants give you celery, which I think is gross and overrated! This gem is right around the corner from my apartment so I look forward to trying many more things on their menu!!!! Happy eating :)  P.s. the photo was an afterthought haha

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_mzU709PifDqvHVMrb5Fqg.text: The restaurant was really cute and clean. Everyone was respectful and unique in their own special way. The animal fries were to die for and since I am not a vegan it was a good way to introduce yourself to vegan food. Out of the four dishes I was presented with I would say that I liked the wings the most. They were crunchy and the sauce was made to perfection. The BFF was very filling, it's more of a one and done sandwich due to the thick bread and the friend mock chicken. I will definitely be back here to enjoy the other items on the menu!

Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4dKCchbP-0BCkjmChndyxA.text: Pleasantly surprised with this place. Went here for the first time some weeks ago and went again today. Both times I got the Big Wac which seems to be their most popular item. I mean, I'd planned to try something different but after poring over the menu I just couldn't pass up the Wac again, as many of the other dishes sounded spicy and I didn't particularly want a spicy meal today for reasons I'll keep to myself :-)  People-watching while waiting for the food to be delivered was interesting. This place definitely has a certain type of clientele. Flesh-colored yoga pants, tree-hugger sandals, tattoos even shittier than those you might see at Pita Jungle (which is definitely saying something), the rogue's gallery of patrons brought a wan smile to my face at least once a minute until lunch was served.  The burger itself is surprisingly tasty. They lay on the pickles pretty thick, and it doesn't have much cheese or ANY tomato, but even so it was soft and delish. The fries were meh. They call them thyme fries, but I pretty much didn't see any thyme on them - maybe a few microscopic dots of green? But for the most part, just regular shoestring fries, maybe a bit drier than normal, and far from the best fries I've ever had.  Great thing about the meal is that you somehow don't feel shitty afterward. After a regular Big Mac I'm filled with self-loathing. An hour after my Big Wac I was happily enjoying an afternoon coffee and feeling pretty good.  If I could suggest one thing, it would be for these guys to pick different names for their menu items. Fun to read at first, but if McDonalds, Wendy's etc (they also have an item called "Wendy's Pickle") catch wind of their trademarks being used like this it could spell big trouble real quick. Maccas probably have more lawyers than employees! One whopper of a law suit (see what I did there?) could probably take this joint down. Plus it's difficult to say "I'll have a big WAC please" at the front counter without breaking out into a shit-eating puerile grin. Oh, and another suggestion - arrange more parking space. The parking SUCKS. Assholes parking on the left and right of the place make it almost impossible to manoeuvre anything bigger than a VW beetle around and out again. Good luck with your F150s, nouveau cuisine gourmands..  Also, fix the fries. They're not worth the money you're charging for them.  That all being said, I'll definitely be back! And MAYBE I'll try a new menu item next time round.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aaaand yet another picture of the Big Wac.

RsWqPEPrLGndGOsxpP9tbw.text: Delicious food and great atmosphere! Was passing through and saw this spot on my nearby places to eat and I am glad we stopped in. Quick and friendly service. They have a nice selection of drinks to choose from also. When you're done eating here you can walk right next door to get desert at Nami!

A7lYbN0rweP3JRlKGrdhPg.text: My son recommended this restaurant and it did not disappoint. I had a bacon cheeseburger that was delicious. Being Vegan makes it hard to find good food, so it is refreshing to have an entire menu with multiple items to choose from. Just wish they had more locations.

uOHj-xIY52FXYcANTsZKGA.text: A little disappointed with this place.  We make a point to stop here every time we are in town from Vegas. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is extremely inviting.   This last time was just unfortunate, we put in an order to go, go out to use the facilities. Come back and wait for our food. We begin to notice how people who came in after us were getting their food so we made a comment about that to the person we ordered with. She looked at us blankly went back into the kitchen and proceeded to run out food. 20 min goes by, nothing. 30 min goes by, nothing. She walks right by us a numerous amount of times so we decide to say something.  They found our food and say, "we called your name out 20 min ago." Hands us our now cold food and sends us on our way. Wow! What service?!? I wish there was an "I apologize we were really busy and didn't notice that you've been sitting right in front of us for 30 min" instead we were made to feel like it was our fault and sent on our way. A little disheartening for someone who goes out of their way from a different city to visit.   ProTip: They are not paying attention to detail, so if your food takes longer then 5-10min say something otherwise your food will be cold.

rtnW84ZXlT36VEYTQSoGMA.text: Great concept! Burgers, eggrolls, chicken wings, mock duck, thyme fries, cream puffs.   Only thing - my friend paid for a sangria. NEVER got it. So she went and repaid. 20 minutes later, I had to go to the counter and asked for it because she still did not receive her sangria.

y-jHizzEZosKO12wgkc0Gg.text: Today I took a vegan client to this restaurant because I heard that the big wac tasted as good as a traditional meat burger.   Highly skeptical I ordered myself a big wac and was pleasantly surprised as it was just as tasty as any meat burger.  This restaurant has restored my faith in vegan cuisine.   Next time I have a vegan client I know my go-to restaurant.

8-xF42WHQEn0tcQBPtJuPw.text: Feel excited to eat amazing vegan food, leave having eaten so much you with you hadn't  Its amazing in moderation. I'd like to actually manage to save room for desert next door one day.

Sqvtzk8oxnygJCHVbrxxlw.text: Staff is very attentive, friendly and food is always amazing! Recommend the animal style fries, "chicken" burger. Don't forget to go next door to their dessert spot Nami for some tasty treats

bnQ3XTT8VM0VHThW0E0Mfw.text: Great vegan place! We got quite a few items by accident. We ordered the crab puffs, cheesesteak with chili on the side, wack burger, the classic burger with brown rice on the side, and the dragon bowl--for only two people, lol. The crab puffs were okay, but I wouldn't order them again (too greasy and only get 4). The cheesesteak was fricken amazing--had bell peppers, jalapenos, "cheese," and was even appropriately greasy. The chili was decent and topped with wonton strips. My husband had the burgers on Ezekiel buns (score for Ezekiel bread!) and said they were better than the beyond burger. I tried a bite and they were pretty good. The dragon bowl was okay, but rather salty, so we probably wouldn't try that again. All in all, delicious!

-KTvVpUHgmQC_-PdaGNb-Q.text: My family and I went there today for lunch and it was terrific! My daughter has a ton of food allergies so it is tough to find allergy friendly places in town. My husband and I are not vegan but have to tell you the food was fantastic and the service was fast and the restaurant was packed. Great experience! Don't forget to go next door to Nami for dessert afterwards!!

sgloIsUa73erE6NdDRzLPg.text: Not family friendly.  Living in the neighborhood I have frequented Green on 7th st a handful of times.  The last 4 times have included a rude ignorance from staff regarding my autistic son and recently his service dog.  Each time I come with my son to get an ice cream we bring his dog, which has his service tag, but on the last trip it was left at home.  The staff immediately question me on dog's validity to which i assured and demonstrated his action with my son.  Today we entered Green. Asked the same question about the dog. Order ice cream & sat down.  This time my son had his favorite cereal in a snack bag which he likes to add to ice cream.  NO one else was there besides staff, every table empty except for the one table where a male worker finished wrapping napkins.  He got up and came over to my table to recite the prohibition for outside food in the establishment and requested that we leave.  I explained to him my son has allergies on top of everything else and would be done in a few moments.   Worker insisted and walked over to the front door, opened it and pointed both to the message on the door and to the street.  I gathered up my son, dog, ice cream.  Walked over to the register and reached in to  jar to remove my tip.    Told him the owners should be proud of the depth to which rules are enforced with an empty room and empty parking lot.  And to go F... himself...

eq7sc2CZsU3zSBSBdDtlVw.text: We luv Green. Big Wac and secret bbq sammy were great tonight. I tried the dagobah jungle salad and did not like it. Had a bitter taste to me. It came highly recommended so maybe it's just me. Ranchero salad was delicious as usual. Very happy that all of our food (for our family of 5) came out at the same time. I can't remember the last time that happened at Green and that was always frustrating. Sometimes someone would be done with their meal before the rest of the food came out. Hopefully they've fixed that for good. Finished with tsoynamis next door at Nami of course. Yum.

h-Nturkcf5CxRC1J8XOn-g.text: Awesome dining in downtown Phoenix. The worst part was trying to decide what to eat. As a visitor to the area, I wanted it all, knowing my time in Phoenix was limited. Decided on the BBQ chick'n, crab puffs and the boyfriend had the Big WAC.   Restaurant was clean and fun, outdoor seating was lovely. The cashier was super friendly and helpful as we were trying to pick some lunch items. I would recommend Green highly, and would be there weekly if I was a resident. I can't think of anything that could improve it!
