YSekf9WscBK5O4-lujEPKA.text: Green New American Vegetarian has excellent reviews, which made me excited to try their vegan dishes. I ordered the Buffalo Wing ($5.50), Sesame Dragon Rice Bowl with mock chicken ($9.75), The BFF $8.75), and Big WAC ($8.50).   From the reading the Yelp reviews, I was most excited to try the Big WAC, but it was salty vegan patties with burnt bread. It does taste similar to a McDonald's Big Mac and like a Big Mac it was lacking. I would also skip the Buffalo Wings as well.   The two dishes I did enjoy were has mock chicken as the main protein - The BFF and rice bowl. After trying The BFF, I got one to-go for my girlfriend and she did not even know that it was fake fried chicken. I would try Green New American Vegetarian again for their other mock chicken sandwiches.  What I recommend: -- The BFF

8inYvUDNUmo7R5oV4Pj_yA.text: Not the best customer service kind of rude.. wasn't the most pleasant experience but the food is really good I can not complain there just wish they would have better customer service to all their guests!!!

BPGAMCbZzG3EZye_ti5ZHA.text: Most of the food arriving to the table was room temperature when it was meant to be hot. The prices were a little bit high, for the quality.

Q20YLRpwB9mVLiBOcgY-ew.text: It's hard not to fall in love with this place, whether you're vegan or not! I've been coming here for a few years now. I'm vegetarian so hands down it's one of my favorite restaurants in the valley.   The food is great. It's truly a vegan/vegetarians dream - comfort food, vegan style! And although it's vegan it still taste amazing! So flavorful!  Recently they changed their menu up, which I'm pretty bummed about. The sandwiches no longer come with a side and they changed a few sandwiches and got rid of one of my favorites - the No Harm Chicken Parm :( whyyyy!?  Although, they did add a new sandwich, the BFF. Let me just say, it makes up for my old fav. The BFF is a mock chicken sandwich and it is so good. The mock chicken breading was crunchy and crispy. There's avocado on it. I subbed the jalapenos for Cholula hot sauce. And then there ranch sauce. Ahhh, I'm getting hungry thinking about it! That along with the chili cheese fries and I'm in heaven.   Another bad change, the kids meals. They now include a side and the price went way up. $8 for the mock chicken nuggets and $9 for a plain veggie burger...you gotta be kidding me! Although, I still bought it for my little ones lol.  What can I say, I'll always love this place.

WJBL4r83Qqc3wbxGddYuGg.text: This place has the best vegan food in town. I cannot wait to try the entire menu. The parking sucks, but definitely worth the hassle. It is our go to place.

zVL1rfpm6o90qRcN4uIyGQ.text: stunning vegan grub!  The Big Wack is bar none my go to burger in AZ, maybe the earth.  Love the wings. Sauce is tangy, unique and totally delectable!  Always solid service and beautiful design and decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rE2gmQc4LKLPP_E1-URK0g.text: The Big Wac was the best version of Big Mac I've tasted! The BFF, Wendy's Pickle, and Animal Fries were amazing as well.

cD1r7gs1bYuAoPoHmcsTXA.text: Service was not to par. Honestly you're not at work to chit chat your life away with your coworkers and treat  the customers like their not even present. Another 2mins and I would have walked out if it wasn't for my husband walking to the counter to retrieve a menu from under another customer who was just standing over the menus, also talking to the cashier about other things that had nothing to do with ordering food. So years later when we finally ordered, And received our food... (Which we got to go) my husband got the animal style fries. Which he didn't like at all. The sauce was too much mayonnaise and no pickled relish. Which last we checked thousand island should have pickled relish. And my sandwich was super plain. Honestly it wasn't anything special. I've had vegan fast food that tasted better than this.

JYMuh8hoLebxNUyh7ONZbg.text: Terrible, terrible service. I understand the restaurant was busy when I was in, but still... 30 minutes is way too long of a wait for JUST ONE WRAP to go. After waiting 30 minutes (plus 15-20 in line to place the order) I finally just asked for my money back.  I was never rude and I did not raise my voice or show any signs of agitation. But all I got after waiting nearly an hour was sarcasm and an attitude. They did not offer to comp the food, nor did they even bother to offer an apology. All they said was that they "simply forgot" and I would be refunded in "about 3-4 business days." That's an hour of my life I will never get back.  It's the second time something like this has happened to me here, but I figured I'd give them another shot, and that was a mistake.  There are other vegetarian options in the Phoenix area, and I highly recommend taking your hard earned money elsewhere. It will be the best advice you will ever get on here.

ppWNZYqNdctulQL11zKObw.text: I went to the Tempe/Scottsdale location for lunch and this one for dinner, where I just got the chili side. I have a moderate spice tolerance - I like some, but I don't have a taste for really extreme heat - and it felt just right to me, and not a bad size for having been listed as just a side instead of an entree.   This location is also very close to a bus stop, and that line allows several easy transfers to the light rail system, so it's easy to access by public transportation.   It also has a little bit of seating outside in both the front and back, and is right next door to another vegan business, which is either great planning or a happy coincidence.   I really liked both of them. I think if I lived in the area I'd probably prefer the Tempe/Scottsdale location just because it has a bigger parking lot, a little more space, and more natural light but this one is still pretty good, and I look forward to trying more of its foods in the future if I'm ever back.

92vqgop8hDrBM00ZPoFrOA.text: We had the Big WAC, omg just like the other sandwich we used to eat.  Loved it!!  Also, the animal fries are the bomb!!  We just need the recipe to the berry lemonade I need to make this at home.

2V19HsxkenF9sQHW7JLgaQ.text: Been coming here for years, always a great experience! Food is always very good, I wish they'd offer rabbit style burgers instead of bread (bun).  fries and garlic ranch is incredibly satisfying

zr3to1IO-dzH6m0EhV_94Q.text: For being, basically, the only vegan restaurant in the downtown area, these people deserve 5/5. I've rarely had mishaps with my food and even when I do the food is still delicious. For being vegan, this place is the best of the best. The fries are a bit skinny for my liking but I still devour pleasingly them with the seasonings and ketchup and fake ranch provided. They now offer alcohol, which is a major plus for the demographic nearby. You have to try the wings. They are delectable, especially for carnivores. And the food is downright delicious. Make sure to check out Nami, next door, for their brunch on Sundays or their Tsoynamis any day of the week!

YnhYYkZSFXfp-V6tbv7DFQ.text: Secret bbq chicken = badical turbo radness. The fries are also excellent; thin with the perfect crunch and not greasy.   the no harm parm comes in a delicious red sauce on a nice sized roll.   when finished, go next door to Nami for delicious (but kind of pricey) vegan dessert!

5U8Oiokg4pOCVQw9lS-3PA.text: Great, hip and trendy place downtown. Loved the place, but didn't care too much for the food. That being said for what it is- mostly faux meat tofu specialties (as opposed to just healthy vegetarian eating, with minimally processed tofu perhaps), it's good. It didn't blow my mind, but I liked the place, the vibe, the social consciousness and the people.

7DM15CJp27SjHzIyJxbSuA.text: I LOVE the espresso BBQ sauce, so the potabella sandwich on wheat bun really hit the spot.  The hubby had the singapore orange bowl with rice and mock chicken, he said the flavors were really good (other than the mock chicken, it was his 1st experience with mock chicken and he is a real chicken fan, so you can't blame green for that)   Good prices too :)

kZyHN4fCVovgnc52Rp0o9g.text: If you are a full-time vegan who misses meat, I think Green adds welcome variety to your diet. If you prefer Middle Eastern, Indian, or "hippie" vegetarian/vegan, you will probably not like Green too much as their menu is largely vegan-ized items (they use mock meats and cheeses to create burgers, chicken wings, and the like) with heavy use of salty sauces, vegan mayo, and deep frying.  The service and atmosphere are decent for any fast casual eatery and the place is clean as a can be. I've been many times, but the time between my visits is increasing each time.  Please don't mistake the the words "vegan", "organic", "natural", etc. for "healthy". Green certainly has healthy items on their menu, but they also have tons of deep fried choices and something like half their menu is slathered in a rainbow of salty sauces.

-YDAUvKXRiY8kQ9VORbFVw.text: Love this place! If you're slightly hungry, share some samosas and crab puffs. The chili fries r great too - my daughter is vegan and I'm veg and we both loved the food and funky ambiance. Worth driving a distance for!

3pHiBx0JVCUk0TZgJPrsKA.text: The vegan Gods have spoken and have decreed: "Let there be Green". Far and away the best Vegan place between Los Angeles and East St. Louis, Green is beyond awesome. The Buffalo chicken wing & samosa appetizers rule.The original po' boy sandwich? Unbeatable. And just when it can't get any better, you head next door to Nami for the best freakin' desert treat you'll ever have.  Green is keen.

3-5mTNIpsB0-rsO24k0eRA.text: If you're a Vegan or Vegetarian you absolutely MUST eat here. It's tucked away and parking is limited but we have never had a problem finding a spot. Their menu is extensive - I've had the BBQ po-boy with mock chicken and the Big Wac. Both were outstanding. The thyme fries are delicious. You also have the option of fresh fruit. They have a great selection of craft brews and wine on tap. You order up front and the food never takes more than 5 mins to be delivered to you. We live in Cave Creek and make the 40 minute drive down here bc it is THAT good. And don't even get me started on Nami, their sister bakery directly next door. Out. Of. This. World. Good.

yMAL6b8HuRfPxOsG4PUH9g.text: I haven't been to Green in a really long time, well over a year if not longer. A few years ago I was a regular & came on a weekly basis but then my lifestyle diet became more strict when I eliminated the "comfort food" that I craved, dropped sugar, & increased my workouts. I decided to go today b/c I've been sick w/ the flu & this is my third week not being active so I guess my body needed that "comfort food" satisfaction. I went to Green and had a salad, & for that comfort food cravings, I had the crab puffs. The salad was good & so were the crab puffs, of course the post meal feeling has me feeling tiered, which I am not used to but the food definitely hit the spot for the time being since I've been having that naughty food craving. Although I don't plan to return for a long time, maybe when that craving hits again, I still want to give Green 5 stars for being vegan, using organic ingredients whenever possible, & my salad seemed like a quality salad, so why not. It's great that Green is able to introduce vegan foods to non-vegans whose mind may not have been open to trying vegan food, that alone deserves 5 stars.

lhTB43jCnAnq-8jjI0ffuQ.text: Just so delicious. Better than equivalent restaurants that uses animal products. I loved it and I'm hardly a vegan!

MhXthA_OI7tcYDGnVUw-7w.text: Ugh I wish they could be next door to me and make me food everyday. Luckily both my jobs are close to their locations so I guess I shouldn't complain. But anyway, I love love love this place. I guarantee I will try every single thing on their menu but my favorites so far are their wings, the artichoke gratine and the drunken Mongolian. I'm not vegan but they would definitely make it easy for me to be. I will be returning for more, without a doubt.

xmbU8RLM4NEOgwT9zifpnw.text: It really sucks that I have to give a bad review but know its NOT THE FOOD its the SERVICE...the food is excellent loved it but the workers ESPECIALLY the one at the register that has been mentioned over and over again in different reviews as being rude is definitely RUDE...im so confused at why she's still still working there!?! if you dont like your job QUIT its that simple...probably could get more business if you guys ditched the mean girl waiter/ cashier...food is yummy though but I can get yummy food and great customer service somewhere else..wont be spending any more money at green:)

RtPrWSj7HVbzqjAsueII-A.text: The argentine sandwich is do good!  So is the big wak!  The fries are also amazing and so are the drink options!  Appetizers were ok though.  The crab puffs and buffalo wings will never see me again... But the entrees have seen me twice and will see me a ton more times!

goQIdzV4Y7y3TxWqOJG8sQ.text: One of my all time favorite veg restaurants in the Valley. The food is consistently delicious and the service is great. I just wish it was closer to my neighborhood in the west Valley.

ZWalxD2g9PiUcWxKlbmVKw.text: Love the fact that non vegans come and eat at this joint. It's that good! I love the variety the menu offers because if I'm feeling not so healthy I can get me a big wac....which insanely tastes like a better version of the Big Mac! But if I'm feeling healthy they have a good variety of veggie bowls too :) so gooooood.

sJ5N0uXMSl1vWspfXdp-aw.text: One of my favorite places for vegan comfort food! Love the new menu and creative specials.

5rx087jN0PMjK4ZHGzLv_A.text: We were only in Phoenix overnight, but we ate there TWICE! because the food is so good. Wish this place was in Philly. GUrDjjs01KWdscPQ-mu-wA.text: How to write a review for a restaurant that I patronize several times a week?  Green is amazing, so much variety, and innovative specials all the time.  Even my carnivore friends like the food here.  Green offers a good mix of healthy (salads and veggie bowls) and vegan fun food (burgers, wings, tacos, mac & cheese).  Not the typical tofu stir-fry vegetarian- Green offers pretty much everything you could want, but in a tasty vegan version.  Also, the staff is always cool and friendly.  A really great experience every time!!

wJKnOZbq_WWOE0IhFD-T0w.text: I'm not vegan or vegetarian, the food is just that good! I'm always down to come here for a bite to eat because the food is always delicious and consistent. It's also a pretty big plus it's right across the street from where I live. I admit, I was a little iffy to try some of the things on the menu, however, I was never let down.

o1jjJx42kKrf8PuxxRF7VQ.text: How have I not reviewed this place yet? I think I have eaten out here more times than anywhere else in the valley! Must try their fresh vegetarian burgers. The Big MAC is amazing and according to my husband (who eats meat) it is close and so much better than the real thing. I personally like the BBBQ burger the best. My advice get it w/ chili fries. Also dont forget to come on Sundays for brunch at nami,next door.

eMWsHgqhJIDd5YFkJp33sA.text: This is my new comfort food one-stop-shop. I used to drop in Coco's next door when I wanted something fast and easy, but now I go to Green and get something GOOD as well.  I can't resist the BBQ Chicken Sandwich, but ALL the sandwiches and po'boys are well worth the trip.

4PzPQiUqwPKExCSLr_S5vQ.text: I love green. I've been eating there for a few years now, and while it may not be the healthiest veg good, it is delicious. I was very disappointed today when one of the girls (a blonde haired girl) at the front desk was incredibly rude  after I inquired about the kind of "meat" being used. She refused to talk to me about it, saying it was secret. Shocked, I stated that businesses really should disclose that type of info without hesitation, and she said "no, they don't and aren't going to." I thought she was very hostile even though I was just curious. It's not like I was going to try and steal their recipes!  Staff should be friendly and understanding about questions, its what makes customers trust and support their efforts.

A2xyeFu_xAbFvO6SaprhDA.text: I love this restaurant!  I have been vegan going on three years and eating out at regular restaurants is always a challenge and not at all an enjoyable experience.  I usually just end up getting a salad.  Not here though.  It is awesome walking in and knowing that everything on the menu is not only vegan, but delicious!  No stress in wondering if the chef or any of the staff understand that butter is not vegan.  And don't miss going to Nami next door for an amazing vegan dessert!

Ya1aAwo6PkWrd_vOIIxviQ.text: Loved the local feel of this spot and appreciated the creativity of the vegetarian and vegan menu.  The interior is well designed and I really enjoyed their display of artwork by local artists.  The food was fantastic and service was extremely friendly.  I'd recommend this spot for anyone who loves tasty food.

4nanUArjKLuDwkC_5G49Dw.text: Great experience! The place is nice and clean and the food was amazing! I got the coconut curry mock chicken bowl and my husband got the "Big Wac"... He loved it! It strangely tasted just like a Big Mac. The fries were delicious as well. The parking lot was a little small and cramped, so you might have to wait a bit to park if it's busy.

G4Q_2tflcYdGQb0EEx56bg.text: If you are a vegan or vegetarian I don't know how you don't live here.  The food is amazing here and you will feel like you are eating a juicy burger.  The berry lemonade is a homerun.

rZP0Y0V1QwNcMMDWfrnVvg.text: This is a nice place for vegans and vegetarian, for well missed fast and comfort food. My friends who are not vegetarian enjoyed food here as well! However, food here is generally salty, and mostly fried which is not the healthiest food option out there. However, I really enjoyed the buffalo wing with barbecue sauce (you have to specifically ask for barbecue sauce, and this option is not listed on menu), and the artichoke chicken salad. I wasn't too impressed with asian dishes though, which is understandable since that's not really their specialty. I would go back again but probably only once in a while when I crave for less than healthy indulgence.

The wings are the perfect substitute for someone like me who LOVES chicken wings but doesn't eat chicken. :)  The bowls never disappoint-- we get the singapore orange and thai peanut regularly. Everything seems simple and not over-done but with amazing flavor. I always feel satisfied and healthy after a meal here. Service is super friendly and helpful for first-time orderers.   The outside patio is a great spot to sit if you are eating in.

We started with the wings which are were very flavorful and delicous. Then split a salad that had charred brussel sprouts. Finished with the one and only big wac which was very filling and a good value for the money. Whole bill for 3 items and an izzy drink was 25 bucks not bad. I like the fact its a fast casual set up where u order at the counter and they bring the food. Def a cool hipstery spot and a place I'd come back to!

e9Jqb0iJo9pfptjmsJ73Pw.text: Trendy, overpriced but well intentioned. The Big Wac is mediocre at best. The vegan meat patties are so thin I kept asking "where's the beef?" After a couple of bites the meat patties mushed up and turned into the consistency of humus. Way too much bread, it's all bread. The thyme fries had no thyme whatsoever that I could see or taste. For $12.50 (burger alone is $9.75 and you have to pay $2.75 for fries) I expected more. There are many other vegetarian restaurants in town that serve tastier and healthier food. I admire the vegan focus but the execution isn't there.  If I can make better vegan meat and vegan food at home, there's not much reason to eat at this place.

L8oE5mQcizHHok6LbxY--w.text: We tried and the Big Wack with fries   I've never tried a Big Mac from McDonalds before, but my husband said it was very similar. If you like a vegan burger that's meaty tasting, you'll love it. So so good! Must try if you're in the area!

fxvjDe0cr0UBREyoAfcS2g.text: Green is everything of my cooked vegan dreams. I nom mainly raw, but when I'm hankering for something cooked delicious, decently priced, and from excellent staff I come to Green. I'm closer to the Scottsdale location, but I've been to and love both. I am only slightly saddened because I always seem to order something that's out and I have to end up getting something else. 1kPF9AT8DppC2X3RZRnP5A.text: Just discovered this place and decided to try their Chicago Cheese Steak. The food was amazing and the staff was extremely friendly. I just found my new lunch spot.

N9q69YsIJhfOdKTBmIt-UA.text: First visit here!! Customer service was awesome and food was OUTSTANDING!!! Will definitely be back again!!!

oKDc7Zghv917QWgmjTOxow.text: We visited on Thursday due to the reviews on Yelp. The parking lot is small but the food makes it worth it to deal with it. I got the Big Wac and fries and was in food heaven. I used to eat Big Macs, now that  I'm vegan I thought I would never have anything similar. This was even better than the Big Mac. I will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Wac....AMAZING!

TI2JpjyFaXTtxvsnZJUZsg.text: Nice vegan spot, first time coming here and it makes me wish I could come all the time but I live too far so I enjoy it while I can.

epwQq2SE47fJFoHZk86leA.text: This Green location is an expansion of their Tempe location. Sometimes when establishments do good and grow, one or some of their locations suffer. Not here. You get the same great food that you've come to expect from Green. And in an ingenious business strategy, they'll offer different specials at each one.    For the sake of not being completely redundant, I'll just sum up my favorite dishes.   Vegan comfort food: Big Wac (simply amazing; that is all)  Wendy Pickle (awesome!)  Original G Spicy Chicken & the Argentine po'boys (both equally yum!)   BBQ Chicken or the BBBQ Burger (BBQ is on point!)   All of the burgers & sandwiches come with a side of your choice of fruit, thyme fries, or a Tahini coleslaw. (99% of the time, I choose their fries because they're SO good!)  Feeling light? Jerk Salad w/ their succulent & perfectly seasoned mock chicken instead of tofu. The jungle dressing is delicious!   Ranchero Salad, which comes with BBQ "chicken" & their homemade ranch. I hated ranch when I was omni, but I like their vegan ranch.   Both of my fav aforementioned salads come with a spinach + dark medley salad mix (no icebergs here!), shredded carrots, & tortilla strips. You may opt for a 1/2 or full sized salad ($6 vs $9). I usually get the full and eat the 2nd 1/2 another day. Just remove the mock meat, heat, & replace on salad. Unless you remove the tortilla strips prior to refrigerating your leftovers, those will be annoyingly non-crunchy the next day.   This location has liquor options for all of my beer guzzling and mimosa-loving lushes. (Which is ALL of my friends.) I don't drink, so I am unable to assist in that area, except to say that they have drink specials sometimes.   Speaking of... This location implemented it's first happy hour this summer. It's not every day or every Friday, so I suggest stalking, er, following Green on Twitter, ig, & FB for the fastest updates & news.  Happy Hour specials have included delights such as Sloppy Jose's (sic) sliders, Buffalo Cauliflower bites, Roasted Brussels, & Garlic Potato tacos. All beyond amazing for my taste buds. (Happy hour prices extend to certain alcoholic drinks as well.) HH has only been at this location, so far.   Live music sometimes.   Nice and clean inside. Pay at the counter, take a number, & they'll bring your food to your table.  If you prefer fresh air, there are a handful of tables outside.    The restrooms are outside of the building. I am extremely OCD & shuttered at the thought. But when I was finally forced to utilize the facilities, let me tell you! That has to be the nice & cleanest little "outhouse" in the history of outhouses. I was very pleasantly surprised!   It shares a parking lot with its sister store, Nami. It's a small lot & it fills quickly during lunch & dinner times. If you're going for lunch, M-F, I suggest arriving no later than 11:30am, to beat the lunch crowd.   One of my favorite restaurants in the valley!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh baked chocolate chip cookie from the cookie jar at the counter. Yum!

Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A peek inside the Monster Burrito: taco &#34;meat,&#34; lettuce, guac, tater tots, salsa &amp; fried pickles! (Tomatoes &amp; cheese omitted)
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huge &#34;Monster Burrito. I came at it from both sides!

f_HOBUswggjA4JFzlp9gWA.text: Ordered online for pickup while understand being busy your online ordering system told me a time which should account for the "busyness". I left came back and was told it would be another 15-30 minutes. Really?  Plus the person was a bit snippy about it. Parking was extremely limited and difficult and there is not a place to wait except your vehicle.

QXDXRc3ZLNz1SCmzmwB6GQ.text: Haven't been back here in a few years and I was surely impressed by the expanded and creative menu!  Glad it's not limited to rice and noodle bowls anymore but VERY sad they got rid of the noodles option!  I was so disappointed that I almost didn't know what to order.  Once I chose and tasted, I forgot about those noodles.  I can't recall the cool name of the salad but it was tons of hearty fried Brussels sprouts in jerk spices atop deep green kale glistening in a thin layer of oil (possibly slightly cooked?) with spring mix, shredded carrots, tortilla chip strips, and a "jungle dressing" that had a creamy orange color and amazing taste.  I was hesitant that the salad without any meat or mock meat would be filling enough so I ordered a side of thyme fries.  The salad ended up being sooooo substantial that I was stuffed and could barely eat any fries.  Fries were only okay...missing some magic.  I cannot stop thinking about how delicious, crunchy, green, and flavorful that salad was!  I will be coming back more often and next time I'm getting the same salad with their awesome mock chicken added to it!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nEtJ2GBhmdNCGM1JWpGBPA.text: I love this place.  Seriously, I crave the food regularly.  It's a bit of a drive from my house, but I don't mind because the food never disappoints!  I have only positive things to say about the food and the ataff.  The only real drawbacks for me are the parking situation (not many spots and kind of a pain to navigate when it's full), and prices.  I can't really complain because a good product and service is worth appropriate compensation (and this definitely is).  I just don't earn enough to really be a regular, if that makes sense.  Overall, I definitely recommend Green (either location), but if you come be prepared to drop a decent chunk of change, and maybe ride share if you're coming with friends

fIKHl3pT1W_-7p7DvxaA4w.text: Background: we've been coming to green for over 5 years and have patronized both their locations and talked them up with our friends and family.  The Good: these guys still make the best non-meat meat in the business (IMO).  The not-so-good: the last 3 or 4 times we've come here things seem too be deteriorating in terms of food and service.   Today we ordered fries, the BFF sandwich and the Street Taco special.  We waited almost 30 min (the guy before us had 2 beers waiting for his order!) when it arrived, the fries and my sandwich were barely warm.  WTH!   Hope they get their act together and don't simply rest on their laurels because I want to support them by they need to earn that support.

0ZYpRMemIpWPuQ_DnRdeaQ.text: I really love this place! Amazing food, great customer service and very clean!  The only reason why a 4 star review and haven't been back to this location since is because of the parking lot. It's absolutely horrible. Never any spots, VERY tight, hard to see the turn in to enter and not in the best location.  If the parking lot ever changes, I'll for sure come back! But for now, I'll stick to the one in Tempe

QuW3Np8m5hBDrcguMGf4hQ.text: I love this little restaurant!! Fresh and delish! I've had 3 of the garden burritos - the peanut chicken is amazing! The ranchero is really good too! I'm not sure what it is but I do prefer the Phoenix location over the Tempe location. Menu is always creative and delicious. Try anything on the menu and you won't be disappointed!

yevDexjBBjjbZlf47uvYqw.text: If you don't love Barbecue than get something else.....  But if you LOVE Barbecue....I had the Secret BBQ Sammie and the tahini coleslaw. It's mock chicken, everything else about the sandwich is traditional, including the oooey gooey mess and deliciousness. For me the mock chicken tastes more like spare ribs with the barbecue sauce and onions all over it.    It's also a fashion statement. If you can eat this and not get any on your clothes, it means once you picked it up you didn't set it down and you made your way through every bite (and the sandwich could be a meal in itself) without getting barbecue sauce all over everything around you -- except maybe your face and hands. This is an important leadership quality. If you don't master it the first time, it could be a really great team building activity to practice. They deliver!

Wzuto8LLcVRvKz4Xf9uqpg.text: Best vegan place I have ever been in my life- NOTHING compares to this place. I crave it literally all the time. Have had so many things and everything was stellar!

FWRGbtD3_71sU3kmbqcd-A.text: Super tasty! Had the "kelly's pickle" sandwich and a side of chili cheese fries that satisfied my craving. Flavors remind me of Veggie Grill. Only downside is the small parking lot but showing up right when they open helps!

Yt4yggGHp2Kiu5HILXGq9w.text: Such a good ALL VEGAN restaurant! I got the original "g" spicy po-boy and it was amazing! The garlic hot sauce they used on it was so delicious. I heard their burgers and wings are the bomb too. You order at the counter, get a number and pick your own seat. Then, they bring our your food when it's ready! They have sitting indoors and outdoors. They also serve alcohol! On Sundays they are not open but next door Nami's is open for brunch. You can order your food at Nami's then head over here to grab a bloody mary or a mimosa. Bathrooms outside. Friendly staff. Food came out quick. VERY SMALL parking lot.

GT0Y301R_3lCpIl9xx1G_Q.text: All plant based and all tasty!  I got the big WAC and it was so good. Also tried one of the cheese steaks and was thoroughly impressed. I can't wait to go back!

6IYZqZqGqkc1F3Kq6Z1uyw.text: After becoming a huge fan of vegan food with the opening of J. Selby's here in Minneapolis, I knew when I went down to Phoenix to visit my parents I had to try their predecessor Green New American Vegetarian. I got the Classic Burger without cheese and the buffalo wings, both of which were surprisingly cheaper than back home at J. Selby's.  The burger was good, but average. I could tell it was a veggie burger unlike the Solo burger at J. Selby's where I couldn't tell at all. The burger was very reminiscent of a Boca burger in my opinion. The wings however, oh my GOD! I could have eaten five orders of those alone! They are easily the best vegan wings I've ever had and I still have cravings for them. I just wish they could tell me how they make their wings so yummy. I wish J. Selby's would forgo their cauliflower based wings for these. But then again maybe not as I would never leave. LOL.

Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic burger no cheese

kARd0WgWN-T6JPGZ52dURA.text: I am really glad that I visited Green during my recent Phoenix trip. It was such an amazing dinner. They had so many different options on the menu, so it was hard to decide what to try. I ended up with the BFF, which is a mock chicken sandwich with cheese, jalapenos, and ranch, all vegan. It was incredible. The meal was a little pricey because fries were extra, but it was well worth it. (I am confused why they were called thyme fries, too, as they didn't appear to have thyme on them.) Having read other reviews, I plan to return to try to Wac Burger. My mouth is just watering remembering my time at Green. Mmm...

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The BFF and thyme fries (where&#39;s the thyme?) - Greens could be my BFF!

HwwLICxDm-2nwFT2O0oaZw.text: I've been to a few vegan and vegeterian places before but this is easily , by far the best place I've ever been too. The food here is dynamite and so delicious. This place is always packed and it's because it's easy to see that people are discovering that the food and atmosphere here is awesome. They have so many wonderful options. If you are in the mood for a nice veggie bowl they have that. But why not try the the burger (big wac) options or the spicy chicken sandwich. I was in phx for two days and i went both days i had too. The spicy chicken sandwich was great and probably the vegan thing I've ever had. The fried brussel sprouts were so good and crunchy. The next day I had the big wac and it's a really good burger with a lot of flavor.  My lady had the tofo curry bowl and it was a lot of food.  The portions are great the staff is fun and this place is the perfect place specially for a bite to eat, everyone should try it not just vegans.
