-_7VEZ29_lzzRPr7C2wamg.text: First time here it the staff was very pleasant and helpful! I have been a vegetarian my whole life and wasn't sure which mock meat dish I should try first and the person there was very helpful with their personal suggestions etc. the food was great too! My friend who does eat meat commented that the mock meat nuggets were even better than the real thing! Will definitely come again so I can enjoy the taste of meat without feeling guilty about the environment or the animals haha!

q4oYjffgBxq0xLOCWw1IDg.text: Holy smokes this place is amazing. I've been vegetarian for 8 years, and am now trying to enjoy a vegan lifestyle. I'm a pretty tough critic in the realm of fake meats and substitutes, as the flavor and taste was never my reason for giving up meat.   My boyfriend and I came here a few days ago and shared wings, crab puffs and a big Wac. The big wac was by far the best hamburger I've ever had in my life. It was exactly how I remember a Big Mac tasting, yet somehow even better. The crab puffs were delicious, but I didn't notice much fake crab meat. They seemed to be mostly cream cheese. The buffalo wings were also very good, but definitely an obvious fake meat. I don't think many meat eaters would appreciate them, but I loved them. The sauce is so good, I want it bottled.   I fell in love so hard with this place, that I think we're going back for dinner tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Asd7dYD36shsUWhJ7LWpKw.text: Ate here and loved it. Best vegan food I've had in this town. I have had the cheesesteak and the big wac and the spinach dip. All of it was fantastic.  I will definitely keep going to this place. All the drinks are delicious too.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chicago cheesesteak

mrtpq3CedPVxhX4H1pUw7g.text: This place is awesome! So many interesting and creative choices. I had the BBQ bacon burger which has portobello mushrooms and caramelized onions and, of course, their veg burger patty. It was so satisfying. The cole slaw was yummy too, peanutty. I had a "mash" for dessert - they choose what to put in your ice cream. Yum!! I wish I could eat here every day...

kfBpZE6NjJzflqTwlGb-8g.text: The most perfect beautiful butterfly of a restaurant I can ever imagine. I was really sad to go home back to Michigan mostly because I had to leave Green behind. It's been two days and I still haven't stopped thinking about their crab puffs. I also got the Mongolian bowl with the chicken and it's was the best chicken substitute I've ever had. I'm going to try to frequent Phoenix more, mostly because of Green

Orwr1yFeFMFGtG4xG9H2fQ.text: I always try to hit up the most popular veg restaurants whenever I travel, but nothing compares to the food and atmosphere at Green. I'm so happy that the best veg restaurant on earth is in my own city. The Big Wac, Wendy's Pickle and Blackjack Pita are a few of my favorites, but everything on the menu is pretty delicious. And don't forget to grab a treat next door at Nami after your meal!

m6LYealiOBsMRQFpaEXdxw.text: A new place for vegan with so many options! I will be back!

fTDxbPyRIrblR5pQhhsA2g.text: Green is a vegetarian staple for residents of the Valley. With a diverse array of options, they cater to every palate. I'm a huge fan of the Big Wac, but I loved the No Harm Chicken Parm when I was a student at NAU and would visit home. The only complaint I have is that they're a pretty small location, but this will hopefully change as they continue to expand.

n070UL4CoKsBquOIY7TsOA.text: We were surprised to the find out about this place; It was packed when we arrived for lunch on our way to SD. Wouldn't never expected there is such a great vegan place like this in Phoenix!   The setting is very casual and the staffs are really friendly! We really like it! Too bad we don't live in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ chicken burger
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab puffs

jJt1xjWsr3-AC4p9V7zCFA.text: Another Green? You mean, we don't all have to eat at Green in Tempe everyday? Vegans, scatter!   To be fair, this location doesn't have the super-customized hipster vibes of the original Green, as in, there aren't painted car doors lining the walls, but it offers the same great food in a metropolitan area. Plus, Nami is right next door, which is essentially a fat, animal-loving kid's heaven.  Currently, my nom of choice is the orecchiette with mock meatballs. If you're missing meat, or need to convince some judgmental bacon-lover that vegan food isn't a leaf on a piece of tofu, order this. Delicious, savory meatballs, smothered in cheese and marinara over veggies and pasta? Hardly part of an ascetic lifestyle. Oh, and it's eight bucks. Double awesome.  Nutshell Review: Tastebuds: delighted. Tummy: full. Wallet: fat. Conscience: clear.

YnnZ9hN4SI-flBODpLoG_Q.text: I love going here and get suckered into going to Nami next door every time lol can't resist. Friendly service and clean

GtNO2Xl1aWmfUFAhNsD4Og.text: I have been to Green twice and both times I have received a heavy amount of rudeness from one of the employees. Which made my visit a bit overthrown but besides that fact the food was great. Although I wouldn't recommend the chili fries as a meal like I did, too salty to be eaten by itself so just leave it as a appetizer for the whole table. The wings are a must so be sure to get a serving of those!

AUFxmkG2xx1M0NMoHgFk-g.text: FINALLY!! Green has been talking about a downtown location forever and it is here and WORTH THE WAIT! Best Vegan food you'll find anywhere, and you don't have to be Vegan to enjoy it! I'm a hardcore meateater, but I'll take Green's buffalo wings and Mexicali Burger over the real thing any day!! The "No-harm chicken parm" is the bomb.com too! The parking is an issue, only because of the small lot Green was built on, but again... it's worth fighting for a spot! The interior is very comfortable, and perfect for a sunny warm afternoon when they can open the large garage door at the front of the building for some fresh air! Go Vegan!! Even if its just for one meal, and give Green a try!!

r6_IHWnUY_h5uL8SQbcdhg.text: It is an honor to be the First To Review this brand new Green location!  Just like Green Tempe, the menu provides an array of delicious vegan treats ranging from salads to flatbread pizzas to bugers, Po Boys, and bowls filled with various varieties of mock meat.  Everything at this location tastes exactly the same as the other location, however, the love exudes from every meal prepared by the incredibly friendly and eager staff.  The location is great, and is perfectly located next to Nami - where you can pick up your vegan soft tserve "blizzards" in any form you desire. I recommend peanut butter with double chick-o-sticks.  The actual restaurant is super clean, modern, and fresh. The front is a glass garage door that when the weather allows, will open to a patio. I cannot wait for this.   If you have not been to Green, I highly recommend you give it a try... the artichoke gratine, chili fries, yellow curry with crispy tofu, and secret BBQ sandwich are among my favorites.  And don't forget your dessert next door at Nami!

mOijko7IiUo5MK6gdH3Yvw.text: This is a great place to get vegan junk food. I am absolutely in love with the Wendy's Pickle. I have liked everything I have tried here and the service is top notch. They have an excellent selection of drinks that are made in house, my favorite is Vimto which is similar in taste to the carbonated version you find in Middle Eastern stores but no carbonation. I also love the thyme fries which are shoestring style. They have other food which is healthier like the Diablo Bowl which my wife enjoys. My son loves the chicken nuggets and carrots. I only wish they had more parking. I have been here multiple times and had to leave because of no parking or extremely long lines. I guess that is what happens when the food is so good. .

xCTzsREp9aqv1wfMajbZFw.text: A non-veggie like me would reconsider if every meal could be like this. The food is excellent! We highly recommend giving this place a try.

VdmYadDnnvQJMuB_wYFffw.text: The food is delicious.  The ambience is casual and hip.  The service is warm, friendly and attentive.   The price is more than reasonable.   I would be a regular here if I could, and I'm not even vegetarian!!!  Alas, I live in Northern California, so I will just have to look forward to dining here again during my next visit to the Phoenix area.

d1X-wWe4tSkDXJG_0636ug.text: This is my favorite restaurant by far! Being a vegan it is hard to find a place that will have options for me that isn't just a salad and that will actually fill me up. Green is always delicious and I feel like I ate a great meal after leaving!  Not only is the food great but the customer service is as well. I have only once had a cashier that was not 100% pleasant and helpful, and I have been here many times! I have taken meat eaters here and there are no complaints. The first time eating at Green was weird because the mock chicken was almost too realistic, the texture is phenomenal!   One warning I will give is that if you are allergic to soy, this is not your place. Every meal has a soy element (tofu, soy milk, etc.), so if you can not consume soy you have to ask for the meal without some of the key ingredients.   I have a sister who is vegetarian and although we are both about a half hour drive from Green we try to eat there as often as we can. Its that good! To add her two cents, she is very picky about mock meats. Every other vegan/vegetarian place we have tried has her saying "I don't like this as much as Green."  My favorites are the Original "G" Spicy Po Boy, the Big Wac, and the Crab Puffs. My mom is a big fan of the Black Jack Pita as well! And although their coleslaw is great, I think the thyme fries are some of the best fries I have ever had!  Gluten free? No problem! There is a whole menu of items that are already or can be made gluten free. Counting calories? There are lots of delicious salads! Want to stuff your face full of delicious fried awesomeness? You have come to the right place!  I HIGHLY recommend Green to vegans, vegetarians, and omnivores alike!

_H38YCPhaLUjPbvEoksAuA.text: I'm a big fan of the food at this restaurant. The "house" tofu is simply amazing, the food is generally great and the service is friendly and all that I need in a restaurant. My loss of star comes in because of the menu.  There are some GREAT menu items, but unfortunately, the descriptions are seriously lacking. I ordered a "creamy" artichoke dip, which led me to think I was getting an Italian-inspired creamy artichoke dip. But what I got instead was an Asian-spiced watery artichoke dip that did not even try to be creamy. It was more like a spicy soup.   The spicy soup was good, but it wasn't what I expected, and certainly not what was described on the menu. It's all about consistency, and unfortunately, they didn't deliver in this area. But, nonetheless, I will come back because the food is great!

tM9CC6p8KCNvbfRiluKjKQ.text: If you don't have food allergies or intolerances, than this would be a great place to enjoy vegan food. They have pretty tasty alternatives to meat and dairy. However, I've been sick for three days after eating there. I ordered everything off the gf menu but still had a reaction. I was a little worried when my chili came out with fried chips on top, but I double checked with the employee who gave it to me. He double checked with the kitchen, so I thought I was fine. Nope. So either the chili is a problem or the banana cream pie soynami (with gf options) from Nami next door. I almost brought one of my children, who has an even more severe reaction to gluten, with me. That would have been a disaster!

PvtSy4rcznAQQ44-KLqfRQ.text: Love. So great. I had the secret bbq chicken sandwich- mock chicken with caramelized onions and peppers in espresso bbq sauce with vegan mayo and thyme fries. Hubby had the Texas mushroom po boy. Both really great tasting, soft bun- messy, good stuff! We also had the crab puffs- very tasty. I headed next door to Nami to get some iced coffees and a oatmeal cookie sandwich and peanut butter cupcake to go. Also totally fabulous!  Will be back for sure.

iBVYbynHt6RXvGRT2O0Omw.text: I was brought here by my team at work and was truthfully afraid I'd starve (I'm not a vegetarian). The environment was fun and inviting and I ordered the "Big Wac" and would you know, it was much better than the Big Mac! Five stars because this place is truly awesome!  Caution on parking, though, there's not much of it and a lot of people don't seem to know how to negotiate the lot.

JjaMQVzYtyJxy5q0VtF86Q.text: The waitress Mariah was very rude and ruined our dinner. All but one person got their food. They went up to the counter and asked her where their food was after waiting ten minutes. She snapped and said that it was coming. Then she proceeded to serve three other tables. Five more minutes went by and they went back up there to ask again about their food. Once again, she snapped and said it was coming. Obviously it wasn't. At this point half of our group lost their appetite and did not finish their meal. After waiting for five more minutes, for a total of 20 minutes after the rest of the table had been served, we asked for a refund of the one plate. This was a $70 tab we will never get back and are very upset by one employee's attitude. She ruined our meal and did nothing but stare as one person in our party complained about her attitude. If there was an issue in the kitchen, she should have said that. Aside from the incredibly rude employee, the food was just okay. My burger bun was burnt and that is all I could taste. This was my first time and I will never return. The people with me have been here before many times, but they decided they would not ever return. It was a waste of time and money. She completely ruined our evening.

intoq0CF_bHNBzdmfhc62w.text: The Best!  We visited several vegetarian restaurants on our Arizona trip, and this one was the best!  The food was excellent, the service was great, and the prices were reasonable.  If we lived nearby, this would be a regular haunt for us.

lRsIMptJs4MUvcNdKGk1dA.text: 10/10 would recommend any soynami flavor.   As for the food, I am a vegetarian and took my non veg friend here, they were not a fan. If you are ever in this position tell them to get fries or a shake and they will be content.   Customer service is always great!   I will be back for the soynamis, still need to try their breakfast and tacos.

FGoKrkujysTC3V0qnr4XJQ.text: I am a new vegan but have had the opportunity to eat vegan in several cities through 3 different states now and the meal here was by far the worst I've had. The "fresh" tofu was rubbery, vegetables undercooked, the sauce watery, and rice nondescript...very bland and not tasty compared to every other place I've tried.

o9oBytS3Ccvfch_eMXggkw.text: I have to say my bf food was good. He got the chili cheese fries and a Chicago cheese steak. My son got just plain fries and I got an artichoke salad. For me it's hard to find place to eat thats vegan/vegetarian and accommodating to wheat, corn, and soy allergies. So when asked for gluten free option they told me everything is on a shared grill. Now to me that's not gluten free, they are cross contaminating their food. I break out in hives eating any of these ingredients. Also, the little chips that you ask for the gluten free option they give you corn chips. So I didn't really eat my salad. Kind of a disappointment. So if you have food allergies I would suggest not eating there because of the shared grill of all their food. Too bad.

iAiilrhkpuM8QC_8A9RmNg.text: It's delicious. It's vegan and vegetarian. It's comfort food done right. Come here or go to the one in Tempe. While I like the quality of the food equally in both, I prefer the restaurant in Phoenix. But, the parking is a dream in Tempe compared to the lack of spaces in Phoenix.   I truly believe someone made a pact with the devil to come up with the Big Wac. As a vegetarian, I do not miss McDonald's, but this burger tastes better to me than I remember the Big Mac or any McDonald's burger tasting. It does this while magically capturing what is best about McDonald's burgers' dressings. The thyme fries are a prefect accompaniment.  My wife adores the O.G. Po' Boy. She says it is the best spicy, tangy buffalo "chicken" sandwich she has ever eaten. It's dressed with baby greens and we fight over the thyme fries everything comes with. They're worth fighting over.   It is worth a hassle, any wait, or even ordering it to go through their fantastic app.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The deliciousness of this Big Wac far surpasses my ability to photograph it.

L23fhQ_ttNgaWSif1XnRRQ.text: Worst food ever ...got an order to go asked for extra crisp tyme fries no tyme and soggy. Chili 4 dollars for a half a cup of nasty  sauce on imitation meat with NO chili beans. Totally inedible!!!!!....the coleslaw was full of sugar inedible and Overpriced.

AIECcChs_iTE2mPhQULSPw.text: This was a very interesting restaurant. The flavors of the food were spicier than most places I've been too. I got the animal fries which I inhaled. They were absolutely amazing. I usually can't eat them and to try them here and have them be so good was surprising. Then I got my salad and it wasn't what I thought it was going to be. The dressing was too much for me and the artichokes were very time consuming to eat. I would like to get something else next time and see if I enjoy it more.

s58WTHQIeK79fzZ6UOfEWw.text: Oh my goodness. Vegetarian and meat eater heaven. Please just go here and go here at least twice, and make sure one of them is breakfast.   Get anything and you'll be happy.

_9jn-sM9pCbqBcEJk-n-VA.text: Aye I really be trying to do this vegetarian shit but omg the food y'all eat is TRASH. I ordered the wings, crab puffs, & a side of fries. I'm not even gonna go in on the wings cause wtf ew. The crab puffs tasted like straight onion. The fries were cool though. I'm giving the restaurant three stars because I'm not actually a vegan/vegetarian so I'm not sure if the food was suppose to taste the way it did.  In regards to the restaurant, it's a cute little tucked away spot but the parking lot is ridiculously small.   The place was packed, however, my order still came out in a reasonable amount of time so good job on that.

0RpuFkn7KlQbNrgVeA3WkA.text: Plenty of options for a great stirfry. Loved all the sauces. I think it could've been arranged a different way so that the sauces don't slop into one another. Food was served quick and I had lots of fresh veggies for my day over rice. Been twice.

cuoSSMEwmks5YjITkTFeug.text: This is a really yummy place to eat! They just need more space. I really enjoyed the food and the employees were very nice!

pkPYZl4UYp06xl9Yay12sA.text: Brought a group of non-vegan friends with me to have lunch today and everyone was very happy with the food! We had the buffalo wings, fundido dip, poblano hummus, the big wac with fries, cheesesteak, and the Thai wrap! Everything was amazing and everyone said they can't wait to go back!!! I'd give more than 5 stars if I could!!!

0cqwWDTBrNuJvaoMl9qv9w.text: The Ranchero Salad has been my go-to for years....can't get enough of those buffalo wings! Save room for a Tsyonomi!

HvqfmKb7gilVpZTCSpCjiQ.text: Went there to have lunch, had the bff, it was awesome.  My friend had the big WAC and was impressed as well.

r6eq4lfFuVNj1WTbw52dfg.text: Not quite as amazing as it used to be - or maybe I've been here too many times and the luster has worn off.  No longer get sides with the sandwiches either and prices have gone up.  I do want to try their new in-n-out substitute animal fries though for sure.  Don't get me wrong, I still enjoy this place, its just no longer close to 5star territory for me anymore.

VszC5kO_L6-RVpXVEbxQXg.text: I really, really love Green. It is one of my favorite vegan/vegetarian places in the valley. I truly wish they would open a 3rd restaurant in Paradise Valley or N. Scottsdale because never have I been disappointed with ANYTHING I've eaten here.  The animal fries are smothered in cheese, onions, thousand island sauce and are sinfully delicious and worth every calorie.  The crab puffs are to die for and taste just like actual crab meat.  The eggless rolls are insanely good.  Thai peanut bowl is yumtastic.  The imitation "Big Mac" (called a big WAC) is my absolute favorite veggie burger OF ALL TIME.  However, I will say that while I enjoy the thyme fries ok, there should be an option for just PLAIN French fries and it'd be nice if they offered sweet potato fries as well.  Still love this place and I never neglect to head over to Nami for a delish sweet vegan treat after dining here!

HbpDU_-LVGaNJ7o1SrOAng.text: Best Vegan Big Mac ever!!!  Second time in 2 days. Animal fries are the best too. Can't wait to go again tomorrow to try the mock chicken sandwiches

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ha3T2qm9NOyIaHYdz9KLMg.text: Parking has not enough space, but the food is fantastic. I had the Big Wac, it's a vegetarian Bic Mac. It was delicious, but next time I will order extra sauce. There were too many bites of dry tofu burger. A more experienced vegetarian I am sure would be more toleratant of that but I struggled with it.

csW_Lc0_4voPCdDGmn_Eag.text: Saldy, my first negative review goes to a restaurant that I used to enjoy.  For the second time in as many visits, the staff at Green forgot to prepare my food.  I didn't post a review after that experience, but felt this warranted one.  I ordered the BFF and a side of fries on the advice of one of the staff members.  But after waiting 25 minutes for the food and watching a number of people who ordered after me receive their meal, I said that I wanted a refund.  A different staff member went into the kitchen, clearly couldn't find my ticket, and asked one of the kitchen staff if they had my ticket.  I could hear the kitchen staff say they did not.  When the same staff member returned to me, I asked her if the kitchen had even started preparing my food.  She stated, "They are cooking it, but we'll be able to cancel it."  At this point, after being lied to, I realized that I don't need to support this business.  Like the lack of courtesy given me about the status of the food prep, the refund process was just as lackluster.  After offering a gift card in the amount that I paid (because that's exactly what a customer wants from a business they don't like), I waited another ten minutes while two different staff members tried to figure out their point-of-sale system.  Ultimately, they couldn't figure it out and just handed me my money back while scribbling what they had done on a piece of paper to jog their memory later.  I guess the best thing I can say for Green is that, while they wasted 35 minutes during my lunch hour and made me late for my next meeting, I saved $8 by quickly buying and eating a sandwich from Walgreen's.  Maybe not as tasty, but then again, I've never eaten the BFF since Green failed to even let me try it.

x3025hbYJ_FPBJWIdBaMPA.text: My favorite restaurant. My husband and I moved to Brooklyn a few years ago but every time we come home we make it a point to go to this place at LEAST twice. This last trip we went four times. The Wendy's pickle is my favorite. Looking forward to my next trip back! (:

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egglessrolls!
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

o0LPC-9ClsjFwhWqAjt9Jw.text: I have been here and the other location a bunch of times and it never disappoints! Even non-vegetarian/vegan friends rave about this place. The food is so tasty and the Tsoynamis are the best. This location has the bakery and Tsoynami shop separate from the food shop.

1CApDbau7Kr4sEEdrgepSQ.text: The food is amazing... I literally haven't had anything I didn't like... please go when you're in PHX work it and not expensive

DuAM2jH_OYbUi0ZbWW5uHg.text: Green is one of the best tasting vegetarian restaurants we have ever had the pleasure of eating.  Delicious sandwiches, salads,  big wac, and buffalo salad.  Let's not forget Nami next door with the donuts and fabulous cookie dough.  This is a must try restaurant.

NbxkN9sDovBbAazt58Hm7Q.text: This was a travel meal for work. I'm trying to be healthier in my travel choices and was happy to find a vegetarian option. I enjoyed the vegetarian chili and the hot "wings" (the sauce was as hot as promised!). I had expected more options, but this is more of a pub than a restaurant.

_dgRQlJRLj38SO9L9BVWjw.text: This chain of side by side restaurants is wonderful. I love vegan restaurants, and this one especially because you don't even realize the food is vegan. The vegan big mac is so delicious that I couldn't put it down while eating. The BFF is my favorite thing on the menu - it's crispy, cheesy, and spicy, all in one! They also have a good assortment of drinks and great decor. Staff is always friendly and personable.

bzKOIFNQdiDgRdJCAbfDiQ.text: Wow wow wow! This was so tasty! Casual setting, hipster vibe (of course), very nice staff. I had "chicken" parmesan sandwich which was a special and brussel sprouts which were slightly browned. The "chicken" patty was so well-seasoned and had perfect texture. Wish it would've had more marinana with it! Shows you how noone needs to eat meat! Go vegan!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U3Lfhx2Zvxmn9CG2MF2t5w.text: My favorite spot in Phoenix. I bring everyone here, whether or not they're veg. We love the wings, and my go to is the Big Wac; the most satisfying burger ever and cruelty free! They also have desserts and some vegan snack foods. Great choice of bottled drinks and amazing brunch. Wish they would open in Tucson so I didn't have to only partake when I'm in Phoenix. Follow them on social media because they post photos of their specials which are all amazingly delicious.

bKG1pvk8yE5UX3FOlAECVw.text: My neighborhood. I'm so spoiled. It's also next to Nami. Everything I've had there is good. And vegan.  The fries are incredible. The burger also delicious and perfectly sauced. Great beer, too. Only problem is, it's always super busy. And that means--because it's so small--it feels cramped. Honestly though, that is my only complaint.

vwb_ahE_5MCkXMc8NfPgVg.text: Yeah, that was great!  We got lucky and timed our visit between the crowds, somehow.. there were a dozen people in line when we left. (This does my little vegan heart good, btw) I listened to the server and ordered the "taco of the day" which was crispy potato with chipotle spices and peppers, and my hubby got a burger and loaded fries.. I also ordered my favorite, brussel sprouts, which were caramelized and delicious.  We will have to return and try more items - my husband particularly liked the name of one of the drinks, the "electric nectar."

YMz-ux7wlzuMCkk2XUIjcw.text: I love this restaurant! It's a super awesome vegan place to eat in a bastion of crappy fast food in Phoenix. The food here is moderately priced, it's family friendly, the staff is nice, and they have the best vegan buffalo wings I've bitten into! The wings aren't too spicy, a bit tangy, and absolutely yummy. It was busy when we got here, just a few minutes after they opened on a weekday - I suspect it was the lunch crowd, but, service is quick!  Also. Save room for vegan desert next door!

_duytFzJoChWA2e3I13SjQ.text: Great vegan spot-  the nacos and Philly steak sandwich is amazing.  The chicken strips were not the best but they were really nice about exchange it for another item in the kids menu.

q9uP6HNgbxBM3gZR7B_Sbw.text: the buffalo wings were amazing!!!! i also got the east coast fries and they were good too but personally too much cheese so if you don't like extra extra cheese ask for not too much, definitely  coming back again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HIc1JB1aJ8Pb-SeFiwJiDQ.text: Great find thanks to our knowledgeable Lyft driver. Easy going vibe with friendly staff and tasty food. I had the vegan Philly cheesesteak - it was huge and delicious. Also really nice selection of local and craft beers at great prices. They don't have draft beer, but they have wine on tap. They also keep a kids menu so my daughter enjoyed kids burger and fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

t2Xds1klQZlEkCPPGrEp2A.text: Food was decent but service was seriously lacking. We waited at the counter to order for at least 5 minutes with multiple employees present but none that would step up. Two minutes after placing my order I realized that I didn't specify the bun option. When I went back up to see if they could change it I was told it was too late, it was already made. Ok....well at least they are fast right? WRONG. Waited another 15-20 minutes for my take out order to be completed. The vibe felt very new age/alternative and I definitely feel like my guest and I were overlooked due to our appearance.  Golf clothes are apparently not the preferred dress code. Overall this was a lackluster experience and the service really puts a nail in the coffin. Hard pass on trying again.

6ggc4OEZci3bonV3DQ63Cg.text: I went to this restaurant while I was visiting Arizona and I was impressed. This is some delicious vegan food. It is as good (and better than some) as the vegan food here in LA and much cheaper. I started with the crab puffs which were basically the vegan version of crab rangoon. I used to love crab rangoon before I became vegetarian 15+ years ago and haven't had it since, so this was a treat. I honestly couldn't tell it was vegan. The cream cheese and fake crab was perfect. I also got the big WAC which is their vegan version of a big mac. This was one of the best veggie burgers I've had. It tasted just like what I have always imagined a big mac tastes like (I've never actually eaten one). It was also a huge burger and under $10. I will definitely be back next time I am in Phoenix. Plus there is a vegan bakery next store

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big WAC
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab Puffs

LuJ74NhtDEIFZ7KlB_t3Lg.text: First time. Went for a late night dinner. Had the wings & samosas. Very tasty.  Only 2 things. Samosas were a little cold in the center & parking was a challenge.

OQEMCx9ofVEBhMZvR6kUjA.text: The Bff is the real deal.  Not sure why they call it that because it should be called a WCS for Wendy's Chicken Sandwich which it tasted just like... but better.  I'm now a vegetarian but i used to love the WCS for its crunchy outside and juicy inside.  Bff somehow accomplishes this fried magic without the bird.  I also had the west Coast fries and have to say that they were a little sweet for me with the sauce - but good.

sBfVfWuELRREvHcEZf_55w.text: Good food but super slow service. I came in here at 3:00 to get a late lunch. Just a few people in the place. Ordered a salad, and it showed up over 20 minutes later. I ask the server what happened, and there was no reason. It just takes a long time

xv6Tejs1D4z7slqiNPDK2w.text: The amount of stars reflects the gal that served us, not the food. Right off the bat her 'tude was absolutely atrocious!! While ordering our food, the gal was snippy and didn't seem to have a nice bone in her body. What crawled up her a$$?  Following this interaction, while delivering our food to the table the snippy gal somehow managed to dump ketchup ALL OVER my moms shoulder and lap and the floor and couldn't even cough up a "sorry". She just brought us napkins and left it all up to us. AWWWWFUUULLL SERVICE! Blonde gal was nice, no complaints about her!  Food was bangin as per usual.  But as far as the dark haired girl goes: YIKES!

2f5mjEr1nrNir9d4XTZPmg.text: This is a vegetarian restaurant. The name is a bit misleading for me because when I hear 'new american,' I expect something upscale. This is a very casual spot and no wait staff.   Food was good though. I ordered a Brussels sprout salad and a local craft beer. It was packed around noon on a Saturday and there was no seat. The Brussels sprout was crispy and well cooked and had really nice spicy dressing. I had no idea what to expect with this salad but I was really happy with it.   Would recommend!

O4HkOagG2AAV7AFqFkDvoQ.text: Wish I could give ZERO stars. The Argentine I got had next to nothing on it. Instead of veganaise the bread was covered in some green grease. Looked awful. Couldn't eat it. My side of thyme fries consisted of 12 soggy fries. I paid $10 for this? I'll never get food to go from Green, ever again.   Hope you take this into consideration before eating or paying for the slop they're serving.

wcSaGky3zLWBeQufSQYN5Q.text: I love this place!  Everything I've tried is awesome. The Big Wac! Tsoynami! I love the spinach dip! I only wish that there was one closer to me.

wWw-Z3uRaGVm1C80VmqqWw.text: My girlfriend and I go here at least twice a month! The food is awesome! The 'Big Wac' is what McDonald's Big Mac wishes it could be. They also have a great selection of fresh iced tea as well. I don't have any complaints about this place. Go check it out!

FEPu_3WvIo3B38rFDFYaQQ.text: Absolutely amazing food. You would never even know you were not eating meat. ;)   The only reason I did not give it a full 5 stars is due to parking and seating issues. They really need a bigger place to accommodate the clients that go there, which says a lot for the business as well.   It is very clean and the staff there are very friendly and happy to help with any questions you may have.   I highly recommend this place for anyone vegetarian and carnivore alike.

z77JIWvZ_npVtS3ZVoR8Ig.text: We've been coming to both Green locations for years, but recently the passed two times we've been there the manager has argued and been deeply rude to the customers. The first time was at Nami, a woman was simply confused of the pricing because I guess she was in there prior, ordered the same thing and it was less. She was very calm, and the manager was really snobby and kept bickering with her. It was really embarrassing for both the customer and the establishment. The second time we came in today, my friend tried to order the same salad she always had to find out you guys changed the menu..The pricing had gone up and now there was no chicken...no big deal, but she wanted something taken out of it. The manager brought he salad back and was just like "can I just bring you a plate and you just pull out whatever you don't want?" It was pretty inconsiderate and having been a manager myself for 6 years at a staple AZ restaurant, I know this was probably not the best way to approach the situation. Shouldn't you be offering your customers good food AND friendly service? I would hate for green to get pretentious.

5vFjzyrZ_Os8i0TGGx_Ibg.text: An absolute favorite of mine. Yes, I'm a vegetarian, but my meat-eating husband loves it as well. Their faux chicken is absolutely amazing - Wendy's Pickle is my favorite.   People from all walks of life eat here. You don't have to be a pretentious hipster to feel comfortable or love the food!

HywxzJDzmJJqDM-3NveASw.text: One of my favorite quick restaurants - vegetarian or not -- cool atmosphere, great staff, and very tasty menu items---I always get the ranchero salad with buffalo sauce instead of bbq and its delicious

l222AYBKBqO5yRYiwGQPWA.text: After having visited the Tempe location, I was excited to try the restaurant downtown.  This space is so much more urban chic, with clean, open decor.  It is much more my style than the other location!  I arrived right as the restaurant opened, daughter in tow.  We quickly perused the menu and decided to order the hummus plate and the drunken mushroom chicken bowl.  We also ordered a couple fountain drinks and filled up with some organic berry lemonade.    We were served the hummus quickly by Chef Damon (though we did not introduce ourselves).  It was spicy and I loved it, but it had too much of a bite for my daughter.    The bowl came out quickly, and my daughter and I shared and devoured the entire bowl.    We chatted a bit with Chef Damon, who told us they were introducing a kids' menu in the next couple weeks.  It will have things like Mac N Cheese and Burgers.  I told him my kid loves the rice noodles, etc.  I really hope they offer kid sized portions of some of their milder flavored bowls.    Overall, I LOVE Green!  My daughter loved it, too.  She asked me if we can go there every week when we are downtown for her appointment.  That's even without making a trip to Nami, which we plan to do next week.  The employees at this location are on point and are very friendly and helpful.    My daughter loved the music and chose to dance a bit while the restaurant was still empty.  Hey - she wasn't bugging anyone!  Who can resist world music?!  Here's to continued growth and success of a fabulous restaurant.

woj_CbPNu5HR1867dVmFoA.text: When I traveled to Phoenix to visit a friend I expected little to no vegan restaurants. Green blew me away. First of all, vegan soft serve - I had the "Betterfinger" with chik-o-stick candy and chocolate chips, yum.  Also tried the Wendy's chicken sandwich with their fries and that was delicious too! The atmosphere was great, the staff was really friendly and it hits all those vegan cravings!

2VC110CvGFJH7fa4gapPQQ.text: Wow! I tried out some of their food at the Phoenix Local First Festival last year and loved the faux chicken wings. They were delicious. I had planned on going to the restaurant but had mostly forgotten about it until recently when a friend of mine had a birthday party there.  I was so impressed! Everything was delicious. I had a little bit of everything at the table and enjoyed it all. I ordered a Po Boy sandwich for myself. It was tremendous! A little spice on the previously mentioned chicken wings.   They had some truly stand out hummus. Absolutely incredible chili fries...I'm going back soon. So good!

3r6pw2W_5gX3o9BiscRqaw.text: I went with the reviews and got the Big Wac. I never even liked the real thing, but I really did like this version. I was so stuffed. That was a lot of food for me.   Shamefully, that didn't stop me from waddling next door to their sister place Nami for dessert. You can read that review. No need to post my pig out fest on both reviews. As I hang my head in shame and think.... YUM!

X75ocLrW12HnaXqufPFb3w.text: I thoroughly enjoy this place. The food variety is fabulous without being overwhelming. There are great healthy options mixed with mock bar food options and honestly all the options are fantastic.   I love the atmosphere. The service is always quick, friendly and fun.   I am a regular here and I highly recommend checking it out!  The Artichoke Chicken Salad is wonderful, the chili cheese nachos are good, the Kung Pao with noodles and tofu is delicious.   DO NOT skip the fresh lemonade or green tea. Honestly, it would be a big mistake! And I dare you to mix them...doooo it!

P6PUEAOlZOFB4twLU489rw.text: Excellent spot. All the food had great flavor. The service seems slightly unorganized but everyone is friendly. I'm not sure what coffee they use but it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute signs

mrUvfg01CZUiGmOLoMJhtQ.text: Some familial vegetarians introduced me to this gem (I've no dietary preferences).  Short and sweet...it's extraordinary!  Vegan buffalo wings?!? My military man/carnivorous husband says (guardedly) that these are the best wings he's ever had! And I agree...  Not to mention the "Big WAC", Diablo Red Bowl, or Original "G " Spicy Po-Boy (Buffalo mock chicken).   My soul mourns the fact that Green is far from my house and not open on Sundays.  Those buffalo wings...seriously...they will blow your mind. I want them now!

3eKuEdOgw1QrLmt8RvUJCQ.text: Very good vegetarian cuisine.  Everything I have had is consistent and the beverages are delicious!  It gets busy at prime times but worth it!  Very reasonably priced for the quality of food!  Definitely worth stopping in!

HX4bREr4Z38zURK9MlHkIg.text: Really delicious vegetarian fare. Tofu is fantastic, and I'm not a health foodie. Dining room is pleasant. It's also fun to get dessert next door at Nami. Close to Phoenix Art Museum too.

zJvVyDbwHbDNdz_FfAIb8w.text: This was my 1st time here and I loved it.  I had the black jack pita any my friend had the big WAC both meals were absolutely delicious!  I plan on eating here at least once a week.

w_Lwcptf0ibT6CLtL8m9CQ.text: I've been a vegetarian for over a few decades, I tend to seek out vegan and vegetarian restaurants in every city that I go to. Without a doubt I have always had a positive experience at Green. The staff is always courteous, the facilities are clean, I have not waited long for food, what I order is typically delicious, and the price is very reasonable for the quality that you're getting. I have eaten at both locations, and even had an art show at one a few years back. The individuals running the establishments are professional, socially conscious, and in touch with their community. It would be very hard-pressed to find this anywhere else.

b4f6z3_t8QAiFC6tkD-VAg.text: First time I visited was so amazing, second time worst customer service ever!!!! cashier  ignored me and took another persons order I was standing in line behind the other two ordering then it was my turn I had thought but a group of three came in after the cashier looked at me and gave a smirk like she knew what she did.  Needless to say I thought sb 1066.5 was being used so I went across the street to Rice Paper and had the most delicious meal (firecracker shrimp one of the hits)   I have ran several restaurants, terrible experience today at Greens.

OhvZ63l71od-WZsuGeo_yA.text: Pretty much the best pure veggie chow around.  Their not-chicken sandwich with fake cheese is better in some ways than the real thing.  You're not always reminded that you're eating vegetarian when eating here.  It's just tasty.    A veggie place that you can take anyone and have them enjoy it is a great and rare find.  This is such a place.

jPdVUy6n0yvs18rdvjOj9A.text: Pretty decent food! Their meat substitutes are solid but I'm not a veg and ultimately would rather just have meat. But when eating out with the veggie friends, this is a great option for everyone. I've had the drunken Mongolian and the Thai peanut bowls. Both are good!

BQY1ubKA1rVHaLIqvn16zQ.text: So, I must admit that when I walked into this restaurant I did not really know what I was doing. As a recently minted Vegan my friends have been telling me to try this place. Figuring from their name, they'd have vegan options or at least items you could modify to be vegan. Upon looking at the menu the "Big Mac" grabbed my attention. It mentioned that it was a vegan burger but had cheese. "Why would they do this?" I asked my friend. "Why would they put cheese on a Vegan burger and make it un-vegan? Why even bother making the burger vegan then?" I queried. She then pointed to a section on the menu that described the restaurant. Much to my surprise, Green is a 100% vegan restaurant!  Now, I didn't know what to get because everything sounded good, being Vegan. The waitress suggested we get the special they were offering that night, which they were doing for NYE 2013. The special included hot & sour soup, "egg" rolls, vegan crab puffs, BBQ "chicken" skewers, some baby bok choy, and some sort of vegan duck dish. I have never had duck so I have no basis for comparison. I must say, everything was absolutely delicious! The vegan crab puffs...I can't get over how good those were.  They also have really unique drinks and they do offer beer and wine.   I will definitely be back to this restaurant or their Tempe location.

hJtgcf3nwulZSEYHQGDy8A.text: I'm fairly obsessed with Green. Great seitan, love the thyme fries and flavored teas on tap, and the creamy sauces are completely legit. It's brilliantly liberating to be able to order whatever I want without having to ask what's in something or beg for crazy substitutions.  It's neither nor cheap nor overpriced for what you're getting, but it's incredibly easy to spend way too much money sampling new parts of the menu.  Loving the Buffalo bites and pasta bowls. Gotta try the nachos and salads next!

A8pxl8TE0WQWMWRYLQFMdQ.text: The food is great but this is absolutely not a kid friendly place. No changing table, no outside food permitted, no high chair

N32raYVeLer53u6sZuMroA.text: Green was wonderful! I ate here last Thursday. I know, this review is a little late :) The atmosphere at Green is very laid-back and comfortable. We had the buffalo 'wingz', classic burger and the chao sandwich. Everything was delicious. I am by no means veggie but you could have fooled me. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who's veggie, carnivorous or who just wants to eat good food that's good for you! Eat at Green! You will not be disappointed !

Akpt14UAF_DZY5nJoaZMHg.text: Had the big wac of course! umm yeah it taste just like a big mac! messy like it too so be prepared for that. was delicious, and I eat meat and I couldn't taste the difference.

TIBRpPnd5v5PGM0zL7H8eg.text: In addition to having fantastic food, the customer service here is SUPERB. Diane is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about veganism. The house chili is outstanding, as are the vegan buffalo wings. Regardless if you're vegan or not, anybody with a taste for quality food will love this place. Highly, highly recommend it.

PkamLauHKTpURaW0dUZERg.text: Great place for vegan comfort food! Had a BFF budget with fries which was pretty good but the dogobah jungle in a bowl was amazing! Also had the San Diego and chameleon tacos. Favorite vegan place to eat so far in the Phoenix area

niK_uQJI-JWD2I1RN4IXEA.text: Excellent option in a sea of big boxes and chain restaurants.  The vegan "thing" is not as rare as it used to be in this Valley, but doing it well still is. These people rock

nGkXcZRBgrRF4q3QnBxSSg.text: We love this place. We go here all the time to meet with friends and it is an awesome place to hang out.   I always get their Ranchero Salad and a burger or sandwich. My top favorites that I recommend is the Big Wac and Secret BBQ Chicken Sandwich. Their Thyme Fries are the BEST!  I am Asian that grew up on home-made Asian Foods, so I don't think their Asian bowls are that good. I use to get them and I would ask for less sauce or sodium because I thought it was a bit salty. Besides that, I love their food.   I love the thought and design. I always think of inviting friends because it is so cool inside. I love how the artwork changes all the time. This place really makes vegan food appealing to those that are spectacle to the idea of vegan food.   I am thankful that they are closer to me now since I live in North Phoenix! I go as often as I can!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the best burgers is the BIG WAC! The thyme fries is worth drooling over!

-Cp9S2cKmFEpZzNSGUuuzw.text: I was recently visiting Phoenix from Portland and we decided to try Green for lunch. I had heard good things about it from Arizona friends. It was hard to pick what to order on the menu because I wanted like 5 things. I ended up deciding on the Thai Peanut Bowl with soy chicken. It was absolutely amazing. The vegetables were very fresh and a bit al dente. I loved the soy chicken. And the peanut sauce was the perfect medium level of spiciness. My companion had the Coconut Curry Bowl with soy chicken and also loved hers. She asked me after we left if I would come back to Phoenix just to eat there. I said I wasn't sure but you wouldn't have to pressure  me too hard to take another trip to Phoenix. She (a non-vegan) also said she wished we had Green in Portland and said it was the best vegan restaurant she'd been to. Anyway, I need to get busy planning my next vacation to Phoenix for about 7 days so I can try everything I want! Or Green could always open a location in Portland. You'd be much loved here.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai Peanut Bowl with Soy Chicken
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Curry Bowl with Soy Chicken

V09Bz4ziPRDIuexuDBMjaw.text: Pretty much one of the best Vegan spots in Arizona. So delicious and thank you for your part in the push for a cruelty-free world.

1Bz5oKM-mdVgrSGSqRNmVQ.text: Food is pretty good! Some of the workers looked overworked and unhappy, but other than that, the experience was an overall positive.  Try Nami next door too, they have some awesome vegan soy-based ice cream. Delish!

q5vvS3bAD9SLrBarF7w0Dg.text: Amazing tasty delicious food!!! BBQ Sammie was flavorful with tangy sauce.  Very satisfying. Yum!! We will return.

KXcS0XdThrxKw1XBM4kBsA.text: The fact that this place has a separate glutenfree menu and the person on the phone when I called to ask about it seemed knowledgable (while still offering the same tired old "don't sue us" disclaimer of "it's a shared kitchen and we can't guarantee there won't be cross contamination," I was optimistic and hopeful. They warned me about fried items in a shared frier (fries and sweet potato tots), but anything on the gf menu would be fine.   The cashier in person didn't seem to care that I stressed two members of our party need to be glutenfree. I should have taken this as a sign. Ordered buffalo wings and artichoke dip for appetizers, and they were so delicious, I was so happy, and thought things would be okay.   Then my jerk tofu salad comes out and the tofu looks suspiciously deep fried. I get up to ask, and sure enough, they deep fried my glutenfree tofu. I said I can't eat it, because I have celiac disease. She asked if they could just remove the cc'd tofu off the top and offered raw tofu in its place. No, that's not how celiac disease works. You have to remake it.   Since she was so ill informed, I decided to ask about the wings and dip. Turns out the wings and corn chips are also fried in dirty oil... Even though they were on the gf menu. When I pointed that out, she said "well we SAY we can't guarantee there's no cross contamination." ...that's different than knowingly bathing all the gluten free menu items in gluten, lady. (The menu didn't state that these items were deep fried, and I figured the corn chips were store bought, so I didn't ask. Stupid me for assuming they had a clue. That shiny fancy gluten free menu was just so distractingly beautiful....)  She tried to make me pay for the remade salad, but after I said I didn't want to pay since I'd just bought a ton of food that 2/3 of our party couldn't eat even though it was on the gf menu, she comped the salad. I should have just walked out then and there, but didn't want to ruin my companion's meals. My spouse eats glutenfree so he doesn't make me sick, so any minimal contamination wouldn't harm him, thankfully.   I'm angry that their employees are so ill informed, but I'm absolutely disgusted and infuriated that the owner(s) went to the trouble of printing gf menus and pretending like they can cater to gf customers while not actually caring about the ramifications of their dishonesty and ignorance.   If you're a gluten free fad dieter, you'll have fun here pretending like you're being glutenfree because you're doing it to be trendy. But if you have celiac disease or gluten intolerance, don't bother giving these people your money.  I don't expect perfection when I eat out as a person with celiac disease. But I do expect honesty and an honest effort to minimize contamination. Neither happened, and now I am incredibly sick. Shame on you, Green. Shame on you.

zacZ16blyqpKnRib1yBn2A.text: The food is good, service is terribly slow. Table of 5, everyone but me got their food. 25 minutes later I finally asked for a refund. Cashier and manager gave me a hard time about wanting a refund.

UXpxxvnDwuONJtSKiaSiIw.text: I love Green. The food is great. It doesn't matter that its vegan it just tastes great and they have a nice craft beer selection. They used to have these awesome Thyme fries that were incredible, but stopped serving them because they had gluten. They do still serve thyme fries, but they are not anywhere near as good in fact I'd say don't even get them they're just "meh" at best.

tEdtzR8mqEv1rek-D3X8VQ.text: I saw that the menu has alot of basic,  easily approachable vegan food. It has simple,  straightforward vegan options for food you'd usually get from the drive thru or Chinese take-out,  kinda. I thought the food was good especially for people looking for vegan alternatives. It was not great only because it tasted like regular fast food. I was just surprised the flavors weren't more developed and taken a step further.  I wasn't expecting that. I got take out (spicy po' bo and classic burger) & my car smelled like a burger king and it tasted like a whopper lol..  Not saying it's a bad thing, but since being vegan I haven't really looking for things to put me in mood of eating McDonald's or burger king. I think if I order something different my opinion will change.  We'll see!

XIsZ8-LWVXkOubes75r-6w.text: True, I've had more adventurous plant-based, vegan food in a lot of cities (LA, Portland, Seattle, for example), but I think Green does a really nice job with quality, service, and an affordable, approachable menu. I am so grateful to have an option like this in a food scene dominated by steaks, pizza, and pasta.   We've been twice so far, and both times got the bowls with house tofu, brown rice, and lots of veggies. They come with various sauces and spices, and all we've tried have been excellent. The salad we ordered the first time was a touch too astringent (over-salted, too much vinegar) but otherwise included a solid variety of diverse vegetables. We tried the vegan chili fries the second time, which were pretty tasty, though I generally find that vegan food trying to imitate non-vegan food comes up a little short. We also tried the chocolate tSoynami, which was basically a non-dairy chocolate shake. I'd be interested to see the grams of sugar, but taste and texture were good.   Overall, I'd love to see a few more options on the menu where plants get to be the stars, but I enjoy Green and will definitely be back.

eyrdDNEhXWM4S93btLk73Q.text: My wife and I love this place. We go here any chance we get. The wing ding dinger is the way to go. The staff is always friendly aswell.

0lkwrypDe6kqw_If1-lS-g.text: Food is delicious! Just wish prices were a bit cheaper - sides are extra to add with sandwich or burger. Big WAC is so good and one of my faves.

-i6OLnHCmyyNI42vfvWi1g.text: I'm not a vegan or vegetarian but my wife is and I love this place. For other meat eaters whos significant other is vegan or vegetarian this is the perfect place to go together.  She'll love you for taking her here and you can get the Big Wac burger which is basically a big mac but way better and more healthy.   The staff has always been super helping and nice. And unlike other places if you admit it's your first time here they don't look at you like your a street urchin, but are excited and help you with the menu. 6 stars!

me-E9eSvqq-6S4pkVR2n9A.text: I love you, Green, I really do. It hurts to bitch about you, but you get 4stars anyway, cuz you still rock. I got the pita, and it was delicious! But, the pita was tough, and kinda hard twoards the end. That, and 2 pieces of artichoke doesn't cut it for me, especially when it says it's a main feature in the dish. I did mention it to the cashier, but that's all. I will order it again in hopes it will be better next time ;)

DzZ92RuimsGJRAnNNPVmkg.text: Seriously the best vegan food I've ever had. I will drive from Mesa to eat here once a week if not more. Delicious food and amazing people. Try the BFF - it's awesome especially if you love avocado and jalapeno. Ammmmmaaaaaazing food. Cannot say it enough.

3rZNiegZYgyS-dufteq2CQ.text: I had only one night in Phoenix to catch up with one of my oldest and dearest friends and based on reviews and the menu, I decided to go to Green Restaurant. Green is a 100% vegan restaurant that features new American-style comfort food. They also try to use organic ingredients when possible. But, it was really the chef's statement on the website that made me want to visit. It is owned by Damon Brasch, a vegan chef and restauranteur who is now living his dream by having opened this restaurant. He wanted to create a menu that would please any palate and that was influenced by many different cultures and cooking styles.  And it was so successful that there are now two locations as well as a separate vegan dessert place called "Nami."  My friend alerted me that it was a very casual place so I was prepared to dine super casual on this Friday night. When we arrived around 8 p.m., it was packed and there was just enough seating for our group so we snagged it right away. We took a look at the menu for a long time. As everything is vegan, it was very difficult for me to choose what I wanted. The menu features appetizers, bowls, salads, sammies & burgers, and sides so there was a lot to choose from.  I was also pleased to see that they served beer and wine as well. Once we made our selections, we ordered at the counter, then sat down and waited for our food.  I started with a locally brewed beer -- Four Peaks Peach Ale. Then, our appetizers started arriving. First, we had the green hummus made of garlic, poblano chilies, and chickpeas with fried pita. This one was a winner.  Next,we had the spicy buffalo wings, which were probably my favorite item from the whole night. They were tender with great spice and served with a delicious vegan cucumber ranch.  Our last appetizer was the samosas filled with curried potatoes, peas, carrots, and garlic served with a tamarind dipping sauce. These were okay, but nothing to write home about.  For my entree, I ordered the Clexico Burger. This was their homemade burger with organic garbanzo hummus, cheddar cheese, mayo, and spicy chipotle sauce. The burgers were a bit too meaty for me and not vegetably enough, if you know what I mean. And there were no veggies -- no lettuce or tomato so it was just a lot of fake meat with a nice chipotle sauce. I thought the burger was good, but definitely not what I should have ordered given the other healthy options.  I ended up wishing I had ordered the Singapore orange bowl that my friend had. Filled with fresh broccoli, zucchini, and faux meat, it was delicious.  Another girl got the Coconut Curry Bowl filled with broccoli, zucchini, and potatoes in a curry sauce.  My out-of-town friends tried their famous version of a Big Mac, the Big WAC! This was way too much burger for me. It was two patties, special sauce, lettuce, cheese, pickles, onions, on a sesame bun just the way I remembered. I have to admit that it was good, just too meaty and too much.  In the end, I was so glad I chose this place. Though I wish I had ordered the fresh bowls, I was still satisfied with everything I tried and some items were exceptionally good. All of our bowls and sandwiches were about $9 so pretty cheap. And I love that they offer beer, wine, and soft serve ice cream. This place is a win-win.

yE9OXlYgzF03SeikCZnSeA.text: Liked them before,  and now they have beer! Don't have to be Vegan to like the food.  you won't feel empty. Only gripe,  and minor... The limes in the food were dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan yum.  Thai peanut and coconut curry bowls.  Little now,  little for lunch tomorrow.

NzsUrGXKB7_h8D6ZJB6UZQ.text: Usually excellent food, but there are times when the chef uses way too much grease for fried items.  The bowls are always great.

BoyebAXQ7sWUsatk_p1yoQ.text: I love this place! Even though I rated it 3 stars, it's one of my favorite junk food vegan joints out there. The food isn't anything necessarily unique or homemade but it's good ol' comfort, vegan junk food.  I LOVE the chili cheese fries (add sour cream)...Ok, that's not on the menu but they can make it for you, I promise ;)  The "chicken" wings are great. I like to mix the BBQ sauce and the hot sauce together.  Don't forget to stop at Nami and get dessert!!!!

O7jP-DolBbt4nhxLX_QcSg.text: Everything on the menu is vegan. Try them all! A lot of the items are naughty, but good. They will make things to order so you can order healthier options. We prefer the spicy peanut with brown rice and steamed tofu and the ranchero salad with wing sauce instead of bbq.

R_Vih9MX-Pf5NvgX30uEUA.text: The staff was very nice and the food was delicious! I had the Po' boy sandwich and a banana creme shake. So good! I had no ideas you could make a vegan shake as heavenly as they do.

59NrAFmKy4Pav6WED3VX-Q.text: The food is wonderful. I've taken many meat-eaters with NO complaints! If ordering fries (or other sides) I'd say you should have 2 or more in your party or it's a waste of money and food. Everything is super filling! I'm not a huge fan of vegan cheese so get the chili fries with no cheese if your unsure.  The downtown location (second location in Scottsdale) has the option of serving liquor as well as Nami the wonderful vegan bakery next door and outdoor seating.   I only left off a star due to the atmosphere which is somewhere between diner and cafeteria and the prices which seem a little steep (keeping in mind I always leave full and stayed that way for hours!)   Try it out for yourself!!!

lRDSm5TAuh2ywCVdM7uzbQ.text: This isn't just a place to go if your vegan (which I'm not), it's a place to go for super delicious food.  I've been several times and I've loved everything on the menu.  I wouldn't assume just because it's vegan that it's "healthy" necessarily, since some of their stuff seems pretty indulgent, but I don't care - it's great eating.  I like the vibe of the place too, and you can get some tasty treats next door at Nami too.  Highly recommended.

d4rrV_8uuyuUbn9BtViyOg.text: I've made a few more visits to Green since my original review and have become a big fan. On my last visit I had the Drunken Mongolian bowl with mock beef. I had them spice it up a little with some chile paste and the flavors were amazing. The mock beef is made from white mushrooms. It held the Mongolian flavors very well and had great texture. It's definitely on my ordering short list now.

Tqi7YgtbBJHuRoBTPIPfRA.text: You don't have to be vegan to enjoy this place! The fries are a must,the "burgers" are all good here, and the "wings" are awesome.   This place definitely has the hipster vibe. I recently had one of the po boys and the "steak" was kind of rubbery but the veggies and sauce was still good.   Oh and you have to go next door to Nami to get dessert after!

8x_-umaMgnOlPNBaZkO_Dg.text: I was in Phoenix for four days, and I ate at Green four times, and even twice in one day. I would have gone again if I had more time before I had to get to the airport. So what kept bringing me back?  This place is all vegan and has tons of gluten-free options. They even have a separate gluten free menu that explains what they have and how to order to make sure you get what you want. They even have gluten free beer, and it's only $3. If it's busy, someone will come out to the line and start taking people's orders to move things along more quickly. And the people who work there are super friendly and helpful.  As I said, I went four times, and I ordered something different each time. My favorite was the salad with mock chicken and artichoke hearts. It was so delicious that I wish I could have it at every meal. It was a substantial salad that more than filled me up for lunch for less than $10. I tried a couple of the different po boys - one on a gluten free bun (which I do not recommend - it was kind of dry and tasteless), and one with gluten free tortillas (recommended). You can go to Nami next door for vegan desserts, several of which are gluten free.  I just love that everything is so well marked, and the employees are helpful and understanding. Not having to struggle to find something to order or to get the employees to understand my dietary restrictions was a welcome change. The fact that the food is also quite tasty made it even better.  I would gladly go here every day if there were one near where I live.

HlgKFF1bQSYPxT5lK_IOaA.text: I scrapped my original review and am leaving this one in its place. The first visit in late 2014 was a fairly large disappointment. We went back for a second try in March 2015, and it was soooooo much better. We had three or four different items (we were fairly hungry) and they were all outstanding. It was simply a matter of choosing the right items. So, stay away from the crab puffs, and you'll be totally fine.   Really looking forward to going back. (And with the next update, I'll make sure it's more timely, and we have the menu items so we can steer you in the right direction.)  Yet another update. We went to Green New American Veg again in October. It was even better than the last time. So, we are now at three great visits, and one mediocre one. I think it's becoming a better and better option every time we go.

y5YD3w_gyD4FWWCFHxpSTA.text: I am not a vegan but I might become one based on this place. Everything I have had so far has been spectacular. I never once asked where was the meat. I have gone a couple of times but I do have plans to return with some meat lovers to get their take.

RAqopKyDmRoE2Fmhx-peZA.text: We've always loved the Tempe location, and this one is also a great addition.  Got the jerk tofu salad, hubby got the diablo bowl--both were as good as always. Would have liked more 'stuff'' in my salad (only has greens, carrot shavings and tortilla strips along w/the tofu) but it was my fault for not asking more to be added.  Service was awesome; one girl in particular was especially jovial, helpful, always smiling and very personable. Another at the counter looked like she just swallowed a lemon and acted irritated or just rude at the mere asking for a condiment.  Maybe she was having a bad day...  Overall we love Green and plan to come back when we're downtown again. The location is artsy and nice, limited parking is tricky but we made it work. ;)

FFy9HTI6waL1q7vFElYNCQ.text: A boy named Bacon gives Green his seal of approval.  Yes. It's True. This happy carnivore enjoyed eating an animal-free meal yesterday. And I plan to return to sample more of there menu offerings. Terry T and I had our second meal of our bike ride here. She ordered the chili cheese fries and I ordered the Buffalo chicken and Samosas. Terry's fries were wonderful, and the chili was surprisingly spot on for the real meat deal. While I found the chicken to be overly salty (something Terry mentioned to me before ordering) the cucumber dipping sauce was good enough to drink. My Samosas were a terrific blend of sweet and savory.  The only thing that really had me scratching my head was the scales in the restroom. Huh? I weighed myself before eating, just for a goof.

CRQKGYTQdWyPeyuJvFsXRw.text: There are not enough starts to tell you how I truly feel about this amazing restaurant.  I am not a Vegetarian, and I LOVE this place.  The food is amazing.  The quality of the ingredients is second to none and the flavors are addicting.  I started a new job down the street from the 7th street location 4 weeks ago, and I think I've been at least twice a week since.  I'd be there every day if I could afford to eat out every day :-)  I've never had a bad meal, bad service or a bad experience.  I have been going to the Tempe location since shortly after they opened.  There is no difference in the food from one location to the next.  The only down side is the parking situation at the Phoenix location.  But for this food, I'll drive around the block til a spot opens up, THAT is how good it really is.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thee Argentine Po Boy with Thyme fries

21UJ47eWkIGMegcD2TBM8A.text: Consistently delicious and friendly! We love the atmosphere and their chefs are geniuses! Food is pleasing to everyone, you don't have to be vegan. Drinks are awesome as well!

BlXeWc4fBBosbWWed_lADA.text: Nice little vegan spot if you are looking for a quick bite. Not the healthiest but still delicious. We enjoyed nice lunch with our non-vegan friends and they loved everything they ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gVm8N1kHKBfsUtvbw_f59A.text: So yummy! I had the BFF sandwich and the sangria (which is huge btw!) Both were delicious and super filling. My non-vegetarian teen daughter had the "chicken wings" and really enjoyed them as well. I highly recommend this place for all kinds of vegetarian and vegan options it's the best in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VgdGKQq5o5lOrjl_onbqOg.text: I ate at Green New American everyday for a week while vacationing in Arizona and cannot explain to you how amazing this place is when it comes to vegan/vegetarian food! Although I only ate at this location once and ate at their other location more, I feel the food here was presented better and just seemed *very slightly better*. Maybe because its their flagship location? I'd recommend either location for American style comfort foods with a vegan twist! See my review for their other location: yelp.com/biz/green-new-a...

DlQptDkOZETyqKN8Xyoo9Q.text: The. Big. Wac.  #ThatIsAll  Outstanding!  Can't believe it has no beef... the flavor takes me back to childhood at McDonalds.

Ye-ffIDcFXckO0XnooghQQ.text: I love this place!!! My favorites are the Big wac, and calexico veggie burger. I could eat here everyday. Menu has such variety and customer service is exceptional.

5R2LdUkyb9nwbwPGOv_i3A.text: This place serves one of the best "burgers" and "chicken". Restaurant is nice, modern, fast ,and convenient. Also great customer service. Prices are cheap for mostly organic vegan food. Food is high quality. They also have a coffee and pastries building next door which    Has Amazing pastries. Also cheap.

4qkFue8PSgIbl4mgY4y5xw.text: Whenever I am in the area I have to stop here. Such great tasting, plant base food. Since I have to type extra let me tell you my son thinks this is one of Best restaurants he's ever eaten at and he's been vegan for a year

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili Fries
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Artichoke Gratine
