MU9n3xomKXc4zEkmiwfJCQ.text: Food was okay for vegan food! Personally, I dislike the taste of fake meat, so I didn't like their "chicken" nuggets or wings. However, I tried their dogobah jungle  wrap and it was huge and tasty! It was around $10 and lasted me two meals so it was definitely worth it. Parking is a little tricky here as their lot is super tiny, but it's a cool place to try out for some interesting vegan dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Chicken&#34; Chicken Nuggs W Ranch Or Bbq, Thyme Fries and the dogobah jungle wrap!

j5fy6V-JWvCkq4_0Iac0ZA.text: This place made me question who I really am beneath all these layers of meat. Have I been living a lie? Am I actually a giant sentient vegetable lost in this wide wild world? As a strict carnivore, I was hesitant to come in. I felt personally attacked when I saw they had all kinds of mock meats. But one bite was all it took to shake and tremble my foundation. Here I sat lost in my identity, but found in the upper heavens of flavor. If we lived 500 years in the past, I'd be writing to the Queen instead of writing this review to accuse the chef of witchcraft, because his skills are nothing short of a wizard's. I immediately had to come out of the closet and tell my bros about my experience. They did not approve. I may have lost my bro card, but oh god was it worth it. Thank you Green for your delicious plants and stuff. This is now one of my favorite restaurants in town.

i6oJ8mTVqgzA7s2bHpFBiA.text: I am really glad I happened to pass by this location. I had previously only been to the Scottsdale location and for whatever reason, it had fallen off my radar. I believe I may have gone in on an off day and it put me off.   I wanted veggies, I saw and I decided to give it a go. Now, I do believe the menu changed since I had gone in so long ago. I went with the artichoke wrap and I was not disappointed in the least!  This thing was massive! It was dressed perfectly with their lemon-tahini dressing so each bite really did have a perfect balance. Artichoke hearts, hearts of palm, kalamata olives, cucumber, tomatoes, greens, just so much deliciousness all wrapped up. I did add mock jerk chicken to it and as I've said in previous posts I'm not a fan of tofu, however the mock chicken was actually a good addition. I was surprised.   When I asked the lady what she would have chosen between (upon being given selections) she was honest and used "interesting" to describe the wrap. I was sold on it at that moment. It was interesting and sometimes that can be frightening. Only, this time, I was stoked and will visit again at some point.

hL6pWAcYrO0QgLNdFJ9CdA.text: Great first stop in Arizona!! Glad to have something healthy to eat after filling up on airport food for breakfast. There were so many things on this menu that I wanted to try but I ended up going with thee fighting artichoke salad and the dressing was AMAZING. Parking is limited but we didn't have any issues finding a spot. This is also next door to a vegan dessert shop that seems to be owned by the same people. Fantastic lunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thee Fighting Artichoke

F-fYipFRxv7qk_fbG8BiKw.text: Great vegan food! I had some sort of "chicken" sandwich that I was skeptical about first but was actually delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone trying to cut back on meat but still wants to eat out.

KycP19utn4BOCj7Upa-Qrg.text: This was a nice find on my recent business trip to Phoenix, especially since I've been searching out satisfying vegetarian fare given how I've been attempting to turn a nutritional leaf. Phoenix actually has quite a few excellent vegan and vegetarian-friendly restaurants from the original True Food Kitchen (review: bit.ly/2BT7Zqn) to Fresh Mint in Scottsdale (review: bit.ly/2Diq8m4). I can see how a healthier diet could help you cope with all the dry heat down there, and Green appears to be one of the more popular spots down there since cars were circulating the funky-retro building on a regular basis in their futile search for an open parking space. I was lucky because I got there around 5:30PM having survived not only the rush hour traffic but also Seventh Street's infamous suicide lanes to get there. For a fully vegan menu, the selection was very home-style comfort food but obviously with a meatless twist like the use of grilled seitan for their Chicago Cheesesteak and mock chicken in their BBQ Sammie. I was immediately drawn to the $8.75 Peanut Chicken Salad since I could easily indulge myself in a bowlful of brown rice otherwise. It featured several pieces of mock chicken coated in a crispy texture, mixed greens, cabbage, carrots, green onions, and crushed peanuts. It was all tossed in a sweet peanut vinaigrette and topped with tortilla chips I probably didn't need (photo: bit.ly/2EJ518M). It was quite tasty though I assume it was not as low in calories as I was hoping, especially since there was a bit of peanut sauce in the vinaigrette that bordered on decadent. It was truly entree size, but I underestimated the portion (as usual) and ordered a $3.75 bowl of Vegan Chili on the side. This was also topped with plenty of tortilla strips which made me think I ate a bag of Doritos for dinner (photo: bit.ly/2DCfnbv). Since a place this organic wouldn't be caught dead with Diet Coke, I took advantage of the bottomless refills of the $2.25 Strawberry Lemonade which lent puckery sweetness to my meal. FOOD - 4 stars...tasty vegan comfort food that's quite filling AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...funky vibe, nice patio, traffic hell on Seventh to get here SERVICE - 3.5 stars...nice vegans TOTAL - 4 stars...another enticing meatless spot to check out in Phoenix

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peanut Chicken Salad
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan Chili
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior

EdmIQc60VW1Iy8jXmJ1tYA.text: So.. we come here 3 to 5 times a week and we will continue to come back but we tend to be disappointed in the service. People here are really snobby to us when we go in. It's the looks and the snobby tones it's almost as if I'm annoying them. One day I thought im going to he extra nice and still just snobby. They have a great food so come for that but when you become a regular somewhere I think its just natural that they are kind to you. Just not here.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. She is super kind! After my last review of them being snobby here I take it back she is a doll. Quick and helpful!
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Getting the man a gift card for while I&#39;m on vacation... glad they offer them!
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back.... again

QzGmYvblehgZAFHEDwhxrQ.text: This place is really good. I had a rice bowl but instead of rice got extra veggies with fried tofu (which was soooo delicious). I'm no expert in vegetarian food, but oh my it was so delicious. The menu has a great variety and I hear the buffalo wings are good (made with mock chicken) they also looked tasty!

a_MEfeR8sb0uxFupDkp-2g.text: One of my favorite vegan restaurants in town. Everything on their menu is amazing! I love their buffalo wings and crab puffs from their bites. From their rice bowls, the Thai peanut is my favorite! For a burrito and my favorite food here, you have to try the ranchero! From hand helds, the big wac is a must, go big or go home right?! Be sure to stop at Nami next door for dessert!

MA_wYEU99a3cH_EN5ASYtg.text: One of my favorites restaurant ., the best vegan burger I have try and the lady at the counter is super friendly and helpful

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V2T9lNUDmzxNPgiw4FiuVA.text: Hands down the best mocked meat in town.  Ordered -  Buffalo Wings : tasted delicious. The red sauce topping is the secret. Totally blasts the sour and tangy buds on your tongue. Singapore Orange Chicken - portion is huge and healthy af. Brown rice, broccoli and carrots gives you the best flavor.  Very good ambience, quick service. Parking lot is tiny but if you are lucky enough you'll find a spot.

oBhOgn808RjMvq41k8_3Yw.text: It is really delicious! Amazing food and service! For sure they will see me when I will be back again to Phoenix! Highly recommend for people that they aren't vegan.. proved that vegan is the best food ever!

oM0zzTsHA3fhtLRL_EEiFA.text: If you're looking for a vegan spot to eat, this is it. They have a variety of vegan dishes, primarily a mock chicken which is great. They also have a mock steak. Everything is vegan. It's can get pricey since none of the sandwiches come with a side. I think that's something they can work on but overall it's a good place to eat.

9z0Q2besEJKyYNOfp3RuYg.text: My first time at this location and having a big wac were not as good as anticipated.  The big wac was extremely salty and lacks flavor. All I tasted was salt but the patty's texture was good and the bread fresh.  The tomatoes were fresh and flavorful but the lettuce was watery and felt sparse for such a large sandwich.  The secret sauce was also very sweet and lacked flavorful seasoning besides salt. No sides came with the sandwich this was disappointing.  There is very little parking and the space offered is both tight and odd.  The inside lacks personality and decoration. It's a plain looking tiny shaped space. No nutritional information is offered or known by the employees or offered on the website or menu.  Also, the service was extremely slow it was well over 30 minutes before the food arrived. Unfortunately the overall paid experience was very disappointing.

Rzy0rp3PyG0213W6Gi8vbQ.text: The food, the service, all amazing. People are right, the mac and sauce is delish, as are the animal fries! I also tried the Thai peanut wrap, and I still have dreams about it. Parking can get a little tight, but it's worth it. This is definitely one of the best vegan places I've tried. And when you're done, go next door to Nami for some vegan friendly desserts!

QR8apcTYEHJBbVQiEvg1ZQ.text: It pains me to have to take away stars, but I must. The website does not show which exact menu items are gluten free, but I know there are some so we decided to go there for lunch. I am mostly vegan, sometimes vegetarians and all the way gluten intolerant. I decided on the "chicken" nuggets with fries. I chose those items because there was a GF next to them. I confirmed with the cashier that those items are in fact gluten free. No they are not!!! While wheat has not been added to the products, they are cooked in a fryer that has had wheat products in it. Total cross contamination. The "chicken" nuggets and thyme fries are totally confusing and should NOT have the GF next to it. I ended up ordering a brown rice bowl with curry veggies. It was good but not at all what I wanted.  Please have 2 fryers in the kitchen, 1 for wheat products and 1 for non wheat products.   For my gluten free friends, please confirm that your dish is in fact gluten free. I would hate for you to get sick.

pSeL2BPOcGp87uv_gBvu9Q.text: I just ate way too much food because it was delicious and I wanted to eat everything.   You get in line to order at the counter. They should probably get more menus- there were just a few that people in line shared. Being my first time there, I would have liked more time to look at the menu.   We got animal fries to share. They're thin crispy fries smothered in cheese (I think it's daiya) and vegan thousand island dressing. Definitely wanna eat that mess with a fork. It was greasy and rich and delicious.   I got a po boy. It had a perfect amount of spice and the chik'n inside was thin and tender and super delish. It was super messy and got orange spicy sauce all over my hands. The omnivore boyfriend got the BFF. It was spicy. He said the breaded chick'n reminded him a lot of a Chik Fil A type of sandwich. His was even messier than mine and he had to scarf it down because it was falling apart in his hands.   Bus your own table. Be sure to save room for dessert at Nami next door. They have super yummy ice cream but the serving sizes are pretty small for the price.   We'll definitely be coming back to Green. I want to try everything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The BFF
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Po Boy
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Animal fries

v9-yj_2byVxqDa5nxh_NOQ.text: I love it here! A vegans heaven! I've been here a couple of times and the experience has been wonderful every time! I loved the "Wendy's Pickle" sandwich with their excellent mock chicken, yummy pickles, perfectly balanced vegan mayo and hot sauce on pillowy soft ciabatta. I could eat this every day! Then there's the kids chicken nugs which I could hardly keep from stealing off my son's plate which go perfectly with their yummy ranch sauce. So so good! Their thyme fries are always great, and their shakes and desserts are out of this world! You MUST try this place if you are vegan!

y7rj-XbFVCEC8BWGAXbrjw.text: For being a vegan restaurant, this is probably going to be the best you can find. I must say that I'm really not a big fan of the fake meats or dishes that try to be vegan when they really shouldn't. However, I would say that the stuff that we ordered was really good. We started with the chili fries and these were actually super good. Fries were nice and crispy and the chili not only had flavor of a legit chili but the texture was there too. You have to get a side of the ranch too. My wife and I split the Thai peanut "chicken" wrap and it was definitely the best fake meat I had ever tasted. It actually had a good texture and the crunchiness from the peanuts and the sauce all went really well together. Whether you are vegan or not, you will most likely enjoy this place.

seHd7mIQYu8xmS1AOznsdg.text: Carnivores have their comfort foods, why can't vegans too?   But it's funny that carnivores don't take in meats tasting like vegetables, but the vegans take in foodstuffs tasting like meat. Hmmm....  Squirrel!  Anyways, I was in the vicinity of some green unhealthy new americans and decided to finally try Green restaurant. It's popularity proceeds it and after reading the menu online, there were a couple of dishes I wanted to try.  Mainly the Dagobah. Day-go-wha? Yeah, Dagobah. Actually the full name is Dagobah Jungle ($8.75): jerk spiced fried brussels sprouts over fresh greens tossed in jamaican jungle dressing with carrots and crunchy tortilla strips. That's how I ordered it but the cashier also gave the choice of having it in a burrito.   Daay-oh. Day-ay-ay-oh! Dagobah come and me want to eat it all. It arrived to the table in a large bowl with ample brussels and a decent portion of salad. On first taste of the dressing (I think it was tahini based) the sky must have parted and heavenly light shined down on me. It was delicious and made me forget about the jerk seasoning which was completely AWOL. Too bad, because now that I think about it, spiciness in this dish would have probably sent me UP to heaven.   I also tried the samosas ($6.75): curried potatoes, peas, carrots and fresh garlic wrapped in a thin fried pastry with tamarind dipping sauce, says the menu. Well...four small samosas came on the plate in thick crispy fried dough with - maybe - two cubes of potatoes in each one. Curry? Couldn't taste it. Garlic? Couldn't taste it. Carrots and peas? I'm pretty sure I would have been able to spot them -- if they were there. But they weren't. Did I already say AWOL? i would not order these again.   Oh yeah, I also had the animal fries ($5.75) which are supposed to be potatoes seasoned with thyme and smothered with melted cheese, grilled onions, and 1k island sauce. These were really good, but thyme was not on my side? It was AWOL.  Are you seeing a pattern here?  So, overall, even with all the absent flavors, the dishes were good. Nothing was too oily or over done. Portions were generous, much better than I'm used too. I would like to return and try the Karma Curry,   If I could change only one thing, it would be the onions on the animal fries. Onions flavor was weak and they were chopped very small, almost insignificant. If it wasn't for the sauce I would not have liked them as much.

z_CLoT0w7HIOf_3H6Df63w.text: This restaurant had a really nice atmosphere and a great selection of vegetarian and vegan options. The fake meat was really impressive and tasted delicious! One thing to note, however, was that there wasn't very much parking and it was really hard to find a spot.

-2LZ77btkG82vJs6kCZ0_Q.text: I had a lunch there today, and can't believe that people actually like the food there. But the place was full! They either never tasted a good vegan/vegetarian, or any other decent food, or cannot cook themselves, therefore they like what is being offered there.   I had a bowl of something that had brown rice, overcooked/burned broccoli and undercooked (very hard) slices of carrots. It was extremely salty, and it did not have any particular flavor. It was tasteless, and the saltiness burned my throat, so I took it back to the counter, and they offered to exchange it for something else. What I got back was another bowl with just plain rice, topped with the same burned broccoli and hard carrots. The salty sauce was missing, so it was more palatable. Oh, I forgot that there were three chewy, fried pieces of tofu ("chicken") mixed with it. My friends had some other stuff, but they did not finish it either.  In my humble opinion, it is almost an insult to compare that stuff to True vegan cooking. Vegan and vegetarian cuisine is usually delicious, and flavorful. Another observation: The name Green invokes that they might offer some fresh salads, or other green vegetables. Did not see any.  Will never go back, as there are many better choices for a good food around here, but still wonder: Who writes the positive reviews???

G7Rv1qB_mhhO_Y43moQ4pg.text: This place is incredible. My food is always fresh, comes fairly quickly, and it's a cute little destination on 7th St. I love the culture there, I feel very comfortable and would eat here every day if I could.

vqYQniHEwuLKYmZGTC8uyQ.text: This place is amazing!! Best vegetarian restaurant in the valley by far. Last year I stopped eating meat and I must say, it's pretty challenging to find these meat spin offs that actually taste good! I'm kind of weary about even trying them tbh but everything I've tried here has been beyond delicious. Plus, the staff here is absolutely wonderful:)   I'm definitely recommending the hot wings, they are my favorite! I even share them with my meat-eater friends and everyone loves them

O4pYgPVnaMkLkFP5QpKqPA.text: We loveeeeeee this place! Best place to eat as a vegetarian. Best environment ever! Great customer service!

4OWqJ31IPKNoBXEsjYZg3g.text: Absolutely loved this place! I don't live in AZ but was visiting a friend. She brought me here on the way to taking me to the airport. I wish we would've gone here sooner so I could've had the chance to eat here more than once.  We ordered a Big Wac and the vegan chili fries with cheese. The vegan chili had really great flavor. The cheese was both crispy and melty, which made it good to eat. The Big Wac didn't work for me because it actually tasted just like a Big Mac. I never liked the original and this version was too real! The name of the place says vegetarian but one of the workers assured me that everything is actually vegan, which is sort of a big distinction. If you're trying to convert someone, this is a good place to start.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Wac Vegan chili cheese fries

jZdfclpO0yx1XZSU7-t36w.text: If you have checked out my Yelp profile, you'd see that I'm a vegan who travels quite frequently.  And when I travel, I eat a lot of vegan food!  Therefore ... I think that I am quite qualified to say that Green makes the BEST VEGAN BURGER in the world.    You got it ... best vegan burger IN THE WORLD.  And do you know which burger I speak of?  It is the glorious Big Wac (with extra Wac sauce).    I have made the pilgrimage to both Green locations for several years now, and the Big Wac is always amazing and still has yet to be beat.    And for you McDonald's lovers, my friend says this burger tastes like a real Big Mac (I've never had one in my life, so I can't confirm).  So just try it.  And if you're flying to Chicago from Arizona, please bring one back for me!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Big Wac

4YugGPZsc69px0m1-hv93A.text: It's a shame I can't give negative stars based on service. I was served horribly cold food!  Called an order in at 7:09p and was told my order would be ready in 20-25 minutes. I got there and paid at about 7:35, by 7:55 I have been watching the cashier flirt with every girl that comes in for half an hour and my food is still not ready. I watch countless people come and go as I am standing nearly directly in front of him. I see a bag on the shelf with multiple go boxes in it shortly after I had arrived. Finally at 8:02 he hands me that bag and I leave furious. I immediately open the bag to check the temperature, and am not at all surprised at ALL that the food is cold, dry and disgusting!!!! I spent 40:00 dollars here!! I have never been so mad at any restaurant. Absolutely NO excuse for this. I will be sharing this post on ALL of my social media and will be warming everyone I know about how horrible this experience was.  On a side note.. I sure the HELL marched right back in and demanded a refund. And the guy with the "Scottish" accent didn't seem to care at all. Shocking . Not!

B4V-GxTMQiCym8Y5gxMIPA.text: So, I'm from Chicago and my biggest food upset right now is that Green New American Vegetarian is 1,753.2 miles away from me.  My partner and me visited Green's on our way to the mountains (oh, I don't like this name for a restaurant BTW and I don't even care because the food is so delicious).  I got the chicago cheesesteak.  She got the big WAC.  We went back and ordered 4 more meals to take with us on our trip - screw going to the grocery store and cooking stuff over the fire.  As fun as that is, Green's food is so delicious, we weren't interested in anything else or trying to recreate this deliciousness from scratch over a campfire.  I'm so glad we got more to go.  The chicago cheesesteak we roasted over the campfire that night was even better than what I had in the restaurant.    Then on our way back north to Sedona, we went out of our way to go back to Green's and get more food to go.  Honestly, we didn't get enough to go and fought over it several hours later (although I'm not sure there will ever be enough).  I'm stirred up by my experience at Green's.  Their chicago cheesesteak is better than any chicago cheesesteak I ever had back in my meat eating days.  That means there's like 3 million Chicagoan's eating cows in the form of cheesesteaks that aren't even as good as cow free cheesesteaks.  That's just stupid.  It's not worth the cow.    I'm trying to figure out how to get Green's food here in Chicago.  Can I just order it?  Have it frozen and shipped?  Should I open a Green's New American Vegetarian here in Chicago, on my block, so I can eat it whenever I want?  Maybe.  I've been avoiding writing this because now I want a big WAC, a cheesesteak, a karma curry, a peanut chicken... and they are 1,753.2 miles away from me.

r8Kl3HbL9Rt6Ko3lsEOcaw.text: Great food and environment just not enough non-soy options. Hard not to find something you would like! Cool employees and a dope ice machine!!!

wUwpvnZO9Hy5sqsvv8OFVQ.text: Would've been 5 star if we didn't have to bus a table to get a seat, that being said, everything else was awesome.  Food was great, we went with the burger and and the cheese steak. The burger was by far the best vegan burger I've ever had, stands up against some of the best "real" burgers I've ever had. The cheese steak was impressive as well. When ordering I initially ordered it without cheese, but the server informed me that everything on the menu was vegan. Points for that.  Definitely will be back

sTfTdHMCVACB1dNTf8RQ1w.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. Just get the sandwiches and salads. You don't go to a place like this to order Asian food. You must try their Big Wac! Wow!! they make the vege-meat patties in house and it tastes like (better actually) than the real thing. Their Wendy pickle is excellent and the artichoke salad is so amazing! I'm not that impressed with their buffalo wings i was expecting something like what you would get at Veggie Grill, instead they are like buffalo bites.   Overall though, their sandwiches and their patented soy-nami's are better than McDonald's and Dairy queen.   I don't know how they do it.

g_fZmdlSiYumiN1TJKwdNw.text: First of all, I'm not a vegan nor am I a vegetarian. I actually love meat, dairy, and most things that come from animals. Having said that, Green absolutely blew me away. I never in a million years would have thought that I'd actually be reviewing a restaurant that only serves vegetarian/vegan options with such high praises, but here I am.   I love the whole "comfort food" thing they're going for. I got some egglessrolls to start and the diablo red bowl. Both were awesome. The atmosphere at this location was also really cool. Super friendly staff that were patient with me.

80Hi4VSWWpBnuKXF5n7rww.text: This place is absolutely fantastic. I was on vacation in Phoenix and randomly found this place by googling vegetarian restaurants and I was completely blown away. The food is top notch.  For an appetizer I had the buffalo wings and they were a perfect combination of spicy and savory.  I also had the the secret BBQ chicken sandwich and it was probably the best vegetarian chicken sandwich I've ever had. Being from NYC I've been to many vegan/vegetarian restaurants and I can honestly say without any hyperbole that this place is better than any place in NYC.   Do yourself a favor and go to this place now!

EnuucqS3e19tS3LXP-ciPg.text: Green is fantastic vegan junk food, and I'm not even vegan. Everything I've tried has been good or great. The Thai Peanut is my favorite to date. Oh and the thyme fries are a killer must-try.

VvvmO5GSRPAJg8zF3hORjA.text: Yummy vegan treats! Not the most healthy but tasty and meat free.

DtGwyrnXqfKOLvtm2zJZig.text: Bicycle-friendly and vegan, Green is one of my favorite places.  I ordered a Mickey sandwich with a side of faux Buffalo wings.  While that was being prepped, I ducked out to Nami next door and got a peanut butter and chocolate blizzard, non-diary treat.  It was obvious that I should eat the Nami first, because its the best.  That Nami was so delicious it made the whole meal a real treat.  Thanks to the cooks at Green and the folks at Nami I had a vegan feast fit for a peasant.   Cole slaw, french fries and tasty vegan meats layered between toasted bread of the Mickey sandwich, it was simply good.

enTdmUShOskuIyyIo_DHIg.text: Oh my gosh IN LOVE. Friendly staff, great food, healthy and unhealthy options available. I want to try their breakfast next! I have never had a bad meal here. Anything is good!

QbqsDxS2Jxse1Or6ZAUr5A.text: Disappointing overcooked tofu cubes.  Food did not appear or taste fresh.  Will not return.

-etl5a5U3bmRZbEvC0f1Mw.text: I love Green and this location is so much more convenient than the Scottsdale location. My only gripe is the hours. I feel like they close too early and should be open on Sundays too. Give me MORE Green please.

EfWpPH3TtaMhT-d916i2KQ.text: Embarking on my newest journey down the meatless diet road lands me here for dinner.  I was so very hopeful and completely open to my new experience.  Place is nice and clean so I ordered: * spicy buffalo "wings "   * egglessrolls * drunken mushroom chicken The wings made me think of boneless wings at first but I found them oily and slightly mushy.  I could only think of a frozen package of fake chicken that was heated and cut up.  Similar or the same maybe for the fake chicken in the drunken mushroom chicken bowl.  A breaded piece of processed, packaged and frozen fake chicken is all I could think about when eating, so I stopped. The egglessrolls appeared to have also been processed, packaged and frozen then,  deep fried in oil.  I was thinking that they would have been fresh rice paper wrapped.  They were mushy and oily on the inside.  Crispy and oily on the outside. The noodle dish deserved a bigger taste and perhaps a bolder sauce.  The vegetables were cut without care or respect to culinary skills whatsoever, often leaving parts that would have been better off in a stock or trash. I so wish that I would have stayed home and cooked my own meal on this day. I feel like I was at the TGIFridays of vegetarian foods. Thanks for reading!

D-ygl6S6D8dqQuwSFPBB4Q.text: This place is awesome!! One of the very best vegan restaurants I've ever been to. Rivals Gobo and Blossom in NYC. This put Phoenix on the map for me as a place that veggies can live!

hSX39rkP_doBz75nax7lpQ.text: I am a huge fan of eating meat. I am by no means vegetarian and don't try to be. My fiance had to practically drag me in this place and it is AMAZING!!! I have eating here numerous times and every item is fantastic. I can't even tell their chicken isn't actually chicken. Their secret barbecue chicken is fantastic. I keep finding myself coming back here again and again to try something new. I recommend Green to anyone who likes good food which I think is everyone.

233h-mdMszXWpq_g5bybXw.text: Amazing food!!  Is it me, or has this place gotten even better lately??  They even have a separate gluten free vegan menu, which is helpful.  LOOOVE the chili fries and the buffalo wings.  Favorites include anything with their chicken in it...the sweet and sour chicken is to die for.  LOVE that this place is next to Nami.  It's perfect...get our yums on here and then head to Nami for dessert.  The brunch is very good here as well.  Have I mentioned the buffalo wings?  oh myyyyy.

2OknOojlU02_SLbZxuNfmw.text: Really good vegetarian food. The spicy po boy is delicious and so are the chilli fries!

uuKNw5REqJjVzHMJYl1XAw.text: Berry lemonade and veggie burger w/Sriracha made me very happy!

VZCmjtQ-Lk9uxC718-O0DA.text: Had I known that eating vegan could be this delicious I would have stopped eating meat a long time ago. I had the Curry "Chicken" with veggies and it was absolutely delicious. Simple set up, quaint and unassuming Green New American is a breath of fresh air to the idea of eating vegetarian or vegan. I hope to see more restaurants like this turn up in the Phoenix area, where the possibilities of eating vegetarian is not so inconvenient.

yFS6C3UTojUCbmxIwvTUyQ.text: Delicious, healthy and inventive.  "Crab" puffs were spectacular, and service very friendly and accommodating.

rnBm2F1wVWqjVjy5jpEDrQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE Green! I would easily become a vegetarian if I could afford to eat here for every meal forever. The mock chicken is fantastic, I can't get enough of it, the texture is amazing. I like it way better than actual chicken, no other mock chicken can compare. Try the buffalo wings, samosas, krab puffs and curry with mock chicken, TRY EVERYTHING. And don't forget the vimto! Then head next door for some delicious pastries and tsoynamis!

y7pyNZxLdYYfpgwGKX_B7g.text: First, I'm not a vegetarian.  I wish I were vegan, because I think it's an ethical way of eating.  Unfortunately, my love of burgers, ribs and fish makes me be less of the person I wish I were.  Oh well, that's my cross to bare.  Now, what was I doing?  Oh ya, writing a review.  The place has cool design elements --I like that.  The food was really very good!  Too good to be particularly healthy, but hey, it is a restaurant; and I don't expect restaurants to be as health conscious as home cooks.  If this place was close to where i lived I'd eat there way too often.  mmmmmm

zJq1_VAZKefP8zW4cx6PaA.text: What a delight to find a place like this in Phoenix. Really amazing vegan food, I will surely go back if I'm ever in Phoenix again!

fKAV9bj9lvj8IyabKfFQGA.text: So tasty I ate here twice when I was in Phoenix only two days.  They have a separate menu that lists gluten free options, which was nice.  I loved the selection of sweet limeade, berry lemonade and some tea beverages that come with free refills.  The artichoke gratin dip was AMAZING.

Qwj9DJJhkW7cQAKN_hTAlg.text: Absolutely amazing. I can't wait to come back and try everything else on the menu! My husband and I both got a burger, we shared fries and buffalo chicken bites. The sauce on the burger was especially good and so was the buffalo sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burgers, fries and buffalo chicken bites!

FZoyrV-raQz2oXPs84h9MA.text: So I must say that the food here is decent . I've noticed prices have gone up on everything . And I understand there's way so much better competition out there now on vegan restaurants. But now it's more expensive AND I personally think that the food is tasting more Commercial ,meaning it doesn't taste authentic anymore . It's losing that fresh cooked taste . Parking is horrible .

ng3qKdaxFZy7q3ycx9J81g.text: I am a carnivore and I love Green! I feel that should be said prior to beginning this. The food is healthy, tasty, and well made. I am slightly addicted to their samosa.... Okay. I lied. Totally addicted. Their noodle bowls are fun and I have enjoyed their sandwiches and burgers. I have not been disappointed. Great food all around.

F9eAxigoB-ZwFBDHwhApTQ.text: I love the big wac, which is similar to the Macdonalds  big mac. The big wac is way better than the big Mac. I also had the animal style fries, which were so good with the sauteed Onions on it! I will definitely be back.

GqG9ryE2kHn-vpL-MytnRQ.text: I've been coming to Green for a few years now, so I've had most of the items on the menu.  My favorite is the Calexico with fries.  On this trip, we got the artichoke dip app.  It wasn't my favorite thing, so I'll stick with the wings, which are FANTASTIC! Their fries are shoestring and have yet to disappoint.  This is the perfect place for vegans and meat eaters alike!  Give their brunch a try, you won't regret it!

kfs-StkDNDlIMBTbLIDpdQ.text: Was here for Smunch.  Let me get the one bad thing out of the way: the parking lot stinks.  While there are lots of fake meat options, which several in our party had, I went with stir fried vegetables and fried tofu on rice. It was really good.  Nobody in our group disliked their meal.  The people are really friendly and the service was good.  It is fast casual so you order at the counter.  Because it is not standard fare for most folks they can all answer questions about what ingredients are in each dish.

hkvbmV0MkET4qfh5QvrlQA.text: They jacked the price, so fries are no longer included.  I mean... it adds like $3 per order, which is kind of bullshit.  A Big Wac, effectively a Big Mac, with fries, is like $12-something now, without even getting a drink.  That's.... it's a bit much, right?  Is it just me?

JdZGeO-grxC5qRzQpmF09A.text: Went here for the first time and I've never seen a staff more annoyed and disappointed in having new customers, you could find more livelier service at a graveyard. Food was okay as there is better vegan food places downtown and even the Tempe location is superb but the worse past was the girl at the register. She was rude, didn't smile once, I asked her what she would recommend for my younger siblings and she briefly pointed at a few items on the menu without giving me a chance to see what she was point at and she didn't say a word when she did it either, for a second I thought she was a robot I could go on and on about remarks and lack of attentiveness from the staff probably won't return based on that

RO7y5bd6wBTxzxcvGBPpvw.text: Everything about this place is awesome. The food, the staff, the next door desert place (Nami -- sister store).  Have loved every dish. The "Crab" Puffs are to die for.  Any of their bowls have been superb. Can't find anything not to like about this place...  They even have a way above average bathroom.... :)

bycsj9DQKIcTIwm2cI7bUA.text: Ordered for pickup about 5 minutes before they closed, and asked if we could eat the food for dine in.  Yea i was that guy...but they accommodated with a positive attitude.    They used to put their noodle and rice bowls in small boxes, but they were served in big ones.  I think this is a good move, as its hard to eat out of the little ones if you're using the box.  The food is always delicious, but the quality of food, and how it was made tonight seemed way better than our previous visit.  Seems like they put continuous care into their restaurant.

YzP9ubYQM5VF1YpNbYlHgQ.text: Never been to a vegetarian/vegan restaurant, never had a veggie burger, about as new as I could be to the scene. The person taking the orders was very nice, patient, and friendly. I had a cider that was definitely not the best, but I ordered the big wac for my meal and it was ORGASMIC. If it was closer, I would be here every day!  While I was there, there was consistently plenty of seating. The staff were all very attentive as well. Great first experience at a restaurant like this!

zFCUpyVhQE7AkvAB9LW6Ag.text: Came here with some vegetarian friends that suggested it and had great experiences in the past. We were excited to check it out.  I had the picnic salad and samosas. Hubby had the po boy, girls had the nuggs. All was very good. The Tamarind sauce with the samosas was a little sweet so I stress them without it. Great flavor.  We were able to get a seat easily (Sunday afternoon), but when I pulled into the parking lot and got the last spot, I have to admit I was scared for a second. Especially because we were a party of 8. The bathroom was pretty cool.  Ooh..and the buffalo wings....bomb!

Ae_U10S65LxH2kcV_HTMzQ.text: Sadly this place has gone downhill.  It used to be great,  really high quality food.  The quality has sadly lowered. I don't know if they changed the oil they use,  it seems like they have, but it definitely is not being heated up enough changed or not.  The fries are no longer crispy,  the fake chicken was slipping out of its breading and it was extremely greasy. This has been over the last five times we have gone so it seems to be a permanent change at both locations.  My family and I are sad regulars who will no longer be returning and we have been going since the store opened.  Bye bye Green :( it was a good run while the food was still amazing.

yM8r4nMmL6H3idynvtnb5w.text: Once again Green comes through with fantastic vegan fare! My cousin was in town for a conference and she wanted to meet up with me for a meal before heading back to L.A, so we decided to meet at Green and she loved it, she ordered all apps, the buffalo wings, spicy peanut tofu and the crab puffs. I had the Big Wac and my husband had the Alfredo. Everything was flavorful and delicious. No one left food on their plates and we finished our meal with desserts from Nami next door.

gWJ9r3J2VOzNiWo1grXnqg.text: I've been here a few times.  I love the big whack!  Very filling and tasty.  I have taken non-vegan/vegetarian people here, and they enjoy it too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

r_XWw8vMCcAAflUuU8N-5g.text: Let me start by saying I had previously LOVED going here. One of my favorite people EVER works here. That person is still AMAZING! This place is 5 minutes from my work and as a vegetarian, a welcome spot to grab food! (At least it used to be.)  The problem is the "new" menu. All my favorites are gone. If I want a bowl, it's no longer available over noodles, only rice. The sides are a la carte and not included with the choices now.   The other reviews of poor service are warranted. It took almost 30 minutes to get my food. The worst part was I saw the expediter eating french fries off the plate of someone's food just before running it out. GROSS!   Time to find a new place for my 'go-to' lunch spot. :-(

F7-6esT6uL6m7BojXUBmIQ.text: Great food; friendly staff.  Even non-vegans would love it!

X-Tkm1McqB5X5Bv14uDCsw.text: So today I tried the downtown location. I'd only been to the Tempe/Scottsdale location before and had really liked it, even though I'm not vegan or vegetarian.   Well, I don't know if it was this location or if the restaurant has changed that much but it really wasn't good. Not at all.   The Green Burger that I'd eaten at the other location was phenomenal. I've lived with vegetarians for years and have tried a lot of vegan and vegetarian food and have never cared much for it (unless I was preparing it) but the Green Burger was amazing.  It was a house ground and packed oats & barley veggie burger with fresh lettuce and tomato, vegan mayo, ketchup and pickles (per the website).   When I tried to order it today, it was no longer on the menu. I was told the menu had recently changed and the patty is now different - even though the Green Burger is still listed as a menu item on the website. This new burger is just awful. It's much smaller and it's soy based and tastes worse than a Boca patty. If I wanted a crappy little frozen soy patty, I wouldn't pay nearly ten dollars for it...   The fries, which were also amazing at the other location were nothing special here either. They are supposed to be seasoned - they are called "Thyme Fries" so I expected some, I don't know, thyme?  Nada - no seasoning whatsoever. They were good but just plain old fries.   It wasn't just me. My husband who has 16 years of vegetarian/vegan experience and who really enjoyed the Argentine Po-Boy previously just looked at me and said "no bueno".  It was mostly bread with hardly any filling in it.  Much different than the other location.  Between apps, sandwiches and a couple of iced teas, it cost nearly $50 for lunch for my daughter, husband and me.  Totally not worth it.   I'd go to the Tempe/Scottsdale location again if I knew for sure the Green Burger was available, otherwise I can't see myself returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The new burger patty - not good.  :(  Please bring back the &#34;Green Burger&#34;...

03LIWsX8ve_HFjljm3q5Hw.text: Green is REALLY great for non vegans, vegans who miss meat, or transitioning vegans. Personally I would like to see more seiten and falafel on the menu. All the fried food and fake meats/mayo/fake animal product really turned me off, but that said, it is called green American food so I think it's just my bored taste buds and dislike of meat and American food. I get the peanut or curry bowl expecting thai food quality, and it's just not that. It's a substitution for real meat and at that they do a decent job, I'm just not into it.

WY37qUkr3j5wf0Dz6pc3ig.text: I used to love their menu until they made all their food spicy. Bring it back to the way it was guys!

joafB6Irn9edCwMiQY7foQ.text: The food is 5 star..... Big wac is an absolute favorite! The only reason I gave it 4 stars was the parking is horrible. Try to come when it's not busy and it will be a great experience!! :-)

Yf3RQ7RYpeF0E04G4E1xYQ.text: I can not wait to move back to the Arizona so that I can try everything on the menu! Flew in last night from Maine where there are very limited dining options, vegetarian or otherwise. I had the  Mandarin orange(I think this was the name) noodle bowl with house tofu and my meat eating boyfriend had the BBQ 'chicken' sandwich and fries. Both were amazing! Great portions of delicious food for a very reasonable price. I can not recommend this place enough. Only downside, hard to find parking!

1CzvpbN4RZW2kSrVXFPP2Q.text: I love being able to get vegetarian hot wings. Now I have no reason to go back to meat.   As for the rest of the food, the chili is good, the mac n cheese is a little weird... but the crab puffs are tasty!  It's a litle hit or miss on some of the food items with regards to their 100% meat duplication, but nothing is bad on it's own without meat comparison.   I'd love to go back again!

oVIZ-Q0lhYTZMf0UIyfLug.text: I love the idea of an all-vegan restaurant. Green is all-vegan and so you know you can have a guilt-free meal. The food is mostly mock-meat versions of stuff like chicken parmesan, buffalo wings, etc. If you like greasy, fried food with heavy sauces and want to try the vegan version of it, that's what Green is good for. It tastes good, but I don't feel so great afterward.  If you prefer healthy, clean organic food loaded with fresh veggies and minimally-processed, try Chakra 4 or Persian Garden Cafe.

8IPQQI5RpKshHvT1nCNf7Q.text: I almost cried the first time I went to Green. For me one of the toughest things about going Vegan was having a place I could trot off to for something stupid like a hamburger. A place I don't have to feel empowered and enlightened just because I wanted to go out to dinner. Not all of us want to feel a smug self righteousness all the time  while we eat raw beets with a side of dirt. Sometimes a Vegan just wants a hamburger. Is that asking to much?! Not anymore. Thank you Green don't listen to the nay sayers. There stupid anyway.  PS my meat lovin man asks to go here. So yep it's good to really good. Get the hamburger and thank me later.

W363pLjduN6TY1f-gAOaxw.text: Awesome food! Big wap was unbelievable!  It took me a while to find a spot to park my truck tho, parking lit is tiny and its packed!

Bu2wMZlOrB99cVzE0hgOgQ.text: I will start by saying (based on the number of wing spots I've eaten at in my life) I NEVER thought I would write the following words.  THIS IS A GREAT VEGETARIAN WING!  Yes, I'm a purist but based on my fellow Yelpers, I had to give this a try. No - they don't look like wings but they are truly amazing, great flavor, with a nice texture.  Saved room for a chicken sandwich & loved it as well.  Friendly staff & nice open air locale.  All you carnivores, give it a try - you won't be disappointed

4fx0mD6GgTR52TPEL4wdmA.text: Ever chug a gallon a water and still feel as if you're thirsty from food that's been over-salted?  That's exactly what happened to us.   We checked out Green in Phoenix.  I must warn you, parking is a bit of a nightmare.  Very limited spots and fills up fast.  Standing in line to order was very disorganized and it took about 25 minutes to get our food.  I can understand waiting that long if you have a sit-down restaurant, but it's a pretty casual restaurant.  The wait seemed excessive.  I ordered the Singapore Orange and hubby had the Original PoBoy.  We shared our meals and I'm sorry to say, I was under-whelmed and felt queezy from all the saltiness.  We drank tons of water thru the night and still had a funky after-taste the next day (YUCK!).  I really wanted to like Green as I've enjoyed other Vegan restaurants.  I think they have way too many cuisines.  They serve: Thai, Indian, American, Italian, Greek & Mexican.  Focus on one or two and make them exceptional.

8AEzW8K4NPtuKPLtRpd-sA.text: Great food but a rude order taker behind the counter today. Short guy with brown hair...didn't thank us and before we even moved out of the way he was already talking to the people behind us. I made a quick change but apologized for the hassle and no response from him. Bro...if you hate your job go get a new one but you're ruining the experience for the rest of us.

8iw6OfJJlnvUPNl2AxM9EA.text: Green changed their menu, and got rid of their 'green veggie burger' which was one of the only items on the menu that did not have processed soy. It was made with rice and veggies and beet juice and now it's been replaced with fake meat. I'm just bummed since it was my favorite and you could order it on ezekial bun for a healthier option. Okay, I get it, this isn't a 'health' restaurant -- it's a vegan alternative for fast food and whatnot, but a girl can dream.  I have to say their fries are still my favorite and their noodle/rice bowls are delish. Uhhh and their fresh green tea/limeade/lemonades are so good. Mix them all up for the perfect beverage. Don't forget to go next door to Nami and get their vegan 'tsoynami' ice cream blizzard-style concoction and a latte (with coconut, almond, rice or soy milk).

lqiE3K8m_1Um3LuUNKpZdQ.text: Great vegan place, been vegan since beginning of the 2013, and I have eaten at vegan places in Philly, NY, CA prior to becoming full vegan and Green New American Vegetarian is a great place in Phoenix!  Great food.    My wife and I enjoyed the wings both times we visited this establishment, we highly recommend (make sure they give you their vegan ranch!).  First time we were there we also tried a Po Boy and it was good.  Second trip there, we had the Jerk Tofu Salad which let me tell you was some damn good tofu salad!!!  We also tried the Mac n Cheese and it was good in the sense if they did use nutritional yeast it wasn't overpowering, tasted like real mac n cheese but lighter.  We were hungry so we also ordered the samosas which were good, I thought the sauce needed more heat but that is just because I like spicy food.  Next time we are in Phoenix we will definitely stopping in again!

mpwvIbf1Ydf6hCb_nkzVmQ.text: The food was Amazing! The Big Wac is definitely a Big Mac in disguise! The wings are fiyah and the Wendy pickle taste just like chicken, I'm stoked!

YCs3OcH2LfwZMUHW8S3zNg.text: DE-LICIOUS!  SOOOOO worth the trouble of finding a parking spot. The parking is a bit tight. But one you're in, you may not want to leave. It's hard to find truly tasty healthy vegan food. I had the most tasty Thai Peanut veggies w/mock chicken. SOOOO good. And  I had to try the crab puffs.....an acquired taste...but still pretty good. $15 with drink left me happy to know I ate super yummy "greens".  Then after wards, I had to go next door to Nami and try a vegan cupcake....and take one or two home to my daughter. So nice to find a place that uses alt to dairy. Blah!   Go try out Green. You'll become addicted.

kkP3bxaoRymq4IZRYlp31g.text: When Green first opened, there were few vegan options at restaurants and grocery stores.  It was worth paying a premium for the opportunity to enjoy vegan junk food.  Now, in a time where vegan options are much more prevalent, Green has raised its prices to almost fine dining level.  If the food was truly gourmet, I would not have an issue with the increase.  However, the food tends to be overly salty and is very hit or miss.  More times than not, I have been disappointed with my meal due to careless preparation (e.g. over-cooked, skimpy toppings, etc.).  Hopefully Green will start imposing better quality control standards in their kitchen.  Until then, I can easily get my vegan junk food fix by going to Whole Foods.  It is surprisingly easy to make a vegan Big Mac at home for a fraction of the price.

zXyWzt1nAzo8r7fHYEhzyQ.text: "Vegetarian never tasted soo good"  No really, I have been continually impressed. I have been here about 3-4 times and this place has yet to disappoint.   SO let's talk about SOME of the things I've had: Spicy Buffalo "Wings" Chili Fries Crab Puffs Egglessrolls Samosas Lemon Pesto (with noodles and chicken) Big WAC (play on the big MAC vegetarian style) Sloppy Joe (Soy Chorizo)  I mean.. this place was soo good, I convinced my meat-loving co-workers to come with AND even they make requests to go back. That's when you know you are on to something.  Let's talk about the people: FANTASTIC. They are patient, answer all of your questions, help you to explore the menu, sauces, sides. Don't like something.. no problem! They are happy to resolve (this hasn't happened to me, but they thought it did and pulled out the red carpet).  The place is super cozy and cute.   Most importantly.. you are in and out quickly and they bring your food as it is prepared. LOVE THIS PLACE!

w68pSj8F0PeNaiNJ_Y_87g.text: If I lived here, this place would be my jam! Awesome curry bowl with mock beef, and they delivered it next door to the coffee joint. Super friendly service to boot!

_fwOGzqOctadVEYvdlj84Q.text: The only way to get me to a vegetarian joint is kicking and screaming. No more. I can't do tofu, which is the main reason I don't go to these places. Here they have a mock chicken (and beef) choice. I was told it's mushroom and soy paste. Sounds horrible to me. Delicious.  Added bonus was tamari in the sauce (gluten free). The bowl was with good veggies and brown rice. The flavor was great.

spJZtGQIe3zGyifhXV7zyQ.text: This was great!!  Even if there were a lot of vegetarian options in the area.  I've been vegetarian my whole life.   Great variety! Will def go again soon!

5rrsRIp1uBgQBK9-Ba-G7w.text: Some of the best , if not the best, vegan sandwiches I've ever eaten. It was a major personal disappointment when I switched to a mostly vegan diet that most vegan restaurants have limited, and frequently bland, sandwich options. This is not the case at Green. Sandwiches are flavorful, filling, diverse, and just plain ole' tasty.    The sides are ok, not bad but not spectacular like the sandwiches either. Service is solid, time from placing the order to digging in is good to great, decor is pleasant, and the prices are fair (~10 bucks for lunch if you get water to drink). All in all a sweet vegan option near down town Phoenix.

QwEbCQgVWCCL0TugSa75mw.text: Green recently changed their menu and it all went downhill. Prices are more expensive and the new dishes tasted bad. Both times everything was very salty. The parking at Green was always terrible and now "but the food is really good" isn't a reason to deal with the terrible parking. I am not going back to waste my money on a third time.

yIZHJaL_MO5tQe_PpIPctQ.text: would it be too brief to simply proclaim "best place ever!"? ok, fine.  how about elaborating by saying order thee green salad and the kung pao bowl or some "wings"?  they are so good, you'll thank me later.  you dont' have to be vegan to appreciate the yummy-ness.

9-5q26vaxoMrpKOdljIocQ.text: will not go back. when i visit asu  i always go to tsom or pomegranate cuz food is wonderful and great prices.  but today i decided to give this place a try.    i am a vegan who do not like fake meat. so i ordered the lemon and walnut bowl with brown rice. there was barely brown rice. and the veggies were all fillers veggies. ie zucchinis and carrots.   they put way too much oil which was a bummer cuz there was no rice to soak up. when i asked the guy how much rice do they put in a bowl he didnt know the answer. hmmmm. also the meal should have came with a lemon pinenut pesto sauce. ummm. i got lemon and oil sauce. i must have gotten a new new cook. what a shame.

6nfeAqfudg_qJr5yhCQ3Nw.text: I'm not a vegetarian, but my good friend (who was with me) is and has been for a long time, so we decided to check out Green New American Vegetarian (actually, it's Vegan).   I'm glad we did!  The place is super cool inside - definitely a trendy place with a lot of young people.  We got there just in time, before the lunch rush, because at about noon, the place was insanely packed!  The menu is pretty big, so there are a lot of choices for the True Vegans.  I ordered the green hummus dish to start - really good and spicy - but not too spicy. The pita chips are freshly made and have a nice spice on them, too.  I didn't get the pickle garnish... a little strange.  I had the small Green Salad - it was really super de-lish.  The dressing was also a little spicy, but it made it really great.  Tons of green olives - so, you better like olives (which I do).  My friend ordered the Argentine Po-Boy - she scarfed it down... she had the cole slaw side and said it was really yummy.  Keep in mind to get there early - the parking is big enough for about 10 cars (we were luck to get one of the last spots) and the place is small, but you'll love it!  Definitely worth trying - even if you're not a vegetarian!

-vfuu5GiZso7HnjBzv37Gg.text: First of all, we knew it was going to be good when we drove up and noticed the great smells from the parking lot! Let's start with the building and decor. Urban hip all the way, clean with a great vibe. I noticed and loved all of the recycled materials used so creatively in the decor. You can tell there are smart and creative people behind this business and it shows.  My girlfriend has been a vegetarian for 30+ years and while I am not, I do all of the cooking in our house and have developed an appreciation for this type of cuisine and am always looking for creative ways to spice up our meals. Most of the meat substitutes found in stores do not measure up to whatever they used as chicken-less chicken in their spicy buffalo wings. They were so flavorful, had a great meat texture, and the ranch dressing to cool it all off was delish. I can't wait to have them again! We then tried the Green Hummus. Again, very flavorful, the green part coming from a creative use of Poblano Peppers and drizzled with a little sesame oil. I thought the pita chips were a little greasy and since I try not to eat fried foods very much, I thought it would be cool if they offered and un-fried option but they don't. Then again, I didn't ask. Whatever they used to season the chips with was also very good and very flavorful. We then embarked upon the crabless-puffs. Nothing remarkable but for a creamy fried (Ughh) little puff, it was great. The "Green" salad was kind of blah compared to everything else we had, but it was fresh and organic and made me feel better about myself after munching down all the fried stuff. The service was super fast and friendly. I thought the pricing was dead-nuts. Even the bathrooms were cool! We can't wait to go back and try more things! We have a great appreciation for restaurateurs who actually pay attention to detail and take the time to develop a creative and super flavorful menu like this. Worth the drive, worth the money, worth our time = Five star review.

Y1X533nUiJAPitvydtvYHQ.text: Great local vegan place. Try the chicken parm with curry pasta salad.

xe9cOyUBHCL-DClc4oHwqw.text: great food, wish it was closer we would come all the time

yPzCtvA1kqQh03jAynSo2w.text: good food and good atmosphere most of the time.  my only complaint is sometimes the staff are rude, they look at you like they wonder why you are in there place...to eat you jerks!

hCrWq5brirQXj_7SqZsLMg.text: Phoenix location - My husband and I LOVE this place! The food is fantastic. Prices are great and the folks running it are always so nice. It's our favorite spot to go in the city.

hLhdZ3Pfb5obL7Zvlt9glA.text: I love, love, love this restaurant.  We were in town visiting people in Phoenix for 3 days, and we went here 3 times.  Incredible.  Insane pizza (they use Tease, which is magnificent), delicious "chicken ranchero" salad, which happens to be gluten-free (incredible) and an amazing bbq chicken sandwich.  One caveat:  it's possible to have mock meat overload here, so follow the lead of the venue's name and order something green, too!

2uRleZM7Ni0_qiCn943eqA.text: I live down the street and can walk my dog here, grab coffee and chill on the patio. It's really the best place for a vegan or gluten free option in Coronado. Super chill with coffee and sweet treats at Nami right next door...  Pro hack: The Hummas app, Big Wac and Thai bowl make even the hangriest kids come back from the dark side.

G5VafhupvlVRp62PO50T3g.text: Green is incredible! The service is fast and friendly, and the food is great! I went and ordered the "wings", and they were delicious. It's so hard to find vegetarian wings in general, so I was very surprised to see them on the menu! I don't eat meat, but I went with someone who does, and even she enjoyed the food! I would highly recommend this place to any vegetarian, vegan, or even to meat eaters who want to adventure out and try new things. :^)

xd7C1TmPRUDVmuK_yqWk5g.text: The big wac was way awesome my wife ordered it and i got the coconut curry bowl it was very filling being that we are in diets. Nice to know you can eat out and still be health conscious.

JBRaC3QP2QYHe12spGDXBw.text: Food was really good to excellent.  Service was slow.  Moderately enrage you slow.  I went to Green on a Thursday at 12:15 and ordered the following to-go:  1.  Crab puffs (meh. decent but not memorable.) 2.  Ranchero salad (not remotely spicy, but good texture on the wings and a great assortment of veg. Ranch dressing was pretty tasty.) 3.  Big WAC (I could eat this every day and die enormously fat and happy. I made moaning noises whilst eating to the horror of my lunch mates.) 4. Secret BBQ chicken sandwich (lunchmate who is a pretty die hard meat eater enjoyed it. Said the BBQ was good, texture was fine "but definitely not chicken.") 5.  Iced tea (I drank at least 5 glasses. So tasty and fresh!)  It took 45 minutes to get my TO-GO order. No apologies given. Other people came in, ordered, ate and left while I was still waiting. Place was crazy busy. Everyone looked happy though. I think my experience was an anomaly.   Bottom line, I will definitely be going back. Much more to try!

qAGfuTEAMZL2lILTLoburg.text: I have eaten here three times now.... each time was delicious and the flavors are yummy..... I love the texture of the tofu.  Again.... the flavors are YUMMY.  While my husband and daughter love lots of sauce - I find my dishes have been heavily sauced.... but not to worry - I will just ask for the sauce on the side!    I love their teas and Iimeade!  SOOOOO Good!    Service is FANTASTIC!  And the service is super quick.  Yum!  Give this place a try and if you are like me - ask for your sauce on the side!

YGyyABDdSCnK202-nXQY8g.text: I'm a confirmed carnivore. I admire my sharp, pointy canine teeth designed for ripping flesh off of a bone. I have an deep, abiding love for pastrami, ham and steak. Heck, I even like bologna and hot dogs-- the worst of the worst.  But if there ever was a reason to "go vegetarian," it's in Central Phoenix at Green, who tout their cuisine as "New American Vegetarian." This means it isn't all ooky cubes of bland tofu thrown into some stir fry or thin Mung Bean Soup. It is, however, 100% vegan with gluten free options.  Although Chef Damon Brasch, the mastermind behind Green, promotes his menu as "comfort" food, that may be a bit of a stretch. There's absolutely no substitute for, say, Shepherd's Pie, bacon or a roast beef dinner. Sorry. However, Green does have an attractive array of dining options that are very, very tasty, flavorful and filling.  The Spicy Peanut Chicken Salad presents spicy peanut mock chickenover fresh greens, carrots tossed in miso vinaigrette and tortilla strips. ($6 sm/$9 lg). Very appealing.  The Kung Pao Mock Chicken Bowl offers spicy ginger and garlic tamari sauce with crushed peanuts. Eight different bowls are on the menu with lots of veggies (of course) plus your choice of chicken, beef (mock), house or fresh tofu. Choose from either pan fried noodles or organic brown rice.  Take your pick from nine different po- boys, sandwiches and burgers. The "No Harm Parm" po-boy features a breaded mock-chicken cutlet with tasty Mum's tomato sauce and a dazzling mozzarella cheese. But the bread ... you have to try their bread. Phenomenal. All these are between $8.50-$9 and come with your choice of thyme fries, fresh fruit, or an incredible dolphin-safe Tahini Coleslaw which will knock your free-range socks off.  Green's cooler has a vast and delightful range of ice teas, sodas, mineral waters and flavored Kombucha that's a pleasure for any diner's palate.   You'll never see Colonel Sanders, Ronald McDonald or Long John Silver in here--but during our visit we saw Hollywood's handsome Kal Penn of stoner flick Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle. (He must've had the munchies, dude.) He didn't find the legendary 100% beef hamburgers there, but he was in the right place for one fine veggie burger.

g2Qozypfve3fR6Bk6mcAvg.text: We finally had an opportunity to drive to Green's Phoenix location and it was amazing!   First we had the artichoke gratine, which was very artichokey, not very cheesy. With heavenly Daiya vegan cheeses and Tofutti ricotta cheese out there, it is possible to make ooey-gooey vegan dishes. However, the gratine was still tasty.   The vegan crab puffs were crispy and had a nice texture, but fell a little flat with flavor. Perhaps a dash or two of kelp flakes would give them a bit of ocean spark. The dipping sauce and lime wedge added extra needed kick though.   The absolute delight of the meal was the big Wac sandwich-- 2 veggie burgers that had an awesome flame broiled taste were smothered in a special sauce and then layered with pickles, lettuce, and onions. All this between two sesame seed buns-YUM!!! Next weekend, (if we wait that long!!) we are going to try the BBBQ (vegan)bacon burger and mac n cheez with veggies.  I Love vegan comfort food!!!

m6GXPPAsr73X3CCMNKnCfw.text: Stopped in, while passing through on I-10, based on the Yelp reviews. It was a hit!  We had burgers, fries, the egg rolls and strawberry lemonades...zero complaints. Would go in all the time, if we lived here.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gCqYLkVOJt2CsLsoy_-zFQ.text: I'm not from Arizona, but I had a few hours to kill before a flight and decided to explore beyond downtown Phoenix for dinner. Yelped "vegetarian" and saw this place, whose menu was reminiscent of one my favorite spots back home in NYC, Red Bamboo.  This is veggie-friendly reimaginings of classic American comfort food. Po Boys. Egg rolls. Buffalo "wings." Some asian fusion-style bowls as well.  The food was excellent. Service was quick - and very friendly (being a NY-er, I was a little overly conscious about taking up too much of the server's time, but they loved chatting!).   EXCELLENT beer selection and wine on tap!  And it was CHEAP, given the quality of the ingredients and portions. Since I knew I wouldn't be back soon, I wanted to sample a lot and the cashier warned me that I was ordering way too much food for one person (I did), but I went ahead and the bill was less $25 including a glass of wine.   Really awesome, forward-thinking place. Made me reconsider my evaluation of Phoenix/Tempe/Scottsdale after a week there. Glad to see this kind of spot in Arizona and I hope it does gangbusters and inspires other similarly-minded businesses (I think it will - I was especially encouraged by the diversity of customers. Old war vets you'd expect to sneer at some fancy-pants non-meat, hearty salt-of-the-earth families, etc. Definitely not what you'd expect at a very urban-hip type place!)  I then went to their sister vegan ice cream/coffee shop, Nami, which was excellent and I will review later.

6DJqemGuH8YS6uKqCd0k7A.text: I really used to love this place but they are changing and not for the better. The quality of the food is not the same plus they have went up on prices of the meals slightly and removed the sides that come with the meal. For marketing purposes this is horrible, your better off raising the prices slightly but leaving the sides with the meal.  The ladies and gentleman that provide service there are AWESOME and this needs to be mentioned because you will always get great service! I will still be getting breakfast occasionally  from their sister place NAMI but I am retiring from Green Vegetarian for now.

qDgOlE6oEY3ONckfKYgOpQ.text: As a vegetarian for about 2.5 years, I really enjoy this place. Their standing menu items are delicious and their daily special is usually good to try if it sounds appealing. The mock chicken is so good it is hard to tell it is not real chicken. The thyme French fries are yummy and go with everything on the menu. For dessert, walk next door to Nami.   Love it!!!

tbwcreFWBGoJddtwthHGoQ.text: Green is one of my favorites. If you are vegan or gluten free, this is the place for you. If you like to eat health and delicious food, this is it. There is a huge menu for everyone.  My favorite is the green salad with avocado. Enjoy a dish. And then you can go next door to Nami and have a dessert.

pkneUHbOzIvkO1OjA4J8mg.text: My friends and I came here on a Sunday morning and got brunch, and everything was SO GOOD! I got a breakfast burrito filled with tempeh, cheese, potatoes, eggs and other delicious goodness but also tried my friend's yogurt parfait and soft serve ice cream. Everything was completely vegan, but it honestly tasted better than any real meat burrito I've ever had. And the staff were wonderful and answered all of our newbie questions. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone, vegan or not. Can't wait to go back to try their vegan big mac!

V5S0GUFMzn80lbcU1xdPKw.text: Was here on business March 4, 2014. It took me forever to find this place because, being an out of towner, I did not realize there is a N. 7th Street and a N. 7th Avenue both of which intersect McDowell Road. Anyway, I got to the restaurant and ordered the spicy buffalo "wings" to go and had a glass of the local wine while I waited at the table and waited and waited...  I love the clever and artistic design of the place, especially the detailed little touches. I had visited the website before coming and loved the chef's story. I really wanted to love this place. Alas, the wine was meh though I loved that it came in a little mason jelly jar. Also, it took forever to get the one thing that I had ordered. It's not like the place was packed; orders were coming out of the kitchen. When other people who ordered just before and after I did got their food, I went up to check. The cashier checked on it and said it would be right out. Finally, 10 minutes later I got my bag and bounced.  The spicy buffalo "wings" just weren't that good. The breaded "mock" meat was overcooked and too chewy. The glaze on it was just ok. I eat (and cook) vegetarian all the time and have had some fantastic eats; this was a disappointment.

TH4QMK2uwjousPt32rZfUg.text: They call it new American because American's are known for fast food. Don't think you're getting healthy if you go to green, you're getting vegan American fast food.   While I have enjoyed meals here time and time again, I must admit I only return for the scene and nami next door.   My friend Cole and I shared a big wack and the wings but I enjoyed my beer most of all. Yeah, they serve beer here now :) I tried Mr. Pineapple a few weeks back and ordered this but Cole had no problem telling me it was light and not strong enough for his taste buds.. Who would have thought that the meat eater would be a bigger pussy than the vegan? It's okay though, I'm a girl who likes beer so I'll give myself a pat on the back for that.   Anyway, after dinner we went next door where my friend Mariah served us up so vegan treats. I originally tried making up my own Tsoynami creation but after a few minutes I just let her surprise me. WOW was I surprised and pleasantly so. She made a strawberry cheese cake creation with nilla wafers and strawberries YUM. We also got a banana muffin with peanut butter frosting that was ORGASMIC.   If you've got a sweet tooth and you're like me / try to stay away from dairy, this is the place to go!

_MUEqw7AAdnORCTcEuhnLA.text: the wife treated myself and her sister to another great meal at green restaurant tonight. i opted for the lemon pesto with house tofu, pan fried noodles. it was again, quite delectable. the pesto was plentiful and the tofu soaked that goodness right up. we again opted for the buffalo wings and i am always impressed at how damn good they taste!  always a great food treat!

QiZSo1DY9TXFVExNGaj9Tg.text: My partner and I had just become vegetarian last month and I've searched for a vegan/vegetarian restaurant and yelp found me this place. This place rocked our socks out! We took a risk to try infamous spicy buffalo "wings" and we loved it to death! It tastes exactly like a regular chicken. The buffalo sauce was at it's perfect spiciness. As for meals, I ordered original "g" spicy po-boy with thyme fries and my partner ordered secret BBQ chicken sandwich with thyme fries. We both loved them and eat them all up! Absolutely delicious! And the staffs were so friendly and knew how to communicate with us in a heartbeat because we both are deaf. We are coming back no question about it! We will try Nami's their little sister 100% vegan bakery. You need to take your friends over here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omg! It&#39;s so good vegan buffalo wings. Tastes like chicken!

DDnFXcCcrKQ1ri8LYyK1_g.text: Shared 2 bowls: Diablo Red and Thai Peanut. Both over brown rice, the Diablo Red with fresh tofu, the Thai Peanut with mock beef. The Thai Peanut was my favorite by far - WOW it was good.   I'm not a big fan of beef, but the mock beef was delicious. The sauce was a bit spicy, and happily not very sweet. Very, very good.  I didn't find the Diablo Red quite as appealing, but that's just a personal preference. Service was very friendly, and it took only a few minutes for our food to be delivered to our table. A very, very good meal.

GIByOecDhrMXMaIOfvkZ0A.text: "Buffalo" wings and the Big Wac are so so delicious! It is one of my favorites restaurants to go for delicious vegan food. I see lots of meat eaters that are surprised to find how delicious vegan food can be.

0jHBrXT-iYR2-RrO9d3HSQ.text: We love green and we're not even vegetarian/vegan. The mock chicken is a delight and so is the service. Especially Simon, who told us she wanted her name to be Simon. So welcoming and relatable. I prefer this location to the Scottsdale Rd. one. Our vegan friend was in town from Portland and we ate here for 3 days straight. Food was quick and delicious--tried the Big Wac for the first time ever. Holy shit.   As in the words of Liz Lemon: "i want to go to there."

_f2eXFWHvFLeFw0Wvb9uyA.text: So strange watching this previously great restaurant plummet. The food is no longer noteworthy and the experience is below enjoyable. I have visited the Tempe location Green since 2010, and the Phoenix location since it opened. Meals that were once well made and adequately portioned now represent a hastily prepared snack. The menu has shrunk, and items that used to be paired - such as the Argentine Po' boy (no longer on the menu) and fries - are now sold separately. Remarkably, while menu items have removed major portions of the meal, the prices of these orders have all risen. Eliminating standard portions from long-standing meals and increasing prices is a bold move, and the absurdity is further compounded by the noticeably lower quality food. It simply isn't that enjoyable. The family members and friends I previously took to Green would always rave about the food and experience; I would not consider such an outing in the restaurant's current state.   *Fun Fact: the largest portioned meal is also one of the least expensive. Try ordering the chicken nuggets from the kids' menu. It looks like that section of the menu is still unchanged. I imagine the owners will make the necessary adjustments if they read this review (sorry kiddos).  The owners seem to be banking on reputation and being the only somewhat hip vegetarian restaurant in town. Using smaller sizes, higher prices, and fewer ingredients are all decent ways to increase net profit, but what happens to your once loyal customer base? Even the soynamis have smaller cups. Absurd.

xzaYjy3ATSjpRtq7cuYeuQ.text: Really enjoyed this place. My general tsaos v-chicken was the right amount of spice but had a slightly burnt aftertaste I wasn't bothered enough to complain, but it did bring this from a 5 star to a 4. Friendly staff and an abundance of options as long as you like Asian food. Burger and fry people should look elsewhere.

DSQ9i4mD7q8oKYVLc3L8yg.text: I'm not a vegetarian or a vegan (my husband is though), but their food is delicious and flavorful and a nice change of pace.  It can be a bit pricey, but I've discovered that if my husband and I each get a bowl and cups of lemonade we can keep it to about $20, which makes it much more wallet friendly for an impromptu weeknight dinner out.  Their curry bowl with fried tofu and noodles is one of my favorites, it's spicy, flavorful and piping hot.  Also their buffalo 'chicken' wings are fantastic, and very 'meaty' and spicy!  Tip: Avoid the pre-bottled sodas and drinks in the case, they are SILLY expensive.  Just get one of the cups for an in-house beverage (tea, lemonade, etc.) from the dispenser on the counter, they are very yummy and refillable.

JU4wAonBuDT_yJpwMEgu7w.text: Awesome little place ! I had the Big Wac and was shocked of how much it actually tasted like a burger ! Also , their their organic teas , black currant and lime juices are very good in the big self serve containers ( dont expect to get soda here) .. I wish I could eat here everyday ! The menu seems so creative , will definitely be back to try more items !

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Even the cups are good for our earth
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ice Cube machine !! Genius !!
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Wac , served with fruit or fries .. Asked for sauce on the side .

noaj4DYzPYz3HTjSCHJCPQ.text: I'm not vegetarian but I'm vegetarian friendly.  I'm no stranger to faux meats and tofu.  I've had the "chicken" wings a number of times thanks to friends but had never eaten at the restaurant.    I was slightly dubious about ordering the Calexico burger but I was glad I did.  The patties were described as "vegan" but as far as I'm concerned, they were made of magic.  For you Midwesterners, they reminded me those wafer-thin steakburgers you get at Steak N' Shake.  Delicious!  The fries were tasty but nothing special.  The lemonade was also quite tasty and not too sweet.

XmFT3W3u_4-9Hb3ImJOcIg.text: I was searching through yelp for a nice vegetarian place before I fly back home from Phoenix.  Green/Nami is 10 minutes away from the Phoenix Sky Harbor (I discovered) so that was already a plus!  The restaurant has a nice feel to it and and very friendly staff! There's lots of younger people going in and out of it so there's a nice vibe at the place. It has vegetarian as well as vegan options and in general it's a nice progressive place.  I had the huevos rancheros and a vanilla milkshake. The food came out very quickly and was really delicious! I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Lvtz2f0uVFgXK_HJRma1gA.text: Ive been to this place on many occasions and have tried a few things myself from the big wac (which is very good) to lesser popular items on the menu that are very good as well, its a small place and gets crowded at times but very well worth it try it someday you wont be disappointed
