yAV05rJoXG2VcuLXTyJmDQ.text: Over 30 minutes to get the two most simple sandwiches on the menu. People that cane at least 5-10 minutes after are eating and finishing and leaving. Complained twice but was also blown off twice. It was not busy when I put in my order so no reason for it to be this slow when it's typically 5 minutes.

Gnn0xjbjcljOgBj9_t0fZw.text: Delicious and affordable! Great for vegans and vegetarians. Even good for people who like meat as it's so tasty and has lots of fake meats.

j4N3mYB0siDjr_Qsa3HnYg.text: OMG!! An explosion of fantastic flavor in your mouth! Everyone really should check this place out. So many options to satisfy whatever you are in the mood for.  The thyme fries are soooo good!!! And I went for one of the burger options recommend to me. It didn't not disappoint. I went for lunch and this place was packed. Everyone was down to earth and happy and munching away. I am adding this spot to one of my favorite list. Can't wait to try their other items on the menu. I am eyeing that "Mac" burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big WAC

4IMdPcJG1zNRXv_U4CHdPg.text: Freaking love This place!!!!! Been here 5-6 times over the last few years and it never disappoints. Love the buffalo wings, big wac, soynamis, donuts, breakfast burritos... like I said, never been disappointed!

YYHb9VpLDTaYje2uVXdLjg.text: Loved the atmosphere! Delicious food especially the Buffalo wings. I'd come back just for that anytime!!

eoIIo1XR8TxZfnvLqmhXpw.text: Green is one of my favorite restaurants! I frequent this joint often because the food is fast and delicious. I am certainly not a vegan or a vegetarian but I do enjoy their food. My favorites here are the wings and the big wac.  The wings are an amazing texture and come with cucumber ranch that is very good. The big wac is messy but it taste very similar to the Big Mac without the guilt. I love their sweet potato tots and their French Fries as well. If you've never tried their vegan cookies or the soynamis at 'Nami' you must give them a try too. Everything is very reasonably priced and the atmosphere is very relaxed. I love taking out of towners here too!

hN4fiVU9pgDPFzcmNNevlA.text: I go to Green on a regular basis, and no I'm not vegan or vegetarian. I've tried several things on the menu and all have been bursting with flavor. You really don't miss the meat, and they seem to do something special with all of their sauces as they all taste great! My faves are:  - No harm chicken parm, this is better than most real chicken parm sandwiches that I've had.    - BBQ chicken, the sauce on this one is amazing!   - Coconut curry, full of veggies and potatoes  - Blonde Alfredo - I don't have to take any lactaid to enjoy this alfredo, and I don't miss the dairy either!  The counter staff is always really friendly and nice. I also like that they have fresh lemonade, limeade and iced tea. I would highly recommend Green.

q7jXYYbzWwTc-hc3fNWSZA.text: Great casual vegan spot!  My husband and I ate here after landing at the airport and before making our way to Sedona.  I had the Classic burger (which was small) and coleslaw, and my husband had the Dagobah Jungle wrap.  The drinks in the cooler were as interesting as the food menu.  Everything we had was great, and we would definitely go back and order more food next time!

P_tl8vl1R1fj1RFIIXwZJA.text: Sadly, I think the last time I dined here was my last.  I always feel gross after ingesting items off of their soy-filled menu. So, I tried a salad and was utterly disappointed.  When it comes down to it, I'd rather spend my money on real food, not fake meat and fake cheese and fake this and that.    Keep it real...er...well, you just keep it.

dEk7PEwa180h3BvQsqrZrA.text: I like it!! Because is vegan. The older lady is the best to serve and her customer service is very good.

IYvzQ3nyst6fQIO1uleS5g.text: Casual but excellent vegan dinner after a visit at the nearby Heard Museum.  It really hit the spot.

GbFO-bF7ozOn1gRLB7Hq6A.text: I ordered Animal Fries, which is a simple order, to go. I waited 20 minutes to get my food and other customers who ordered after me received their food before I did. The waitresses were extremely passive aggressive and did not provide the respectful atmosphere an established restaurant should have. I have been to Green multiple times but never to this extent of customer neglect.

-croffmKBSiHjSFqgNe5Tw.text: Last time coming here. Everything on the new menu is pricy and I got a burned disgusting salad today. Had to drive back in the hottest day to return it. The cashier seemed indifferent and tried to make me believe the sprouts that looked like meatball were only "a little bit fried". Excuse me? My entire office noticed the burning smell when I opened the box. I used to love this place... So mad and so sad.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burned food for 13 bucks. Never coming back.

JwZ3aA577yg4DRypnVTkqA.text: Even my Dad found something to eat here!  As a vegan, I have been known to go out of my way to find tasty vegan eats, so the whole family jumped in the car and drove 40 minutes to check this place out. All in all, I was pretty happy with my Po Boy and would love to come again next time I'm in the area. I loved the free refills on the fountain drinks - four varieties to choose from including a lemonade and iced tea. All you can drink so if you don't get filled up enough with all the delicious and creative choices, you can sure fill yourself up with liquids. We also enjoyed the craft beer choices starting at $3. Thanks to Green American for sharing their love of vegan food with Phoenix.

b1fuStbKbZH-IFbB1UAnvQ.text: Guilty pleasure Vegan eats. The Big Wac is awesome as are the "buffalo" wings. Place can get kinda crazy busy. Worth the wait

Hc8jdEctDwZcso8mAgfU_Q.text: This was a really great place, busy and a bit pricey, but they do deliver on the food.  The drunken mushroom chicken was great.  Not only the taste was better than most "real" chicken, but the texture was as good as I have tasted.  Save room for dessert though, as you have got to try their vegan soy ice cream, watch out 31 flavors!

9AktpFuxOGqpc701Ar3f_w.text: A little pricey, but that seems to be pretty standard for np vegetarian or vegan food. I had a large tasty salad and my beloved had a rice bowl. We both left feeling satisfied. I'd rate it at very good, but not great.

rdsXa6KjZSRoEx2I7RGwFA.text: Love this location. Fun building and local art to look at. The people are always friendly and helpful about the menu.   Love Green. For someone who recently became vegan, it is our go to place for comfort food. If they are offering a special, get it. The specials are always amazing.   We have taken vegan friends and carnivores with us and they always love it.. most are especially enamored of the Big Wac and Wendy's Pickle.

lAX0mWCK9aCNG-jYWLu1eA.text: There's nothing better than a bunch of spunky vegetarian restaurant people. So, the people were great and helpful when it came to my first-timer questions about what to order (vegan gyro, singapore noodles) for the hubs and me, and plain lo mein noodles for the kiddo. My concern always about a serious vegetarian place is that they skew snobby, rather than populist and happy. Green is the latter. Go Green - nice work! PS: yes the food is awesome. Just eat here, even if you like meat.

8Sz25U2Zi15pdfHXhrSrmw.text: I had the Hummus and Black Jack Pita and both were great. The hummus was really flavorful but the chips were a little over cooked for my taste but were not burnt. The pita was delicious. It wa a robust sized wrap and a pleasure to eat. The food is reasonable priced and the people are extremely friendly making for a really good experience. I will eat here when I'm in this part of town!

HActh-YlOsJWlOh0sF7ECA.text: This place is amazing!!! Great menu selections, so great that I wanted to try everything.  I tried the vegan crab puffs and they were super yummy.  Trying the pizza next!

MkydDZKqlGzFs3u-71OGhQ.text: Finally an upscale restaurant in downtown Phoenix offering organic food that is delicious. I eat mostly vegetarian but I've never been to a place before that prepares food so well I that I want to completely convert.  I have eaten there twice and felt completely satisfied both times. Can't wait to visit Nami next door.

HGQa9o68-pjDjecSrKQl9A.text: I really enjoyed this place. Just passing thru, I didn't expect to find much in the area like it. All vegan. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The menu being American fusion is really diverse. I ordered the Red Diablo (with mock chicken) which was a pretty impressive asian stir-fry brown rice bowl. All the veggies were cooked perfectly as was the brown rice in a tasty sweet spicy sauce. Other options ranged from pizza to almost any typical sports bar styled sandwich such as Buffalo chicken or 'pulled' portobello mushroom. Pricing is fair; $7-8 for most main dishes. Check out Nomi next door for coffee, tea and plenty of vegan deserts, too.

59njeeWNcyJ6XWLi0zSX6g.text: I just made the switch to vegetarianism a few months ago, and have been scouting out some decent cuisine when I stumbled on Green today.  I ordered the Spicy Po Boy, and damn if it wasn't the best Po Boy I've ever had!!!  (vegan or otherwise).  Casual unassuming atmosphere with a bit of a beatnick vibe.  I will definitely be going back to try the "Drunken Chicken" along with a Tsoymami desert!

DjUaMkY-fTtuKcxhwwxl8w.text: In an attempt to move toward a more vegetarian/vegan diet, my husband and I decided to give Green a try. We were both completely amazed at how good our meal was and are sure to be repeat customers.   It was difficult to decide what to have since almost every item on the  menu looked delicious. I finally settled on the No Harm Chicken Parm with Thyme Fries and my husband had Wendy's Pickle with Tyme Fries. We both had green tea to drink.   Our sandwiches were both delicious. This was my first try at vegan cheese and the faux mozzarella on my sandwich was delicious and added just the perfect touch. The tomato sauce was rich and garlicky and balanced out all of the flavors.    My husband took one bite of his sandwich and declared, "This is really good!" High praise from a man who eats everything but rarely gets excited by any of it. We both loved the bread our sandwiches were on and thought the fries were awesome.  We will be back, Green, to try all of the delicious items on your menu. Next up: The Big Wack!

Fu5G4AEvj40_TKlG19b5MQ.text: So in love with this little gem!  My husband and I come from California where you can find a vegan restaurant on every corner. After moving to Arizona I am happy that we have found GREEN! We ate at the Scottsdale location last night, and today during my lunch break I ate at the 7th St location! Both had the same great taste and quality! For any vegan skeptic out there...try GREEN before you try anything else...it will set a great standard of how awesome Vegan food can be!

5VfG9NiyJEphEZrCPeeHKA.text: It's easy to be vegetarian and order anything from the menu!  This place rocks my world.

ghroh0qPgCIo34EgPuiEgA.text: My wife and I share the crab puffs and two of the sandwiches. All were great and we hand an outstanding dining experience. I'm just sorry I didn't try the wings - next time.

56NVlt4BjpxXkcedmZQmcw.text: Stopped in for the first time today. I got the Thai peanut bowl with brown rice and mock chicken. It was incredibly delicious, actually. I was very pleasantly surprised. Wish I lived closer! Very impressed.

N-yakSTqwgOl0acKJtF2oQ.text: Love love loved it! I've had the opportunity to sample their food at local festivals but this was my first time to the restaurant.  Seating options include inside and two patios- a louder one off of 7th street and a quieter on at the back of the restaurant.  We ordered the hummus and the chips were perfect accompaniments.  We also spilt the secret BBQ chicken sandwich. Okay this is where I tell you that I am not a vegetarian but thought this was amazing! Also ordered a side of the curry past salad- good add on.

vK8VHS-k4czKFV2C14LpxQ.text: I was first introduced to Green through a friend who had her birthday dinner catered by Green and later visited the Scottsdale Road location.  This was over 2 years ago.  Soon after, I learned that Green was opening a location just down the street from my home in Phoenix.  This is by far one of my favorite places in Phoenix.  I have yet to try everything on the menu.  The service is always friendly, the drinks are always refreshing and the bathrooms are always clean.  If you Like Green on Facebook, you can stay up to date with the specials that Green has to offer and at which location.

2BUPU3K6mZIsCz_gOlH8NA.text: I love this place. I am not vegan but I must say the food here is great!! I have been back several times and each time the food is delicious!!

mcHk9083AVavdjP2W_-Vjw.text: Visiting from out of town and wanted a good vegan experience.  Being from CO, we have excellent vegetarian/vegan fare so my expectations were high.  We got the spicy edamame, Big WAC and Calexico burgers.  GREAT flavor, friendly service, quick with the food order and arrival!  Amazing experience! W

1Eg14ojmDea-9WmvpvAWow.text: This is defiantly a gem. The place is very cute and urban. I got the original "g" spicy po-boy and my boyfriend got the Thai peanut bowl. The sandwich was amazing if you like buffalo sauce but oh my... my boyfriends good way so much better. I would defiantly recommend this place for those who want to start their vegan journey!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

N6_eA5_YhlLdlzNurKpZkA.text: Super friendly staff, and the food was delish! Really cute atmosphere, and great location! The "meat" was so good too, you could hardly tell it was all vegan!

O_2CpIPJuD1NX1BuhN17bw.text: Funky little spot on 7th street with friendly servers and excellent food!   I enjoyed Green in Tempe and was excited when the Phoenix location opened.   Parking: This is one problem area of this location. Parking is tight.  There is likely street parking around the area.   Service with a smile: The employees are always friendly.    Food: Amazing!  This is vegetarian comfort food.  I have ordered almost every salad and bowl on the menu. Some veg-based places skimp on flavor and spice, but Green knows what it is doing!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious mock chicken salad

f0RAW1FnORX44qKt5JegHg.text: Amazing food, by far the best vegan friendly food in downtown phoenix. Roasted sprouts are my favorite and they have amazing teas made in house. Do yourself a favor and try their nektar it's a must have!

UgjSK7maB9B5xdayw12ioQ.text: Best food ever! Even if you're not a vegetarian, this place is boss! The big wac and BFF are amazing. They textures and flavors are on point.

TSfZ4l_OXwDdSHtX00kVrw.text: I have been a vegetarian for about a month now. I was sooo happy when I found this place! Their food is amazing and helps me get that "meaty" taste I've been missing. The staff is very friendly and helpful as well!

H4f_8ua4V-1liX8w7g1VVA.text: Hands down my favorite vegan place! I'm sure i've tried almost everything on the menu. I love the big wac and west coast fries. The sweet lime and lemonade together is such a great combo.

qEIInDPD74yCa7aZEB1vuA.text: I stopped here while in Phoenix for the day. After reading glowing reviews about the Big Wac, I just had to try one for myself.  My husband and I arrived around 6:30pm and the restaurant was pretty busy. Luckily the line at the counter moved quickly and we placed our order. Two Big Wacs, 2 orders of thyme fries, and "wings".   All of our food came out really quick. Wings first, followed by the burgers. The wings were great! Good flavor and the dilly ranch paired very well with them. The Big Wacs were great! A little too salty for my taste, but I still thoroughly enjoyed the burger and fries! My husband, a carnivore, was shocked at how much it tasted like the real deal. I've tried the famous vegan versions in other cities, but the Big Wac blows those out of the water!  While the service and food were both great, I feel the price was slightly too high. In my opinion, burgers should just come with a side of fries automatically.  Great restaurant that's definitely worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Wacs and thyme fries -delicious!

7WOxVW-0OJ9ythBS50hwOg.text: This is probably some of the best tofu I have had with the biggest portion size for only $10. The food was incredible and tasted so good. The place had a great atmosphere and I loved the employee that took my order. She was super helpful and was really experience which made it easy. The people in the place were all happy and made it fun. The place was really cool and unique. Overall, amazing place 10/10!

8FB2YbyyX1v0Naj0d1Fjpg.text: See check in for review. Highly recommend this place. Parking sucks but that's the only downfall.

a83qxMxFqkQQi7Ch3vrEzg.text: I can't say enough about this place. Even my husband who's not vegan can't believe how good the food is. We love the big wac burger-I have no idea how the chef does it, but it tastes pretty close to an actual Big Mac! The drinks they serve are delicious, and we always love getting cookie dough to go. Thanks for making AWESOME vegan food!! Please please open one up in Mesa or Gilbert, you'd get a lot of customers here. Just not much vegan options for us in the east valley

7TyNGc-6cnRpyIS21MjLOw.text: Facts  Food: delicious  Variety: amazing Quantity: good Drinks: refills on green tea, strawberry lemonade, regular lemonade, this burgundy drink that tastes delicious, and bottled selection (no refills). Restaurant: clean, cute, cozy, very small Staff: friend Wait for food: fast, quick  Parking: a nightmare, the worst.   I ordered the chili cheese fries, special jalapeno and avocado big wac, samosa (4), curry chic bowl and that yummiest burgundy drink. I think it was called nectar.   I would like to see other mock meat options besides soy.. I'm a vegan and a cancer survivor who do not eat soy due to the cancer soy estrogen risk.   Yummy additions: Portobello mushroom burger. Non soy veggie patty  This is a safe serve restaurant.  Stand in line. Give them your order. Pay. And u will receive a  number standy to place on your table. They will bring your good.  They will also remove the dishes from your table when done.  My rating Food Taste, quality & quanity: 5 stars Parking: 1 star Food selection: 4 stars (would like to see more non soy selections)  I would return.

_eLz0sgc4B1o2OpXE5_oiQ.text: This is a restaurant for anyone who thinks that vegetarian food can never be as good as its non plant-based counterparts. If you are on a quest for delicious vegetarian comfort food, you'll definitely want to try Green. (AND they're kid-approved!) They've got a fridge full of yummy Kombucha, an Ice Cube-adorned drink machine and vegetarian hot wings that will make you forget that you're not eating meat. The fried Brussels sprouts are amazing, I have to have them every time I go to Green. Their staff is always so cheerful and nice. You can also hop right next door to their vegan dessert-y counterpart, Nami, for yummy cookies, ice cream and other sweet treats.

Xutz4x3EwRjpWt2IS2Chwg.text: I am not a vegan whatsoever but food is really good. I got the Big Wac and animal fries, I don't know how they do it but it tasted exactly like a Big Mac and animal fries if not better than the original. Tried the buffalo wings and they were good as well. Price wasn't bad considering how good the food was. Place is nice with plenty of seating and drink options including alcohol. Only negative is there is not much parking. Will definitely be back.

Jh7ufn3M09NgZHoeKKMJfg.text: The Scottsdale Rd. location is my favorite restaurant and the first place I stop whenever I return to Phoenix. The Big WAC is out of this world amazing. Actually, everything on the menu is fabulous and sure to delight your senses. On the weekends, this place gets packed and the line goes out the door. I'm the only vegan in my group but the food here is so good, I can bring the meat eaters and they enjoy it too. I'm a Green lifer

fLd8ol-tm0994ujutLkeyw.text: The food is delicious but there is one major problem with it, you wait for it A LOT, and it comes to your table COLD. Very disappointing. I really wanted to like this place because there are not many choices for vegetarians.

C6jFtn0ME3DxqZReSl48Ig.text: Wow. What awful service! Ordered three meals for three different people on the same order and the first meal came out, followed five minutes later by the second, followed five minutes later by the third. The first meal (rice bowl) was cold by the time the last meal (avocado wrap) came out. Both were okay, not great. And the second meal (burger with coleslaw as a side)? Burger was garbage and tasted like i was being punished for ordering a veggie burger in a vegan restaurant, while the coleslaw was good, but probably only because of the overwhelming sweetness of its sauce. There was no apology or acknowledgement of the huge gap in time between meals, and to make matters worse, the waitress opens the garage door that serves as the front of the building and forced people to put their jackets back on as they were blasted with cold air. Why would you open the whole restaurant to the outside on December 28?To distract us from the cold food on our plates with the cold wind from outside? My coworker said, "I like the atmosphere in Green's Tempe location much better." Although she was referring to the murals and decor, she could just as easily have been referring to the climate, because unless it's got a cold arctic wind blowing in from the north, it couldn't be worse.

JeXSzpzE1l_WJ09R2w-v9Q.text: The food was great. Service was TERRIBLE!!! I ordered online and waited 45 mins when I got there and it still wasn't done. The girl at the front said she would call my name when it was ready and that wasn't done either I had to continuously go to the counter and check. Don't go if you're on a time crunch. There is absolutely no sense of urgency AT ALL.

osL7vJxtf5xkYAutrQIMPQ.text: This place has amazing vegan food BUT this location is always a bad experience. The parking lot is AWFUL. There is not enough spaces to accommodate the massive crowd that is always there. I've had many near accidents in the parking lot, there are hardly any spaces available, and the layout is awful. If you can take an Lyft I would recommend it. Also, prepare yourself for a large crowd stuffed into a tiny space. After a few bad experiences here I choose to go to the Scottsdale Rd location even though the 7th street location is much closer to home. The owners should really consider expanding this locations facilities. I know I'd go a lot more often if it was a better experience.

W8Gclx8mxjkOPjixqpZzWw.text: Wow--this place was a super find! The Big Wac is outta sight! The BFF was yummy & the special of the day, a giant burrito filled with everything but the kitchen sink, was delicious! Oh how I wish there were one in Texas!

We ordered the Buffalo Wings, a "Burger" and the Karma Curry. All of these were great, we were impressed and we will be back to try more! nL0x_HZGhN7WBAxk1ubuKw.text: Really great vegan food here! I had the "big wac" which is a superb double decker v. burger.  We also had a tasty "chicken" sandwich. Staff are also super friendly and helpful.  I will totally come back for more on our next trip to Phoenix. That burger was one of the best vegan burgers ever! Highly recommend!

KeS60DwXxq3eGxnpneup_g.text: I love this place. The food is great and the staff rocks. I went in to redeem an e-gift card and the place was busy and I got pretty flustered, so I paid with my card. Today I went to use try the card again and for some reason it said I had redeemed it already. The manager listened to my story and gave me a 50 dollar card with no problem. This is why I frequent this place.

m1pV3DnA7q0uMej3K2pL4w.text: There's not much more to be said about Green, but I wanted to make this my 100th review because I'm a sap like that. Green (and chef Damon) has revolutionized the greater Phoenix vegan community. Sure, there are healthier dining options, better parking and better service at other vegan places in town now, but without Green's leadership, it might have never been possible. It's too crowded? Hooray! More people not eating meat! It's too expensive? They actually pay employees a decent wage, and use unique ingredients that make our bellies happy (usually). It is hands down always my top recommendation when people as "where can I get vegan food?" or when someone comes to town who might be so inclined.   Rather than going into menu items, I'll give a hat tip to the regular specials. By far the one that makes me say "Let's go now" is the Grinder. I'm not a huge mock lunch meat fan, but the way the Grinder comes together with oil, pepperoncini, and mock salami-like meats and cheese is cosmic. Other favorites are the street tacos, anything with beans (which is my only real Green complaint - give me some beans on the menu, Damon!), or almost anything with hot dogs (but the recent hot dog stuffed pepper was a step too far for us). We recently had the bangers and mash special - a very fun vegan treat!  In short - Green is a Phoenix treasure and I hope it survives and thrives for decades to come!

_Ff740gvzXy4dwPrNYWLRg.text: Adorable interior! I grew up as a vegetarian and I remember when imitation meat was absolutely disgusting. Things have changed! The Big Wac is delicious!

PwyJ5vhNeRrafejaPf8_Sw.text: Vegan goodies bomb!! Such a cool Vibe inside. Save seats or order first as place gets pretty packed. We came on lunch time and had to leave since in a hurry for a tournament because of packed line. We came back the day after and glad we did!! Food was great in flavor, packed in goodness earthy vegan ingredients indeed. We had the vegan peanut bowl, a great substitute for Thai flavor. The Brussels were fried just right and great tasting. Don't expect humungous portion in their somosas and crab puffs but at least they make up for taste. Animal fries was worth the guilt. When you're in downtown Phoenix, it's a couple of blocks but great vegan options indeed. Must come back again to try more.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Luv it
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No eating animals!!
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside vibe

FGjtGN3gXqkbQ30gpw1mUw.text: Loved the Animal Fries! I would go as far as to say it's better than the real thing, by a lot!  As for the Big Wac, I didn't really see what all the fuss was about.  I will be back for those fries! Perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Big Wac.
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Animal Fries, divine - a must have!

2WtKf3FiZW93ySx_U70VoQ.text: Oh wow what an eye-opening restaurant! I'm usually a meat lover when it comes to food but this place has completely fooled me! I could live off of this food please expand to California!

LrGNihexiN84TH7naljLug.text: Currently waiting here for my to go order because This place was that good! I had to get more food to try at home. I tried the no egg roll , buffalo wings, artichoke burrito, and the hummus! Everything was amazing. Can't wait to try what I got for take out once I'm not full anymore lol I will definitely be back!  The only con would be parking which is easily over looked.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AwOPV2jbdMV14XsGeUu9LA.text: Love that there is a vegan place in Tempe! It is pretty simple decoration inside, but they do have a good selection of food. They have bowls and burgers and some sides like fries. We had the coconut curry  bowl and the Chinese ginger flavored one. I like the curry one, curry taste was mild. And someone was very hungry and got another "Big Mac", it was too salty. The bun looks sad, but tasted good. And they do have some beer and wine selection. When bf asked the counter boy for recommendation what's good. He mumbled and then he said he doesn't drink. Bf said that he hadn't been drinking for a long time. The boy said 'why start now?' Wow!! That clicked! Bf realized that he shouldn't drink under his condition now, and decided to keep record clean. Thank you so much for helping save him from falling!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dragon bowl

7CMiDBBVGiK7EWlxkb2kFw.text: Okay so while this was one of the very first Vegan Restaurants the wife and I visited when we moved to AZ...I have to admit I wasn't impressed. Even when our cousin came to visit just a couple of years ago...I was just like...okay it is better than I thought. Now with all of that being said, I have 3 recommendations for food choices if you decide to visit this establishment.  The Buffalo Wings The Wendy's Pickle (might be the best chicken sandwich in AZ) The Big Wac (think McDonald's but better of course)  All missing is the IMPOSSIBLE Burger here but maybe one day they will get it. Eat, Drink, and be Merry, my Friends!!!!!

cmXlJQeb_9ioHxG9yQgfNw.text: Wowed to the Max! Those chili cheese fries were epic. The spinach dip was danky. I felt it had a hint of mojo de ajo and I love garlic. The po boy was good but not as traditional as the vegan version I had in Nola. Definitely spent the night in Phoenix so I could eat here the following morning and it was soooooo worth it

wHJHH3kZ-REwWzvpN29LrQ.text: The food was great! I got the Wendys Pickle Burger and the boyfriend got the Big Wac Burger. Only downside was the very small "parking lot"

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ghSNML2fk-oote94HTBHnA.text: I got the cookies and cream vanilla ice cream. It was really good. They put it in a small cup but it was a lot. I couldn't finish it. They came out really quick. By the time we sat down they already called our name.

8wQ7WgqC--YzO_rOHLqpIw.text: I decided to give this location a try after having many things I didn't enjoy at the other location.  I got the loaded fries. They were extremely soggy, mushy, and absolutely dripping with grease. Their fries are normally decent, but these were not good.   It is a consistent issue I have at both locations that their food is overly greasy. The only thing I've ever enjoyed is the Thai salad, but the chicken on top makes the greens wilt and get greasy. Over the years, this has been my consistent review, yet I keep going back hoping it will get better.

S5f1fa6NXFcj7-1SXQNiOA.text: I ate here once when I was in Phoenix for a Lana Del Rey concert and it rocked as hard as she did!! I had the vegan big mac and it was SOOOOOO good! I was recently in Sedona and was bounded and determined to stop here and eat on the way back to L.A.... only to find out they are closed on Sundays! Nooooooo!!!!! That made my taste buds very very sad. )-:

KXjG3tSAFeCL7lGhMPumFw.text: 5 stars! I love this place. The soynamis are excellent. The chicken nuggets are the best!!!

-XpxxgQjYhDmXl-IpuzH7Q.text: Don't call in your order expecting for this to make the process faster. You still have to wait in the very long line when you walk in to pick up.

jbNFkB_PdvsGKL7EBc45-Q.text: Trying to eat better and a good friend told me about this place. An amazing way to ease into eating vegetarian, many of the meals have imitation meats made with vegetables.

NS5M0aMD53GbCObUFtntmg.text: First time trying this place and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. I'm not vegan but I like trying new places and a friend suggested this place. I had the Drunken Mongolian with monk beef and it was full of flavor and the portion was perfect. Also had their strawberry shake which was delicious and a great way to end my meal. It doesn't hurt that the staff was very friendly and helpful in making suggestions. It's not very close to where I live but I'm sure I'll make it back there.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Drunken Mongolian... very tasty :)

kpNkRHy_jBusleDTeLuBlg.text: I am not a vegetarian but my cousin is so I took her here. I was a little hesitant at first but the food here is delicious! I got the BFF, which was messy but delicious, and she got a rice bowl which was also amazing. Cute little place that has a hippie chic feel to it!

fC2fVJywNwqya9Gn7_w9Eg.text: Delicious... I really love their wings, chicken nugs, cheesesteak, fries and their peanut chicken as a burrito does not disappoint. Try their bowls as well those are so darn good. This placs is LEGIT!!!!

cXPGSagtmsri2Fr9Ir1H2Q.text: I am two months in being vegetarian and have been struggling a little with the transition. Most places I have encounter that are full vegetarian have a lot lacking in flavor and texture. However, this place nails both!!!!! There is so much flavor, and a million things to choose from! They have awesome teas and lemonades, plus a wide variety of adult beverages. The staff is super welcoming and even at their busiest are still super friendly. The prices are very reasonable and you feel full after the meal. My husband was skeptical (as he is still a meat and potatoes guy) but came with me to support me. The chili cheese fries and Big WAC won him over to come here with me. I can't rave enough about this place! Vegan done the way all vegan should be done! I can't wait to come back!

h-kgFrg3lqksLHBy2GntYg.text: I had the coconut curry. Although it was tasty I just didn't get the coconut. Where was it? I wanted chunks of fresh coconut. Still. Very good. Casual atmosphere. Too many soy dishes. For those of us who stay away from soy meat alternatives are just not here.

lH6XHD7QOstwLLDVfKrw2g.text: The staff was super friendly, very cute decor and friendly environment. We ordered the animal fries and they were blegh... too greasy and the potatoes seemed to be the frozen kind. The "chikin wings" we're some weird nugget looking things in some kind of chili sauce and they were toooo salty. However, their Philly cheesesteak sandwhich was DELICIOUS.

hg12gSu-XZZNASHD3D2bpg.text: Let me say my peace to the Mock BBQ Chicken:  What yum wizardry was this? Medallions of mock chicken stuff so superly slathered in delicious espresso BBQ sauce. Accompanied, of course, by flourishings of sauteed onion slices and red pepper magic.   Face, marauded with tasty sauce. Mouth, accosted with the deep and boisterous flavors, the tantalizing textures of this feast.  And the side, the joy of the coleslaw? The cold crunching cabbage of fine and seasoned tahini company? Scrumptious with honors.   The lost tummies of yore are gnashing their teethy parts, they're wailing and weeping at the heavens for not having been born in times as these; these moments where one could get the secret BBQ chicken sandwich at Green. Oh, dear eater, hast thou had such an explosive endeavor upon your tasty tongue buds? Have you dined upon such sorcery as is this so noble of sandwiches?   I say nay, I say too that you must. These are the songs of my taste buds and to these songs you should harken and heed. Have.... the Secret BBQ chicken sandwich  The sweet limeade is yumy too!

i-aqcgYqYtO9eGGRg3levw.text: This place has been on my 'to try' list for a long time, but a little part of me always pushed off going here. This changed the other day when hanging with my buddy Dave H. We went here at lunch time. You walk up to the counter, order, and sit down to wait for food delivery. We ordered the hummus, the samosas, and the coconut curry bowl with the house tofu. We quickly had the hummus delivered and then.... crab puffs? Woops. Well, we had discussed the crabpuffs, so we figured they just put in the wrong order. That was ok, we were happy to try them. The crab puffs were good... I don't like regular crab puffs, but the veg version was fairly tasty, creamy, and crispy on the outside. The hummus was very good, a little spicy, but overall tasty... now, it was no Pita Jungle hummus... definitely not at the same caliber, but it was good. I liked the crispy pita chips, but I think it might be better with just normal pita. Anyway, I guess they realized they brought out the wrong item (crab puffs) and they brought us the samosas... woohoo! The samosas were by far the best item I tried there. They were cinnamon -y and delicious... crispy with a wonderful filling. I would come back here just for the samosas...yum. The curry bowl was also good, but I wish it had more sauce.... it wasn't the most flavorful food I've ever had, especially for a curry. I would want to try it again to see if maybe it was just lacking sauce on the day we were there. I will definitely be back here!  PS the decor here is beautiful, very clean and modern.  PPS the prices are affordable- less than 10$ per person

oZoycc2Airv8WDbwzOrKXg.text: I love Green.  I love every thing about it. Especially the fact that I can order anything I want and not have to worry about ingredients. The meatball sub is bomb, the bowls are bomb, the limeade is bomb...  But the Wac burger...the Wac is the best thing I've put in my mouth since the pad thai at Loving Hut. OH MY STARS!  pair the Wac with the thyme fries and you have complete perfection. The people running the place are super nice, and this location even serves wine and beer.  The restaurant itself is very nice inside-sort of casual elegant.  I would highly recommend it for date night if it weren't so hard to hear your companion when inside.  They have a tiny back patio, and a larger front patio-so if you can score one of those tables-you'll really enjoy your meal.  They have a companion vegan bakery next door and that's where you get the soynamis instead of at Green--go next door too!  It should be 5 stars but it did take quite a while to get our meal, and it's really hard to hear inside.  Food is 5 stars though-NO QUESTION.

FyVwwAhpL7BzNtArMHeAnQ.text: Impressive! Loved the Cheesesteak, Thai Peanut Bowl, Crab Puffs, Egglessrolls, and Chili Fries. Even got some to go to eat in the hotel room. Seriously, everything tasted great, had perfect texture, and even some spicy kicks here and there. Can't say enough good things about the food.

vhf3akpC5k4BS_GP-Sbt9g.text: After an MRI and some great drugs My girlfriend  thought this would be the best time to persuade me into some Vegan food, not gonna lie though, that BBBQ Bacon burger was on point and the crab puffs were bangin too! Tip: Always get the house sauce, it's crazy good!

1pSHR_eGa3OMA5gw7QLaaw.text: The first few times I tried this place, I would've given it 4 stars. However, the saltiness aspect makes me detract a star. I love their faux chicken (seitan? Soy?) and I usually get the original g spicy po-boy sandwich with the thyme fries (that don't taste like thyme but are still yummy). Big WAC and the BBQ sandwich are both winners. I stay away from the bowls, the food always seems to get cold quickly. I like their samosas and chicken wings as well. Please cut back on the salt, people! As much as I love savory foods, it's really too much. Otherwise, service is always top notch and the place is always busy. Parking can be an issue at times.

u4ZLSDr7lN77YuETSDgHYA.text: The house special tofu is amazing! The kung pao noodles is good, get it with the house special tofu! You won't be disappointed! I've also had the po'boy sandwich which was pretty good too. The fries are amazing here. I would recommend this place to vegetarians and anyone who wants to dine healthier :)

UBdBvyG66JjCUhWN72oMWw.text: I ordered their thai peanut bowl with noodle and house tofu. Tofu to me doesn't taste like tofu and I've had many tofu being that my mom cook vegetarian dish a lot. The house tofu seem like fake tofu is that's a good description. The brocoli was not cook fully and hard to chew.  Overall, it's a small place at 7th street/mcdowell so parking is small but the service was very good. A good place to hang out. maybe next time I'll try something else.

qhQ-Gll8ZdB7T07cuNn61Q.text: Green is a place that satisfies my cravings for comfort food made a little differently.  I first came here with a group of ladies who were mostly, if not all, vegans or vegetarians. I wasn't one of them, but that didn't stop me from ordering a pasta bowl with a meatless add on. It was heavenly. The taste is simple yet more than enough, and the variety in the menu is plain fun to look through! For not being a vegetarian, I come here a lot more than I should.  It might seem that it mostly appeals to young crowds who look for different and conscious approaches to their food, but anyone can try it and fall in love with it like I did. It's well-made food that delivers and makes you feel good while eating it.  Parking is a bit of a challenge if you have a large car because it's quite narrow, but spaces are usually open when it's not busy.   The decor is clean and minimalist; you can't help but fall in love with that Ice-T ice machine, pun intended.   All in all, if you feel pretty cool for coming to place like this, embrace it. It's a rad and one-of-a-kind place to eat at.

GWb_VHIsfqUGh3gQRLxG9w.text: When I worked in the area I would occasionally go here for lunch.Although I do eat some vegetarian foods, have not objection to a non-vegetarian meal and was a little leary the first time I went. But for realz. Shout out to the Black Jack Pita. It's super delicious and the texture is just amazing (something that can be a fatal downfall of vegetarian foods).  One of my other favorite foods is the hummus. I like to order it and put it in my tummus....  Anyway... If you have that one vegetarian person in the office let them have this one, it won't kill you eating one meat free lunch and it is not bad food. Just don't let them pick all the time, after all, we can't let the minority over step their bounds....

F3hXWnYLRGxkFXBDgW2I6Q.text: Great gem in Arizona!!  Their po'boy sandwiches were delicious and a great value for the price!  I was in AZ for 9 days and ate here twice!! So good!! If you love American comfort food this is the place to go!  This place is 100% vegan.

D-bxvPPVtOM2dJRTIINWPQ.text: most of the things I have had here have  been decent.  Not mind blowing.  Nice to have this around as an option though.  Don't have the macn cheese but the fries, bowls and burgers are good

5VRC1KnSEA-sORy3TQBX8w.text: Went here for the first time with my boyfriend and brother. To start off the parking was extremely limited. Next to impossible to find a spot between the two combined  parking spots. Go inside it was sangria day so of course I got that, I was good but not spectacular, couple dollars over priced. The food was good. My brother hated his salad but he ate all the other 5 appetizers we got to try and was well satisfied afterwards. No server came to our table, not sure if they were supposed to hit we went up to order and the woman said oh I'll tell her to come to you, so we went and sat back down and about 5 minutes she took our order, food came out in a timely manner, but after that the server was MIA.

7BTt-UnW_D0UCwQFYRzong.text: DUH. THIS PLACE IS THE BEST. It is so nice not to have to drive to Tempe for my favorite menu.  The decor is simple and clean, the staff is adorable and sweet. My favorite items from the menu? 1. No Harm Chicken Parm 2. Tahini Coleslaw 3. Orecciette pasta  4. The secret bbq chicken sandwich 5. Homemade curry pasta salad 6. Balsamic picnic salad  Leave room for a Tsoynami. Just walk next door to NAMI and wait to be amazed. This place smells like sugar and coffee heaven.

ojvIyfeh3K9DomZLjO_Tfw.text: Let me just preface by saying I am not a vegan. Actually, I am the opposite of a vegan and indulge in red meat pretty frequently. However, a good vegan friend of mine wanted to try this place out and I am so glad I did! We went on a Wednesday afternoon and it was packed. The parking situation is not favorable, so try and carpool if you can. Luckily, we ordered and were able to snag  a table at the front. I had the Thai Peanut Bowl with mock chicken and it was surprisingly, really good! It was loaded with fresh veggies and the perfect amount of sauce. The only aspect I found lacking was. . .salt. I'm not sure if I am desensitized by the morbid amount of soy sauce I consume at home - I most likely am. Don't get me wrong, the meal was amazing but I think a dash or two of salt would have made this meal perfect. The mock chicken was also surprisingly yummy. It had the consistency of a frozen chicken nugget (odd) but the flavor was spot on. I would definitely visit again! I am dying to try the Big Wac.

B7T2-3TeEsWpB_IymABTSQ.text: I was actually pretty disappointed in Green. This was my first experience at Green and as a vegan, I don't think I'd bring a non-vegan here hoping that they'd think vegan food was super tasty.    My (non-vegan) friend and I both thought our sandwiches were over-sauced and he actually couldn't even finish his. I will say the texture of the mock chicken was good...but, again, the sauce (mine was BBQ) was way to overpowering.   I guess if you're vegan and are craving something meat-like, this would be the place to go.    I might go back to try a non-sandwich menu item...  Also, it would have been nice had the waitress not taken my half-eaten meal off our table when I got up to refresh my drink.  While it wasn't the best lunch ever, it was still my lunch and I would have liked to have finished it.

5VggcQ1-5CDrMFb3WXPGtg.text: If you have a hankering for pure vegetarian food in Phoenix, then this is probably the default restaurant.  We are all veg in our house, and my son's a picky eater and also a homebody, but he loves to come have their veggie burger and fries.  While I can't name all the dishes I've had there, I can certainly vouch for the BBQ chicken sandwich and burger, and I've only had one dish there that didn't excite me, but that's a pretty good track record considering the number of times we've eaten here.    Love the atmosphere here and enjoy occasionally sitting with people we don't know at the bigger tables.  As others have said, there is very little parking.  We've always been lucky and found a space, but if you can bike here, then I highly recommend doing so (so there is more parking for me).

e1nBGy323KGflZAansmOxQ.text: indifferent service, mediocre food and way to salty, wont be back

eNNK4qJ1ngZQJs9QsBeQlw.text: As a frequent vegan restaurant goer that hates most faux meat/cheeses, I was AMAZED that Phoenix had this great of a vegan restaurant.  I ate there every day for the week or so while I was in Phoenix.  They have plenty of gluten free options, including alcohols, and the prices are very reasonable for the quality, taste, and service.  I can't recommend any particular dish because everything was amazing.

lFNoEo9DoRuwtBr8B-QFNw.text: I was in Phoenix for a brief and very busy business trip and only had one evening to try Green New American Vegetarian.  I'm glad I found time for it.  I ordered the small ranchero salad (which was substantial enough to have been my entire meal) and the special, which was a sandwich of tempura cauliflower with melted cheddar, pickled beets and a spicy sauce (I don't remember what it was).  I took the components off of hte bun becuase the salad was filling me up, but was very pleased with the dish.  If I lived in Phoenix, it would be very difficult for me not to get that salad every single day.  It was delicious, hearty and perfectly dressed.  The service was quick and pleasant and the space is welcoming.  Check it out!  I know I'll be back next time I'm in Phoenix.

JWBIn3m7YX_gmaJAw9NZSg.text: The staff is wonderful, and I love the secret BBQ sandwich with french fries. many non-veg eaters will enjoy this spot.

HNpRZjDjj9JVK92D-TjVYw.text: Our very favorite restaurant in PHX and I am not even vegetarian!  We had the vegan breakfast of sausage and gravy and wow- amazing!

mp7FNyv221_vwUWlTpf2Fg.text: I typically love the food here, it's innovative, healthy, and a delicious way to introduce vegan cuisine to the general public. I typically also love the staff, friendly, cordial, and seem to fit with the vision of this organization. Today was an exception. I ordered a to go order and arrived promptly. I could see my order sitting on the shelf. A petite nose ringed gal was taken an order to someone. Usually I am acknowledged at very least upon entrance, however nose ring girl was deeply entranced in conversation with the man making an order. While I understand the need for deeper connections between people in a fast paced world, I was in a hurry and starving. I was not even noticed and stood there for about ten minutes waiting for them to be done. She did a good job of explaining the menu but body language and gesture certainly gave light to a clear flirtation. Apparently his name is Dante, not Donte. I took off my sunglasses in hope eye contact would evoke some sort of recognition as I stared longingly at my food. I'm pretty sure she could not have bent over further to see down her tank top, shameless. I get it, young and beautiful abound this place, freedom to communicate and be loose is all good. This is a business as well and I wonder if this conduct of greens operating model. Ok I'm a little dramatic, but the bottom line is my food was cold, my sandwich was congealed and fallen apart, my salad wilted with cold mock chicken. So I just want to thank nose ring girl, my green perception is altered. Thank you to all the other staff who are friendly and a sheer delight, but ms nose ring girl, speaking from experience, being of service to ALL customers is a typical principle in food service. 1 star, not for green, 1 star for nose ring girl who clearly has an affection for up and coming hipster boys clearly I'll accustomed to female attention. Peace.

hwUUjQHTiBnsSUI7O1OJIA.text: Love it. Best vegan selection in town. Meat eaters will not be disappointed, though they should considering coming over to the good side of life. :)

ex4wwoZ29RmPENNwe7zYgw.text: i always chuckle when people say vegetarian food is boring. next time you hear that, send them here. then pat yourself on the back because this place is awesome.

tfJQekHGa8oct8vNq4e9yw.text: Almost every time we come into Phoenix from my home up north, we stop at Green. It's hard to go from the quick, tasty grease of traditional American carnivore meals to vegetarian. Green makes it a little easier :). The Big Wac is amazing, tastes better than a Big Mac and I have convinced a lot of carnivores to go try it. A few decided to go full vegetarian after knowing they could still get flavorful, comfortable tastes without having to settle on just rabbit food or squishy tofu. There are a few thing that didn't tickle my taste buds (the kids mac&cheese, tahini coleslaw and crab puff dipping sauce). But everything else I have really enjoyed. LOVE the Spicy Peanut Tofu as does my tofu-hating brother, which is saying a lot. The No-Harm Chicken Parm is the best and the Original "G" and BBQ Chicken/Portabello Mushroom Sandwiches are incredibly tasty. I like to ask for extra thyme for my fries because yes, depending on the kitchen, I have noticed it can get be a little skimpy :/. Overall, if you're in the area and willing to try something different, try Green.

pMWL52e97g5xCpHC-crl2A.text: This place is awesome, and I'm not even a vegetarian!  First points go to the ambiance... the place has kind of a cool "green" feel to it, but is also very modern and open.  The garage door in front opens during nice weather, and the place is very airy.  Second points go to the food.  I really have no idea what I'm eating, but I've been a few times and haven't been disappointed.  Service/staff is pretty good, they definitely fit the theme of the place.  Minus one point for having an awesome staircase that leads to nothing but an office... and a tiny bit of a point for recommending "Nami," the place next door that I think they own.  It's a vegan bakery that is overpriced with so-so taste.

I7d4n2nsWSMztVPALI4yvg.text: If I were to quote my friend Saul "Its vegetarian junk food, what's not to like..."  I like the 7th Street location better than the one in Tempe with one notable exception, there are no soft drinks. I get it, Coke isn't vegetarian in nature, but I am not a vegetarian, so let's work something out here.  The art is way lower key at this location, which is nice. The Tempe location's art is almost distracting from the food.   The chicken wings are great. The meatball sandwich leaves something to be desired.   I dig it. Glad its close to down town now.

LLZ_m3il9xMjGBGgQTkZow.text: I am a vegetarian who is also allergic to dairy.  If you have an allergy, you understand how annoying it is to go out to eat places.  With Green, I don't have to worry about this.  The best part is, the food is amazing!!! I literally crave this place at least 4 times a week.  If you go, you must try the fake chx - I think I am addicted. I should honestly go to FCAA (Fake Chx Addiction Anonymous).  Don't forget to top the meal off with a tSoynami - absolutely TO DIE FOR!  Thank you Damon for creating such amazing food.  One complaint... BE OPEN ON SUNDAYS :D

yKCea1SOR4Q_O3s5nasq9Q.text: Love green, delicious food... whats more to say... could eat here everyday if I had the funds... big wac yumm!

DLrDQZNKtHuzWnH2kFcEJw.text: I'd never been to Green before, went with a friend on a Monday night, the place was hoppin', the food was amazing (though I recognize the trick of providing a huge bowl to make the portion size look bigger than it really is, but that's a logistics issue and doesn't detract too much from the overall experience) the service was pleasant and efficient, and I can't wait to go back and try everything else on the menu.  I had the thai peanut bowl w/ sprouted tofu for my first outing, and I was not unhappy about it AT ALL.  Good stuff.

ZMHUsfUOx8nM_G-ABdcfYw.text: Heaven for Vegans! very popular place so unless you go on a very off time plan to spend anywhere from 10-25 minutes in line. Once you order it's hit or miss if you'll get a table there or need to take it to go so just be cautious if the space :)   Amazing food. Soynamis are a fantastic alternative to a blizzard. They even have wine and beer options. 10/10 would recommend!!

C2N72RDb3mJJwf2nJEXxnQ.text: Recently came in for a small meal to conduct a class project. I came in with no expectations (since I am not vegan) and had my stereotypical doubts. OMG was I totally wrong. Green is absolutely delicious!! I tried their Chili Cheese Fries and you would never even guess they're vegan! My friend got their Boneless Buffalo Wings and they were great! I would totally come back. Service was extremely fast and the ambience was super chill.  Only knock I have is the limited parking and the confusing line/waiting area. Also, the menu is not on the wall, but physical handouts you have to look at in line. I wish instead of alcohol they had some food items on the chalkboard. Consumer Behavior theories would back my ideas ;)   Either way this is such a great place for a great price!! Love that they also have the Nami across the way for dessert. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili Cheese Fries and Buffalo Wings. SUPER GOOD!

40rIh8FIoGZZ12d4KUGOMg.text: Amazing food, really it was better than I'd thought plant based could be. Had the Big Wac and the 'cheesesteak' sandwich and was really pleased with both. Great drink selection too. Sangria was on point!   Coulda done without the pentagrams and Satan themed art on the walls, not sure why that was necessary. The clientele seems like a combination of people who appreciate that kinda art and the afterparty from an REI garage sale, but the food was fantastic.  Also, get the Animal Fries! Probably tastier than in and out.

KS81zeBruBkh9lYXxLGL9Q.text: Love this place!!!!! My favorite is the Ranchero Wrap & animal fries. Only con is the parking is very limited & the employees aren't friendly most the time. Sad because I really thought it would be a cool welcoming atmosphere....  But as long as you sit outside or just as far away from the counter where people order food ( it gets really crowded & employees are constantly trying to get through to deliver food)  you should have a nice visit.

1CVIzmemNCaFDAcjD2Xo4A.text: I love this place so much!!!!   Animal fries are just fantastic and the burritos are just the best

iIDrzuScToOiDWxwArFNWw.text: Well, I love this place let's just start there shall we? I'm so glad I found Green New shortly after moving to AZ because it is certainly full of options. We started with the buffalo wings, not my fave (it's a texture thing) but my gf loved it. The samosas were a bit greasy for my liking but the Big Wac made up for that! Man, that is a good sandwich. Back in the day when I ate meat and loved Mcdonalds that was my jam and now here we are in veggie land just as dee-lish! I come here just for this sandwich. Staff is always helpful and friendly and I love going next door for vegan desserts after. Love this place.

J85xya0kJWS_nvf72PnRpA.text: Hands down my most favorite restaurant in town! It doesn't matter if you're a vegetarian or not. Shits delish!

sbQgvAB3lvFbrkGOYuEXmw.text: Love this place and always have to visit when in the area. Would probably be dangerous if I lived closer.

WnrCR5AE6zSvRoL1vaf-Ug.text: MY TAKEAWAY: Great food. Will hit the spot. Cheaper than most vegan establishments in NY and namely Brooklyn that I've frequented. The service leaves a lot to be desired. I would gladly be willing to pay more for a better customer service and overall end-user experience. Going out to eat or grabbing a bite outside of your home is more than just about getting good food, it's the totality of the experience. From how you order, the staff, speed, food quality and consistency, atmosphere, etc. This place is great already, as-is; however, if they want to take things to even bigger heights, they may want to revisit the way you order and/or the staff's ability to offer better customer service. Everything else is perfect. Maybe it's just the New Yorker in me, that has come to expect more. Food-wise this place even beats some of the best places to eat at in Brooklyn, NY. Yes, even those classified as some of the best Vegan establishments. I will be coming back. How often? Well, that is yet to be determined. If my customer service experience changes in future visits, which would make this place an easy 5 stars, I will be sure to update my review. This place is nearly perfect! Green, the first vegan restaurant I've visited since moving to Phoenix, AZ. There is a decent selection of vegan establishments to choose from, yet I choose this place to try first. Mainly because before moving to Phoenix I was doing some research and came across this YouTube video featuring this establishment and it's next door bakery Nami. (link - youtube.com/watch?v=y5Cw...) After seeing the passion behind the brand and mouth-watering food, I had to try it for myself, once I completed my move to Phoenix. I've frequented this location on two occasions, once on a weekday and once on a weekend to get a better feel of the place. First visit, a weekday: The service leaves a lot to be desired. You go up to the counter and order then have a sit and they bring you your food. The customer service and/or the end-user experience isn't the best, however, you don't go to a place like this for its service. I'm well aware of that; however, it would have made my experience that much better and truth be told the amount of times that I would frequent this place would have been a multiple of what it is or would be now. The food matched my expectations and slightly surpassed them. The BIG WAC, boy, oh, boy! Excellent. Filling, tasty and utterly satisfying. My burger fix, as a vegan, has been fulfilled in the most pleasant of ways. Their wings are also amazing. I tried them on this visit. Second visit, a weekend day: Service slightly worse than my weekday experience. There was a line to order unlike my first visit, but no worries because the line moved fast. The staff was very efficient in managing the high traffic. I'll give them that. Overall, customer service was a little worse than my earlier visit. Food was great again. I'm liking the overall consistency from my only two visits thus far, food wise. I ordered the BIG WAC again, fantastic. That has been my experience. You should try it for yourself. It's more than worth it. I hope this added value to someone out there. Happy Yelping :)

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ?

Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The glorious, glorious Big Wac. 10/10. Doesn&#39;t get much better than this for Vegans in the need for a burger fix. Well done, Green!

55nY2mfL67aCCn8CCsVBHA.text: Sadly this restaurant quality of food is terrible.. always burnt frys  and the customer service is terrible.. when are they going to produce good quality food.. we found hairs in our food .. this is not a place I would recommend for vegan food

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FtYdlYKgTfsj9AVJrtlYwg.text: Good food, but soooo unhealthy. I can't eat here anymore, because it hurts my stomach. They also raised their prices a while back and it isn't really worth it.

oz4kefqybGeorrD7snT_3w.text: Went here with a colleague off of the recommendation of the concierge at my hotel. I wasn't expecting much honestly, but was very surprised by the experience. I ordered the Big Wac burger and thyme fries and fell in love immediately. It was literally the vegan version of the old school (circa 1979-1982) Big Mac sandwich from McDonalds (back when McDonalds used actual beef and not "meat product". My colleague had a salad that he was very pleased with, and we shared the eggless spring rolls which were also amazing. I recommend this place to anyone looking for great vegan food in a relaxed/chill and casual environment. Unfortunately the place closes at 9pm so if you're going to go, go early.

0MohB80z-j_MlsQSH34gWw.text: I love this restaurant! The food is amazing, I ordered the OG spicy hand held, chili cheese fries and the buffalo wings. Each dish was prepared nicely and served warm. The best part about Green New American Vegetarian is the "going green" atmosphere which is influential.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious!

O5-DW3rjXNOuD6Si9vzN0A.text: First time we had great service, all in a creative and fun setting, along with good vegan food! The soynami is great too! We got the buffalo wings, animal fries, the bff and the classic burger. Second time around the food wasn't as enjoyable and didn't taste as fresh, also service was not friendly. Will mention the first time we went was the one in Phoenix, second time in Tempe. Go to Phoenix location!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

onAc6Ghh2zBaH0vR3SM-Hg.text: You ever read A Clean, Well-lighted Place? Well this is a clean, well-lighted place and I'm like the suicidal old man, but goddamn, the food here makes me grateful to be alive and have a mouth that can taste such delicious shit. Seriously, can't say enough. Just fucking go there.

HKYcz4LWr4F5leIi-wXHSQ.text: One of my favorite finds in Phoenix/Scottsdale. I've had several items and have seen a lot of consistency.  Lots of flavor, easy on the greasy, and the food is filling.  I would have given 5 stars but both restaurants could do better cleaning.  Sitting at sticky & broken tables with left over food from previous guests isn't appealing.  Great place for a casual lunch to catch up with friends.

3K0KLS7HHssNLKt0V0J8MA.text: Delicious vegan food. This is more of a vegan comfort/fast food type of joint which is harder to find than healthier vegan food. Done very well!  The wings were FANTASTIC. Po' boy was excellent. Crab puffs were pretty good - definitely unique - I've never had a vegan version.   Reasonable prices. Friendly and quick service.  I liked the atmosphere inside. I got my food to go but I noticed their craft beer selection and was impressed. Cocktails and wine available too.  Parking lot is a bit small so might get packed during lunch time.

agJfRQNP0SZpmKIyG8s9ZQ.text: Surpassed all expectations. I had the big WAC and my jaw dropped as soon as I bit into it. Tasted just like a Big Mac from McDonald's. I also had the chicken wings appetizer which was incredibly tasty as well. I'm already planning a return to this place again cuz they have so many other tantalizing items on their menu.

cqyGJ8an8eGal_OkGYlRiA.text: Everything on the menu is excellent! The burgers are our favorites, but the salads and rice dishes are tasty, too. Great beer and wine selection, and their gigantic sangria is very good.

3ARNEI9F5QSZORMiRpsWVQ.text: I think the concept of this place is really nice. There is only one vegan based restaurant in Cincinnati, so it's pleasant to find a place that only serves vegan food.  The inside is really nice and they honestly have a lot of seating. When you initially see the place, it looks really small but you will be surprised once you go in. You can sit outside, front or back.  It can become crowded when trying to order food because the counter is pretty large and takes up space, but that's a small complaint.  I ordered the Wendy's pickle burger and thyme fries the first day and the second day I ordered the Brussel sprout salad with the buffalo wings.  I thought the burger was pretty good - I'm not a fan of a lot of fried food because of the grease. The burger was a tad bit greasy and I would hope that they would drain it a bit more. The fries were okay. I'm not sure if I was supposed to taste the thyme or not.  I would probably not get the Brussel sprout salad again. The Brussel sprouts were fried and I did not like that. Maybe I'm old fashioned but I like my greens to stay green  the Brussel sprouts were waaayyy to greasy. I bit into it and oil came out - I think roasted Brussel sprouts would be better.  The buffalo wings were pretty good and the dressing for the salad was pretty tasty. Overall I think the place is nice and the food is pretty decent. I'm not a fan of fried food but I got it anyways in hopes that they did it different because it was vegan and hopefully healthier but that was not the case. I think others might like this which is why I didn't rate the restaurant bad because it's more of a preference rather than a standard.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Buffalo wings
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. In house drinks
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad with fried Brussels sprouts

OIKSX5TEDbf7RxR_JK93tQ.text: Disclaimer: I am an avid meat eater who is in no way veggie forward. I can count the number of vegan/vegetarian specific meals I've had on one hand.   I came with a group of friends who love Green and have been raving about it for years, literally years. So I finally caved and decided to give the place a shot. I tried the chicken sandwich with avocado, chili fries with cheese, hot wings and the eggless egg rolls.  The restaurant was busy but not "impossible to find seating," level of busy. Though parking was definitely tricky. We sat and the egg rolls and chili fries quickly arrived. The egg rolls are fantastic and the chili fries are definitely something I will get again, as a person who doesn't enjoy ground meat I liked that chili better than ordinary chili.  Then my friends big wac, my other friend's curry and my chicken sandwich all arrived. No mention of my boyfriend's dish or the hot wings. But we couldn't wait and dug in. One friend loved the thousand island that came with the big wac but wasnt a huge fan of the burger itself. The curry was fantastic with fried tofu. And my sandwich left me a bit confused. It had the initial feel of chicken and definitely the look but was very bland. Next time I'll stick to a more veggie solid meal rather than a meat substitute.   My boyfriend's meal and the wings didn't arrive until after everyone was finished. Thankfully there was just enough room in our stomachs to give the wings a try and they were fantastic as well.   In all I would suggest this place if you're feeling a salad dish or appetizers as that's where the taste really shinned for myself. I wish the service had been a bit better, or if they had communicated a bit more. And I would have appreciated salt or hot sauce on the table to umph the taste of my sandwich a bit, but their fries are delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili cheese fries.
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two orders of eggless eggrolls
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken sandwich

mz6ml9rO_jIWDydSuLNS2A.text: I love Green! I have enjoyed everything I've tried so far, especially their wings and samosas. Also the Big Wac and Po Boy. My partner got the Sesame Dragon rice bowl once and what I sampled of it was phenomenal.   My only gripe would be that the fried brussels should be served on a plate/larger bowl and they should all be cut in half and then roasted (got both and the full size brussels are just hard to eat)  Also that the "thyme fries" do not have any visible thyme and if the flavor is there it is a bit more subtle than I would hope for. I also tend to prefer a thicker fry, but they are a decent fry nonetheless.  Love the 'Ice Cube' machine  and the Electric Nectar juice! Can't wait to go back and try out happy hour and some of the other menu items!  My advice is to save a little room for their tSoynami ice cream at Nami's next door!

p_AMxiFnksZk8ccyvYEVEA.text: I am SO glad we found this place as we transitioned to a gluten free, vegan lifestyle. It's such a relief to be able to order (almost) anything we want. The clearly labeled menu with marked allergens helps quite a bit.   The food is wonderful EVERY time we go in. The store is very modern and cute and there is always such a fun group Of people in there eating and working. We never feel out of place.   The only "complaint" would be that the parking lot and seating areas are almost too small to hold the demand of people that this place takes on, especially on the weekends. It's sometimes hard to find somewhere to sit and the line sometimes goes out the door (obviously because it's so amazing) so that can be a bit of an annoyance when you are trying to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wIVbxp1zTzNb6QtSYtD6Fw.text: Green New American was one of my fave spots when I visited PHX two years ago, however, I was a little disappointed after visiting a couple of weeks ago.   The bf and I both ordered bowls, I had the sesame dragon bowl with house tofu and the bf ordered the Singapore orange bowl with their mock chicken. We also ordered the spicy buffalo wings as an app. The bowls had absolutely zero flavor. I tried a bite of my bfs and he tried mine as well, and both were just "meh". And the veggies weren't quite cooked, but weren't raw either. Just not impressed. The lemonade was extremely sweet as well and made it difficult to swallow. I did enjoy the buffalo wings, and the sauce and ranch were on point, so props to you guys!   So I guess I am now 50/50 with this place, but I'm sure I'll be back the next time I'm in town, I'll just skip the bowls.

mCdrdIh6kAbAW_dzdYps_A.text: Was visiting in Phoenix and we stopped on impulse. This place hit the spot if you're a veggie and missing so many of the fast food/burger joint favorites. The four stars is because my sandwich was extremely dry, mostly breading and bread (see photo but easily solved though by getting more condiments). Liked that they have adult beverage options!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wings, cheese fries, and chicken sandwich.

zHfdToP71oEQew8qM_wFbA.text: Long narrow restaurant with seating in front (busy street side) and behind on quiet back deck. We chose the back deck on this night to enjoy our meal. Right decision.   Here's the low-down on our order: Chili ~ nice bite to it  Thai Peanut Bowl ~ light on sauce, spicy and tasty Chicago Cheesesteak ~ enjoyable BFF ~ good but the cheese was not, disappointedly, the melty type  Brussel Sprouts - delicious, overly-roasted and crispy  The portion sizes were adequate and filling but not huge.   3 Suggestions if you come here: 1- Definitely order the Brussel sprouts. 2- Sit on the back deck (if weather permits) 3- Enjoy the libations, as they have a nice selection.

t9h224pEsCo2SIIliibssg.text: This place has so much potential to be amazing , but it's awkward the way the line is set up. It runs along diners tables which causes you to literally stand over them as they are eating their meal. As a person who suffers from severe anxiety this makes it really difficult. I didn't actually get to eat here bc there was only one cashier at the time and I had already waited about 10 mins just to order. I had seen some of the dishes come out and they didn't look too appetizing so I ended up leaving. Kinda sucks bc I wanted to give them a try but the overall experience was a turn off.

5WOd5Sw3kCfucJccyXKxRA.text: I ordered their famous "wings" and they were delicious! I also ordered the pickled sandwich- I devoured it before getting a good picture! The service was great, the food was delicious and the seating was well designed with a choice of inside or out. This was my first time buying vegetarian food and I will be back! Again, let me emphasize- the wings are so worth it! Oh another awesome factor or the five stars- the price point is definitely affordable! Oh the drinks are good and refreshing.

vbDgCfNxIKfvk4Yzyzg10w.text: We had tried green new American when we 1st moved to Phoenix. We went to the Tempe location, and while the food was fairly good... it was a little too salty for us. Because of that we hadn't been back.  We were surely missing out for the last few years! A friend from out of town was visiting in really wanted to dine here. Super glad that we did because we have put green new American  on our rotation of restaurants.  We have the Buffalo wings, West Coast fries, Thai peanut rice bowl, peanut chicken burrito, And the karma curry rice bowl. Everything was so delicious! We will definitely be back for more!

i5Du34WFkYoc04XCyaibBQ.text: I am now a regular here. I have had differing opinions of this place over the last few years with the change of menu and having stopped trying to eat wheat free. Now I am just trying to be vegan, and this place keeps me on track. This Wisconsin girl loves cheese, and the west coast fries satisfy my craving. I recommend getting the big wac or classic burger and using some of the cheese from your fries on your burger. So good! The staff is always great! The fresh bevvies are delicious amd made with organic cane sugar too. The crab puffs are cravable! The bff is great, but I like the burgers even better. I love you, Green! Recommendations: crab puffs, the earthling (it's a special), the west coast fries, And the cheesesteak. I LOVE this place. I am now a committed vegan thanks to Green.

MZo56c031wYtqLT802s4Dw.text: Holy crap.. Let me tell you.. I am beyoooonnnddd IN LOVE with this place right here, amd now I have hooked every non vegan friend and family member I have in AZ on this fabulous restaurant, even friends that have visited from UT! You can't go wrong with ANYTHING on the menu!! Trust me. Granted, it's not the healthiest vegan restaurant, but when you crave a big mac and you're vegan THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO!!   I die for The BFF, made with fresh jalapenos, cheddar, avocado and ranch drizzled. Yum!! Or the famous Big Wac that has even my Utah friends craving to eat it again. The Wendys pickle tastes just like a Wendys chicken sandwich, crazy! They nailed it here. Now if you guys could make a vegan chickfilet sandwich pretty please you guys elses be straight murdering it in the vegan food game!!

odn7ySyZxa8tvbVRM6vbDw.text: Wonderful vegan food at a great price. I am new to the vegan thing and, if nobody told me that these items were totally vegan, I would never know. It truly is fantastic. We got the Big Wac, Buffalo wings, enchilada fries, po boy, and a grilled chicken. They were all fantastic.

Xlzcov9144yeFMbSK5mlOA.text: I ate here twice and will be going back tomorrow. Great selection and great choice of "meats". I had the Chicago sausage special sandwich and then the Wendy's pickle sandwich and both were great

NAnFMG0dJhYoHlsziyvcTA.text: I flew into Phoenix for the day and knew I had to come visit one of my old favorite places, this location and the Tempe one are really good! The only downside is the small parking area.. but overall great place, I stopped by around noon and it was busy for lunch time. I was able to get my food in a timely manner though and it looked delicious, I enjoyed every bite! Thank you again for a wonderful experience

Thank you Green for being amazing and everyone that works there is always so friendly and helpful!!
