qI0JE6tZZdYAg9wRQ6OjqQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here twice for dinner on our trip to Phoenix! I decided to try the Spicy g po boy and OH MY LORD it is to die for. I had this each time I went and my bf is gluten free as well and they had a different bun option for him. I also had the drink that is called electric nectar and - I need the recipe!!!  it is soooo good! Both ladies that helped me were very nice and professional and it's a pretty welcoming environment. We will most definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is what I had left of my spicy g po boy before thinking about a pic! Lol YUM!!!

YWcTgwnzR20diqKGvlV_-g.text: I went for a late lunch with a friend and I was so glad I did. The place is small and I was lucky to get a parking spot. You stand in line to order and pay and then get a number to take to your table. I ordered the Thai Peanut Rice Bowl with Tofu. It was very flavorful and the vegetables nice and crisp the way I like. My friend bought a chocolate chip cookie afterwards and gave me a bite and it was delicious! I will definitely be returning here!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai Peanut Rice Bowl with Tofu

dWRIHC6svRCf4l6T0H61xw.text: I love to go to Green! They're a bit pricey, so It's not something I eat often, but it's a great treat for those times that I'm craving that comfort food that's harder to score as a vegan.   What's even greater about this place is that the food is SO good that even non-vegans eat there. My meat-eating husband often craves their buffalo "wings".   I highly recommend the buffalo wings or the Big Wac (which is Green's take on the McDonalds' Big Mac.   The people who work there are also great. They've always been very polite and the service is fairly quick and always friendly. I heard somewhere that the head chef and creator of the Green menu even won some culinary award. I'm not sure if that's True, but it wouldn't be hard to believe based on the taste!   If you're a vegan looking for some hard to find comfort food, or if you're a meat-eater looking to either dabble in the vegan cuisine or need to take a vegan friend or significant other to lunch, I HIGHLY recommend this place!

1uvQ3s7x7xPn1cE-4UHKyQ.text: Love this place, everything I've tried has been great, my favorite is the Big Wac with fries!  Vegan junk food at its best, but you don't have to go that route if you don't want to, you can go with healthy vegan, but why would you when you can get the big WAC?!?  They also have several craft beers, and a good selection of bottled soda.  Make sure to get dessert next door at Nami!

NrBtQzmNAQqjMS58AULUUA.text: This place is da bomb, and I love me some beef!! This time "Challenge Accepted" while visiting Phoenix! I got myself a Big Wac and washed it down w Mexican Coke!! Best Vegetarian Burger ever!! Better then San Diego (Home Town)! If I had the Big Wac in Sunny SD there be no more In N Out for me. Lol :) But I dont, so I have to settle for Beef Burgers. :(  Excellent Service at this place too!! Get the Big Wac next time you passing by!!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious Big Wac Burger!! Da Bomb!!

GhgVJRuNwdWKDYqcy0Hqww.text: Based off of the reviews we were anxious to try this place out. We just recently ordered their "ThanksLiving" holiday meal, which was good. My review about the food is like everyone else overall. We were most disappointed in the service. I can always appreciate when an explanation is given to a first timer, who doesn't know how they run the restaurant. None was given, fine. So we leave a tab open after ordering apps because we wanted to eat as we went and didn't know what to expect for four people. You basically have to expect a do-it-yourself type service. The two front of house people were rude and short with us. The blonde female seemed as if she was having a terrible day and it rubbed off on the rest of the staff. I asked where I could park my grandpa's walker and I suggested an empty corner and she said no, that I should keep it at the table. That has never happened. We asked for side plates and got rolled eyes. The poor service alone definitely discourages us ever returning.

abOkIWETWADpltUvLC9Y0g.text: 50 minute wait for food, no apology or acknowledgement. Served 6 people before me who came in after me. Food wasn't very warm. Heard complaints from other customers waiting over 40 mins for one burger. This is very good vegan food, but nothing is worth the wait and treatment. Please Green, GET IT TOGETHER!

uhkQ8MgenChpouieDOD7Tg.text: Absolutely love the buffalo wings here! They are a must! Love the big mac its sooooo good! Ordered the curry bowl also and we had so much food that we had to save it and finish the rest of it for the next day, but it was awesome because we wanted to go back for more buffalo wings and realized that they wouldn't be open till later on and our plane was leaving. If your a vegetarian or vegan or even a meat eater.. I promise this place will not disappoint! Its mad awesome delicious!

J-ysKlSMWf44OxyrjVE-aQ.text: I am shocked and amazed at how delicious our food was, since going vegan the only meat I have missed WAS chicken wings, not anymore, the "chicken" wings at Green are every bit as tasty if not tastier and certainly greener and happier than real chicken wings! Pure heaven!  I also enjoyed the chili and my husband loved his sandwich.  We will be returning, frequently.  We also stopped into the vegan ice cream store next door and it was also outstanding, what a great addition to this community!  service was also well above average, I am talking about outstanding, I had a ton of questions and she gladly answered them all.

T0ZkSHDgx_TxxjOfCu-9Uw.text: Green, I'm so glad you've opened up a midtown location.   In college, when I lived in Tempe, I'd frequent green very regularly. After I graduated and moved downtown, I'd drive myself over to the Scottsdale Rd. location as often as possible for the sweet and sour bowl, the smores tsoynami, and whatever yummy baked goods were fresh that day.   So here's the scoop, for all of you soon-to-be enthusiasts.   Green serves 100% vegan food. That means no dairy, eggs, gelatin, etc. However, their food isn't 'healthy'. That's not a dig-they do casual, 'comfort'-style vegan food that you'd be hard-pressed to distinguish as being vegan.  With mac and cheese, burgers, rice/noodle bowls, salads, buffalo wings, etc, green has a little something for just about any craving.   After your meal, go next door to their joint dessert/coffee bar and snag yourself a tsoynami. Just. Do. It.   The (few) downsides-  They changed their menu a few months ago, and I was pretty bummed-some of the items that I loved and ordered regularly throughout the years were replaced. I was kind of disappointed when they first rolled out some of the new items, but it's definitely gotten MUCH better/consistent.   I've gone with a few non-vegan/vegetarian friends, and while all of them have been pleasantly surprised with the food they've ordered, sometimes the staff hasn't been too keen on explaining things, making substitutions, etc. That's kind of a bummer. I feel like it's improved, though, and the Phoenix location feels less hipstery-'cliquey' than the green I first encountered five or six years ago.   It's downtown. Parking is limited and tight. Carpool!

_ar7MGuw1_QEiNGjbLjw3g.text: I'm a big fan of the crab puffs and big wac here. The staff is great and the food is always on point. The food comes out pretty quickly as well which is another plus. I still to have yet tried a lot of things but everything that I've tried has been awesome. The artichoke chicken salad is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big WAC

Wk3k9MNIAVudupLLs1lIPQ.text: I'm not a vegetarian but I loved this joint. Great food, good portions, good beer. Nuff said.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ sandwich
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Wac....mmmn

td0QrJFKVtl70IuCeCI2_Q.text: We have come here twice and each time is was delicious!! We have only come during Sunday Brunch, but we look forward to coming during the week to checkout their other menu items.

LZ0tdlisEOgGs3untWCmjg.text: This was my first visit to this Green location - I love the Tempe location but decided to try something different yesterday.  Green is located next to Nami in what looks like a tiny vegan complex. I love how cute and cozy Green was! The ice cube machine made me laugh too. Service was friendly, food was good as always. I was happy that they had the same menu as the Tempe location so I was able to get my usual - the calexico burger with thyme fries and buffalo "wings." Yum!   I'll be back to try their brunch!

MTx9iRGAI7KV7Rn_xrHdbw.text: Awesome!!!! Great vegan comfort food love the big wac better then a Big Mac. Everything I have tried is amazing. Big fan of the animal fries and the green lime tea. It's a great place.. their mock meats are really good. I have not had anything I don't like. I wish their were more places like this around the valley. I also love their sister Nami the dessert place next door. Really great place a little expensive but worth it especially if your eating a plant based diet but crave a Big Mac....

HAyCEur2Zcpwa12YzSp5rw.text: I have this friend who loves meat.  I mean LOVES meat.  I convince her to meet me here for a meal and being the brave soul she is she gives it a try.  Now I've been here before and I know the food here is good but she's a skeptic.  She orders a burger and fries and the look on her face when she took that first bite said it all.  She was blown away how good vegetarian food can taste.  If you like good food don't let the vegetarian scare you away.  Every item I've tried on the menu is amazing.

AKJUoJCD0GKs-LL7G0l6cg.text: Absolutely impeccable food. Vegan is the way to go. Green really allows new vegans to experiment with something incredibly realistic and delicious. Not to mention their dessert spot is to die for, but not literally because no animals had to die for it to be THIS GOOD!!!!!

3tK9H_Boa3jy3JLz1-nmqQ.text: The best vegetarian food in Phoenix. Mock jerk chicken to die for, save room for desert at soynami next door

_MdYSIU8f7cfTd3bjq6pBA.text: OH MY GOD!    The BIG WAC is amazing. I had the Big Wac and the animal fries, and seriously, I was in heaven. If you told me i was eating a real Big Mac, I would believe you. I would never know it's not meat. This place needs to be all over America, save the animals. No need to eat meat when there is food like this that is healthier and more compassionate. I see fast food Green American everywhere.  Save the planet.  Forget meat, eat here!  You'll live longer.  I'll be back Green New American!  I swear, you are my new best friend.

tbKNNKPRH0d7jypRihi0Vw.text: True carnivore leaving a review here. This place is awesome! Great atmosphere, wonderful staff, and delicious, delicious, meat-free food. I had thee argentine po boy and I wasn't disappointed. The umami taste had me doing a double take and the warm, soft roll that completed my sandwich only blew my mind some more. I'll definitely be back for more of this meat-free deliciousness!

QcjmzLJ6ryxbVOn4y2R8SQ.text: Great food and a vibrant environment. The menu has a lot of good options, you would want to try all of them. The meat imitations are delicious, vegetarians can get a taste of how it feels to eat meat without actually eating one. The flavors are amazing and original. Loved my experience and will surely visit again :)

LkJ_F3RWyFDqupYIhuZGww.text: Vegan restaurant jackpot!  Wings and fried Brussel Sprouts are so delicious

BAIRI42d7iodgVYV7KZJAw.text: 100% vegan, 90% awesome.    I've been to Green several times is the last few months, as I've traveled to and through Phoenix, and I have really liked everything... except that I wish they went easier with the salt on some of the dishes.  Maybe Green thinks non-vegans will find vegan food more flavorful with lots of salt, and of course salt does magnify flavors, but they just use too much of it.  It's the burgers especially that I feel are too salty (I've had the Calexico burger and the BBBQ bacon burger).  Tip: you get a choice of 4 fake meats in the bowls, and of the 2 I've tried (mock chicken and house tofu), the house tofu was the star.  Nice flavor (just a tad too salty) and chew.  Also, the tahini coleslaw that comes with the burgers is excellent.

apUCYTV6C8SLIgFgDdH_VA.text: So so great! For appetizers, we tried the chili cheese fries (they were alright, used Daiya for the cheese, and I was hoping it would've been a homemade cheese sauce), and the crab puffs. Wow, those crab puffs were amazing! Since being vegan, I have missed having crab rangoons/crab cheese wontons at restaurants, and these tasted just like the real thing!! I had the thai peanut rice bowl, which was great (huge serving too, especially after all the appetizers, so I had leftovers!) and hubby loved the bbq sammie. Just when you think it can't get any more awesome, theres the Tsoynamis! Holy moly!!!!! These are like mcflurries/blizzards but with vegan soft-serve and all of your favorite goodies incorporated in. Some of the best dessert I've ever had!!

EK8hFCXwU4_og3ElQxQDaw.text: Yay I love this place. Are you a vegan or vegetarian and miss American classics? I typically don't, but on that off chance you miss a burger and animal style fries... You found your place. I kept feeling nervous and asking if it was actually vegan. They also have that more traditional "vegan" food... You know the delicious tofu bowls and stuff so you really gave options. Side note, they actually have beers on tap and house sangrias that are fantastic AND if you save room Nami is 20ft away and you can get down on a Sounamu for dessert.

QiC6WSAedc35fJ_IED2PFg.text: Went here last night with three friends. Two had been here before, me and the other had not. Person number 1 ordered chili cheese fries. Person number 2 ordered a po boy. I ordered buffalo wings and crab puffs and person number 4 ordered the chicken parm sandwich. All food was enjoyed and it was all vegan meaning no dairy and no meat. But it tasted really good. One would never guess that it was all vegan. One of my favorite things there is the delicious juices they have... there was a berry one that was very good. Want to try the desert place next door.

HT3hLyp4lKfxwzXmTkJXrw.text: Loved the atmosphere and service we received at this restaurant. Loved everything about it- the wings are delicious and everything is vegan. I will be back and recommend it to everyone

fLab90ohQMMnqgcZvzajsg.text: I flippin' love this place. Tasty tasty food.  I do hate that I have to order at a counter, and I hate that it's so damn loud in the restaurant, and I hate the parking.  But the food makes up for everything else. I love Green!

d8oO9ZRVM0evv91YGrko0w.text: Fkn delish!  This place never disappoints!  I've been here twice so far (two different visits to PHX) and always have to come here.  Their Big Wac is outta this world!  The fake fish sandwich is solid!  Were my family willing to live in an oven, we'd relocate to Arizona and eat here everyday!

SRW-Vhpn5EEFCFoANcb3sw.text: We arrived shortly after 8:30pm to realized they closed at 9:00.  No worries as they were quick to say, "Come on in!"  Prior to our arrival we didn't know if Green was a sit-down or counter service.  Upon entering we found that it would be a counter service experience.  Nice and laid back. I immediately loved the flow of the restaurant with the painted wooden tables along with tree stumps for some of the seats.  Patio dining is available but the far end also has a see-through garage door that can be opened up for open air dining too.  Quick examination of the menu had me wanting everything.  It's so nice not to have to decipher which items are vegan and which ones aren't.  I settled on the Mexicali Burger.  However, when I went to order I noticed the special...."The Big Wac".  What?!  This is what everyone has been talking about in the Green Facebook Group. You see, The Big Wac is basically the vegan version of the Big Mac.  It's not always available and absolutely everyone was raving about it.  I made the quick switch, ordered the Big Wac with fries and my husband ordered the Kung Pao bowl.  Did the Big Wac live up to the rave reviews? Yes, and more! Although I admit I was never a huge burger person even prior to going veg this may be one of the best burgers I've had in my life.  Seriously.  My husband's meal was also tasty but after a nibble of my burger he immediately wished he had gone for the Big Wac too. Partnered with the yummy thin fries I had the perfect meal.  I can't wait to return to have another fantastic meal!

Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Wac

zdCGn0RFlYLM8uFCjWf0TQ.text: The Ranchero salad and eggless rolls are phenomenal. Great staff, great environment, great food.

t76PStdDU2VpXWATUEP6Kg.text: My sister and I went here while I was visiting her from Palm Springs and wanted to try the vegan options they had here. Surprisingly there is quite a bit and this has gotta be one of my favorites of all time! The jerk salad was sooo good and I still crave it! The big wac was scarily similar to the real thing too. w0TeQ9b0e2PUG0AzkVh5Ig.text: Delicious buffalo wings and house tofu with veggie and rice (does not matter what kind of sauce/style you get).

CHoLBcqayoFEyJnGk1tx0Q.text: Guys. This is great vegetarian food. I am not a vegetarian, and I loved every bite of my Asian noodle bowl with tofu. My husband got the big wac, I took a bite and it was delicious. Basically it's good vegetarian food and if you have friends that are on a pretty restricted diet (like mine are), this is a fun place to take them because they don't have to scour a menu for the only salad in town - they can eat it all. Plus the ice machine had iced T on it. What could be better?  Next time we plan on checking out Nami for their awesome soy dessert. Woo!

SBkhQjF6AkXidUmkani8UQ.text: This is a wonderful eatery. We drive by a host of vegan friendly dining on 7th St. North of McDowell Rd weekly. If you enjoy fresh, appetizing and healthy food don't miss an opportunity to dine at this hipster and down to earth eatery.  As we dined there were beautiful people everywhere. (Lunch time) The food is more of an incentive. We had the vegan mexicali burger (delicious), fries (nothing to write home about) and refreshing refillable Berry lemonade. (Four different flavors).  Total bill was $11.50 plus tip  Mikey he likes it!

huxtjyGAfaxmts9pxsYNIQ.text: Really good meatless chicken. It tastes just like chicken. I'm not a vegetarian or vegan but I still really enjoy this place. The thyme fries are awesome, and the bowls are always good too. Service is always friendly and quick. Everything is very affordable. A lot of vegetarian food is really expensive, but here you can have a good lunch for about $10 or less. Only downside, parking is a pain, it always has been. But it actually really improved from how it used to be at that's a wrap.

riuLX28pLiRtNXY8qW1aQA.text: Never disappointed. The buffalo "wings" and fried brussels sprouts are awesome! Good, fast service.

0uV3yl_EAfTWs6m5kYrimw.text: Not Vegan? Hey neither am I! However, if all Vegan food tasted like this I would never eat meat again! I got a Big Wac based on reviews, fries, side of ranch and a chocolate chip cookie. Tasted just like McDonald's minus the horrendous guilt and shame that follows about 2 minutes after you start eating. Ranch was very dill-y and garlic-y, which I loved. Cookie was crunchy on the outside and soft and gooey on the inside. Will be going back again soon!

3I2xZRwosvdqxjuQAOUXgA.text: I've been a patron of Green New for about 2 years now. I'm from Los Angeles, but have a ton of friends in Arizona and discovered this place via Yelp. On every visit I made it a point to stop at Green New. I moved here in November and have only been 3 times. My 2 visits were just as I remember it! Excellent on every level. This last visit - Not so much. My husband and I went in for a Big Wac. We were about to place our order when I looked down and noticed the menu's looked different. I inquired about them, and was told they had an updated menu with new items. We decided to take a quick look and apparently they downsized....and raised the prices. The Big Wac no longer comes with a side, but is now $8.95 for just the sandwich and all sides are additional. We wanted fries and those are now $3.75. Whatever. We knew it was going to be good and we drove 35 minutes for this specific meal, so we ordered. The woman with the red hair was very nice, took our order and gave us our water cups. The thin pale woman with the short dark hair looked as if she hated her job. No smile, no warmth, she appeared to be just miserable. Totally not the friendly faces I'm used to! Really weird to see because everyone has always been super cool! I even made friends with one of the manager ladies who always recognized us and knew about our treks back and forth from Los Angeles. Anyway, out came our food, served to us by the dark haired girl. She said "Enjoy" and took off. Eh, no matter, cause I'm about to get down on this Big Wac! So I took a bite and it was tasty as ever! Picked up a fry and that sucker was cold and hard. The portion was a handful and they were unseasoned! WTH?! What happened to the seasoning? So I asked my husband if he wanted a dipping sauce and he asked for a side of 1000. I get up and wait at the counter...and wait...and wait...and wait. These people have just taken my order and just served me my food, but I was forced to wait in line while other patrons ordered and all I needed was a side of 1000. And it's not like they didn't see me. The girl who served me my food was looking right at me while she was just stood around. By the time I was given my sauce my food was cold and my fries were stiffer then when they were served to me! NOT COOL!!  My Big Wac was just like I remembered it - DELICIOUS. The service, however, was not. Of course I'll go back because the food is tasty. I'll just need to prepare for the bad attitudes the next time I visit.

W9yLF6fm7G3W1awl8Ywhow.text: Every time my partner and I drive through Phoenix, we HAVE TO stop by Green New American for that Big WAC.  It's just phenomenal!  I wish I would try their other items, because if they're anything like that burger, I just might have to relocate to Phoenix!  (Okay,  kidding; I hate Arizona.  But that burger really does make drives from California to New Mexico and back so much more enjoyable.)

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Behold the Big WAC (and Luke)!

unc9n3SvcfnF-WFGLqFXMw.text: Causal and city wine cafe ambiance. The food isn't the healthiest, but is very good and all vegetarian. Living with 2 vegetarians, this is a great place to let them eat with their taste buds and not their brains.

YGD4p_6f71bLeRu0DikgiQ.text: Traveling through Phoenix as road warriors on a hot summer day we  found a place even Mad Max  would approve of. We had the Singapore Orange bowl, and Wendy's pickle for lunch and started it off with the buffalo wings with creamy cucumber ranch dressing. All were fantastic. The Singapore had an orange sauce on mock meat and I picked noodles that were cooked just right as was the veggies. Wendy's pickle was made with REALLY good bread, mock chicken and lots of pickles and came with thyme fries. All vegan but bring the meat eaters.                                                  Imperator Furiosa: You never gonna have a better chance. Max Rockatansky: At what? Imperator Furiosa: Redemption.

BbkFexsDyyi5sP3azCSo2g.text: Used to love this place. They recently changed menus and i went last week to try it and the service was horrible i waited an hour for my food to be ready and when i got it, not a single meal was correct and the lady up front was rude. Not returning however i do recommend nami right next door they sale their pastries there and they are amazing and very kind!!

Egl99sDt-7jzod_RhzJfnw.text: We're giving three stars overall based on: 1.) Quality of ingredients 2.) 100% Vegan (which is rare) 3.) Gluten-Free offerings 4.) The diversity of the menu, including baked goods and vegan "ice cream" treats 5.) Okay, and they also serve alcohol  We can't give more stars because they were not earned.  We'd LIKE to give this place more stars, but we're very discerning. We went twice this week--once at each location. At the Phoenix location my companion had a noodle bowl with tofu, and I had the gluten-free rice bowl with tofu. Each bowl comes with a choice of protein: tofu, mock chicken or mock beef. You're getting charged for it, so you might as well pick one. We shared an artichoke dip appetizer that is gluten-free.  At the Tempe/Scottsdale location we opted for the large size artichoke heart salad. We had to choose a protein (it comes with it) so we chose mock blackened chicken.  We'll start by saying the sauces were terrific (Mongolian and coconut curry). We both enjoyed our flavor choices at each location.  The artichoke dip appetizer was very tasty and we would recommend it.  The downside: Take a close look at the photos and you will see large chunks of carrot and zucchini. While  we normally like these vegetables (we should--we are 90% vegan in our household and have high standards for a diversity of vegetables and food preparation. We also manage food allergies), we did not care for the "bite". The vegetables are crisp, about half-cooked, which is usually okay but not in this dish. We are actually used to preparing our dishes with these raw (100% uncooked) because we grate them or spiralize them, but we prefer them fully cooked when they are in large chunks.  Experiment/Note: Try shaving vegetables, grating them, or spiralizing them vs. chopping them into large chunks. You will find that the flavor profile is way different. Especially with a red onion. Thinly sliced is heavenly, but grate them and you're in for a horrible bitter taste that can ruin a dish completely. Super large chunks of red onion in a salad? Unheard of. Yuck. Same goes for carrots and zucchini.   So, the texture and bite ratio of the dish fell short. The large chunks off-set the dish in a negative way. They overpower and it is unpleasant. At home we spiral cut everything, so the bite ratio is evenly dispersed and not overpowering when we're making it ourselves.  Spiral cutting also allows for a lightness to the dish and a fuller plate. We WISH SO BADLY that Green would do this! We get the feeling that vegetarian restaurants serve a bulk of carrot and zucchini to add volume to dishes at a lower cost, and we have the sneaking suspicion that vegetarians eat them this way because no other choices are offered. We take what we can get.  At the Tempe/Scottsdale location our salad (thankfully) lacked the monster carrot/zucchini overdrive. The "big" salad did not seem that much bigger than the "small" salad. We had a problem with the blackened mock chicken. First, it was overbearingly salty. Yikes. Second, it played havoc on our digestive system later. Apparently we cannot handle processed meat substitutes--but we understand that a lot of people *can*, so we're just putting this out there.  We are of the philosophy that more vegetables are key, rather than simply substituting meat. Normally we avoid all substitutions and go for an abundance of colors....avocado, very thinly sliced red cabbage, spiral-cut or grated carrots, cucumbers, zucchini, etc. This salad had none of that, other than a few tiny pieces of artichoke, which left us wondering, "Where's the artichoke?!" Also, the salad contained a lot of very salty, but otherwise pleasantly crunchy, gluten-free tortilla strips.  We get a sense that Green is for people who rely on substitutes, reminding us of "french fry" vegetarians. We'd like to see more TRULY GREEN/NUTRITIOUS/LOW SODIUM choices, with more colors. Truly. We mean, we really do. This place has so much potential and it falls short, which is sad because the two locations are surviving in a city where vegan/gluten-free/organic restaurants are hard to come by. Maybe we're going there because there aren't many places for us to go--but you can create more converts if the bites are better.  We want to go back, but we will be disappointed if we do. We'll go back a few times a year, probably, for that special sugar splurge, for sure. The people who work at both locations are cool and totally nice, and the service was good on both occasions.  This is a sad love letter to Green. We *want* to love you. And sometimes we take risks in love. So we are hoping you find it within you to take menu risks with more vegetables in smaller bites, more colors, and no substitutes because, frankly, we don't need them. Give us an abundance of clean eating with those marvelous dressings.  In short: Grate or spiralize your veggies, add MORE kinds of veggies, and cut waaaay back on the salt. Also, give us a protein free option. We will be loyal forever.

UTMSVoycaFZ4fjPn1QmAaQ.text: Mediocre "Vegan" food and service.  I'm better off at Whole Foods. My original post was removed anyways after I pointed out the braless rude cashier. Lemonade was extremely sweet, bbq mocked chicken burger was super greasy and it tasted like burnt salty bbq sauce. My Sister's salad was also super greasy and bland.

Y5PkLy0pXOf4tCxNgjJBGA.text: This place was delicious and the service was great. Got the big WAC. Amazing!!! Highly recommend getting the Sangria too. Crab wantons were bomb diggity.

lhWzxHRFRulIgeeDAKUpww.text: Amazing!!! One of the best vegan places ever! I had the Big Wack that was so much better than a Big Mac! Fresh and flavorful with a beautiful bunch of fries. The place is small and adorable. The staff are friendly, hard working and polite. Oh! And their bottled beverage selection is surprisingly kitschy. They serve local canned beer as well! I would recommend this place for a quick and quiet lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s the Big Wack!

MjU_Y61Urlc_-xN2VoeXkQ.text: This was my go to place to eat when I was in Phoenix. They have a great menu and everything is delicious! I loved the specials they had and the BBQ sandwich was the absolute best. Also, try the fries: you won't be disappointed.  Staff was also super friendly and helpful.

IE0Olxi09jb9P3k_adZ_DA.text: I have frequented both the Scottsdale road and Phoenix location. From my husband and I's first visit, we fell in love.   The Wings are incredible! Texture, flavor, everything! The portion is somewhat smaller than it was a few years ago, however.  I always get the Original G spicy po boy with fries. Its like a Hot N Spicy chicken, and it is delicious! I've had the other dishes as well (we are regulars) but this is my favorite. They always have fun specials, they post them on their website! The only issue is they don't always say how long they will have it :/   They serve a sunday brunch, which is awesome. Always something new. They have breakfast other days during the week on a regular menu basis.  Oh, and this is great for vegans, vegetarians, and omnivores alike.

dobsCGXDJE9xvfROq41VXA.text: Good if you want vegan food. Had The po boy sandwich that was pretty good. Couldn't even tell it wasn't real chicken. A little out of my way but might return if I decide to be vegan someday.

oHeajFIHEHbUV5FDie96DQ.text: pretty meh. on the way out of town, my friends and i came here to trick ourselves into feeling healthy. i think it's worth trying, but not remarkable in any way.  i got to try the coconut curry,  bbbq burger, thyme fries, crab puffs, and berry lemonade. the curry was super bland. i got it without a protein since i just and it was like something i'd make at home and eat begrudgingly. the bbbq burger was okay, and the fries sounded like they'd be really good, but were just pretty normal.  the crab puffs were the best! as good as everyone said. they were garlicky and hot and creamy. i was very surprised they were vegan. their drinks, berry lemonade, and limeade were both really really good and not too sweet. definitely get one if you're here.  the atmosphere was decent, cafe style with a few booths. the people working were nice enough, though i think the girl i got was new because i don't think she understood the menu exactly. this would be a cool option to try, but i probably wouldn't come back if i were back in the part of the world.

C4W0hSsnTbDu8khUGaGi5w.text: Yum! As a recent vegetarian, this has become a go to place for lunch. It is a funky little place with some interested artwork. Very cool atmosphere that reminds me of Santa Cruz,CA. Both indoor and outdoor seating. Order at the counter. Eat in or to-go. I have had the brussel sprout salad which is so tasty as well as in burrito form. I have not yet tried the veg meat offerings since I have an allergy to tofu/soy. I am excited to try some new things over the next few months!  So glad I found this funky little gem!

GaKUe-WXcUw3DXat4SOVLg.text: This restaurant is so nice and so edgy! My friend and I really enjoyed it! I got the drunken Mongolian with mock beef and fried noodles! Hole in the wall!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i0EPKCkkuKD9BXjGAbqemw.text: Good stuff!  Came here on the Fourth of July and had the special. Was a play on BBQ ribs but a sandwich. Surprisingly good!   I will return

5jDDsXsdOgF0sivx7H5maA.text: I'm not vegetarian. I love meat. Yet, this place is absolutely delicious. I've tried a few noodle and rice bowls, their Big WAC, and now the Argentinian Po'Boy. The "steak" is moist, flavorful and full of spices. I can't believe it's not meat. Their peanut cole slaw is my favorite side. So good!   The parking lot is small so good luck during the lunch and dinner rush... But I've never seen it so packed that I had to drive away. I personally love sitting on either the patio out front by the sidewalk or in the back under a tree. They have excellent service and even make an attempt to remember your name if you become a frequent customer.

mhvRT1IPnsO5KK9bNrobLg.text: Delicious food, interesting assortment, good booze, friendly staff, great atmosphere.  What I had was more comfort food than health food, though I'm sure it's easy to eat healthy here, too.

uJhkDXEeUzzOdtP--90ejA.text: This place is AMAZE-BALLS. It was my cousin's birthday and this is like the one vegan place in town so we decided to go. The food was delicious, especially the vegan buffalo wings! The only problem is that we went as a group and everyone got their food at really weird times. 3 of us were done eating before the others were even served. Besides that, it was great. Lovely concept and a fun, quirky store.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hummus and buffalo wings!

L6YR545-hAGEtw1Y5YsqZA.text: The hubs and I have been veggie for over a year but he continued to resist ordering from  Green...I have no idea why.... we shared the big wac, animal fries and egg rolls. Everything was great and the take out process was a breeze. We will be back!!!

JMJtUVCdzzoI0l5aXmWQMQ.text: I loved this vegan joint. They had a wide array of vegan sandwiches. I got the BBBQ sandwich which was amazing. Their juice bar is fantastic as well. My favorite was the black currant. Great friendly staff and great food. I also recommend going next door to get some tasty vegan ice cream!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A blurry shot of the juice bar and the &#34;Ice Cube&#34; machine. :)

udlbHB_jZTtGIA8PJDJVZQ.text: I usually go to the location off Scottsdale Rd so this was my first time trying the 7th St location. I used to go to this location when it was the former restaurant "It's A Wrap" back in the day and I love the remodel since Green moved in the space. Parking is always hard at this location so I had to park a few businesses away and walk over. I got there a little before noon and there was already quite the line. The line moved slower than it does in Scottsdale and I ordered my Spicy Thai Chicken Salad (my favorite) and ordered it to go incase I didn't have time to finish the entire salad during my lunch hour. I'm really glad I did because by the time I got in the door, stood in line and got my order I had 10 minutes to eat my lunch. I think next time I will call my order in ahead of time so the wait is a little less and I can eat my lunch with more time to spare.   Still very good, services was good and I will be back soon.

bH6KOgYcnGH40lDuxVAt1w.text: Phoenix is lucky to have this place!  Vegans rejoice as the food was amazing.  I had to go there twice on my visit.  For starters, the staff is very friendly and were happy to be there.  The drinks: Great selection with some organic choices like lime/lemonade.  I mixed it all up which tasted great.  I will say that trying each individually was nice too.  I love that they have green tea as one of the options.  I did not get anything from the fridge as they had sodas and other things there.  Nice.  The food: Fries were awesome considering they were thin cut which made them crispy throughout.  Not sure if they had another options, but we got the thyme fries.  I recommend it.  Sandwiches were bomb! Big Wac - Well, if you like the Big Mac when and if you ever ate meat, this is it without the guilt or blood.  Tasted awesome and I am surprised that this was vegan since the cheese was so cheesy.  Barbeque Chicken - A big sloppy in which you may need a knife and fork to eat.  Me and my friend split it, so we just cut it in half and it oozed with sauce.  Great sauce and great sandwich.  The extra sauce is a nice dipping item for the fries for sure.  Faux Lay Of Fish - Awesome!  Since I had a fish sandwich before while I was eating the last bite, I had to make sure it was not real fish.  My friend reassured me as she is a fish eater.  I on the other hand was surprised.  We had to get it again on our second visit.  The only thing is for those going there to try this, it is a seasonal item or special.  I hope they have it when you go!  Diablo Bowl - Not bad and had great seasoning.  We had a mix of both noodles and brown rice (friends wanted that as I only wanted noodles).  That probably didn't help the dish, but in the long run, the dish had a nice flavor.  Would try again if I am ever in the area after getting one of the above beforehand though.  We also went next door to try a cake.  Although their other stuff was pretty good based on some sampling, that cake was way too sweet.  It was my mini birthday cake though, so THANK YOU for putting that candle on it!  :)  Made me extra happy.

rfqz97bBl8xJCI00Zv7tpw.text: Vegans get a bad rap. People seem to think all we eat are sprouts and vegetables. We eats so much more and it is outright delicious! Green is the best example of vegan comfort food! They even serve beer!  Even if you are not vegan you totally have to try this place. Excellent food, friendly staff as well as a really enjoyable atmosphere. Try the por boy sandwiches as well as the great appetizers. The chicken wings are my favorite! You forget that they are not made out of real chicken. Love this place.

SO4OTHeO2XqbqSjrrTGpEg.text: I've never actually been here but at work we get take out from here all the time and it is incredibly delicious. It's so good and I can't believe it's vegetarian/vegan.

3k6F-RjxNX68PcT3fcnjMA.text: I truly hope this was a one time thing as Green has always been one of my favorite places.  The food was good, not sure how they get the mock chicken to have the look and texture of what I remembered the real thing to be like.  The service however was another thing.  We ordered two Wendy's pickle sandwiches and an order of fries.  The fries came out pretty quickly a good 5-10 minutes before our sandwiches.  When I could finally get one of the food runners attention I asked about the rest of the order as well as why did she bring out the fries so soon.  The response was "I know, we don't like it either but the kitchen just prepares the orders as they get the".  WTH?  I told her I ordered the sandwiches the same time as the fries, shouldn't they then come together?  Her response "sorry we have no control over the kitchen".  Again, WTH kind of answer or logic is that for any establishment?

YiDqD1tCXClanITS9nKN6g.text: Went in hungry to check out the Big Wac and left satisfied and happy. It wasn't very obvious that it was a vegan burger for anyone steered away by that fact, but  it was all delicious. It is quite a hefty portion, and a bit more than you would pay for it's meaty counterpart, but certainly worth it.

aH_RVnC3QLQNRd7PuUqXmA.text: All I can say is I'm very sad there is not one of these in the Bay Area . I may or may not have came here a couple times In a couple of days before I left back home . So amazing!!!

5jyBz8lGvWSky7d4MP6Nog.text: This is my second visit to Green.  The food is off the chain.  I love the decor!  Its framework is a garage.  This place is just as good as Red Bamboo (my fave vegan spot in NYC).  The first time I came to Green was in October.  I had the Spicy Buffalo Wings (they sure are spicy and SALTY!) and the Sweet and Sour bowl.  The bowl was very fresh, love the variety of veggies.  My friend had the Thai Peanut Bowl and loved it.  This time around I had the Secret BBQ Chicken Sandwich with the Thyme fries - amazing!  The Vimto is the TRUTH!  I seriously need to go back and try more things!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The one and only Michael Jordan!!!
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BXEXhCx4wLNfobnzHeen0w.text: I am so happy that Damon opened a second location in Phoenix.  The renovated building is beautiful and not stuffy at all, and I love the garage door that opens up. Very cool. The new restaurant is modern, simple and clean.  I love the decor and of course the delicious food. Healthy, cruelty-free and eco-conscious too!  It's one of the best vegan restaurants on planet earth. Okay..maybe the best one in Phoenix. Green Vegetarian is an excellent place for lunch and dinner. Without a doubt, If you are ready to become a vegetarian. This is an excellent place to start because the flavors are explosive!  I have tried pretty much everything in their menu because my friends and I frequent the one in Tempe.  However, it's too far from where we live, so we were delighted when the second location finally opened in Phoenix. I took a few pictures and posted them to show you what we ate this evening. Since I enjoyed the Singapore Tofu Noodles in Calgary today for lunch, I decided to try it again this evening in Phoenix.  My friend Boston ordered the Apricot Miso Bowl. He said it was sweet but delicious. I will be taking more pictures of course because I intend to eat here again and again.  The employees here are also very nice, polite and unobtrusive. I really love this eatery.  You don't have to be vegan of course to love this place. The dishes maybe vegetarian and vegan, but in no way restricted in its choices or flavor. Great place to get out of food rut and find your food groove!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan Buffalo Wings

m3uFlq-4NLiLt5_Ln5bbfw.text: This place saved my life while I was in Phoenix last weekend. It's hard being on vacation with people who are not Veggie or Vegan. I was able to escape twice and enjoy Green.  The Big WAC is a must try! And make sure you save room for dessert next door at Nami.

tMcUl-me21fQTiJoy5vzsQ.text: Great selection of items!!! The BBQ Sammie is beyond amazing! And there's so many tea choices.

QlofTTfgUnuPHICemVhmxg.text: Big wac, Big wac, Big wac. Just remember to say that to the person behind the counter and you will find yourself in a happy place.  This is a True vegan/vegetarian restaurant that caters to any sort of dietary restriction (except of course if you're a carnivore).   Most places are scared of not having a meat option on the menu, because they think it would drive away customers. Well this place is bustling most hours of the day, as is the companion dessert-shop Nami right next door. As with most places in this area it can be sometimes challenging to find a place to park, but if you're crafty it shouldn't be too hard.   You could also try the Calexico burger, that was tasty as well.  The staff are always cool here, if a bit hipster (hell, I suppose the whole place has that kind of vibe but it certainly feels less judgmental than say...Cartel Coffee).   I'll be a customer forev.

oTSE7HmEqHoUQuleGwHMEA.text: This is an amazing vegan restaurant! The menu is so creative (a Big Whak, with special sauce)! Can't wait to go back yet I hope the staff realizes what customer service is. I felt I was doing them a favor for being there. Also, we were there for almost 20 minutes and the staff didn't bother wiping down a spill at a nearby empty table the entire time. Granted, the place was busy yet I think wiping a spill doesn't require hours of time.

_THUcnGYXw60tCI3tnSC1g.text: A vegan place with familiar flavors; don't get me wrong, I love new and interesting cuisine I just think this place will make veganity (is that a word?) accessible to more people.  RECOMMENDATION: Try the crab puffs and the secret bbq chicken sandwich!

xys1KidP0Ixc2MbwJapQvg.text: I recently found out I'm allergic to dairy and eggs, so I was somewhat thrown into the vegan lifestyle. I had lost hope finding a restaurant where I can actually eat breakfast, but then I found this place! AMAZING! I had the biscuits and gravy with tofu scramble, and it was to die for! Come eat here...NOW!

VpdxI89td9WXeayRFff6LQ.text: I've heard a lot of hype about Green, and it's taken me years to finally get down there to try it out.  It's the kind of vegetarian restaurant that even a carnivore would enjoy. The menu is large and creative, and "meat-substitutes" like fake chicken and fake beef are available (I'll stick to tofu, thank you.)  I went with a friend and we both ordered bowls off their menu. I got the one with the mushrooms sauteed in sake (so good) with brown rice, veggies, and house made tofu. With a tip it was about $10, and I had leftovers.  Definitely will be going back there again.

wMiFigaO_FLatexvUYVAWQ.text: I'm in love with this small, wonderful vegan oasis in Phoenix. The food was nothing short of great. I had the "karma curry" with vegan mock chicken -- great flavors and the mock chicken was incredible. My friend had the "thee fighting artichokes" salad which was spot on. And we shared to the "chili fries" just to sample the vegan chili but ended up cleaning the plate in short order. Prices are great. Portions are generous. Staff was friendly and helpful when ordering. The food arrived quickly and hot. There are seating options inside and out. And it seems to be busy with eat-in and take-out orders at all times. Only drawback -- parking at the restaurant and next door at its sister dessert/sweets cafe can be challenging during the busy times. Still, this is my new "go to" place when down in Phoenix.

1wMugPsKaSb7f2cmMkp7hw.text: Yum! Loved it! Veggie restaurants always run the risk being... boring? Not the case with Green. Stopped in for lunch with some friends and I was not disappointed.  There's a small parking lot shared with Nami. You can also park around the perimeter of the building in different marked spots. The restaurant is modern and simple and comfortable.  Lots of different wines and beers available, and I would have loved to have one, but I opted for one of many different healthy flavored water drinks in the fridge by the counter. I had the Thai peanut bowl with house tofu and noodles. Sauce was spicy and delish; noodles were cooked well, and there were nice big pieces of fresh broccoli and carrots alongside perfectly done tofu. It was filling and yummy, and I did not feel depressed (from grease and calories) after eating it.  The big wac really does taste like a big mac. It looks beautiful - the way you'd hope a big mac would look, and it tastes awesome. Calexico burger was pretty good. Cole slaw is really fresh, really good, and the fries are amazing. I could eat the fries all day, every day.  I will be back! Even if you're not huge on veggie only food, this place is worth a try. If you like tofu, definitely stop in. Faux meats taste really close to real meat so again, give it a go!

-AFq5CbhvGP6jflE-j_tFQ.text: A hidden Tempe gem has opened up a store in cen Pho, and changed my lunch time landscape.  The menu is the same, with sandwiches, salads, bowls and burgers. Prices are $7-9 for most items, a bit steep for the amount of food.  The ambiance is contemporary with a minimalist eccentric interior and staff to with the piercings to match.   My thai peanut bowl was good, the mock meat has a great texture, the sauce was strong but not overpowering and the noodles were cooked well.  We also had the Mexican burger that was great other than that the bun was a bit too large for the patty.

5SdwaQkQ43QJKSxNWNwbXw.text: I've been a vegan now for about 15 years and have eaten at every possible vegan friendly establishment I could find in my travels.  I can honestly say with no hesitation that in terms of good old comfort food done vegan that Green leaves every other place I've eaten at in the dust. This includes every restaurant frequented while living in Portland, OR which to many is some kind of vegan mecca.   Get the Big Wac. Best vegan burger I've ever had.

MFYEP9NCmU7qM36wo9GgBg.text: Yummy! Not too many healthy options, but if you're looking to splurge on some junk food, or convince your non-vegan friends that vegan food is fun and delicious this is the place to do it. They recently updated their menu, with that their prices went up...again. However service is pretty good and the food is delicious, creative, and filling. I often wonder why they aren't open on Sundays, especially because Sundays is the main day of the week I have the time and energy to travel to one of their two locations, but I have learned to live with it, especially supplementing with Nami and their deliciousness (see other review).  Be aware of their hours of operation and check out Sunday brunch at Nami which is served at Nami, but essentially hosted by Green.

CzV44iIT5co4rFppJiCT0w.text: Well ... based off of so many positive Yelp reviews and considering how packed the place was when I visited, I must try it again. For me, the food was only okay... perhaps I should have tried the special of the day. In fact, it was highly suggested that I try the special of the day (street tacos) but because it was my first time I wanted to try the local favorite, one of the most popular items on the menu, the buffalo chicken wings. So that's what I ordered.  I waited a very long time for just one order of buffalo wings. The buffalo sauce was amazing, but cold, so was the wings. They tasted like they've been sitting back there for a while and forgotten about. I ate 2, ate the carrots and cucumbers that accompanied the wings and left the rest of the wings there. They were cold anyway. I opted not to get a to go box because I just didn't like them very much. I imagined if I would have taken them home to heat up they would have taste worse.   The restaurant was wayyyyyy too busy for me not to give them another try. Something's gotta be good! Next time I think I'll try their version of the Big Mac

GEzPmfsAIvaTsuueuAhIOg.text: I'm a vegan of 4+ years and have on a number of occasions dined here and Nami. For the most part the food has been good, but I consider it comfort food because of its heavy sauces and rich flavors. Don't get me wrong it's quite good and flavorful. But unfortunately it's been going down hill the last few years because of its smaller portions, higher prices (which don't trouble too much), but my biggest concern is the cleanliness of the place. I was just here yesterday with my good bud Jeff and man the place is in need of some MAJOR cleaning from floors needing to be machine scrubbed, air vents in the ceiling needing major cleaning, chairs are filthy, and restrooms need love. Look, I'm not bashing just sharing the concern, because let's face it, if you don't take pride in where your customers dine, sit and enjoy their food, what does the kitchen look like, eek!  I know vegan options in Phoenix are scarce, and I've been to most of them, and I don't want to criticize a place with a decent reputation, but I can't keep coming back to enjoy a good vegan meal in a dirty place. Get it cleaned up and you'll earn back my biz!  With love and respect!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Major, filthy floors and &#34;no&#34; that&#39;s not what this concrete floor was meant to look like...that&#39;s straight up grease!
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dirty base boards/edges where a greasy mop is sloshing up against.

5JwqmfbAF8224qexQa41iQ.text: I recently stopped in for a late lunch last weekend. I ordered the Sesame Dragon bowl and we also had some thyme fries and crab puffs. The Sesame Dragon bowl was decent but could have used more sauce or flavor (though I tend to like my stir-fry with more sauce than most). The "thyme fries" were OK but I didn't taste any thyme. However, the crab puffs were awesome. I don't know what kind of vegan magic goes into making them, but I highly recommend getting them! I also had green tea to drink, and it was nice that the four different teas & lemonades were all self-serve & free-refills.  I've been trying to eat vegetarian more often throughout the week and Green has been on my list of places I've wanted to try for a while. I finally was able to drag someone with me and was also pleasantly surprised that this is a casual "order at the counter and food is brought out to you" kind of place rather than one with waiters -- good to know for future times I may be looking for a quick bite.  The main downside was that the dining area was not very clean at the time we visited. The open tables were pretty dirty as were the floors. I also didn't notice any staff wiping off tables during the time we were there. It may have just been a freak thing and I still plan on visiting again, but this is something I'll be paying attention to.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View of the front counter
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab puffs
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sesame dragon

oXD4TCIlbHs_yEG7Ir1SNA.text: Green is one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix. It's nice to go somewhere knowing I can eat something totally vegan without sacrificing flavor.   My favorites on the menu are the buffalo wings, the spicy chicken sandwich, and definitely the big wac, but everything so far has been amazing! My vegetarian friend didn't even eat all her chicken because it reminded her too much of real chicken. I, on the other hand, love this, because I still enjoy the taste of meat and dairy. Green gives me that satisfaction without having to give up being vegan.   Come to Green is you want delicious, cheap, junky vegan food, and make sure to stop at Nami afterward for vegan ice cream!

ULzoPcQE4UXzD8ACjnXE_g.text: Two words for you- ANIMAL. FRIES. This dish is a must have!  First time eating here and the service was fast and friendly. The menu is a bit long, so the fear of picking the "right thing" was rising.  When my burger arrived, the patty was very thin. The flavor was still there and complimented the fries.   Overall I really enjoyed this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bY-nN_OHXwobZan4R5UfVQ.text: The food is really good, I love the chicken sandwich it's my favorite every time. If you aren't vegan or vegetarian I strongly recommend give this place an opportunity, you will like it I guarantee.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious, sorry for the bites I was hungry

XfnyhXhKGjyI--RA3Z0hpQ.text: I love a good vegan find and if you're ever in Phoenix, make sure you come here!!!   The place is super cute even though I stopped here on my way to the airport so I didn't get a chance to sit down and eat.   I got their famous Big WAC, the vegan version of a Big Mac and let me tell y'all.....I side eyed questioned if it wasn't actually real meat! It tastes just like an actual Big Mac!!! But what was 10x better about it was 1- you're not eating any actual animal products, 2- there is none of that McDonalds food after taste that used to linger for hours (belching not included) and 3- you didn't get that "omg I'm going to pass out I'm so full" feeling after you ate it.   The Big Wac with a side of thyme fries and a berry lemonade really makes you question how important IS that flight you're about to catch. Maybe it could wait the savoring of such a surprisingly delicious HEALTHY fast food meal.   And side note, Amy fiance, a non vegan, took a bite (which turned into a few) and he himself could not believe it was actually vegan. So whether you are vegan, or not, this place is a must!!! 5 stars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fast food made healthy, what more could you ask for?
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big WAC and thyme fries! Absolutely delicious!!!!!! (Vegan)
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Berry lemonade and chocolate chip cookie (vegan)

gbF6LHgcmjpr1wKWf7Jg8Q.text: If you love McDonald's Big MAC, then I highly recommend to try the Big WAC!  For someone like me who hasn't had beef or a philly cheesesteak in the longest time, I really appreciated the Chicago Cheesesteak.  For dessert, go next door to Nami's! You can get a complete vegan meal with Green's then Nami's!

GOpo5PWfraTiWt65tDf5kQ.text: I was in town for a conference and I had more than my share of well/over prepared convention food. I called the restaurant and placed my order with a very curteous staff member. The food was absolutely amazing, I had the classic po-boy sandwich with fries. It had all the right spices to make that sandwich a "ten".

f41HgfTX_X8kYLx2ORBjbA.text: I like to hit up the Phoenix location of Green when I'm in the area usually because I see some yummy special on Instagram that lures me in. Most recently, it was a vegan version of an Arby's Beef and Cheddar.  I really appreciate that you can order the sandwiches by themselves now because they are plenty filling on their own. The sides are very good though. My husband loves the fries, and I go for the tahini coleslaw.  One thing I wish could be tweaked is the size of the sandwich buns. It's a little too much bread  to filling ratio for me. I could be healthy and order some of the rice and veggie bowls, but I'm not going to drive all that way for such nonsense. I'm here for the vegan junk food!  Green has long been a favorite of mine. I'd go here over Coronado any day.

-0QxIfcIe-HI_N19a8crXg.text: I've had the pleasure of visiting a ton of vegan/vegetarian places in the world and this is in my top 5.  I had the "chicken" burger and it competed with many crispy chicken burgers I had back in my meat eating days.  If you're into fake meat this is a must try. If you're a veggie for the veggies, this might not be you're ideal spot.

T_kookm5YmnW75POT4D6-Q.text: Hands down the best vegetarian/vegan spot in the valley. I recommend this spot to anyone who says vegan food is "boring". The place itself is on the smaller side but there's still plenty of seating to hold 25+ people. The parking isn't the greatest and can be rather annoying when it's busy. With that being said the food is great.   They offer a "big wac" which is a vegan twist on the classic Big Mac burger and it's greatly done.   The buffalo wings are a real winner and you'd be doing yourself a disservice if you don't order them at least once.   I've tried a variety of their "burritos" and have yet to be disappointed. The peanut chicken burrito is my favorite. The mock meat they offer makes it very hard to even realize you're not eating the real thing. This is a great place to introduce someone to vegan food for the first time.   Be sure to order a drink and try they're house made drinks! All of them are delicious and compliment the food well.   If you still have room after the meal right next door is a vegan bakery!

xo4U0YPDMWx4G4l0HzayYw.text: I was excited to try this place! This is my first time really at an actual vegan place. I got the bff sandwich with fries. It was good but a little greasy for me. I haven't had food like this in a while-since before going vegan so I'm just not used to vegan food like this. I'm not really into heavy food like this all the time but when the feeling strikes I'll be back and try something else next time. Parking is tight too.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BFF with thyme fries

o_3T6kROYwGHOaEYFxDP5A.text: So I've wanted to try a vegan version of a Big Mac for a long time, this place did not disappoint. I'm not vegan, but enjoy eating vegan food that imitates popular foods: this Big Wac tastes like a home made Big Mac mom would have made, so good! I'll be back to try more.

tcRa6s5eDCxYX7cusxoV1g.text: I love green new american! I come here probably once a week to get their BFF sandwich and west coast fries :) I love that they have so many beverage options in their cooler and always have some house made desserts. The service is always great! Love you guys! :)

K12ZQQCuUihJzUmKLi-J_A.text: This place is beyond great! Out of all of the years I've been coming here, I've never had food that I didn't enjoy. I usually get chili, eggless rolls and fries, bur I went this weekend and finally tried the big wac. IT IS SO GOOD! I will definitely be ordering it every time from here on out. Ambiance is great, staff is super friendly and they always have a decent selection of beer! Definitely recommend! PS bring back the mac n cheese!

LKOfFdOnWSo-ktt0jzEs7Q.text: I eat lunch here err day. I've tried almost everything here and im never disappointed. Fighting artichoke is killer and that big wac is f****** dank. Staff is excellent as well.

6xKkPGLoKMrQyXFS0L54hg.text: Oh my gosh this place was fabulous.  I got a big wac think a Big Mac but vegan and also a great strawberry smoothie.  Excellent.  My wife got a salad and also enjoyed it!

g6wMnFuXEwyAXmcQLxBXFg.text: We tried Green this past Friday night.  Yeah, we are totally fans.  A little backstory...My Wife and I have been vegan for about the last 9 months.  Our Son was out of town last week, so we decided to try a couple of new places during our "Staycation".  After a rather disappointing meal at another establishment just down the street, we decided to try Green on the recommendation of a server at another restaurant.  We arrived about 6:30 on Friday evening, and the first thing we discovered is that parking is not so great.  This almost made us go somewhere else, but I'm glad we didn't.  We were able to find parking on a side street and had a short walk back to the restaurant.  The restaurant was busy, but we were not deterred.  We got a menu, and got in line.  While waiting in line, I was looking around the place.  There is one main dining room with the ordering counter/drinks at the back.  Out front facing 7th Street is a nice patio, and the main room has a roll up type door for nice weather.  I also found out later, that there is a back patio that I would love try.  The place was very clean and modern; but be warned, it's loud.    While looking at the menu and deciding what to have, I was also "window shopping" other customers plates.  Everything I saw looked good and the portions were large.  While there was a lot of talking going on, people really seemed to be enjoying their food (a very good sign!) and not letting it sit on their plates.  Turnover was also pretty quick, people seemed to eat and go, not a lot of lingering.  My Wife and I both decided on the big WAC burger (Green's take on a popular burger from the "golden arches" place), thyme fries, and an order of the buffalo wings for an appetizer.  We both had iced tea to drink (there are 4 house made drinks to choose from).     While it took a little time to get our food (understandable, it was Friday night and the place was busy).  It was sooooo worth the wait.  Our burgers and fries came before our wings.  We both requested no onions, and that's how we got them.  The presentation was awesome.  The burgers and fries were hot and looked like a million bucks. The patties came to the edge of the bun, the "cheese" was melted, the taste was phenomenal.  The burger was huge.  The fries were crisp and not greasy.  I'm trying not to use too many exclamation points so my review doesn't get canned, but I could put them after every sentence, the food was just that good!  We both felt like we were cheating.  The only let down was the Buffalo sauce.  When our wings arrived, they looked great and smelled good.  The texture was spot on and they were sized nice, but neither of us cared for the sauce.  Maybe I'm too much of a traditionalist when it comes to wing sauce, but I would try them again.  Overall, this was a fantastic experience and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Green to anyone.  Vegan or not.  Great job Green!  4.5 stars

EToPaQtcJVgIBHJ1Y08kHQ.text: The food was great but the service was the worst I have experienced. It was very busy but after waiting a good 20 minutes we had to ask for our table to be wiped down as it had food remnants still on it from the previous diners. The food came out in stages with the last meal coming 50minutes after everyone else's food had arrived. Had we not had to pre-pay, we would have left. Asked to speak to the manager who was less than thrilled at hearing some criticism (hey - I get it - it's busy as heck and the service industry is not an easy one to work in - but at least act like you care.) In an annoyed tone she asked me if a gift certificate to the bakery next door would "make it all better?"  With all the money they're making on those delicious vegan burgers and with the place packed you'd think they would hire more staff to accommodate! That would actually "make it all better."

UFZ8snqYKsHM6TuORENHuA.text: Yum, yum, yum! The Big Wac tasted just like a Big Mac! The boneless chicken wings were amazing! We can't stay away from this place!!

wTZiG26_xd2WMRGs3W-JjQ.text: Found this place on yelp. We were 5 vegetarian people looking for good veg food and this place didn't disappoint. I had red diablo and was really good. Try their imitation meat, it's really good. Highly recommend for vegetarian food.

3IfGEhOaVCJXPM-CiLJWAw.text: I love it! My new fav. restaurant!! Big Wac taste just like a Big Mac, Curry bowl is my favorite, thyme fries are great, crab puffs were delicious, buffalo wings super tasty, chili fries could have been better but were still very good!

UrkMsbjl_59SLGuvgPjTDA.text: Took my daughter today and it was a great experience. We got two Big Wacs and the Green Hummus. DELICIOUS! Super friendly staff. Wee took a short stroll next door and got TSoyNami YUM! Will definitely back very soon. I'm a big carnivore and this place is now a goto destination.

Zk9AEgby-whrU3wVvkj67w.text: We found this on our way to the airport. The food was delicious and fresh. I had Thee Green Salad which had Hearts of Palm, greens, tomatoes, etc. with a tasty dressing and the Samosas as recommended by the waitress...delicious and unique flavor.  It is a treat to find good, fresh, delicious food while travelling.

x4nuYJCoYqi4nSWUY_2ChA.text: this vegetarian restaurant is good but certainly not healthy. their food tends to be a little greasy at times. also, their portion sizes are extremely unfilling. i usually come and spend about $30-35 per meal just by myself with no drink, which i feel is rather a lot to pay for a date out with myself... to fill me up,  i usually order an appetizer, a large entree salad, and a bowl. their appetizers are a bit greasy and fried. their crab wontons tho obviously being vegetarian have no crab, are just fried wonton crisps stuffed with a little amount of what tastes like philadelphia cream cheese. i did not enjoy those. i do really like their mock buffalo chicken wings tho. i order those a lot. but they can get a little greasy and heavy on the stomach. their salads are decent, but i generally like my salads without the purple lettuce and often times they forget so i end up eating a full salad that is actually the size of a small side salad after half the salad is removed because it is purple... the bowls are my favorite part but they are extremely small and considering there is no meat, is very unfilling on its own, hence my additional order of an appetizer and salad. they are tasty tho! you can choose to order with rice or noodles. the noodles are tastier but makes the unfilling bowl even less filling on the stomach. so i usually get the rice. they have a great amount of sauce in their bowls and their veggies are crunchy and delicious. the ambience is nice too tho sometimes it can get loud. they have an outdoor patio too which is nice. the restaurant opens up into that patio, so it looks pretty nice. tho i have to order more than i normally would at another typical vegetarian restaurant and spend more than i would like each time i come, and have to deal with the upset stomach from all the grease and oil they use, i still come eat here every once in awhile because the food is good, and im not on a diet. they do have many things they could improve upon tho IMO...

esCMCQz6j6snWXDE50Y92g.text: My friends, who are vegans, invited me to tag a long with them one day to this restaurant. I was quite skeptical about trying the food because I'm not vegan at all, but I said what the heck I'll give it a try what can it hurt? I'm not a picky person at all when it comes to the taste of food. Anyways, I was actually very impressed with the taste of my dish, which was the kung pao with mock chicken. After my first experience, I had gone back about a total of 5 more times. The 3rd time I decided to try a new dish, the lemon pesto bowl with mock chicken (my friends favorite dish). This dish ended up turning into my favorite as well. On my 4th visit to Green,  I ordered to go, and got the lemon pesto bowl with mock chicken and requested an extra side of lemon pesto sauce. When I looked in my bag to make sure everything was in their, I noticed my lemon pesto sauce was not, so I kindly asked if I could get the lemon pesto sauce (my friend also requests an extra side of lemon pesto sauce with her order all the time and they have NEVER once forgotten to give it to her). I tried to be as understanding as possible because I know we are all human and forgot little details like that. I will honestly say I was a little irritated because I had to wait additional time for them to prepare it. On my 5th visit, same thing,  they forgot my pesto sauce AGAIN. I was thoroughly irritated because I just didn't get how they could forget a second time after I had specifically requested for the side and the cashier even verbally repeated my order . AGAIN I had to wait for the pesto sauce to be prepared . I decided to give this place another try because I became addicted to the lemon pesto bowl (my 6th visit). I ordered the same thing over the phone, to go. Mind you, they always verify my whole order before hanging up. When I picked up my order and paid, I checked the bag to make sure my pesto sauce was in there.... and once AGAIN my pesto sauce was not in there!! Bitting my tongue I asked the cashier if I could get an extra side of pesto sauce because it wasn't in my bag. The cashier told the people in the back to prepare some.. After waiting patiently about 5 minutes I asked one of the servers walking around if she could check up on my pesto sauce because I was still waiting. She went to the back and came back with the sauce. I left and headed home. When I got home and was getting ready to eat my dish I noticed they had forgotten to add the mock chicken (the best part of it)! I was so freakin pissed because here they had forgotten my pesto sauce for the 3rd damn time and now they forgot my mock chicken! I was extremely irritated that I felt compelled to call and let them know. When I called, I explained to the girl that answered the phone that I was just in there, and I now just noticed that my mock chicken was missing (I didn't bring up the missing pesto sauce) She proceeded to apologize and asked if I would like to come back to get the chicken. I told her I'm already at home (what I was thinking in my head: I live 30 mins away their is no way in hell I would waste gas just to go all the way back to get the remaining portion of my order that you guys screwed up on). After a couple seconds of awkward silence, the girl was unsure what to even do to solve the problem and put me on hold so she could ask a coworker what to do? Really? She acted like she had never received a phone call before about an incomplete order. I've worked in the food industry in customer service so I found it to be very strange that she had to ask another coworker what to do. Maybe she was new? Idk. Anyways after waiting on hold, she came back and told me that her manager wasn't in today and that she would take down my info so he/she could call me the next day to maybe set me up with a gift card for the chicken they had forgot. Which I was totally fine with, all I wanted was the chicken that they had forgotten, that I paid for. The next day came and I never received a phone call from anyone.  I was very surprised that no one called especially with all the good reviews on Yelp, I really thought highly of Green. I was so disappointed with the whole situation and previous experiences with my order that I told myself I'm done with this place. I truly enjoyed the food, but after so many screw ups I gave up and told my friends that I won't be returning. It's just a big headache and a waste of time. Maybe I should have spoken up the first time they forgot, and not have been so polite....but that is not the type of person who I am. I try to be as patient as possible. This is my first time writing a review on anything, sorry it wasn't a good one.

VviQsmlDCr7pTWvDmLG5UQ.text: great salads and fries. Cool hipster environment with a really yummy ice cream spot right next door!

BVtDHePDMdXpcDuSaEA0MQ.text: Love those garage doors that open up when the weather is nice. I'm not crazy  aboutabout the mock chicken but they have a good tofu and veggies. Still need to try others menu items, I'm sure that I'll upgrade the stars after liking more dishes.

OZ3KNjp1uc_cEREw4qHhoQ.text: delicious vegan food! i always have to eat at green every time i am in phoenix. this time i had thee argentine po boy. it was great! the staff is always so friendly here, too.

PYigzlnn763pm-at2Yfc4Q.text: Have tried twice to visit this restaurant.  Never able to find parking.  Hopefully will be successful one day!

6NfJMihaYURVFLJX5omyBw.text: WOW! I went with high expectations because of the reviews. I was not in the least disappointed. The food was absolutely amazing. To top it off the service was great as well. The girls were so friendly and inviting. Cant wait to go back tomorrow.

gOfW1Wjo_9T6l5hLnyBRuw.text: I read reviews on Yelp all the time, but it takes something special to cause me to write one.  Green's food absolutely blew me away.  The flavors and combinations are just amazing.  I was in Phoenix on business and ate here 5 times in 3 days.  The sandwiches are the best vegan sandwiches I've ever eaten, and the salads are great too.  Friendly staff and a cool atmosphere top it off.

AFnd82G6Gas4y5K_YMxp4g.text: Great place if you're vegan and want some burger or sandwiches. Severs are helpful, choices are plentiful, and portions are reasonable.

Vg4b3NDwVoWGX41BzHoyaA.text: Ordered an order for pick up recently.  Was worried about being able to park etc, as it's limited, but found a spot right away... order was ready (We called right at 11 to order it which I think was key here- I've heard it can be slow during lunch.  Staff was super pleasant and WOW it was GOOOODDDD!  Green hummus with pita was awesome.  Had the Coconut curry with house tofu and it was awesome- perfect amount of 'sauce'- just coated not swimming- which my waistline appreciates.  Everyone's food in our party  was super.  Just under 10.00/person with tax- no drinks- but SOOO worth it.

AJIWfTBNqLmzCUbSkeMczA.text: Two Words: Big Wac. Not on the online menu but they do carry it. Best veggie burger I have ever eaten in my life! It puts the Big Mac to shame, best part is no formaldehyde like at McDonalds.

EsBRha1umoLxBVfENsZMvA.text: As card-carrying omnivore, I sometimes like to take a break from meat and play for the other team. I have never eaten at the Green original in Scottsdale. This place is so close to my work that I was able try it. The first time, I had their buffalo wings and an apricot noodle dish. Their take on ranch dressing with cucumber is a to-die-for concoction. What I wouldn't give to be swimming in that. Soooo good. They need to bottle that. NOW. The buffalo wings really tasted like what you'd get in a sports bar but they were a little salty for my taste. Another time I had the vegetarian chili fries. Very authentic tasting also. The faux-cheese was meh. But it went well with the fries. Another winner is their green chile hummus with the fried pita chips. I would love to work my way through the whole menu. I also like the decor of woods and recycled materials. So far, I haven't found much to complain about. If you're going to pick up to-go, definitely call ahead first. Also, parking can be tight; you may have to risk parking at Coco's. Still, I'm all for going 'green'!

Jxj4TK0jc2W8vKDfYBv7sQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  The best place for vegans!!  The samosas rock.  It is so awesome that I can eat EVERYTHING on the menu.  The ice machine is hilarious.  GREAT.

sSVmfIKPOs5CD6d_zG01uw.text: My favorite haunt, usually there 2-3 times per week. BBQ chicken sandwich could fool most any serious carnivore. Best thing to order is the daily special -- which unfortunately is offered less often than more. Brunch on Sunday, though not cheap, is good, especially the sticky buns. Again, get the daily special. Parking can be problematic, though you're sure to find hybrids and HRC stickers, so it won't sting as much.

_eh7ELfRTr2LCa8WZ0TyFw.text: We've gone here a lot the past couple months, and I have to say that they have really stepped it up!
