The Argentine Po'boy is a favorite of a lot of people here (including me!) but if there's a special I have to try it, and it's usually amazing. The Citrus Chicken sandwich was sooo good. I can't wait until they have it again! Also, my boss NEVER eats fries but she has to get the thyme fries every time we go here because they are awesome and perfect even for takeout. I'm really happy! It's a favorite of ours now!

JH53unGLbqwzayA4SWTbZQ.text: I'm not vegan or vegetarian, but I absolutely love this place! I enjoy the variety of the menu and the atmosphere. Some of my favs include: Wendy's pickle, the big wac, and any of Asian inspired bowls.

MgVa1hYW-xHvdOlXmXY_Bg.text: I love the Original G Spicy Po-Boy with thyme fries! Hot wings are my weakness and this meat-free twist on them satisfies my hunger when I'm in a healthy, yet indulgent mood.

n3JvcAFy4QCm-Al1ezKPHg.text: This is by far the best restaurant. My husband son and I go on Sundays for brunch and order take out for dinners. Amazing is an understatement! The staff is the best, really down to earth! I love everything about this place! Thank you for the awesome food!!!

kBLL90RvFw4nXX2UinlRPQ.text: Vegan Dinner & appetizers. Good crab puffs! did not care for the spiced edamame - where's the spice? I liked my peanut thai noodles with good veggies. My friend wasn't impressed with the caliexica burger. Liked the fountain drinks!

2NzaSMPMb0oP8rogH20SWw.text: Good food, nice people. Poor service. Waited 20 minutes past my scheduled pick up time.  Not acceptable.

uJkWx6sg8JbnLsxzA7pvaQ.text: I am not going to pretend I am a vegan anymore.  I look like a hipster, I smell like a hipster, and occasionally I eat like a hipster... so I have to eat some vegan stuff once in awhile.    I know that my vegan friends will not judge me for eating delicious little animals if I go with them to Green once in awhile.    When Thai food and salad bars are not enough, Green picks up the ball and paves the course for the future... providing a comfortable and hip atmosphere, great service, and mouthwatering delicious stomach stuffing.    I have eaten everything on the menu, and there is not a single thing on it I wouldn't order again, which I cannot say for any other eatery in the Valley.  But if I had to suggest something to a meat-eater that is venturing out into unknown territory, I would recommend "Thee Argentine Po Boy".    If you were raised by American McDonald's junkies like myself, and you are trying to change your eating habits, and you love to eat that ice cream cone after your McFeast, then feel free to hoof it over to Nami next door and satisfy the sweet tooth as well.  Thank you Green for making me feel a little less 1950's America in a ever-evolving world.

RVMJOZBNyWAm9tiG9HJjcA.text: I got the Singapore orange bowl with rice and the house tofu, then went back only a couple days after to get it again. It's a lot of food and great quality, so it's worth the price. The vegetables in it are nice and big and the house tofu is delicious! I plan on coming back many more times!

hSyTsgLHqsfyJYIFlDX8lA.text: I've been to the other Green location in Tempe many times (which is always great) - and I tried this one for the first time yesterday. Seems like it's in a great location and it definitely stands out. The service was friendly and quick and the food was fresh, hot, and delicious. I would recommend their veggie burgers to anyone - they are made there and are unlike any I have had. Love this place!

cX1kCYkT6d7W_t4Krck5dg.text: I love the Tempe/Scottsdale location but I have to say I enjoy this one much more. Feels a little less pretentious, a little more grown-up, and hopping next door to Nami for a Tsoynami and vegan dessert is unbeatable.  I love everything on the menu and have always been impressed by the prices. Whether you're vegan/vegetarian or not, GO. I have brought several friends who are meat eaters and have since been back with them on countless occasions. The options are overwhelming. Their mock meat is incredible and all of their noodle dishes are loaded with an abundant variety of fresh vegetables. Great for a healthy lunch or dinner with friends.  Even if you're not big on the food -- give soy soft serve a try and pop next door for a Tsoynami (Green's vegan version of a McFlurry or DQ's Blizzard). There are so many flavor options and they are all PHENOMENAL.  No doubt if you try once you'll be back for more.

GlQHOls5VThkCU1RneiGug.text: This was my very first visit to a vegan restaurant. I was so thrilled to come here, I couldn't contain myself. The employees were nice, but they were busy. The people in the restaurant seemed a bit snobby, but I shouldn't care about them anyway. I am there to eat, not make friends.   I was overwhelmed with choices. I went for the buffalo wings and the spicy chicken po' boy sandwich. My boyfriend got the Green Veggie Burger, and his sister got the no-harm chicken parm. We are vegan, she is not.  The wings were by far my favorite! I think I will order them as a meal or to share though. Some reviews said the portion was small, but I couldn't finish them despite how delicious they were. My sandwich was pleasantly messy and delicious. The texture is truly fabulous as far as faux meat goes. Don't come here expecting gardein textures and flavors - it is the best of the best!   A lot of people said it was greasy and oily. I am familiar with a low-fat diet and usually eat as low-fat as possible. Even though this is not health food (unless you get the healthier options), it doesn't feel heavy or disgusting like traditional SAD food does. There is a noticeable difference. The salt level could be taken down a notch, but other than that, this food is AMAZING.   After going to Vegas and trying vegan food at restaurants here, Green is still winning as far as value and quality goes. I can't wait to go back, and Green will certainly be on my mind for awhile.

I4eXyfFE-HTrPCf1KO6sNQ.text: Everything on the menu is good. Highly recommended. Service and atmosphere are good but not outstanding really. But not bad and the food is great, so there you go!

c4tuGkklM0aK1u7Xfx1gQQ.text: Lovely place in a location on 7th Street around a bunch of other cool little places to eat. I was there last weekend and had their mock buffalo chicken sandwich and it was messy but great. They use a great bread for the roll and it comes out literally burning hot so wait 2 or 3 minutes before you dig in and have plenty of napkins. They also do a variety of vegi and mock meat stir fries that I've had at their other location and though I've not had them their vegi burgers look amazing.  Parking can be a bit of an issue if it is busy but the place draws a wonderful eclectic crowd, sort of the same group that you might say, see at a showing of an independent film. Oh, and I especially like the fresh teas, lemonade, and  ginger drink that they have available and the ice maker has a wrap around of face pictures of the rapper ice cube, how cool is that baby!  I hope that one day they open another location near Mill avenue, I think it would do well and I would eat there on a much more regular basis!   Bottom line, give it a try and the other thing, the boneless mock chicken buffalo wings, good stuff!

KfhTaNImPmcKNimLJ9GYiQ.text: I've eaten here at least a handful of times in the past 2 months and it's quite delicious!!

WnsuXNICDh7RF7NMf_BOPg.text: love love love. when I was in PHX last year, this location was not open, so I went to the OG outpost in Tempe.  this one is a lot more convenient.  had every possible meal at Green.  I have to take advantace of the vegan delish whenever I can.  main dishes I tried: Coconut curry w/ fake chicken, Mongolian fake beef & Thai fake chicken.  plus some salads & starters. and tasty housemade bevs.  everything there is AMAZING.  brought a veggie friend & an omni & they were huge fans, too!

FtTmd864HkyTnAgRpSkP_g.text: I LOOOOOOOOOVE GREEN.   I don't love their parking. Beware. Carpool if you can. DON'T PARK AT COCO'S. They sometimes tow.   That being said, their food is DELICIOUS! Proof that vegetarian and vegan doesn't mean tasteless! Definitely get the fries, they're seasoned and pretty much perfect. You get a decent serving of them, as well.   Brunch is served on Sundays, I've never been disappointed. The Biscuits'n'gravy is quite tasty.

Qax5g-8Xzg17WY7ijFF8Ew.text: I gave Green a chance after banning it from my already incredibly small list of vegan friendly restaurants. I was shocked at how expensive everything was for such small portions. $7 for four samosas? Maybe you could fool some people who are vacationing in veganism but it's not going to fly with me.  The food was fair. Just fair. The sauce for my samosas was almost disgustingly sweet (no chutney?). It took a ridiculously long time to get my main meal out and I was disappointed to find that it was /really/ greasy. I understand that the point of Green is comfort food but excuse me if a quarter cup of grease just makes me sick.  After dinner we popped over to Nomi where I tried the BFs twinkie which had an incredibly dry cake and unfathomably greasy cream (which I think has more to do with how long it had been out and how they decided to store the cakes rather than how it was made).  The only good part of this time's visit was that I could stomach the food. Last time I went there I had a lemon slice on my freaking pizza. Who the hell puts lemon on a pizza??  I don't think I'll be going back. If I want Asian food I'll go to Loving Hut otherwise I'll be making things myself. It's not worth the price nor the taste to be ignored while surrounded by artsy fart "hollier than thou" attitudes among fellow vegans.

vRDi3bQaQ7M4x2T9Jqeytg.text: I am not a vegetarian, let alone vegan, but I ADORE Green. I had their Big WAC and can't stop thinking about it days later. Will definitely be back! Nice staff, great food, happy tummy!

fORwznQ7NkZmS55zIMfvew.text: Big wacs are crazy good. they're not open Sunday, but next door has good vegan breakfast. We eat here all the time, whenver friends are in town and when we're craving some delicious food in a cool environment. Big wacs!

MiEFyU8b_X75TGRuMYHoDw.text: Yummmm.. The absolute best vegan joint in Phoenix! Even people who aren't vegan will like it.

5g9kBkgnThg2WViJ3FIaOQ.text: This is one of the most amazing vegan restaurants I have ever been to. Many things on the menu sounded great but I decided on the Big WAC (vegan Big Mac). It was insanely delicious. The burger patties were great and it was topped with plenty of special sauce and vegan cheese. It came with a generous side of fries and ketchup. I had to try the vegan chili and it was amazing as well, I wish they sold this in grocery stores so I could eat it all the time. It had a perfect amount of flavor and it was the only vegan chili I've ever had that wasn't made with beans. I highly recommend this restaurant to plant based eaters and carnivores alike.

ujWIeOjq7KTp2JX4kcI1tw.text: Very good! I had the Sesame Dragon and Eggless Rolls. The rolls were amazing! Crisp and hot even though it was carry out! The sesame dragon was ok- veggies were crisp but there wasn't a lot of flavor. I will definitely try them again. Great and friendly service!!!

LFDYcGyf360WFiMn3vQIMQ.text: Love this place! Always packed and always recieve friendly service. Really cool specials and craft beers. Parking can be tricky here, theres only so many spots behind the restaurant but i have always lucked out and found a spot .Majority of their food is heavily mock meat based but its all pretty yummy. Clean chill restaurant with alot of personality and im all about supporting vegan restaurants. The big wac is my favorite but this time i got the bbq wings salad with a tangy ranch dressing and crispy tortilla chips. Light but filling, veggies were fresh and wings had lots of flavor. I think ill do the wings in buffalo sauce next time though, i think it would go better with the dressing. I sat out back on the patio under the tree and it was pretty relaxing.also, love the varieties of house made ice teas! I mixed some of the sweet ginger tea with some lemonade and dangggg, so refreshing! I will be back as always! Cant wait to try something different next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Ranchero&#34; bbq wing salad w/fresh veg,crunchy tortilla chips and house ranch dressing, all vegan. Salad was a little overdressed

hhlKysz__EAL7WSy_gJ6Jg.text: Really good. I had the Big Wack and my teen had the nuggets and fries. As a non vegan she loved her meal more than the other meals that she has had while we have been in Phoenix. Hope to make it back.

4FrVK995W7Y9b07vMZxNHw.text: Love love love love absolutely love this place. Best vegan/vegetarian ever,  hands down.   I got my family to eat vegan food. The meat "imitation"....  they couldn't tell. Haha. Chicken, meat or sea food. Nope. Not at all. My cousin said " what? this isn't real meat? This is awesome." Hahaha  I come here for dinner and nami which is next door for brunch :) my favv.  I always come back.  Always.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7dqLzGpA1ao4CSVqGaRgUA.text: I really wanted to like this place because most of the reviews are awesome, and I've had multiple meat eating friends recommend Green to me. Sadly, my first experience was far from what I expected. The woman who took our order was rude, impatient, and unhelpful. Our food was served quickly, but most of it seemed like it had been sitting around and was zapped through the microwave before it got to us. I ordered the BFF and chili cheese fries. The sandwich was only slightly warm and had cold spots throughout. The chili fries were cold and soggy. It was apparent that they only heated them enough to melt the cheese on top. Everything I ordered was lacking in flavor. Basically, the service was crap and so was the food. I won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The chili cheese fries were cold and soggy. They definitely only heated them enough to melt the cheese. They also lacked in flavor.
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The BFF was served only slightly warm and had cold spots throughout...

Fs9XkaIhdP303RDpIgJhGQ.text: Found this spot after a search for a quick and healthy dinner after a long drive in from California and was highly impressed with the quality of the vegan/vegetarian food. Spinach, artichoke "queso" dip is to die for and the veggie patties on the burgers are truly top notch. Highly recommending this place to my friends here in Phoenix. I'll be back next time I'm in town for sure!

1FrxKB4LMkp9mlHKmxstVA.text: I stopped by last week for a quick lunch. I got the hot wings to go. They were AWESOME and tasted exactly like meat! The sauce was delish and I loved that they served it with celery, pickles, and carrots (as wings should be).  The place was swamped when I arrived, so I understand why the girl at the front wasn't super smiley-- but she definitely didn't make me or the other customers feel welcome, and she wasn't terribly knowledgeable about the menu when a group had questions.  I would go back to try other items, though. Definitely a great option in the heart of Phoenix!

MThoLzAIdQ4fEUMAWD2Djg.text: I've never had something here I didn't like. My husband is very much NOT a vegetarian and he loves this place. Their mock meat is incredibly real tasting. His go to is the Big Wac. I usually opt for the Spicy Peanut Chicken Salad. We took a Cheese Burger and fries home for our 15 yr old son and he had no clue it was mock meat.  Staff is awesome and service is fast.

8migR4lKMso6F-JwE3Pwdw.text: My observations of Green:  1. The name Green belies the fact that the food is mostly comfort food. It's good, but should not be confused as health food. The last menu change seems to have put more emphasis on the comfort-food. I miss the green burger greatly. If I'm not mistaken, it was a hand-packed patty made from oats, beets and sundry seasonings. It was delicious and didn't make me feel like a pig for eating it. The newer burgers - while good comfort food - are not something I care to eat when I'm not depressed or too tired to cook.  2. The management seems to hire employees based on their number of facial piercings and overall devil-may-care fashion sense rather than friendliness, helpfulness and other attributes of a True customer-service professional. There are some very nice employees, but the lazy ones who behave as though they're doing you a favor by showing up to work have put a damper on many experiences for people I know.

_QFm5wDLu06p8ZsIU7esPg.text: Vegan Buffalo Wings were rad. BBQ Sammie Was delicious. Cheesesteak was delicious. Kombucha, Coffee, Tea, & Booze all fantastic. This is Vegan Heaven.   Heavy on the Soy products, so take it easy vegans. And make sure you hit up Nami next door afterwards, it's like a unwritten rule.

amFl1KKAISeYjjOWthN95A.text: Those who know me might need smelling salts right about now.  Yes, I ate at a vegetarian restaurant.  And I liked it very much.  The dagobah jungle was really great, though - who can argue with spicy brussels sprouts, and I had them do it up like a burro.  Tortillas really do make everything good anyway.  My dining partner had the peanut "chicken" which she loved, though fake meat is where I draw the line (not judging others here, I just choose to stick to eating things that really are what they're called).  I would come more often for lunch, but it took 20 minutes to get our food, so need to go when I have extra time.

AH5HrKpygdIdJyGCaa2O6g.text: After a long morning of hiking, and an afternoon of volunteering it was music to my ears when my carnivorous father suggested a vegan restaurant for dinner. I was stoked to discover he not only enjoyed the food, but would go back for seconds! Good service, clean place, delicious comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili fries, fried Brussels sprouts, and buffalo &#34;wings.&#34;
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cozy outdoor seating.
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xmZh0nXQO4B5i7us2Lt82A.text: I have never written a Yelp review in my life, but this place was so good that I felt compelled to do it. I was in town for 4 days on business, and stopped in 2 separate times for dinner. Such a cute peaceful outside patio and the best vegan "meat" I've ever had in my life, great drinks, super friendly service. I'm not kidding when I say I will be flying back to Phoenix specifically for this food.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The BFF

kKspfrv08YlRbH0YWu1YkQ.text: I've been to the other location and got confused, thinking this was that location!  What a different interior than the other; a lot more upscale looking, a nice patio, good beer selection.  But no big fat ice cream bar?  Or maybe I just wasn't looking hard enough.  Ah well, I just wanted good, not desert.  Went with the Big WAC (second time having this) and buffalo wings.  Damn, eating that Big Wac makes me feel like a kid again.  So freakin' delicious.  And they have Teese vegan cheese you can switch out for Daiya (which I eat all the time).  Sweet!    My companion enjoyed his huge chili dogs and we split the wings, loved em.  What a great ranch sauce.    I'd be here all the time (other location too) if I lived in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big WAC with teese. One of the most amazing vegan burgers of all time
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ejC-VW-rnzpNDuMoQ2OTJg.text: When we first arrived the place was full with only one seat open, which was a good sign. We got the bbq wings and the samoas. Being a restaurant called "green" we expected the dishes to be presented more healthily. The wings were lacking in flavor and only came with 2 carrot sticks and celery. The samoas were good in flavor, but rather oily. Overall, the best part of our meal was the kombucha.

ByUR33b5eXY6eZBZHy5u9Q.text: This place has great Vegan options. I had the cheesesteak special that was very tasty. My friend had the salad with  Brussel sprouts that was so tasty. GreAt service.

gBDqmvwrN-HTkYjIYwAX7Q.text: For anyone looking for amazing vegetarian food I highly recommend this place for their food, culture and style!!

2z1tlq7wGcs484eHU2khlg.text: Plastic white object was found in my food this plastic was so thick it actually hurt my tooth feeling confident of my food I bit into my big wak and hurt my tooth because of it. I was not given a refund but just a gift card of 25 when I had purchased 2 big wak meals and drinks I liked this restaurant but I did not feel appreciated as a customer nor satisfied

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This hurt my tooth this was the thick plastic in my food
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plastic object in my food

47dDLNwvflcYUYkNxjGaTA.text: Was a loyal customer. Bad customer service. Ran poorly management. If an order is wrong or if you've had a bad experience, expect a shrug and a half hearted "yeah, we'll address that/sorry but don't care bye"

wnDJWlVidlKcerWc-EpDGQ.text: The Argentinean Po Boy, The Big Wac, and Seitan Wings are fantastic comfort food to me.   I cant go to Green without splitting a order of the wings with my husband.  We lick the basket clean, haha.  On the advice of a friend, I recently tried the Kaisor Soze Reuben weekly special,  and hope it is added to the menu. LOVED IT!!  We live in South Phoenix and its so nice having one in the central Phoenix area.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shroom
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shane&#39;s drank
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac n cheese

WTIKmLDxPszpHPGzSuMCbw.text: Went here for lunch yesterday Yummy. I had the mock chicken thai peanut bowl hubby had the big wac A mock burger He loved it !

L4BrmAZ58sdnk1z4S91lyQ.text: So. Tasty. Reasonably priced, fast, vegetarian. The thyme fries are amazing!

mRCrGcEpe7MfjFprjJsl0w.text: Disclaimer:  I am not a vegetarian, vegan, or hipster.  What the hell am I doing at Green?  Eating really friggin' tasty food, that's what!  This Green location is very airy and pleasant.  On nice days the garage door in front is opened up so the whole restaurant seems like a patio.  The staff are friendly and orders come up in a timely manner.  The parking lot is quite tiny so sometimes it's tough to find a space, but it's worth the wait!    Today for lunch I tried the ranchero salad.  The salad features Green's famed "wings," which I learned today are made from mock beef, not mock chicken.  The restaurant happened to be out of the "beef,"  and I was asked if "chicken" would be okay.  Silly me thought that wings would be made of faux chicken anyway!  I'm not sure what they taste like when made with "beef" but I really enjoyed the "chicken" version.  The salad also has a vegan version of ranch dressing which sort of tasted pesto-y to me, but was cool and refreshing just like non-vegan ranch but without that heavy, artery-clogging feeling.  Yum!  I've also had tried the secret BBQ chicken sandwich.  This seems to be quite a popular item, but I thought the "chicken" in this dish was chewy and hard to bite through.  The sandwich was also messy to eat because it had tons of sauce on it.  The sauce is fantastic though.  Just get lots of napkins.  I particularly like the Green burger and addictive thyme fries.  The apricot miso noodle bowl really surprised me.  Lots of sweet and subtle flavors.  Green is an excellent place to come for a late afternoon lunch.  I think even people who are hardcore carnivores can find something to enjoy here.

SmGmv5DsTdOe8iIhqWBJGQ.text: This place is great. The food is delicious. Actually, I eat the Wendy's Pickle every single time, so really I don't know about the other food. But my partner's tried some other stuff and really liked it as well. Very reasonably priced, friendly staff. Love coming here when I'm in the neighborhood.

qatH47m4-YP37kXRJPkTRQ.text: One of my favorite places!  I love the BBQ Chik'n!  I also love the cookie dough.  I felt it is a bit pricey but I am OK with it.  Parking is sometimes rough at lunchtime so I usually pick up and run.  Maybe they will figure out some way around it.  They are always great and helpful with phone orders.

WzE3PLx_vhoN0wzILkootw.text: Absolute greatness!!!  Service: friendly  Food: TRY the faux chicken wings (I crave this) Kung pao noodles Vegan chilli fries  Ambiance - A+  Tip: don't order the faux chicken wings Togo. Soggy experience plus they add the carrots, cucumber, celery in the box and close it. Equals the case of raw cooked veggies.   Go next door to nami for dessert!!

Edd1v9TSrwpxiHtWdYKWrQ.text: Stopped in here on a business trip to Phoenix. I have to say the big wac was amazing. It brought back all the memories of a McDonald's Big Mac without all the concern with ingredients. I will make this a staple meal on my business trips here. We also had the buffalo wings, crab cakes and everything was delicious! Definitely recommend.

x5WlO1R14h9J_yBz1Zislw.text: A great and convenient stop when you're craving vegan comfort food. This location is much better appointed and more comfortable to dine in than the Tempe location. However, they could use some additional parking. Also, I could swear the meal portions (specifically the noodle dishes) have gotten smaller, especially for takeout.

nSDKebTZ4Ip8wRLu1051Bw.text: Great/cool/semi-chill atmosphere. Very clean. The staff was consistently wiping the tables clean. Average noise level. Large assortment of options on the menu. Menu is perfectly priced. I appreciate how you order at the counter (do not need to give a tip). I had the Big Wac. It was great. When I come back I want to try one of their salads. They looked awesome.

-S2M7u1tXabGSQxnbet88A.text: So happy to have this restaurant in my neighborhood. It is my go-to place for excellent vegetarian meals.

kNEIR3CGVvz1Giah9SVlTQ.text: Good overall just don't order the mac and cheese! Really, no, don't.

n3U1Kurnch4dpncbkUCG0w.text: This place is YUMMY! I used to be a Veggie and love the food still. I work downtown and have a ton of options for lunch but, I'm always wanting Green. I recommend the Thai Chicken Salad and the Po Boy Sandwich. The Po Boy is so SPICY but so bomb. You must go! I ordered the kid's chicken nuggets today and they are so good! :)

z9AZI9elsIZXhiaTjTCZ3Q.text: Came here twice. The first time was just to check out the menu so I only got a beer and their "buffalo wings" which I believe are made of cauliflower and are very good. I recommend them. Then today I went for their Sunday brunch and had their vegan biscuits and gravy and a chocolate peanut butter crunch donut. The biscuits and gravy had great flavor and I really liked the tofu scramble and potatoes that came with it. Their tofu scramble has a better texture and flavor than most that I've tried. The meal wasn't hot when I got it - in fact it was almost getting cold. The donut was gluten free (I don't require a gluten free diet; it just happened to be) and I got it because it was smaller than their "main selection" of donuts which are all very large. The donut was like a very moist chocolate cake donut- very little to no peanut butter flavor and no crunch- that did not bother me at all because it was still really good. I can't wait to go back!!!

Ylrw4HEub7kzleFftZLHgg.text: Love this place and so do my kids.  That says a lot.  The food is delicious and healthy.  It's also reasonable.   I love the thai with chicken and the tahini slaw

AWmJ15lbzoSH-k68LKnIUQ.text: Fifth time here and it keeps getting better, if that is at all possible.  Service is outstanding, the food is nutritious and very delicious.  Their Sunday brunch in conjunction with Nami next door is fun and very tasty (think waffles and mimosas)  So far I have tried their spicy buffalo wings, the thyme fries, the wendy's pickle (twice!), the tahini cole slaw, and the thai peanut bowl.  They were all fresh and very tasty.  The portions are also quite generous, and we usually end up taking home some really good left overs. The vibe in the restaurant is wonderful too, people are happy and all appear as satisfied as I feel right now.  If I lived closer, I think I would be a daily customer---they are that good.

bVA2deYqwLvT20rujkGUoQ.text: Green has fantastic options to suit all tastes and appetites. It attracts vegans and nonvegans alike and I love how it helps people to explore plant based options. For those interested in a beer or wine with their meal, they have a fantastic selection. They offer teas and bottled drinks as well. I have never been disappointed by any meal I have had there, and I have visited dozens of times. I recommend it to everyone. It gets quite a lunch crowd but I always manage to find a place to park and to sit. The food is reasonable priced, delicious and plentiful.

EhXl6KasRGIqSzJYE-uwQg.text: YUM!  This place is amazing.  I am not vegan anymore, but I still love cooking and eating vegan every once in awhile.  This place does it well.  Amazing flavors, great options, and Stronghold wine on tap!!  My birthday is this weekend and I have veggie, vegan, and gluten free friends, along with bachelor types that eat burgers.  I know going here will make everyone happy.  My only complaint... I wish there was one in San Diego!!

AIuDk-JSIN4POwnVawtyGw.text: I absolutely adore Green and would probably eat there every day if given the opportunity. The staff consists of a crew of heavily pierced and tattooed alt-hipsters, who are typically very helpful and pleasant. They are always willing to explain a menu item. I've taken lots of non-vegetarians there and most have wanted to return.   Their buffalo wings are the best to be had in Phoenix, hands down. I love the "Original G Po Boy," which features the buffalo wings front and center. And the thyme fries, oh jeezus. I tend to stick with the sandwiches, and I've never had anything I didn't like.  The ambiance is great, too. In cooler weather, they roll up the delivery door, which opens up a full wall of the restaurant to the outside world. It's nice sitting in the clean, modern setting while overlooking the 7th street traffic. Very urban and cool. The artwork, which is in constant rotation, is also something to be seen. I loved the NWA-themed stuff they had when they opened.   Excellent food, excellent experience.

MwD8eUAuAydcqzzqP57rgg.text: Fantastic gluten free buffalo wings, though the Alfredo bowl is very bland. Be sure to check out Nami nextdoor after!

f4tPeT7uqqnjkZjnADyxUw.text: Whoot! Finally an awesome veggie place that serves tasty mock meat and alternative fooooodddssss! I lament the fact that Vegas, which is a major city as well, doesn't have anything even close to this place.  First off, the serve every vegan, vegetarian and organic eater alike, and the food is GOOD! So good, even my carnivore boyfriend liked it. I got the Thai Orange bowl with mock chicken, and he got the No Harm Parm chicken Po'boy. The Thai bowl seemed to be very popular since I saw nearly half the people in there with it, and it was very good, full of fresh veggies cooked perfectly and not at all soggy, with a semi-spicy sauce to die for, but only a few pieces of mock chicken. His meal, however, with the giant Po'boy and tasty potato tots was fricken AWESOME. I tasted his mock breaded chicken and nearly cried. It was like a biscuit covered in country gravy and soooo moist.  They have really cool alternative sodas and organic lemonades- I got my favorite Zevia cherry cola and he got the cup (which you can go and choose from three lemonades, endlessly) and got the organic berry lemonade. The place is really cool too, but kinda hard to find if you have never been there, only because it is so laid back and not "HERE WE ARE VEGGIES". It's sign is very dark, but no worries, just remember it is right by Coco's. Parking is very tight, so I advise to park either at Coco's, or down the side street by Coco's in the residential neighborhood and walk.

oy1yjN-EZv_RNXjyz7kHRw.text: This is hands down the best vegetarian/ vegan food ever! We are from Michigan and were vacationing in Arizona. We ate at both locations of this restaurant. I'm sure we went here about 4 times. The food is THAT good! We really wanted to try everything on the menu. They do a phenomenal job with their dishes. Even non-vegetarians would love it!

2gh4vlAskLHjq0t2BTrDtg.text: I'm a meat eater and I would go vegetarian if I could eat Green for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Their soy-nami desserts are also amazing and have been known to turn any frown upside down.

N1qjmIJxG5vynqB0y9iu2A.text: I have been here several times, this is one of my favorite vegan restaurants in Arizona ! AZ is fortunate to have several! I walked in here tonight and my heart filled with happiness to see so many people here embracing the vegan lifestyle, after all peace begins on our plates!!!  Everything I have tried here is delicious....from comfort food with their burgers and fries to their bowls, delicious specials, salads and appetizers. Big wac is definitely a go to when I want something " bad" .  I have taken both my carnivore hubby and child here in the past ( but they both are now vegetarians ~ by choice.....yeah !!! Still hoping they convert though to all plant based diet though )And they even loved it then when they consumed meat.  You order your food at the counter, they give you a number and they bring your food out to you. Outdoor seating as well, both in the front or the back of the restaurant . Friendly staff and I cant forget about the desserts next door.....omg....nights on 7th Ave are made for vegan foodies !!!!   I do have to warn you....parking can sometimes be a challenge but the meal is soooooo worth it !!!!

yYwdfooWUg_ub3kiaEOZ8g.text: We visit Fountain Hills once or twice a year, and we ALWAYS make sure to visit Green. Everyone in the family loves it. I think we've tried almost everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. Amazing food, amazing drinks. My personal favorite is the Big Wac. I only wish it was a national chain.  Grand Rapids, MI would love a Green Restaurant!!!

Fus5OWCwbXdv2XYP-gBWaQ.text: We live three hours away, so we don't get here that often. However, the food and the service had always been great. Busy place for a good reason. Love the BigWac and the spicey dishes. Staff has always treated us well. Parking is tight. Overall rating is great!

VtgaKW_ZT4b4bvDw_bqOFQ.text: Let's be real. This is vegan fast food. Good if you want fake meat done well. But I do find it ironic that Green serves nothing green. I would give them a solid 3, but my last visit, I don't know if they changed things... but I always remembered having a side of coleslaw with my sandwich, and now you literally just get a sandwich on a blank plate. Nothing else. Just seems kind of like it's - not a meal at all. I'd rather stay home and make healthier plant based food.   Bummer.

7U88DyghFdcE5Km77rWq8A.text: Love their bowls and veggie burger.  My partner loves the big wac.  The "chicken" patty isn't my favorite, as it often seems too thick and fried, but the concepts are awesome.  Plus always a great selection of beverages!

ZAZlEWTEGfmh9cZiQ9SPZA.text: This place is awesome if you like a crap ton of salt and oil. I suppose if you are trying to mimic real shitty food like Big Macs and fried chicken then they hit the nail on the head.  They couldn't even get the chili right- it was full of oil and salt. Just a shame.   I'd rather eat the face off a puppy than eat at this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was where my meal ended up 20 minutes after eating!

DM9CBatFNDZYoQ0ark4BXQ.text: As first timers, we had a great experience and ordered the following:  Buffalo Wings Animal Fries  Big Wac  BBQ Sammie  The wings were the best part of our meal. The buffalo sauce was very good and the texture of the wings was nice and chewy. The wings aren't particular crispy, but my non-vegan boyfriend said he preferred them to Buffalo Wild Wings. We want to order a platter for our next football Sunday!   The rest of our meal was still great. The Big Wac was very filling and the BBQ sauce on the Sammie was to die for (vinegary and sweet and smoky). Animal fries were a good side but I'm sure we would've been happy with any of the others!  Can't wait to come back! Also, the service was great and staff were patient and helpful. :)

4rm_GL4RNM-X2oEhoEQKxw.text: Never dissapointed  I love that it is Vegan  My son likes the hummus  I like the karma curry

Qv3UBJDFTNUEmxMyTtJNNg.text: This place is absolutely amazing.  It is usually very busy and loud inside but I try to see that as part of the atmosphere and a good thing because it means more people are eating cruelty free.  I usually stick with the same order because I am easy that way but my mate usually gets whatever the special is for the day and hasn't had a bad thing to say about ant of them.  And despite how big then portions and plates are, don't forget to save room for desert and check out Nami sweets next door!

N7p_Od5auntb6UVXOVcIwA.text: Good food but it was way too oily/ fatty for me. Everything was pretty much deep fried but I enjoyed what I ordered. (Fish tacos, buffalo wings, egg rolls)

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Buffalo wings

YaWcFTCkIOfVwoA35hH-zA.text: I love the this restaurant they have the best food in town. I love there big wac and there spicy wing dings. I also love there salads. The Services, is wonderful.

eYkFgVNXmPoLi6OlXP7SrQ.text: First time here. We thought it may be in a "hip" place downtown so we skipped the closer location to us in Tempe. It's not in a good spot but it is cute, clean and friendly. Parking was minimal so we had to park down the block and walk. The portions were large. We certainly could have shared. My husband isn't vegan but he really liked the food as well.

iYI-N2nmZsITkpRDf0i0GQ.text: On the night I flew into Phoenix to visit my friend, this was one of the places she suggested we go for dinner.  She and I decided to order food to go since I had just flown into town, she had just gotten off of work, and we were both a bit tired and wanted to get to her place, eat our dinner, then crash for the night.  Didn't take very long for us to receive our order (wasn't busy), which was good. Small inside, but nice atmosphere, and pleasant, helpful servers.  I ordered the artichoke chicken salad and paid $2 to have avocado added to my salad, and it was AMAZING! Very filling.  If I had not known any better, I would have thought that the "un-chicken" was real chicken.  Only downside is parking, which is why I gave the place four stars.  My friend had to park in an adjacent lot, which was dark, and at night, regardless of the neighborhood, it's always best to park in a well-lit area. Need to improve on that if possible.  Otherwise, I will definitely go here again when I am back in town.

pfe3Qm0pQbtAGWEtcE7nMg.text: Staff is friendly and food is great. Most of it would be what I consider "comfort food". Probably not the healthiest but damn good.

6l-WNBWdrhiecJWnkpshbg.text: We try to stop by this place whenever we are in the area; however, the parking is so sparse, that it is often a challenge to find ANY space. Sometimes, we have to park at nearby business just to get in here. So, be forewarned, you may have to squeeze into a narrow parking lot to get in.  However, when you do manage to get in here, you will be well pleased with the menu. Some dishes are fairly original, and some are variations on a standard. But, so far, we haven't really been disappointed with anything that we have tried.  For starters, we often order the spicy buffalo wings (wings? I thought this was a vegan/vegetarian place), or the green hummus. Both are delicious.  For the entrees, the spicy peanut chicken salad, or the Big WAC are some of their standard and well executed.  For drinks, and this is probably one of the plusses of coming here, the Vimto juice is just such a wonderful departure from the ordinary. It's a combination of grapes, raspberries, and black currants and is wonderfully mild on the pallete. Normally, each one of these fruits can be quite overwhelming by themselves, but in this iteration @ Greens, it is quite a mild and satisfying combination.  And the service is friendly and efficient. It's not a very big place, and it is easy to miss down 7th street, but it is worth stopping by if you are in the area and want to try something different.

LnRWs8Kt2jlkSOWdBPn1bA.text: We had a birthday party here with some people who had never eaten here before and they came a little skeptical about finding food they would like. They were so happy with their selections and very satisfied. Thanks to everyone for the great food and welcoming atmosphere.

R0NbDYEsjhFY-_DwvJ5_MQ.text: I really like this place, especially when I am in the mood for vegan comfort food! And that's just what it is, comfort food! Don't expect to find anything adequately healthy here.  On my most recent visit, I got the brussel sprout bowl wrapped up as a burrito. It had crunchy tortilla strips and a southern sauce, and the brussel sprouts were sauteed to perfection! So yummy!  Their homemade drinks and teas are also quite delicious! I got a mix of the green tea and their fresh strawberry lemonade.  Overall, the meal was super good and the employees are generally friendly and helpful. It is a bit on the pricier side but there are only a handful of vegan restaurants that are this good, so it's understandable. If you enjoy vegan food and need a good cheat meal, this is the place! Then stop over at Nami for dessert ;)

WW73OU-FgiM6SxOjvKpRpA.text: I'm allergic to gluten, so I ordered the hummus plate gluten free which is an option on their menu. I was very clear about this. When the food was brought out, I found out a couple bites into what didn't taste like corn chips, that I was eating flour chips. I asked the lady I ordered from who went back to the kitchen to double check and said, "yeah sorry those are flour. Here's some corn ones." And gave me a small bag of corn chips. All she said was, "sorry that was a kitchen error."   Seriously?! I'm allergic! No sincere apologies, she just hi-tailed it out of there as quick as she could. Didn't offer to comp my meal, nothing. So irritating. Had to leave early because I got sick from the damn food. This is ridiculous. Will not be going back there.

NUNU7O0qj1_8n0so--yLRA.text: Great vegan place in Phoenix! Great food, friendly helpful staff and a cozy atmosphere

BoA0lJdd11pUzYzkjq1Ikw.text: Hands down the best vegan comfort food restaurant in Phoenix!    I've tried several vegan restaurants since going vegan and this one is the winner that I keep going back to.  Again this is comfort food...  The Big Wac (totally tastes like a Big Mac) - I've been back for this several times! Their Buffalo Wings are good as is the Cheese Steak sandwich. They have Animal Fries!  Yum.  They have specials regularly.  The Carne Asada Fries that was excellent - wish they would keep it on the menu!  I don't care much for vegan cheese, however theirs is great.  They know how to flavor for a totally savory meal.  Nami is next door for vegan desert afterwards!  Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BFF
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Asada Fries

LUaGgarpU-TX7YMULgAgBg.text: I had the burger with a side of fries and brussels sprouts. The burger was good, I added bacon and cheese and the bacon was a nice added flavor. The fries were ok but I preferred the sprouts actually. Great little spot, definitely worth checking out.

MWfknwSOziImF8VZtAN12g.text: I really wanted to like this place more. But it was good for what is was - diner type vegan food. We got the buffalo wings to share and I got the Big Wac burger. The buffalo wings were okay. It was slightly sweet and spicy. But, I didn't like the sauce runny. I wish the sauce was gooey and nicely glazed on the wings, but it was runny and the wings were just sitting in a pool.   As for the burger, this was the best vegan burger I have ever had. The patty was the closest to taste and consistency to a real beef patty. BUT, I was so disappointed with the "secret sauce." I could barely taste anything AND my burger barely had any sauce in it. The thing I detest the most is a dry sandwich. This burger falls short from perfection because of the flavorless sauce and the lack of sauce.

dqZqEcKryDMJZU0LixdXRg.text: I had the Wendy's pickle with no mayo and it was ridiculously good. We had eggless rolls...let's just say nom nom nom. And my bf had the singapore bowl and that too was delicious. Winning.

WuKlXwgeE5vcP2HQslI8lg.text: I appreciate Green for what's it's worth. Vegan fast food that hits the spot for the junk food craving. Slightly over priced for non organic processed food and never in the three years I've been going has there been any great service. They are always in a rush and rude due to being packed most days. The parking lot is a living nightmare when it's busy. So much use of soy, not great for people with intolerances. I've had friends become sick after eating here, I don't know if it's from things being too greasy or too much processed junk. The Big Wac and fries (taste like the real thing) I must say are incredible, but everything else is lack luster including the "BFF", with very little flavor. I'm happy they cater to vegan community and even non vegans who can't believe it's all vegan. I just remember the experience was better before they raised their prices and I was new to the area.

OVAYXeQOzcYicaa6jp8Crw.text: Grateful to Have found this place. Very good. Clean and with many choices.  The mock Big Mac was fab.  When ever I come through Arizona, consider this place to be a regular stop.

pj4QO-aeCc8RoXcyQoP52Q.text: Yaaaasssssss! So much goodness - this is legit vegan food. Sadly, we vegans/vegetarians/pescetarians settle for less than not when it comes to vege restaurants. This was not the case here. I'm seriously thinking about flying back to Phoenix just for this place.   I basically did a tasting and ordered the Big Wac (so amazing - totally had that "mouth feel" we're searching for), the Wendy's Pickle (a little fake meat taste to be honest), the buffalo wings (spicy for my taste but still good) and the vegan chili which will soon become a late night snack.   Couldn't eat it all in one sitting of course, but had to try it! This was a Postmates delivery, so I'm sure it would have been even better at the restaurant itself.   Don't cheat yourself - visit here!

koB3S_9ZVO7uAJwZZfI7Aw.text: Very good had the philly cheese but wish I would've gotten the burger all in all very good.

mZhDhD2jUigB5PvIwB1cvA.text: Best vegetarian restaurant I have ever been to but weigh that with the fact that this is the first one I have visited.  :) I have wanted to try this joint for some time given they carry their version of a Big Mac, called the Big Wac and if I am going to try vegetarian I wanted to be doing it eating a Big Wac. In addition to my first visit, I brought my 74 year old father who also has never had a vegetarian meal and thought it would be fun for him to. As for our food experience, wow, if that was vegetarian grub, I am now officially a vegetarian. Everything we had was on point. The spicy wings were awesome. The sauce for the wings was what made it stand out. So flavorful. As for our Big Wacs, oh and with the thyme fries of course, it was a tasty meal.  Now don't get me wrong, it does not surpass the Mac as the flavor of real meat does carry weight but our Wacs were darn good. Tasty and as close to a Mac as one could ask. Could of used a little more sauce, if I am being picky. Overall, a real nice meal with a slightly higher price point. That seems to be par for the course though when eating anything that is slightly better for you. Will have another Big Wac in the future for sure.

jL0EIKHergb5HLQKyFRIUQ.text: Came here to try the "Big Wac" and I was not disappointed. I usually stay away from imitation veggie/vegan burgers. The flavor was great, didn't taste like "fake meat" at all. It was also very filling. I ordered the Thyme fries as a side. For the price, I was underwhelmed. Thin cut and the Thyme salt flavoring isn't really that pronounced. The burger is definitely enough on it's own and the drink selections are delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thyme fries and Big Wac...

1gIrHbuMxcJQ2ASvxxo-jg.text: hey y'all it's donet!  many of you have requested i do a a green "kidsadilla" review. i did. horrifying. 1. atrocious. i felt myself experiencing uncontrollable diarrhea at the table.  2.the cheese smell alone could tame wild bob cats from africa. 3. the consistency of the cheese had me question my existence and i felt as if i was floating in and out of a nightmare.  4. the bread was moist and the cheese stayed in my teeth for days after.  5. service 6/10 6. please fix this shit PRONTO

vlRtJRb6rSH2yNpwaRFC_Q.text: One of the best vegetarian restaurant I have ever been to. I've been here 3 times, and walked out a happy customer every time. The menu is unique and food is delicious. Not your typical natural food salad bar fair. The chef put thought engineering the menu. This place is always busy and I am not surprised. I think you folks should be looking to open a new branch in North Scottsdale !  My only suggestion is to have a counter space for online order pick-up so we don't have to stand in line. You are doing so well that there is a line and usually just one cashier who takes order and answer phone calls. It's hard to expect this one person to tend to pick-ups.

4haz6PSzkTUA_eYdTXPkqw.text: Ive been to Nami and thought it was awesome. But I never had the chance to try Green until now.    I tried a good amount of things and highlight all the details below.    Jamaican Bowl Thing - Super fresh, brussel sprouts were fried just right. The sauce they use was a low toned sweetness that wasnt overbearing. The vinaigrette was a little too powerful in the first few bites, but subsided immediately after.    The crab ragoons were a freak of nature. Its hard to believe that it wasnt cream cheese or imitation crab fr that matter. It didnt necessarily have the fishy taste of the sea, but it was damn close. The sauce they give with it tasted like au jus! I could have ate a boatload of those things.   The samosas were a solid option. They weren't as crispy as I like, but they had some flakiness, as well as a nice overall mouth-feel with the grease. Oddly enough, I wish the containers of dipping sauce were wider, as I had to break the samosa down for it to fit.    The chameleon taco had a great, bold flavor. I thought of it as a southwest flavor, even though I dont think thats what they were going for. The tempura batter taste was spot on for what you would expect on a piece of chicken. The eggplant and sweet potato are already soft, so they spill out of the tortilla fairly easily. As long as you eat this carefully, its worth getting.    They serve fresh fruit that tastes great, but I m annoyed that they only gave me pineapple and grapes. Im not asking for the Chiquita banana hat in my bowl, but Im expecting some type of variety. Maybe if they listed what fruits were actually available, I wouldn't have been as perturbed.   Overall, I was quite excited with what I had. I feel this establishment is a not-so-hidden gem of the community.

vjOD47nEIKs1G4FUqozT3Q.text: I had a Wendy's special chicken sandwich and it was delish. The place is small and parking is tricky. However, it is a nice place to eat for an alternative meal.

GqmkXTxed-ES6ytOA3ldag.text: Went on my way to airport to grab something for lunch.  I had the BFF and it was so delicious!   It was a delicious combo of flavors and texture.  Will definitely be back next time I'm in town!!

KOL_YKm_DfxkQzMm_0v6Eg.text: WOW WOW WOW. Such a cute little vegan resturaunt me and my boyfriend stopped at during our stay in Phoenix. The wings were amazing, his peanut thai noodles were insane and my "chicken" sandwhich was everything you could want in one. Wish there was a location in Texas.

P9gRm5z_oJDSE9P5KcTUPg.text: It should be said that not all vegetarian and vegan food is necessarily healthy.  Sure, a lot of folks adopt veganism or vegetarianism for the health benefits.  But even meatless foods can have junk food appeal.  Perhaps you're scared of going vegetarian and want to try something that tastes just like your favorite chicken wings.  Or perhaps you're already vegetarian, but you're craving a great All-American burger but without the burger patty guilt.  For those of you who've never been to Green, take it from this carnivore.  This is the place to get your junk food fix (and a few healthy fixes as well).  Truth be told I've been to Green a number of times.  The menu has changed a little here and there, but the core of Green's appeal remains the same.  A place where vegan and vegetarian foods can be creatively woven to mimic the foods we all know and love, pushing the boundaries of what vegetables can do.  At first glance it would seem hilariously out of place to see items like a burger, or a cheesesteak or buffalo wings while perusing the menu of a vegetarian restaurant.  But for owner and head chef Damon Brasch, that's the whole point.  Opening the public's eyes to whats possible to construct with creativity and an almost religious devotion to avoiding meat and meat byproducts.  I've had a number of items on the menu in the past including the Buffalo Wings, the Chili Cheese Fries, and even the Crab Puffs.  All vegan, all surprising, all quite tasty.  For tonight's visit with the Yelp Veg Curious UYE crew, I decided to attack an item I had yet to tackle.  You've all heard of the Big Mac (two all beef patties, special sauce, lettuce, cheese, pickles, onions, on a sesame seed bun).  Wait till you get a load of the Big Wac.  Same basic recipe, but the patties?  Yup, vegan.  To make it an All-American meal I went with their Thyme Fries on the side and one of their house made lemonades.  Total cost including tax came to about $15.  I would invite any longtime McDonald's Big Mac fan to try the Big Wac and point out any truly noticeable differences in the texture of Green's version of this American food icon.  As with the rest of Green's menu, you find yourself perplexed at how they can make a vegan version of these dishes taste like the genuine article.  To this day I don't know how they make the Buffalo Wings taste like legit chicken, or how they mimic the crab so accurately.  All I can say is Chef Brasch has incredible imagination.  Some dishes I've had here are better than others of course, but even those that fall short are not for lack of creativity.  So if you're among the flocks of those steering clear of meat but want the closest approximation to a meat menu you can find, you'd be hard pressed to find many places in the valley of sun that can accomplish that fete the way Green has.  The prices for the food are also quite reasonable, and the restaurant itself is a pretty cool spot on 7th Street (just be aware parking can be a bit of pain as many Yelpers have noted).  When you do come here, be sure to save room for dessert next door at Green's sister restaurant Nami.  And if you're a suspicious carnivore coming here for the first time as I once was, prepare to be confused, surprised, and delighted.  And most importantly, full.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Big Wac (plus Thyme Fries).  Lovers of Mickey D&#39;s version, prepare to have your mind blown by this meatless wonder

1VstVw4lTXPbpo0JQ2h75g.text: Thank the gods that this place exists! I highly recommend this venue for the filling food and affordable prices. The staff are phenomenal, and the people incredibly friendly. When I came in, I was welcomed with a very hip vibe, streamlined decor, and wonderful chalk boards filled with local brews, wine, and drink specials. Everything on the menu is vegan. They took the time and care to recreate fast food classics en vegan, so that the same cravings can be placated when we have that hit for a quick bite from a place like Wendy's or McDonald's.They have West Coast fries, flavored with thyme and smothered in vegan cheese, vegan 1k dressing, and onions at around $5.50. My main was the Sesame Dragon sauteed carrots, broccoli, house tofu, scallions, and cabbage all over rice and served with a lime. The amount of food is plenty for the price of $9.50, so come in with an empty stomach, and have a good time filling up. None of the guilt. All of the flavors. Non-alcoholic drinks are self-serve, but the quality is through the roof--I would strongly suggest the strawberry lemonade! Oh, and their partnership with Nami is awesome---I went over there to get a Tazmanian cupcake and a chunky Samoan square, too! Please, if you have a chance, come on in, and get down with some great vegan loving! I'm coming back for more!!

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Those chalk boards, though!

2383FJ6rTbwMVGbt-2mLAg.text: I was invited to eat at my first vegetarian restaurant by my sister & wow I was surprised! I thought I was going need tons of salt etc to make the food edible lol but it didn't need a thing. I had wings and the Po boy sandwich with coleslaw. I never knew vegetarian food was so good. All I can say is wow and I'll be back!

GutJo6nCL_4yM-Zuparg5A.text: So delicious!! We had the Big Wac, samosas, and the bbq salad. It was all fresh and wonderful.  The service was really good too. We will be back!!

K8xN7YtIROiuu5KfRVBfrg.text: Best ever!!! Really. The wings are to die for. The hamburger made all my non-vegetarian friends envious.  The food comes out quick. The service is also very responsive. I just love everything about this place!

04DOciyhlHZzn4_1DBJXsQ.text: Strap a feed bucket on me loaded with mock chicken and I'm set for the weekend. It's that good.

ggIMHYNkGto47HOlLCDn6g.text: Feels a lot like That's a Wrap (which used to be in this location).  I love the overhead door; I love fresh air.  Lots of seating and a bike rack (that doesn't really properly serve a lot of bikes, honestly).  Food was very, very fresh.  I expected (per norm in most places) corners to be cut where not noticeable (see: frying something often masks it's lack of freshness) - corners were not cut.  The three things ordered were all well prepared, fresh and delicious.  The things I oversaw on other tables were also looking mighty tasty.  I'd love to see a few bottles of craft beer here - that's my personal opinion.  Part of the issue is local laws, the other part is those running the show.  Will return, for sure.

_TpF5sDowHGpRkpjjeIFIA.text: Fake chicken parm & burgers were ridonkulusly delish!

1BsN_LpDh5JFA7d58PWl0Q.text: I absolutely love this vegetarian restaurant. They have a wide selection of food to chose from and it's all so good. My favorite things to get there are the jerk tofu salad, the spicy peanut chicken salad, the green hummus and the spicy peanut tofu. You really can't go wrong with anything you order though. For those of you that don't even like vegetarian foods, well try this place because it will certainly change your mind.

LFcE4Lb3IE6RG2Uzg6Su7A.text: i'm glad we finally have a veggie restaurant in central phoenix!  i think it was a void that really needed to be filled and i can see myself ending up here often when i am looking for a quick and healthy option.  i haven't tried enough of their menu yet to comment on the best dishes, but the atmosphere, location and prices are great!  i was only moderately impressed with my first meal, but i think i may have chosen incorrectly for my taste - they have LOTS of options so i'll be able to tweak it next time!

2vwNBpX7QcfcD0Hmpi1s9g.text: I'm not a vegan/vegetarian, so this was a new thing for me and I loved it!  If this is clean eating, gimme more.  I've only eaten at the Phoenix location once and the Scottsdale location once.  I definitely recommend the vegetarian Big Mac thing, even though I'm not a fan of McDonald's.  The fries were delicious too.  I liked that they had a couple different kinds of teas and you can refill your drink with whatever you want (or buy the glass bottle drinks).  The atmosphere is trendy and fun, right in line with the food.  The staff and the other customers all seemed friendly, even the biker-dude eating on the patio.  I guess this kind of food makes you feel good about eating for once.  I wish we had a Green even closer to us in East Mesa.

1Fd-efZTCsA7zzJueOLguQ.text: The big-wac and their fries were amazing! Loved this place!

HaQHcLxzHfo03S2njPJJSA.text: I was in town visiting and decided to check this place out. I'm so happy I did! The food was amazing and staff was really pleasant. The buffalo "chicken" wings where addicting!

m5UaMA2pzUueb-yDi-YaAA.text: I was very surprised by their food.  I've never been a huge "vegetarian" but I could eat here ever week.  The food is excellent, service is always polite, and courteous.

_SQMnhO3PNWNcmhe9YfS_g.text: Simply amazing!  I would recommend the Edamame, Wendy's Pickle, and Thai Peanut Bowl with House Tofu and Noodles.  The people here are always helpful and friendly.  Such a pleasure to have a date night here.  Also, good priced Kombucha and Nami (vegan desert shop by the same owners) next door!  Thank you :o)

a9Npz_20VT7EZ-ihgIv9PQ.text: This place is awesome! Everything I have tried is incredible! I love the spicy buffalo wings! The only thing that would make it better would be delivery service

nPvvV5r1ctigEUo5k3-IFw.text: Green is vegan junk food. Very fun and delicious, but not incredibly healthy. If you are more health conscious, you can get a bowl of steamed veggies in various sauces from the bowls section of their menu. They do offer an organic tofu option if you are concerned about GMOs. Just ask for the "fresh" tofu. If you are not worried about health, everything here is delicious. The chicken wings are great. Not very chicken-wing-like; more like like little soy nuggets drowning in spicy sauce with a side of ranch. Super yummy. The artichoke gratine is amazing, also spicy. The chili fries are just ok IMO; their ranch is amazing though. Next time I would just get the fries with ranch to dip them in. Seriously the best vegan ranch I've ever tasted. I could go on and on because I ate practically everything while I was here. It's all good, you guys. I love that their water is room temperature. The people who work here are super friendly and helpful. The restrooms are great. You may be tempted to sit on the front or back patio in the evening because the weather is nice and they keep it pretty cold inside, but being eaten alive by mosquitoes is not worth it. Bring a sweater and brave the A/C.

SLAvHQ9TDcXkXIOWHVfgmg.text: I ordered online and my "wings" were ready when I got there about 7 minutes later. I love how simple it was to order and how fast things were ready. Food was great as always.

a0a2jDy5mxc5spuvMrGQHg.text: This was my first time there as I was visiting Phoenix on travel.  We ordered the Spicy Buffalo Wings and the Samosas for appetizers.  Thai Peanut Bowl and the Singapore Orange Bowl for food on recommendation of the cashier.  Very excited to be there and I tipped the cashier nicely upon ordering because she was so helpful with menu recommendations.  I'm not sure what was wrong with the kitchen, but the Spicy Buffalo Wings and the Singapore Orange Bowl were unexpectedly very seriously oversalty, to the point of inedibility.  The other two items were quite excellent, the samosas were crispy and fluffy, and the Thai Peanut Bowl was very good, so I think the other people's five star ratings are probably spot on for their dishes.  I'd forgive them the inedible dishes, except when my companion complained about the oversalty dishes, our complaints were treated quite poorly.  My companion then asked for some rice to cut the salt, but were told we would have to buy extra rice, which my companion did... it did not help.  I asked that at least the chef be informed or that someone check our complaints..., no one.   Maybe it was the cashier, I'm not sure; I felt that our complaints were not taken seriously, and we did not finish the inedible (oversalted) portions of the meal and I left hungry.  While I would understand why people go there, it was an unsatisfying, and the complaint service was seriously lacking.

uMhYiAdADGuBOZmXxWD_LQ.text: First time every going to a restaurant that was Vegan and had a menu just for gluten free items. My friend is vegetarian and had been asking me to go try her favorite place with her for some nice meatless lunch. I was in heaven!!! Especially with the new year and trying to eat healthier it seemed as a good idea. I didn't necessarily get healthy of food but in comparison for fast food it was a lot better for you. I got a Big Wac...hehehe which as you can get the hint from the name it was suppose to be a Big Mac. Was much better. We also split the spicy buffalo "wings" which were phenomenal as well as a Pickle Wendy. A must try place for something different and yummy.

gJqUsXcOXuAJ5-8aiUnH2Q.text: I often visit the Scottsdale location and just love it, so I was excited to try the downtown location. I ordered my favorite dish: kung pao mock chicken. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. It wasn't even close to as spicy as it should be and the brown rice was severely undercooked. I will definitely give it another shot, since I love the menu so much, but this particular visit was disappointing.

C9nLRqTp_YXm-sGA8AuVMA.text: The thrill of having a whole menu to order from! Yummy little vegetarian place tucked away in a sort of ugly strip mall, and worth the trip. The salads are very large, and unsurprisingly very green, fresh, and full of yummy toppings. The menu has healthy vegetarian options and unhealthy vegetarian options, so everyone can be pleased. I particular like the Mushroom Po'Boy, a really nice take on the normal (and getting boring) restaurant standard of a portabella sandwich. This Po'Boy is full of a savory and solid flavor. The pesto stir fry bowl is also really yummy, what vegetarian doesn't love pesto?

yboe81mEybGJPFhhrF_qlQ.text: Love their rice bowls! There's always a line when I go but the staff is always quick to accommodate :) Great hard ciders as well.

RPoTuHPyhGeuhnMIBqwg0w.text: OH MY GOD. The Bff sandwich and the buffalo wings are so damn good, always ask for a side of their dilly ranch. This place is soooooo tasty. The Big Wac was a bit salty for my taste but it was alright. My boyfriend even loves this place and he isn't vegetarian. He says the patty in the Bff legit tastes like chicken, its been a while since ive had chicken lol but i do know that its mouthwatering and just soooo soooo gooood. Must try for every one even if you aren't on the vegetarian band wagon!

P6wHAuslbcqQJKM_WbWu8g.text: Walked in after 5 minutes of trying to find parking and dealing with traffic.  My 4 year old son had a yogurt with him and left it on the table. The lady that was cleaning the tables got it and almost threw it out before my husband walked up to her to let her know it was ours. She looked at my husband and handed it to him as if she was disgusted with it and said "If it's not vegan it's not allowed in here". Really?!   We just walked out.  Horrible!  So if someone walks in with leather shoes or a purse they'll also be kicked out or is it just food. Kind of a double standard there if you ask me.

lcqoL_yFk0DwI8OWnvgnlw.text: This is so far my very favorite restaurant in Phoenix. Delicious vegan comfort food, I didn't know there was such a thing! I always get their no harm chicken sandwich, which is amazing. I LOVE that all the cups and silverware is biodegradable. Their Nami desserts are also delicious.  I very much prefer their San Fran location as there is far more parking and more room inside but either location deserves a happy 5 stars!

BNMljZJuoRyZGWxHy2FwKw.text: In a nutshell, Green Restaurant serves fantastic vegan meals that I sorely wish were back in my city of Oakland. Looking at the selections of entrees and sides, it feels just like an all-American diner- but without the stinky grease! You walk into this place and it does not at all feel like a cheap place to get your fix of fries and burgers. Such a good vibe!  You walk up the counter, place your order, and then barely get to wait, as it comes out to you rather quickly. There is also a refrigerator that stocks some bottles of kombucha- you know, just to fill out your vegan dinner checklist!  This great feeling, for me, is exemplified in the Po' Boy sammie. The mock chicken was so meaty and filling that I was astounded it was meatless! The buffalo sauce was just the right combination of spice and heat. Makes my mouth water right now just recalling that delicious sandwich.  I found the prices to be a tad higher than I would expect, BUT I would whole-heartedly support a vegan restaurant instead of a traditional American joint.

B_wPklesiBdspXDZae-n8w.text: I love the food at green but would suggest the Tempe location as the customer service at the Phoenix location is appalling. If you do end up in Phoenix I'd suggest sticking with Nami next door.

nV1YheTc4j6shr-5mRc24w.text: The food was great. I had the Original Po'boy and it was yummy. The thyme fries were good but lacked a little flavor. My husband had some kind of Peanut Chicken wrap which he thoroughly enjoyed. So much so that he didn't let me try it. Great spot for Vegetarians looking to enjoy a little junk food.

eTPNgd2yaI4LeSoDkwVddg.text: Excellent food, and a particularly awesome place to eat if you are vegan/vegetarian. A diverse menu with items to please any appetite, including some of the best mock meat dishes around. Order the Big Wac, its better than the original. Parking and seating is tight during peak times, but it's worth the wait. Follow up with a delicious Tsoynami - a vegan blended ice cream dessert.

nmJZn8JK71o_Nd7uPFECoA.text: Absolutely love this place.  We tried their Chicago Cheesesteak, Big Wac, Animal Fries, Karma Curry Rice Bowl, and Buffalo "Wings," and every dish was delicious.  The burgers were actually so good and juicy that I hesitated to ask my vegetarian friend to try.  The favorite at the table was the Karma Curry Rice Bowl which had crunchy vegetables and soft/dense fried tofu pieces.  Everything was very rich and flavorful, not the stereotypical vegetarian blandness that most would expect.  Also, for vegetarian food, this place is quite affordable!  Would definitely return to try other things on their menu!

_CR2_Z470BiaBp54fDHHig.text: I really do hate to do this but, I have been coming to Green for several months now. I love the food, especially the Big Wac! This is my go to place for vegan food. However, the last few times I have been here the service has really gone down hill. Tonight I ordered at 8:15pm, then sat at a table to wait for my food. Several other people came in after me, ordered, then had a seat. I got my wings at 8:35pm. I started eating then started to notice that the people who came in after me started getting their Big Wac sandwiches BEFORE me. I counted 5 other people who got there sandwich before I did who ordered LONG AFTER I did. Finally at 8:55pm I got my sandwich. It took them a full 40 minutes to get me my sandwich and 20 minutes after my wings.        This is HORRIBLE customer service!! The girl who brought me my sandwich knew I wasn't happy and she did apologize. What I don't understand is, why did several other people get the same sandwich BEFORE me when they ordered AFTER me?        I really do hope they don't keep going the way they have been. By reading other reviews it looks like I'm not the only one having this problem. If you're reading this Green, please fix this problem. If you don't, you could ruin a really good thing.

_ZcCm_jgFxRHcQgDcuZIdw.text: Nummy nummy in my tummy! Walked over with hubby from Nami, since it is next door. Split Cajun chicken sliders and loved it. Split the Big Wac and loved it. Complimented both dishes with fries that we shared together. Everything was rich in flavor. Left fulling full and light because of the ingredients. Well done.

2qn-GDc7Mjs3QlR9QCFQ9g.text: I love their Wendy's sandwich and their ice creams.  Not the healthiest but fun to have once in a while!

TQ-iVShGrh38ZTf_qsEYUQ.text: Amazing. New to vegan and I've been here twice. It has restored my hope that healthy conscientious food can also be delicious. Big Wac, no brainer. Sampled many things off my families plates and they were equally as delicious. Decor is also very unique and interesting making it fun. Parking can get a little tough but it's worth the effort. Staff are so very nice, friendly, and helpful. Next door offers some of the best vegan desserts in town. We make the drive from Lake Pleasant and it's worth every mile. Highly recommended.

OwRCWDbeTnhW6Z0I4wq9aA.text: Wow I love this place, tried it out since I was hungry and in the area.  The Big WAC was so amazing, the tea hit the spot. It was nice to get a little "less healthy" meal since I usually eat most fruits and veggies. I will be sure to let others know how awesome this place was.

EI3-S5AzBEGiIWJvOZ0GBQ.text: I never knew how exceptionally good vegetarian food could be until I had it here.  They truly knocked it out of the park, for me.  One key trait that separates a great restaurant from an average one is whether they are consistent.  And my dining experience here demonstrated that.  I've swung by here for lunch and brunch on separate occasions.  During my first time, I took a stab in the dark and went for their Thai Noodles with "Chicken."  Boy, did I order right.  The noodles were perfectly cooked al dente! The "chicken" had great texture and taste.  The veggies were cooked firmly and evenly.  The freshness of all the ingredients made the biggest difference!  The sauce that glazed all over was on point! Everything was balanced nicely.    As for brunch, the fiancee had their "eggs" Benedict and I had the breakfast burrito.  The Benedict was just okay, we thought.  The "ham" that came in it was on the rubbery side.  The burrito was definitely much better.  What stood out from both dishes was the "egg." Although it didn't quite taste like an ordinary egg, it certainly appeared like one given the texture and color.  The tortilla tasted non-gluten while the potatoes and "sausage" were cooked nicely.    I wish I lived closer as I would frequent more often.  I certainly hope they expand.  This is truly a hidden gem in my book.  7th St. & McDowell Rd is not known for being a food area but a trip here is definitely worth it.  Parking can be challenging, so if you can't find one, go into the neighborhoods on the south side and park on the dirt lot (you can't miss it) or by the curb.  It is minutes away from Downtown and the I-10 freeway.
