Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eC5iuSkF05Xaakvhgq1sWQ.text: Love Green!  Buffalo wings, fries and the whopper burger......delicious.   The iced teas are fresh and tasty as well.   Great selection of beer and wine too!   Num.  Num.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ice Cube for your Ice T!

RkXBy66EHwS_taFFqAPKpA.text: Long wait! 50 minutes and the hamburger bun is cold! Was told when I complained it had been 45 min that that was normal but when we went in there was only one couple in front of us.

PYhgISLVjtCJ0PXghRRg9Q.text: Maaaaybe my husband and I were here on a bad day. We were visiting from LA over Thanksgiving weekend, stopped by Green Tuesday late afternoon (11/24). I was super excited, because traveling and veganism don't often go well together unless you meal/snack prep for your road trip (which I obviously didn't).   I was extremely disappointed.  First of all, the girl that was working the cash register that day is probably a master of resting bitch face. I went up to order, said "Hi" and she just stared at me without saying anything. Even when I asked her a question, she grunted. There was barely any interaction between us, she was your typical emo-vegan-Urban Outfitter clad hipster. Okay, that's probably not fair of me, but she really pissed me off.  Furthermore, a lady came in while I was ordering claiming that she left her car keys or something at the counter. Resting bitch face girl couldn't be bothered.   OKAY, enough ranting about customer service.   Food.  I got the Thee Green Salad, and my husband got the No Harm Chicken Parm Po-Boy. My husband took a bite of his sandwich and didn't eat the rest. But I'm not a fan of vegan, imitation meat, so I'm not surprised.  My salad was boring, they were pretty stingy with everything but the "fresh greens". Plus, I asked for no tortilla strips, but there they were...  Blehhhhh.

uRHYFQkuqKN_j16wj1weFA.text: This is a must every time I'm in Phoenix. Food is incredible. Service is great. And then I always stop by their vegan ice cream shop next door.Love this place!!!

tx57egGnKraAd3or8G_9_Q.text: If you are looking for some nice american comfort food, but all plant based, this will hit the spot. A lot of their food is crafted in a way to mimic omni food. The big wac is derived from the big mac, etc. Its a hair on the pricey but definitely worth it. Plus, their sister store, Nami is 20 feet south. You can get vegan pastries and Tsoynamis, which are the vegan version of DQ blizzards. Great place to take a group of mixed eaters, vegan and non vegans

hru8Ofq9CKQER5XqsdifSQ.text: New to vegan eating, my tastebuds, firmly rooted in meat eating, were happy little campers. Staff is knowledgable and helped us figure out what was a good fit for each of us. Tea is great, teen had mac and chees, ditto, hubby had curry and I had blond Alfredo bowl. We all ate 'til full and have enough for lunch tomorrow! All was good!

VCYe1waaUMQO51CWlTGgkQ.text: Woah that bbq "chicken" sandwich was awesome. I don't know how they do it, but that tastes like straight up chicken!  I'm also not vegan, but I enjoy vegan/vegetarian food. Can't wait to come again next time I'm in town. :)

R2dd0wXheSjDcrclHBACBw.text: I happened to drive by while looking for a place to eat. Got the Philly Cheese Steak and Tahini Cole Slaw. Both were especially flavorful and deliscious. The service was quick and friendly! Decor clean and neat! I a vegetarian for over 40 yeaes, I loved everything about this place.

A2P5tm8MadWprlG2sNZMWQ.text: One of the best vegitarian restaurants I have been to in the city. I love their spicy thai bowls with fried tofu with their brown rice and veggies.  I come here at least 2 times a month. I am slowly working my way up the menu. I have loved everything so far.

aF2oCE6IygnKn0f_AKK7wg.text: I've been coming here for years and showing all of greens glory to my friends. Damon is a complete genius and combines casual food and a funky atmosphere in a location you would drive by everyday without realizing it.  The bowls are awesome, I love the specials with catchy names. And tsoynamis! You own my soul.

UJkzAF-pODu1_BJFq0zXrA.text: Hmmmm I have been hesitating to write this review because I want to like this restaurant. I want to like it so much. I just love having a dining option that has ingredients that I recognize. I have eaten here three times. Each time my food has tasted completely different. I ordered the Singapore orange rice bowl twice. The very first time I got it the tofu was cooked perfectly but the vegetables were horrifically overcooked and were the same quality as the generic frozen vegetables I can get at my local Fry's.... The second time I ate there I had the Wendy's pickle. The sandwich was not disappointing per se but the mock chicken patty was too big. I don't know how to explain precisely what it felt like biting into it. If Green is trying to re-create a chicken patty using texturized soy protein etc. etc. then they're missing the part where the patty needs to not be large... This sandwich would've been perfect if the patty had been exactly half the size it is. The second time I ate the Singapore orange dish (which would've been my third visit to green) the sauce was so salty-the sauce tasted like they had made the sauce out of soy sauce than reduced it and then added more soy sauce and then salted it. The tofu was perfectly cooked again and this time the vegetables appeared to be fresh vegetables and they were cooked perfectly crisp tender. Had I not had the sauce the dish would've been perfect. I really like the idea of this of this restaurant however when you look at the menu and compare what's on the menu to the food there is a distinct discrepancy. Either the owner isn't being honest or the general manager can't keep a consistent staff in the kitchen. Until something changes I will just take my business elsewhere or make my own version of Singapore Orange at my house.

bDYyLw9HrUfN5cCUg7iADA.text: Green is an awesome vegan restaurant. The food is delicious and the menu is creative. Try to catch some of their specials when they have them and then stop next door at Nami for a vegan ice cream or baked treat.

OrYnhR3XLHXwJT92KfUnSg.text: Let me put it to you this way fellow yelpers, took the family to Greens for lunch about a month ago which included my son in law Mr Meat and Potatoes and he LOVED it!!!  He got the Philly Cheese..  The fried brussel sprouts are AMAZING!!!  I got the Big Wac finally and everyone had some and LOVED it too!!!!  This is the best place!!!!  Need more of them around the valley!!!  LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

IDkRDgslIO8q5-3LEt0WMg.text: Had the chicken artichoke salad and it was delicious, even though I kept wondering to myself...what the "chicken" concoction really was.  I did wait a ridiculous amount of time for my food...the cashier said to just go ahead, find a seat anywhere and they will find me.  They apparently looked everywhere except that little patio a few steps from the cashier.  :-(    Since it was a salad and not a hot entree...no harm done!  I will be going back.  Since my first visit I have been back several times...service has been perfect and I really like this place ALOT.

GCE5hTRpFRzdNFyh1UzT6w.text: Absolutely loved this place.... the fact that they had an Ice Cube ice machine was amazing. If you don't know what I mean then you will have to go to check it out! I had a Big Wac here and honestly no vegan burger has ever been able to stand up to it! It was literally perfect. I have tried several versions of vegan big macs and none compare to it! The fries were also amazing. I seriously consider going back to Phoenix just to go here to eat!!

uKguUzg_3KYr-N9dDNGhzg.text: Food was great. My wife is Vegan (I'm not) we decided to give this place a shot. I'm very satisfied with my experience.  The people that work here are very nice and I could hear the cooks singing which made me laugh. I also like that they seemed very quick to clean the vacant tables (nothing is grosser than a dirty table, well maybe two dirty tables). One thing I will say is that the music was a bit to loud for me but I'm sure they would have turned it down if I asked.

photos.caption: Photo of Green New American Vegetarian - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not sure what this was but can it if it I don&#39;t want all my blood replaced with this stuff.

6go0hAJPLk-S32J4BZkAxg.text: AMAZING. The owner, Damon, is a genius! His creations are unique, delicious and cruelty-free. Whether you eat meat or not, this place is BOMB. Check it out!

RHM2uPHf2vLNk3ZuIqF71w.text: I walked in last month on a whim and have become a regular; I am not in any sense a Vegan. However, the food is scrumptious, the service is excellent, and it is very good for my health. The space is very comfortable , open, and minimal. Lots of natural light.  Highly recommend!

fwOvL3imYjrHcW3JXcgswQ.text: I love this place! Take your meat loving friends here and I'm sure even they will be surprised!  First time we went healthy and opted for a bowl- it was good but this time we got the Big Wac and had to leave a review!  Its gluten free and suffering free (vegan) and taste like junk food!

wpi4NY9rgWahFC81oatAkw.text: I love Green and Nami both!! I come to green multiple times a week and am always helped by Diana, she is the best!! I take comfort knowing everything is vegan and there's no contamination of meat stocks etc.. hiding in my food, I have had experiences at other places where I find a random piece of meat in my food! Not here!!! The food is consistently good and the service is always great! Can't say enough good things about this place!

KZ-FCc1BoGXEXSzEgbeMpg.text: If it were possible to give 10 stars I would.  This restaurant is the best and the staff and management are amazing to work with. I had 3 days to plan a small get together for my best friend's wedding reception.  It was happening at the courthouse and I wasn't going to let her get married without a party.  Since both she and I share similar food allergies, choosing Green was a no-brainer, especially since I could order a cake from Nami next door and have it delivered.  We ordered some appetizers (which were promptly eaten) and Jeanette was so incredible to work with.  The staff at Green and Nami really helped to pull together what might have been an empty evening into a wonderful celebration for my best friend and all of her old and new family. Thank you so very much Green for making it possible on such short notice! BTW, on a side note, their chicken enchilada nachos (which was the special that night) were positively amazing.  The food is top notch each time I visit.

zWjU0GRdo3NWz5djxypguw.text: I love Green, but my stomach doesn't.   The last few times I have eaten here I have left feeling greasy, bloated, and fat.  I think this proves the point that JUST BECAUSE ITS VEGAN DOESN'T MEAN ITS HEALTHY!!  I wish Green had healthier and freshier options.  Maybe some kind of local quinoa salad?  Interesting daily soups? Their salads are pretty pathetic, with their "mixed greens" resembling something that came out of a bag from Fry's.  However, Green IS delicious.  I would classify their hot wings as one of  my favorite foods ever, and I am always very happy whilst eating their creations.

ElHe_zXLVTfiABIlg7kfSQ.text: The quality of the food here is fantastic. This is the best vegan junk food place I've been to. My only complaint is that the parking is a little tight.

yd_3I-P1ubVG-vT0D5X-6Q.text: When I told my friends in New England that I was moving to Phoenix, AZ everyone said the same thing "you've got to go to Green!" The coast-to-coast reputation is well deserved; vegan comfort food at its finest. The downtown Phoenix location is even better than the Tempe one with Nami, the bakery right across the street. Service has always been good when I've been in as well. Even if you're not vegan/vegetarian you should stop in.

aH9pLGlSwP0wA_PxvdyVkw.text: Best burger I have EVER had. Newly vegan and have had many real burgers before. This was amazing. Literally the best burger I've EVER had (the big WAC). I also got to try my friends "hot wings" it was amazing as well. Highly recommend this for anyone. If you are a new vegan, this will give you the hope you need. If you don't believe that a meatless diet will taste good, you have to try this place. Check it out!
